title: Disaster at the district hotel
text:
We wanted to take a trip to New York that would be a beautiful piece of luggage to carry with us... and so it was if it weren't for the hotel... a real disaster...
Convenient only for the location..
Broken air conditioning
Broken bathroom toilet...
We asked to change rooms but nothing.. only after calling the tour operator were we able to change rooms people who were going around one morning were crazy and entered the hotel while we were having breakfast they forced us to go back to the room because it was safer.. .
Alarming!
It is a hotel that I strongly advise against... and I will soon ask the tour operator for explanations for sending us there!
Omg

title: New York City
text: Great location for Broadway shows. There is no real dining on site and the room was not up to Hilton standards. The staff is very friendly and helpful and would recommend this hotel on just the staff alone.

title: Great staff
text: Was concerned with some of the reviews,  but tried it anyway.  The hotel is very nice. The room is good, bathroom great. Had dinner in the bar. Limited menu but good. Best part was bartender,  Faith! Great attitude,  great service,  friendly even when she got slammed.  Check in was also excellent.  Clerk didn't give his name,  but friendly and helpful.  Overall good hotel.

title: Excellent would stay again
text: We are from the UK Before our visit we read reviews and were a bit nervous of visiting this hotel but boy were we wrong to think that, On arrival we were made very welcome the staff  from all of reception to bar staff & room addentants are amazing everyone was more than helpful from helping us with directions and taxi's and even storing luggage until our room was ready the bar staff explained about ordering food to eat in or take away as it's so different to the UK they even had microwave for warming your own food if needed, the bedrooms we had before our cruise(2days ) and after our cruise ( 4days) were really comfy and everything you need ie. safe hairdryers iron & ironing board & fridge and very large tv. the bathrooms are good with large shower & toiletries provided are of good quality, the hotel is literally 5 minutes walk from times square and is very central for getting around we would definitely stay here again thankyou to all concerned

title: People. People make this hotel shine!
text:
Hotel was lovely. Clean, efficient, in a very convenient area that felt safe. Rooms were a decent size given its NYC. 
What  made my experience was the staff. Five stars all the way. My only regret was not getting everyone’s names. Genesis checked me in and was lovely, welcoming, and eager to help. The young lady working breakfast on Jan 24 was so friendly and engaging. And then this, this is truly amazing!! The gentleman, bellman, working on Jan 24 late afternoon who retrieved my stored luggage. We chatted a bit before I headed out to catch my train. I’m walking to the train station. I’m well on my way and I hear someone calling Miss! Miss! from behind me. Here is the young man, he ran 2 plus blocks with my cell phone that I’d left on the lobby table. The true definition of hospitality! The most exceptional way to end my trip to New York. He has my sincere gratitude and deserves all possible forms of recognition from hotel management. He clearly takes care of the guest above all else. Priceless!

title: Dec 23 stay over Christmas
text:
I have to say after reading some reviews I was slightly concerned about arriving at this hotel, however we had no issues at all.

Yes the area can have some local characters, however we felt safe all the time walking around and there were the same people all over New York.  

The port authority is opposite the hotel but the actual entrance is round the corner. Yes the street is noisy but so are the other surrounding 10 streets and 3 avenues, a price you pay when you are close to Times Square, especially during Christmas. 

Yes you can hear traffic from your room (we were floor 18), however we also visited The Edge and could hear traffic when we were 100 floors up, you can't visit a central city location and have an issue with traffic noise.

The staff were lovely, we had no issues with the food at breakfast (normally the New York bagel) always served warm and fresh.  

The lifts worked with no issues. Rooms were clean, beds made fresh every day, towels replaced every 2 days.

All in all a good, clean comfortable hotel with friendly staff in a central location.

title: Good value but DO NOT TAKE ANY TRANSPORTATION THAT HOTEL SETS UP
text: Rooms were clean and tidy.  Beds were comfortable.  This is in a sketchy part of town and I would not stay here again no matter the cost.  The front desk offered a limo ride to LGA when my husband had to leave before the rest of the family.  Price was quoted for $65 and was indeed what he paid plus a tip.  Hours later same day when they offered the rest of the family a ride to LGA was quoted $65 and I asked at least twice no added fees?  Once we arrived at LGA, driver said $10 for tolls ( REALLY ?)  and suddenly it was $85 !!  Don't know what the other 10 dollars was for.  So I recommend NOT GOING WITH ANY TRANSPORTATION THEY OFFER TO SET UP FOR YOU.  Make it easy on yourself.  UBER everywhere you go and you know the exact price and there are NO SURPRISES.  Cabs in NY add fees so watch out.  BEWARE.  In fact, they set up a cab another time and got the address wrong where we were going and we told the driver again the address and he went the wrong way and we had to pay for it.  Do not trust them.  Get an UBER.

title: The view to Hudson Yards was great. Breakfast not.
text: The hotel is well located and service is okay. There have been issues with the elevators when I stayed there, which caused very long waiting times in the morning. Breakfast cannot be recommended. Not really a variety and quite expensive. There are better places for breakfast if you go outside and walk to the west. The view to Hudson Yards from my room (oriented to the south) was great. All in all, the stay can be considered as "okay".

title: Good location and value
text: This was a comfortable hotel for a good price within walking distance of a lot. As other reviewers have noted, the front desk staff here are excellent and very friendly. The bar staff are rather slow and not as friendly and we had difficulty ordering drinks. The rooms were clean, beds were comfortable. The room was terribly hot and our thermostat wouldn’t adjust. Also, I got locked in the shower because there’s no knob on the inside of the door and I’m not tall enough to reach the top. Use caution if you’re short. Our room did not come with the advertised in-room Nespresso machine but there’s one in the lobby

title: Voleur
text:
Pour commencer, un accueil à notre arrivé médiocre (pas un sourire pas une seule marque de sympathie) on nous donne la carte des chambres sans rien nous expliquer de plus. On découvre après plusieurs jours que l’hôtel nous oblige à consommer 29$ par jour et par chambre (consommer ou non vous serrez débiter de cette somme) et bien sûre tous cela ne nous a pas été expliquer à notre arrivée ! Et je passe sur le comportement de certain membre de l’équipe qui non clairement pas leur place pour travailler dans un hôtel mais plutôt dans une prison ! 

Hors mis cela les chambres sont propre et bien équipé (merci au femmes de chambre pour leur travail) 
L’hôtel est bien placé.

title: Mitigé
text:
Hôtel bien placé à proximité de la gare et de plusieurs stations de métro, les chambres sont un peut sombres mais très correctes et confortable.
EN REVANCHE !!! L’accueil laisse à désirer nous sommes tombé sur une réceptionniste froide pas accueillante du tout, elle ne faisait aucun effort pour se faire comprendre en anglais au lieux d’utiliser des phrases simple courtes et parler doucement elle nous déblatérait un charabia avec une expression du visage hautaine. On avait clairement l’impression de la déranger et d’être des nuls qui comprennent rien du tout.
Au bar « restaurant » de l’hôtel il y a une serveuse pire encore elle est très nonchalante presque agressive, c’est pas agréable du tout d’avoir à faire à elle. 
En revanche l’équipe du matin ils sont adorable vraiment des AMOURS. 
Et pour finir au bout de 4 jours en scannant  part hasard un QR code dans la chambre on a compris qu’on avait le droit à 29€ (33€en réalité) de consommation part jours dans l’hôtel!!!! On est donc aller à la réception pour demander si on pouvait rattraper les jours perdus car personne ne nous avait parler de ça!!! Bien évidemment la réponse a été NON catégorique!!! Bref du coup depuis ce jour nous avons fais en sorte d’utiliser nos 29€ jusqu’àu jour de notre Départ et là une ARNAQUE de + le jours du Check out on ne peut pas utiliser les 29€ de conso …. Même si on a consommé au petit déjeuner avant même de rendre les cartes de la chambre !!! C’est inadmissible de fonctionner ainsi c’est pas du tout  honnête.

title: Decevant
text:
Hotel bien placé à proximité de times square, literie confortable et chambre spacieuse. Chambre tout à fait correct.
A notre arrivé, enregistrement fait en express, la fille de la réception froide comme un frigo ne nous a rien expliquer ni fais d'effort sachant que nous ne parlons pas anglais. Au bout de 4 jrs on a su qu on pouvais profiter d'un crédit de 29$ , on a demander si on pouvais récupérer les 4 jours, on nous a dit non. Merci de nous laisser payer dans le vide. La barmaid du soir, aussi aimable que celle de l'accueil, on a juste l'impression de la déranger dès qu on passe une commande, si elle ne soupire pas devant vous quand vous commandez un verre, et une façon de parler on a l'impression de se faire engueuler ( équipe du matin et du soir au top par contre). 
Au départ, on prend notre petit dej, qui n'était pas compris dans les 29$ alors encore un supplément à payer, merci encore une fois de ne pas nous avoir dit que ce n'était pas compris. 
Certaines devraient changer de métier, ou au moins faire un effort d'être plus aimable, sa ne coûte rien de tout expliquer ou juste un sourire, déçu de l'accueil. 
Même pas un geste pour les jours où on a pas consommer!!

title: Luxury -- No, A Good Value -- Yes!
text: This hotel is what it is -- a NYC boutique hotel with limited service at a decent value compared to other Hilton properties in the city.  Yes, Port Authority is across the street; yes, the block is less than picturesque, and yes, there are probably more people sleeping on the street than your average city block, but this is a city and these things are just going to be part of the experience.  We paid less than $300 per night when there was no other Hilton property in the city under $600 per night.  For that we got a larger than average room for NYC (with a king bed) and a staff that delivered on any request that we had (extra towels, housekeeping, bill modifications to reflect breakfast and resort fee credits, etc.).  The small bar area was open all day and gave you more than enough opportunity to use your breakfast and resort fee credits and their prices were very reasonable by NYC standards.  Speaking of credits, the staff was upfront from the beginning on how you could use your credits and how you couldn't.  If you want a luxury experience, you need to book a luxury hotel.  If you are looking for a good value, consider the Distrikt.

title: Clean and convenient
text: Nice Hotel, clean and convenient. Easy walks to most areas, Javitz center walking distance and the port authority transportation center right across the street. Nice little bar off the lobby, great bartender Judith takes great car in her job.

title: Last minute stay
text:
A last minute unexpected extra night in the city due to flight cancellation. We didn’t know where to turn due to how busy things were with the NYC marathon. Fortunately some do and we bumped into Dennis. What a top bloke, sorted everything for us and made our stay enjoyable. Great spacious room. The little bar served good snacks and staff were friendly. 
If management see this, please extend our thanks to Dennis once again.

title: Simple Functional Hotel, Great Location
text: Stayed here for two nights on a quick trip to see some shows. Check-in was quick and easy. Appreciated the two water bottles and the food & beverage credit (I believe for being a Hhonors member). The room was small but not tiny. Beds were comfy and we slept well. Shower head couldn't really be adjusted, and there was some general wear and tear, but it was fine. The location is perfect if you're there for shows as it's within walking distance of everything, but far enough from Times Square that it's not crazy directly outside the lobby. There's limited food there, but if you need a quick drink or snack it's perfectly fine. Being across the street from Port Authority may not be the best visual, but it does mean a subway to JFK is right there, making getting to/from much easier.

title: Check your bill!
text: Charged without telling me or offering a receipt at checkout. Now trying to get the receipt for the charge. Will not stay here again. Rooms and space were clean, but I won’t chance getting charged and not getting a receipt again.

title: Clean and comfy - highly recommend!
text: The room, including the bathroom, was clean. The bed was very comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was clean and nicely maintained. My fiancé and I stayed on the 22nd floor, and it was very quiet. Highly recommend!

title: Adequate but don't pay too much
text:
I stayed here at very short notice after my flight was cancelled and where I had been staying was fully booked. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient but the room was a bit basic.

There was no trash bin in either the bathroom or bedroom. The aircon couldn't be adjusted which meant the room was freezing cold at night. The bathroom products also didn't include a shower gel or similar. 

Considering I paid a similar price to stay at the Marriott Times Square it felt like the value was lacking.

title: Perfect for theatre-goers!
text:
I have stayed in 3 hotels near the theatre district over the last year. This one by far was the best. First, the desk, bar/restaurant staff were all very friendly and helpful. We stayed here for 4 nights and it was fun feeling like they got to know us and our preferences. 
The rooms were updated, clean and comfortable, spacious by NYC standards. 
The location for those attending multiple plays is ideal. Very walkable to everything. 
This is my new home-away-from-home when I visit New York!

title: Great location/stay!
text: Zaida was amazing! She helped us get checked in a little bit early and she was very friendly and helpful! She definitely went above and beyond to assist us in any way possible. We had a couple issues with our stay , the noise and room temperature could've been better but great location, nice spacious rooms for NYC

title: Good For A Short Stay
text: Stayed for 2 nights while in town for business. Hotel is small but the location is perfect. Close to time square and the hustle and bustle new york is known for.  Room was clean and had what was needed, could have used a small fridge which I was surprised was missing. The shower head was also a little weak. What made this hotel shine was it's staff. Always greeted with a smile, needed help with a shipping label and they were happy to oblige and arranged my airport transportation. Location was also safe. Front desk was never left unattended and you need your key for the elevator to work.

title: Great Experience!
text: I was taking a cruise out of NYC and I arrived the evening before at my hotel.  Unfortunately the hotel that I had originally booked (Double Tree Hilton next door) had given our room away and had no availability.  We went next door to the Distrikt Hotel and they were amazing.  They had an available room and after hearing our dilemma with the hotel next door, even upgraded us to a better room.  The room was a good size and had a great view, the beds were comfortable, the elevators were quick, and the bar area was very nice.  The man working at the front desk and the woman working at the bar were excellent.  The hotel saved our trip and I would definitely stay there again.

title: Good for its Cost
text: Big room by New York City standards. Came with a desk and decent-size closet and dresser. Away from the worst of Penn Central mess. Room 2005 was furthest away from elevator and at the end of the hall.

title: Small hotel with great staff
text:
You walk into the small but well done reception area. The staff was wonderful and very friendly and remembered your name when you came through again. The way up to the rooms is secure as you need a key to get to your floor. 

Pillows were good for hotel pillows, as a user of foam pillows at home hotel will never be one hundred percent great for me, but they had enough choices for me. The bed was comfortable as well. 

The lounge/bar was nice, though when I went for a drink with a friend before dinner, not busy at all. They do offer cups to go for your drink if you wish. 

The whole experience was great, the only minor things I saw were some maintenance stuff for the room, screw holes that need covering(think they changed from track blinds to the drapes), some rust in the shower around the metal shelf and wallpaper in the bathroom that was starting to pop off (turn on the fan when showering people). 

Overall, would stay there again. The location was great for if I wanted to take a bus to Jersey to see friends there or hop on the subway to see people in Queens. Easy walk to Penn Station for the train as well. 

NO GF on the bar menu but they did have Angry Orchard Cider. Also, easy walk to Senza Gluten on 10th.

title: Great stay!
text: I stayed for one night while meeting up with friends for dinner and a show. Staff were all very nice and stored my backpack at no charge both before my room was ready and after I had checked out. Room was perfectly fine - a little small, but that's typical for NYC. It was very clean, which is the most important thing for me. I appreciated the full-length vanity and the mini fridge. The thermostat and AC worked well. I wish the shower head had been a little more adjustable, both in height/direction and type/intensity of spray. The room doors could also close a little more quietly as I heard them slamming on and off, especially in the early morning hours. The location is great and close to the action. There are a few homeless people that seem to hang out on the street (closer to the corner of 8th), but I never felt unsafe. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Non consigliato.
text: Le uniche cose positive sono 2: l'hotel è a 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square e il letti sono comodi. Le stanze sono molto piccole.La colazione ha pochissima scelta ed il personale addetto è scortese e poco professionale. La manutenzione è pessima. Abbiamo chiesto un intervento per il lavandino che in 5 giorni non hanno mai fatto. Le camere vengono rifatte solo su richiesta e gli asciugamani sono insufficienti. Anche lo shampoo va richiesto in reception.

title: A nice little place, close to the heart of NYC
text:
The best thing about this hotel were the staff. Polite, helpful and served with a smile.
We will stay there again.
Brodway is close by and so are some nice eateries.
It is very close to the PATB subway station.

title: Séjours sympas
text:
Chambre et hôtel très propre , personnels super sympas.
Proche de Times Square, beaucoup d endroit autour pour visiter et manger.
Chambre nettoyé tous les jours. 20$ de conso par jours offert par chambre.

title: Sejour 3 nuits
text: Sejour de 3 nuits - hôtel très bien situé - chambre correcte -  service petit déjeuner trop long - clim bruyante -  pas de ménage et de changement de serviette et nécessaire de toilettes durant notre séjour -

title: Perfect Location
text: Traveled to NYC to celebrate birthdays and our anniversary!  Found this hotel on the Hilton app. It was perfectly located near theatres and restaurants !  The staff was wonderful and attentive.  Close to Times Square but on a quieter street.  Easy walk to multiple subway stations.

title: Seriously amazing staff
text: Jodi Ann at the front desk is a sweetheart. Barbie is excellent, and really cute. And the two female bartenders (one is from Haiti/Jersey) are all great. They made my stay good. I will be staying there again. Thanks again everyone.

title: Flawlessly experience
text:
We were immediately welcomed upon our arrival. Zea (front desk staff), was incredibly accommodating, friendly and professional. 
The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The bar/restaurant was perfect for a quick snack, hot coffee in the morning and cold drink in the evening. 
We would HAPPILY come back to the Distikt Hotel.
Staff, who was awesome, contributed to a flawlessly experience for my daughter and myself.

title: Look closer to Times Square
text: Our stay was between 7/21/23-7/24//23. We stayed here and thought we got a good deal. Hilton will forever be a favorite. During our stay we were not told upon check in we needed to call the front desk and let them know we need our room cleaned. We thought this was something that would naturally happen when you are staying for at least 4 days. So we did not have our room cleaned the first day. The 2nd day we asked for our room to be cleaned and they did. :) But left the trash when I placed it on the table to be taken out but I guess since it was not placed on the floor it was left untouched. The 2nd night our a/c was not blowing cool air. It seems like when it's the summer time per the front desk the hire up the room the more hot the room will be. We were on the 12th floor. I think there were 30+ floors at this particular hotel. On our 3rd night we asked for a wakeup call b/c we had to catch our flight in the morning. They stated yes, will call and they do wake up calls. Well guys there was not a wake up call but glad we had a backup with our phones but it was the principal behind it. There is a Frames Urban cool place bowling alley which has some good food and drinks, the vibe is perfect. There is a doubletree next door that has a rooftop we experienced the first night but was not able to experience the 2nd night b/c the elevator guy on the first floor allowed a group of us to go up and then we get there and 2 guys stated we couldn't get it and told us and the other strangers to come back at midnight. the place was empty so if it wasn't an option then the person on the Lower Level should know what is going on via the rooftop when they don't feel like letting people enjoy the roof. Departing and Arriving they were friendly. Oh if you are a coffee drinker the coffee maker only worked 1 days while we were there. So find something else to drink. They do however, have flavored water in the front. You are about a good 15 minutes walk from Times Square. Find a closure hotel unless you don't mind spending the money for mediocre service. spend another $2-300 for a better place. Maybe when you see the picture it may not look like it's trash that needed to be removed.

title: Decent stay but no proper breakfast despite what was advertised
text: Here are the list of issues I had - a) They sent someone else to the room after I checked in. B) They did not set up my internet until I called them. C) Finally - the breakfast experience was the most odd I've ever seen - you literally have to stand in-line one by one before ordering.

title: Disappointed
text:
The location of the hotel is mediocre at best.  Not too far from Times Square but surrounded by some interesting street activity that can be cause for concern.

The rooms are small and the elevators are small and limited as there are only two available for a high-rise hotel.  

Our room lacked a telephone and a tv remote.  After several requests, the hotel delivered a remote only to discover that it didn’t have batteries.  We were told that the hotel was transitioning phone equipment which accounted for the absence of a phone.  Why we weren’t advised upon check-in remains a mystery.  A written notice might have been a nice thing to have.  I dread the thought of a room emergency which might have required a landline.  

Fortunately, we only stayed two days and relocated to a previously reserved hotel which proved to be a great hotel experience.

title: Brand new Adventure
text: It was a brand new adventure for me coming into this hotel. I was in the city for the Burna boy concert and the room was comfortable just hit because the AC didn’t work. The credits for food was used at the restaurant. There is no gym but they collaborated with a gym two blocks for you to use. It’s a small Hilton hotel don’t expect most of the amenities. It’s a new hotel so they are still improving give them a chance

title: Trip to New York.
text: Great base in convenient location. Staff brilliant and helpful. Clean. Everything was efficient . Great restaurants and bars near by. Short hop to all the sites. Lovely staff. As it was our first time in New York the staff helped us no end with all the information we required. It is not a fancy hotel but perfect for a short stay in New York.

title: Great location, Great Service, Comfortable Bed
text: Great location - we walked to Grand Central Station & into Times Square multiple times. The front desk & the bartenders are all very friendly and helpful. As a Diamond member I received a goody bag with two bottles of water and a brownie. The room is substantial for New York... the beds are comfortable and the showers are hot with good water pressure. We were there during the smoke and the staff was diligent in handing out masks. Would definitely go back.

title: Great hotel.
text: Great hotel in great location. Rooms are smaller but functional and modern. Service and front desk are amazing (especially Gideon - wonderful gentleman). Mandatory charge gives you that $$ amount to spend at their bar.

title: clean, simple, affordable, and a friendly staff.
text:
Just the kind of reasonably priced but absolutely not run down facility you want if you visit New York on a budget.
Close to Broadway theaters.
No fancy restaurant, just a simple bar if you need a drink after a busy day.
Staff was very friendly.

title: Bien situé mais qualité moyenne
text: Tres bien situé mais manque de professionnalisme pour cet hotel situé à 5/10 minutes àpied de Times Square. Petit déjeuner inclus mais moyen. Le personnel n est pas toujours aimable..Chambre petite. Ménage inclus mais sur demande : ne pas oublier car la chambre ne sera pas faite!

title: Tired Hotel
text: I got taken in by the word “Tapestry Collection” and “Hilton Honors” hotel. The neighborhood is awful (Port Authority) with lots of homeless and the room had battered furniture. The Bar and Lounge was pretty terrible and not visually or well appointed to make it welcoming.

title: Fantastic hotel ideally placed for any tourist
text:
This hotel was the cherry on top of what was the best city break I’ve ever experienced. We Stayed here for 4 nights and I couldn’t rate this hotel highly enough. 
The Staff were very friendly and helpful. The
Room was on the smaller side, but given that they were only used it to sleep it fitted the bill and we slept very well in them. 
I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York. The location alone was perfect.

title: Friendliest place EVER!
text: every member of the staff was just so incredibly helpful and pleasant during our entire stay. We didn't encounter one surly attitude or one unkind person. The front desk staff was knowledgeable and more than willing to give us recommendations on the local diners and hangouts. The housekeeping staff greeted us in the hallway, and ensure that we had everything we needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York City. If I should find myself there again, this is where I'll stay.

title: It's by the Port Authority
text: The hotel name sounds fancy, but it's anything but that.  The location is ok, but it's on a street across from the Port Authority.  The lobby was so small, and a lot of people were trying to check in early.  As a Gold Member, I wasn't able to check in early, which is fine, but the desk employee was very rude about it and didn't seem to care.  So they took our luggage behind the desk, and we went to grab some pizza.  I decided to check in on the app, and immediately I was assigned a room with a Digital key.  We walked back less than 30-minutes later, asked for our luggage, and went to our room.  Clearly there were rooms available. The room itself is small, but it's am ok size for one night.

title: Fancy Name.  Not So Fancy
text: Hilton is putting its brand name on just about any property these days.  When I checked in I was told there was a $20 per day resort fee!  This is a high rise across from the Port Authority.   As a native New Yorker I knew this was a scam.  I asked where is the pool. I was told there was not one.  I asked where is the spa.  Same response.  I asked where are the tennis courts.  There are none I was told.  The gal behind the desk then said “Stop Pulling My Strings”.  I asked to speak to a manager and I was told one was not available. After night one upon returning to my room the room was not made up.  I had to call the front desk and ask that it be cleaned. Ridiculous.  I expect more from Hilton and as a Diamond Member.  I will not recommend this property and I will not stay here on my next trip home.  Good Luck to you.

title: Rude!!!
text: I'm a Hilton Honors member and have been loyal to Hilton for years. One hour before I was to arrive to the Distrikt hotel, they CANCELED my reservation. They said it was because, I made the reservation with different credit card FOUR months before my arrival, and since then, that credit card is no longer in service--the original credit card was involved in a fraud, and I had to be issued a new one. They sent me an email saying I had until 6 pm that day to give the new one. Even though I attempted to give the new card at 4 PM the day of my arrival, they canceled it anyway! I tried and explained it was because that credit was in a fraud and I had to be issued a new one, and could I give the new card, and they wouldn't allow it! The person I was dealing with was named Ajahni P, and she was the rudest, most condescending person I have ever dealt with in my life. I want to add that I am a college professor with an excellent credit rating, I am 60 years old, and she sounded half my age and treated me like I was a criminal. All she did was give me the Hilton 800 number to make a new reservation. To make a long story short, after Ajahni canceled me, she called me back to say she reinstated my reservation. I had new reservations, so I canceled the new one to get the old one back because it was in a better location. AND THEN she canceled my reservation AGAIN! In the end, I ended up with a place to stay, but the entire experience was very stressful and I can't believe how disrespectful Ajahni P from Distrikt Hotel was. In the end, for the stress my family endured, we were given only 5000 points. The entire experience was completely inexcusable and I can't remember the last time I've been treated so badly.

title: Fee Rules Not Explained but Charged
text: My main issue with this hotel is what feels like predatory behavior of “the fees”. I booked and paid for the entirety of the stay vid Hotwire. Upon checking in, I was told that $100 would be held for incidentals. No problem. Then I was told I have $20 fee but I can use it in the restaurant. I asked “if it was per person” and the front desk replied “no just $20”. So we are busy doing what we came to the city to do so we never go the hotel restaurant. So the AM that we check out, I go oh I need to use the $20 so I go grab some snack bars and water to use it. We check out and ask for a bill print out and front desk says you will get it online. Fast forward I get the bill and it’s like $60. I’m like what is this for .. well turns out the $20 is PER DAY. And the snacks I grabbed were charged too not applied to the $20. I go through hoops btw Hotwire and the hotel to find out I was charged because the $20 is not charged in the day you check out so if you get breakfast then it’s just a separate charge. Well where and when was all this broken out? And since you know you The Hotel holds $100 not Hotwire then I should have been able to get a receipt before I left so I could have dealt with before o left. I just don’t like being randomly charged  without full knowledge. At the very least this policy and the rules should be posted at the front desk.

title: This is ultra-budget lodging in an iffy location
text: First the good things. The staff were lovely and my bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and modern. Now the bad: My room is so small that it doesn’t have room for any furniture other than a chair. It is located across from Port Authority, which is uncomfortable if you’re a woman walking alone at night. There is a $22 per day location charge that is ridiculous given the lack of amenities.

title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
text: AVOID AVOID AVOID - unless you are happy to suffer food poisoning and being high from inhaling second hand  weed… We have been home 6 weeks and the hotel are still yet to compensate us for cooking food in a microwave and giving me food poisoning for 4 days… even the head office have tried to email them requesting a full refund on our behalf but  we have heard nothing … absolute joke

title: Misled by previous reviews
text: Not sure how this hotel has gotten a 4 and a half rating. My dorm college room was more luxurious than the “upgraded” room I received. Bed is soft , pillows hard. Room overlooks the roof mechanical systems. Lamps are lopsided and basic furnishings. I thought Canopy was a upper upscale brand?

title: Good visit
text: Arrived super early on a Sunday snd understandably no rooms available but they did store my luggage so I was grateful.  I arrived late THST evening to check in and the agent was very pleasant.  We got to the room and it’s small but had everything need and the view was perfect.  There were no bath towels so I had to run down to front desk to get two.  He apologized gave me one and then brought another one to the room.  The cordless phone was not working, I reported it upon departure.  Hotel is close to everything but area is not most desirable it’s right next to port authority.

title: Deceptive
text: Not a very nice accommodation and the mandatory $20 charge for bar food/drink was disingenuous and unexpected. No complimentary coffee was also an alarming deficit. The room was quite small and very much like a motel

title: Location
text: This hotel sits across the street from the Port Authority Bus terminal clustered among 3 other hotels.  The street is not well lit and does not seem safe - you definitely need to be aware of your surroundings when walking to or from the hotel at night.  The lobby is quite small and not very welcoming.  While there is an additional mandatory fee it is unclear why since there are so special amenities.  The deluxe room was clean, comfortable and spacious.  Be sure to ask for an upper floor to minimize street noise.

title: Necessita di rinnovamento
text:
L’hotel si trova in una zona centrale comoda ma molto brutta e degradata in quanto costeggia la Port Authority dove arrivano i bus e quindi non molto ben frequentata 
Le stanze dono medie anche per gli standard locali ma necessitano di un rinnovo negli arredi abbastanza vecchi e trascurati
La pulizia è scarsa la camera viene rifatta solo su richiesta ed i servizi non giudicabili in quanto non ci sono
Non una delle migliori soluzioni sempre a parità di standard

title: Mixed review
text: To celebrate my daughter’s 16th birthday, I took her to NYC to do some shopping and eating.  We picked this hotel because of its great reviews and close proximity to many NYC sights. When we first arrived (2/18 evening), we were greeted by very pleasant front desk staff.  That evening, we went down to the bistro to get a snack and use the food coupon.  The staff at the bistro was not great.  First, we ordered a pretzel appetizer and waited several minutes before she says they were out of it.  Why not tell us ahead of time? Snack options and menu was minimal and poor.   We checked out early (2/19) and kept our luggage at the front desk.  The luggage assistant was great along with the morning front desk staff.  But then when we came back to add to our luggage check, that front desk person was rude.  Restaurant attendant in the afternoon was also rude.  I would say the stay was a 3/5.  The positives were some friendly staff, great location and   clean rooms.  The negatives were food options, bistro rude staff and some rude front desk staff.

title: Thanks.
text:
We stayed here for 7 days at the beginning of December. Location great, room not the largest but functional and spotlessly clean, Small bar/breakfast room from which you could get snacks and drinks, very handy. What is exceptional though is the staff, they always go the extra mile, with great politeness and friendlyness. I can not praise them all enough.
Thank you all.
Lorenzo and Tina Guerrini.
England.

title: Friendly Staff
text: The check in was easy, the staff friendly and responsive. The room was fine, but the shower door design was a little difficult to maneuver without get hit with water before you're ready to get in. I liked that there was a magnifier mirror in the bathroom, but I always think rooms are too dark and could use more lighting in the room. That said, the desk lamp was very good for work.

title: Not first time elevator went out in NY hotel! Average food.
text: Diamond perk upgrade to top level is great until the elevator goes out. Walked up 32 flights of stairs with bags and a 12 year old. Food takes a while and don't get the wings. I usually play it safe with a burger when I'm on the road, hungry with slow service. The rooms are nice, good views but great location!

title: Bed very soft - service so so
text:
In summary style + and -
- One elevator working - took stairs from/to 15th floor often because its small and can take a long time
- Room not cleaned despite requesting it 
- Breakfast not worth it. 
+ Staff is friendly, free water bottles on request
+ Location, many good restaurants and touristic sights at walking distance
- Bed is very soft 
- alarm was set for a different time
+ free 20 usd voucher to use at the bar

title: Don’t order food with your daily credit; plan to wait for the elevators
text:
Arrived around 9:00 pm on Christmas. Was told that the bar would stop serving food at 10:30 pm. After checking in, I headed down to the bar to use my daily food credit. The line was long and slow, but there were a lot of people in the bar. As I got to the front of the line the bar tender handed a guest her fries and asked what she could get me. I told her the food I wanted to order and she said the kitchen was closed. This was at 10:00 pm. I was confused because that was not what the guy at the front desk said. So my dinner that evening after a long travel day was a soda and trail mix. I wasn’t going to order a drink after watching the bartender look up recipes and pour incredibly slow. I complained the next day and the front desk apologized saying that they didn’t realize she closed early. Breakfast was open until 11:00 am. They ran out of food most days and they even ran out of to-go containers. So if you wanted to eat breakfast you had to stay in the bar. One evening I ordered the chicken sliders. They arrived with chicken and bread. No toppings whatsoever. It was very dry to say the least. Out of the 6 days I was there, only one server had a decent attitude in the bar. Most were super crabby and felt put out to help you. 

The rooms I expected to be small, but that was fine. The linens had stains and holes in them. That wasn’t ok. The luggage rack was completely mangled and not usable. They had 2 elevator shafts for the hotel. More than half of the time one of the elevators wasn’t working. The front desk was doing their best to get it fixed, but the wait time for a ride was 20+ minutes. And that was in extremely fully elevators. Good luck trying to get down to the lobby with your luggage if you were on anything lower than the 20th floor. I witnessed many people taking the stairs. 

The positives of the hotel were the front desk staff (all very friendly and polite) and the location. Everything was in walking distance.

title: Location, location location
text: Once parked we walked everywhere, the checkin was super friendly the room super quiet.  I would recommend this little gem for a comfy nights sleep with every thing New York had to offer at hands reach.  There are only 5 rooms per floor so you are going to be near the elevator, but it’s ok it makes no noise.  The beds were comfy, there were plenty of towels.  I will return to this spot.

title: Tired staff in a not so nice area
text: I checked in online. That meant that I didn¨t get any food voucher or information about the gym. The staff was tired and didn´t  like there job. Didn´t get what I ordered for breakfast and they handed my food to another customer. Just picked the one who was closest. During peak ours the elevator took forever to arrive. I had to wait for 10 min or more. The beds are nice. That is why I choose hotels in the Hilton group, the beds are always nice.

title: Je moet erg veel geduld hebben
text: Gelokt door alle positieve recensies hebben wij dit Hotel geboekt. Om positief te beginnen, het ligt erg gunstig op 10 minuten lopen van Times Square, de kamers zijn netjes (wel beetje doorzakbedden) en wij hadden mooi uitzicht. De entree ziet er wat rommelig uit. Grootste probleem is dat ze van alles maar 1 hadden die werkte… Van de liften werkte er meestal maar 1 (met 32 verdiepingen!), dus van je kamer kan zo maar 20 minuten duren als je nog in de lift past… Het barretje waar je ook kan ontbijten wordt (meerdere dagen geconstateerd) maar bemand door 1 persoon die ook alle drankjes en gerechten zelf moet klaarmaken. Reken hier dus ook op half uur in de rij staan. Zo kan ontbijten een landurig project worden als je ook lift op en neer wil. Wat later voor ontbijt (je wil je food voucher toch liever wel gebruiken…) en dan is veel al op. Zelfs de dagelijkse flesjes gratis water zijn de laatste dagen op. En op 1 januari is het zelfs überhaupt niet mogelijk om iets te eten te krijgen.  Het personeel lijkt inmiddels murw geworden hiervoor. Helaas dus niet de beleving die we verwachtten.

title: Avoid…the double tree next door is much better managed
text:
This place epitomizes terrible management. Staff has no desire to help. The hotel is in a state of total decay…think death spiral. 

I reported a plugged sink multiple times to the front desk. I finally had to pull a Wookie shaped hair ball from the p-trap so I could brush my teeth

title: Clean hotel & staff very friendly/helpful
text: The hotel rooms were very clean! Staff were very helpful and friendly all the way from the front desk to the cleaning. Had no issues in anyway while at the hotel. Clean hotel, rooms were great. Staff always answered questions with no attitude. Would definitely recommend this hotel!!

title: Poor Customer Service
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights in October. Hotel itself is not bad. Rooms are a decent size for NYC. We're  Hilton Gold members and this is the first time I have not been upgraded to a higher valued room. I'll go over the good and bad of this hotel and then expand on the bad.

The Good
- Rooms are a decent size for NYC
- Room was clean upon arrival
- Elevators aren't as bad as others state
- Hotel is in a decent location, never felt unsafe 

The Bad
- Customer service is severely lacking
- Breakfast isn't that great
- Internet is not premium as advertised
- Housekeeping does not clean your room even if you ask multiple times
- Management does not follow up
- Hotel does not value Gold or Diamond members of Hilton
- Hotel will charge you and not give you Gold / Diamond members food and beverage credit

Check in was pretty straightforward. Was not offered an upgrade to our room. This is the first time this has ever happened to me with Hilton so instantly knew customer service would be lacking at this hotel, but oh well. We received the $20 each daily credit for hotel destination charge. Was told this was mandatory and charged by every NYC hotel (this is simply not true). You get premium internet for this charge but I can tell you this is not premium internet. I've had it at other Hilton hotels and was able to do video calls with it. At this hotel with their "premium" internet I was not able to do a video call as it froze and the video quality was  choppy. 

The breakfast at this hotel isn't great. The sandwich is heated up in a microwave. The acai bowl was good but whp would regularly pay that much? I felt bad for the staff at the bar as there was always only 1 person there and they were overworked and understaffed while the front desk always had multiple people there who were sometimes standing around. The allocation of staff is not great at this hotel. On the first night after using the daily credit at the bar I went to the front desk and asked for room service the next day. Again in the morning before breakfast I confirmed with the front desk staff that my room was on the list for room service that day and was told it was. I had breakfast and put my name and hotel room on the receipt so that I could claim my food and beverage credit. I went out for a few hours and came back at 1130am my room was not done but cleaning staff was on our floor. I confirmed with the front desk that my room would get done today and that I would be back by 330pm and it needed to be done before then. I got back at 345pm and it was not done. I was told cleaning staff left at 5pm for the day and they weren't sure if my room would get done today. I asked to speak to a manager and was told no one was there. At this point I asked for a towel from the front desk to have a shower and was told they didn't have any and that cleaning staff would bring one. Staff brought it at 415pm to my room and asked if they could cleany room now. I told them to forget it as I needed it done before 345pm. The next day I charged my breakfast to my room again. Upon checkout I asked again to speak to a manager and was told they would be in later in the day. Someone from the hotel called me later in the day to tell me I left a pink backpack in my room. I told them they had the wrong guest but that I did want to speak to a manager and was told this person was not a manager and that someone would call me. I got my bill later the day I checked out and saw I was charged for breakfast. My Gold Hilton food and beverage credit was not applied for both days of my stay. I called the hotel a week later to speak to a manager as no one had called me. I was told someone would call me back. No one has since. No accountability for this hotel. I can not recommend this hotel as the customer service is lacking in multiple departments and starts with a non existent management team. I will be reporting this to Hilton.

title: Awesome Experience !
text: For a boutique hotel in midtown NYC, this was a wonderful experience for 2 adults & a child.  Room w/ 2 dbl beds was roomy , quiet, & very clean.  We walked to most places like Central Park & Radio City Music Hall.  Convenient subway access to Battery Park for Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial, China Town as well as subway to LaGuardia airport.  Always felt safe.  Never experienced any of the negative comments posted earlier.  Very reasonably priced when compared to other hotels literally next door!  NYC was the busiest I have ever seen during this Christmas season!!

title: Friendly staff, great location, will def return
text: I'm not going to lie after reading some of the reviews on this page I was quite nervous about coming here to stay but I honestly had no reason to be.  On arrival we were greeted by Cindy who was amazing :) we arrived about 1230 so our room wasn't ready (which was no issue we didn't expect it to be) and Cindy upgraded us to a deluxe king room and stored  our luggage for us so we could head straight out to the city, the gentleman that took our luggage had a constant smile on his face and was very helpful with any questions we asked.  When we arrived back we gor our room on the 18th floor, the room was both spacious and clean and the bed is the most comfortable bed iv ever slept in, you do pay a resort fee of $20 a night but this is given back to you in a voucher that you ask reception for each day. This can be used in the morning for breakfast or the evening for drinks, we used our for breakfast each morning which was a lovely way to start your day. House keeping are available if you ask but we were happy enough just getting fresh towels and we left our own rubbish down to Reception when needed as we weren't in the room enough to need someone to come and clean it. In reference to the comments regarding the homeless coming in and out of reception, we didn't see this at all, there is homeless all over NYC at the minute so don't let that put u off staying here as u will see it everywhere. We would 100% come and stay here again in the future! Thank you to all the staff for making our stay an enjoyable one :)

title: Forced us to stay in a room with no heat!!
text:
Stay far from this hotel. Worst customer service ever!! 
It was 3 of us and we booked a double room.  We stayed here for one night - after an hour, we realized our room had no heat and we went to the front desk to let them know. We were told by GENESIS at the front desk that the maintenance person would not arrive until 9am the next morning to see to the problem. In the meantime, she can give us extra blankets.... like WHAT?!? It's 30 degrees outside!!!  She wanted us to sleep in those conditions?!? She refused to change our room because we paid a certain amount and she could not switch because the other rooms costed more. Biggest crock of bull ever! Like how is that our problem??? We asked for the manager and was told Gideon was not in. Genesis made NO attempt to call him! We let her know how pissed we were and confirmed we'd be asking for a full refund on the room. We then went out, and returned 30 min later. 
Magically, Genesis found a double room that she could put us in with heat!! 
We will NEVER stay here again and I'll advise everyone to avoid every booking Distrikt Hotel.

title: Absolutely no not stay here. Service is terrible.
text: Terrible service..... no amenities,  location is unsafe...elevator takes forever.... Gideon the manager was beyond unprofessional. Rats were cracking g around in the pipes and the property would not assist in moving me to a safer Hilton property and charged me for a night's stay even though I left at 11am.

title: Very underwhelming for a Hilton property
text: Very basic hotel and underwhelming for a Hilton property. Lobby is boring. Rooms are dated. Mine had a smell to it like an old motel. Nothing chic about this place. The “restaurant” is basically non-existent. Breakfast for Gold members is a warmed up sandwich served in a bag like you get at 7-11. The phone system in the hotel was broken. I asked for housekeeping daily upon check-in, got it once and I stayed 3 nights. On the plus side, the view was nice and the staff members were pleasant and accommodating.

title: Stay anywhere else.
text: Run don’t walk to another hotel! Between being forced to have 3 people share a king vs receiving a requested double, mold on the pillows, housekeeping only if you ask before 10 am daily, and it still not receive it, being limited to 2 bath towels thrown in a bag in the lobby for 3 guests after said housekeeping never showed, safety hazardous broken phone line, front desk supervisors that arrive at 11:30 am and not available, photos that do not show the current state of the lobby, a daily credit that doesn’t occur unless you use a coupon you did not receive and being charged incorrectly for incidentals and being told to call later when they know their phone system is broken, I’m thrilled to say as a Hilton Diamond member, it’s my first and last time at the Distrikt.

title: NYC Hostel
text: This is not a hotel, it’s a hostel. Awful Hilton offering. Shocking that the staff here were terrible to every guest we saw them interact with. They made fun of an elderly couple who couldn’t find the parking garage, including the manager on site at the time. Awful property.

title: What happened?
text:
Rooms are spacious and clean, it’s in a central location 

Unfortunately our visit wasn’t as good as previous ones, the bar has limited opening hours, there is no room service 
Housekeeping is erratic & has to be requested 
We requested a fridge, we asked 3 times, it never appeared 
Some staff are very pleasant, most are sullen and unprofessional 
There is a mandatory resort fee, they give you this back in a voucher to spend in the bar, however you are charged tax on it too. I would have preferred that they don’t charge this & you can buy your breakfast anywhere, it seems like a bit of a con
We used the hotel car service, the driver tried to adjust the agreed price, we refused to pay it, we were overcharged for a short 20 minute journey 
We wouldn’t choose to stay here again, there are far better options for the £350 a night cost
This hotel used to be great with happy hours & complimentary snacks in the bar, housekeeping came as standard, staff were friendly and welcoming, not sure what has happened for it to go downhill

title: Super Convenient
text: This unassuming hotel is tucked away in a busy area of town. It’s a 10 minute walk to Times Square and about 15 min to Madison Square Garden. It’s close to many attractions, restaurants, Lincoln Tunnel, and the Port Authority, so there is no shortage of things to do.  A couple of things to keep in mind: the hotel provides parking about two blocks away for $50 a night. Staff at the lot are friendly. There is no in and out privileges, so make sure to take everything out of your car. The hotel also provides a $20 voucher for the cafe attached to it but it’s only open from 7-11am for coffee and such. Our room was small but super clean. It didn’t have a coffee maker and there are no ice machines — you’ll have to call the front desk for ice which they deliver to your room. The room had a mini fridge. The area is busy and it can be noisy, so a higher floor works. It also it frequented by people who appear to be without a permanent residence, so if that bothers you, be forewarned. As for safety, we had no issues whatsoever.  Staff were always friendly and helpful. Overall, a great first visit!

title: Could be a great place if changes were made.
text:
The location of the hotel was ideal for us. Close to lots of transport options, especially port authority. Our room was ready when we arrived and that was a real bonus. The room itself was spacious with comfortable beds, plenty storage space and hot water with good shower pressure. You have to request housekeeping which we did most days  on others we asked for clean towels and the bin emptied. It was noisy at night as we were on the 4th floor I would recommend a higher floor. Also the smell of weed from people smoking out front was notiecable in the room. But it was everywhere anyway so no avoiding it and not the hotels fault.
We had booked on a bed and breakfast basis. Honestly don't it was a joke!!!. First morning we had issues when trying to explain we had alreay paid. We were given the limited choices and to be honest Ive been to New York 8 times and this was the poorest breakfast ever. But that wasnt the real issue.
 It honestly went downhill from here. It was very confrontational the next two mornings. A different staff member, who was rude, and actually called us crazy. We went to reception to speak to them to ensure breakfast staff were aware of our B&B booking and to say how intimidated this guy made us feel. Banging about being very intimidating. The response was we will update the breakfast staff as you are not on the list and inform the manager of your concerns. Whilst at reception the breakfast guy came over and was rude again. To top it all the next morning my friend asked for the parfait to be told there were none left and whilst sitting eating our pastries watched other guests recieve the parfait. My advice would be avoid the breakfast altogether. We have never encoutered attitude like this in New York before and for 2 women travelling alone it wasn't great.
We were unable to ay to keep our room as the hotel was full that night but the luggage guy stored our cases and booked our airport transfer. He was by far the most helpful, pleasant staff member we encountered. 
We stayed for 6 nights and if it had been a less confrontational visit then we would probably have stayed again.
8th visit to New York and it wont be my last. Its an amazing place.

title: Amazing Location
text:
Location-Location-Location . Stayed 5 nights In the middle of everything. Port authority station just a minute walk, Penn station is 5 mints , Times Square is 5 mints. What else you could ask for! Staff are super-friendly and they were able to accommodate us in a 2 queen beds room as we requested. Meant a lot to us as family of 2+2.

I would have rated them 5 if it wasn’t for the cleanliness issue we had.

Highly recommended.

title: Tolles Hotel, sauber, perfekte Lage, nette Mitarbeiter
text: Ich bin selbst Reiseverkehrsskauffrau und kann diese Unterkunft total empfehlen. Tolles kleineres Hotel in perfekter Lage. Sehr nette Mitarbeiter. Tolle, saubere Zimmer. Ich kann die Kategorie Deluxe empfehlen. Ich hatte ein tolles Zimmer mit Blick auf die Skyline. Ich würde hier immer wieder wohnen.

title: Grab your wallet both in and outside the Hotel
text: The Hotel is crazy expensive when fees are added. My two-night stay was about $250.00 per x2. With my lack of math skills, it adds up to around $600. with some tax and fees. My bill was closer to $925.00. It is robbery if you ask me for my opinion. How they can be so brazen and top off the price with excessive fees. Do me once but never again. Many Many Homeless on this street. Do your homework carefully. Maybe you can practice avoiding the ever growing mentally ill and homeless in Manhattan.  It is starting to give me flashbacks of the 70s and 80s. My room was adequate and on a par with a Comfort Inn hotel. No stirrers for the coffee machine. Only one coffee type Pod for use in the maker. Safe in room was already closed and locked. I would have had the have staff come up and reset the machine if I wanted to use it. This should have been done prior to me taking the room. Once again it may sound as though I am nitpicking, but the cost was very high for me for the level of service and overall quality of the product.

title: Great place to stay after a concert at The Beacon.
text:
We were in town for a concert at The Beacon.  

Parked car overnight at a lot at 350 w 37th Street which has an ideal location to Lincoln Tunnel. 

Read reviews & booked a King Deluxe & asked for a room above 13th floor.  We stayed in room 1501.  
It was decent size for a NYC hotel room &   bathroom had a heavy (read “soundproof”) door.  Had ample space for clothes & gear. 

Got an ice bucket w ice from a super nice bartender and used the $20 voucher for mixers in our room.  

Staff incredible friendly & helpful. Will def stay here again!

title: Great Location, but stay at any other property on the street
text: Horrific place. Lots of homeless people in and out during day time hours. The desk people are not always there which encourages random people in and out. Room was full of fruit flies when we checked in. The elevator broke 2 out of the 4 nights we were there which caused several problems. Hidden "resort fees" that they blamed Hilton, Priceline, the person outside for. Extremely unprofessional. I bet they have hourly rates.

title: Girls Trip
text: Staff was very friendly.Great suggestions for food and entertainment. Great location. Room clean. I wish the bar and restaurant had better operating hours. Bathroom sink too small for 2 ladies. I would stay at this location again

title: Definitely will say again
text:
Definitely will stay here again for nyc comicon ! 
Proximity to the Javits Center is excellent we had a great trip
The bar area was nice 
❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ this is alot of characters to write
The beds are amazing

title: Tolle Lage
text:
Das Hotel liegt ideal für einen Sightseeing Besuch. Wir hatten ein schönes Zimmer im 28. Stock und deswegen mit dem Straßenlärm kein Thema. Die Zimmer sind zwar klein, aber ausreichend. Bei einem Städtetrip halte ich mich nur zum Schlafen im Zimmer auf. Die Frühstücksauswahl ist übersichtlich, aber das, was sie haben, ist gut.
Die Damen und Herren an der Rezeption waren freundlich und bemüht.

title: Extremely Convenient!
text:
I walked from Penn Station to the Hotel. It was very convenient! Walking distance to the Theater District, Restaurant Rowe, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and so much more! Complimentary access to Mid City Gym.

Rachel, at the front desk, was beyond exceptional! She answered all my quirky, annoying questions! She was very gracious, patient and accommodating! 
Dennis was also extremely helpful.
My short stay was amazing! 
Highly recommend!

title: Great hotel near MSG and theaters
text: Loved the location as well as the rooms, service and breakfast.  Only wish we had been able to stay longer.  Rooms were well decorated and not as small as I imagined they would be.  Bathroom was pretty and all was clean.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Self parking was an easy walk.  Loved being close to both MSG and theaters.

title: Good place to stay
text: Hotel is ideally located near Times Square. Whilst aware of the local tax payable another tax was added for each day of stay. Twenty dollars was returned daily to be spent in the cafe/bar. Our room was good with 2 double beds, walk in shower and had a good view overlooking Time Square. I had chosen this hotel because my niece was under 21 and the cafe/bar looked like a place we could sit in the evening. I was disappointed as it was small and dark, so we chose to sit in our room instead.  I always love Hilton Hotels for their firm but comfy beds and lovely bed linen!

title: Everything you need, no frills. NIce staff at the front desk.
text:
We cashed in some Hilton points for a one night stay after a Broadway show. Glad we did.

We were able to check in a bit early, so I dropped our bags off. We then proceeded to leave our car at the hotel's designated parking partner at 136 W. 40th. Hotel guests get $10 off an overnight stay - and the lot is well run if a bit far from the hotel.

Our room was in the 3 series, so it was right off the elevator but we were not disturbed by any noise. The room and bath were very clean. Sleep quality was excellent, the HVAC was strong and fairly quiet, the bedding was very good and there was no noise from other guests. The bathroom was the best feature of the room - a little nicer than a Hilton Garden Inn bathroom in terms of space and a stall shower instead of the dreaded shower/tub. Amenities were limited but the hotel did provide separate hand and both soap bars. The towels were good as well.  The TV was quite large maybe a 46" or 50." There was an alarm clock with extra outlets and USB charging ports next to the bed. Very handy.

The hotel gave us a voucher for Collage the bar/restaurant -- however it had to be redeemed the night of our stay and thus could not be used for breakfast. I cashed it in for soft drinks. The bar was surprisingly lively on a Monday night - mostly with European tourists.  Like the corridors, the bar was a bit stuffy, in contrast to the excellent HVAC in our room.

I thought the clerk who checked us out was particularly pleasant, so shout out to him.

title: Nice stay, great staff.
text: Stayed here for a two-day solo trip, room 1301. I arrived early, around 8:30am. Room was not ready as they had a full house the night before.  Lobby area was very attractive and clean.  Front desk staff very nice and helpful.  My bags were tagged and put into a secure area until my room was available in the afternoon. I had a King Deluxe room, it was very clean, small and cozy.  Just right for what I needed.  Only two issues I found was the lighting in the room was dim, only two lamps. I feel a lamp at the desk would have been nice and also no sheers for the large window, just the heavy curtains.  There was not an ice bucket in the room, but I was able to get a couple cups of ice from the bar/dining area. I had two quiet nights, no issues with noise.  All in all, a great stay and I would return.

title: This Hotel was amazing!
text: This Quaint tucked in little hotel was AMAZING! The front desk team members were outstanding! Extremely kind, professional, very helpful, and funny! My room... OMG my room was amazing. A little on the small cozy side, but was fantastic! Super clean, the shower was one I would have in my house! I had an awesome view of the city. Definitely give this hidden gem a try!

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Great location within walking distance to Times Square. Safe area, clean property with an AMAZING Staff! Every interaction I had with them was smooth, friendly and professional. 5 stars and then some!

title: Décevant
text:
La chambre est petite mais propre par contre pas de bouilloire ou machine à café comme mentionné. Le ménage est seulement fait sur demande.
L hôtel est très bien placé.
Le gros problème vient du personnel. Ils ne sont absolument pas aimables ni serviables sauf une petite jeune. Après une erreur de leur part sur la réservation   nous avons été laissés dans le doute un grand moment puis aucune excuse. 
Il y a certainement de meilleur hôtel aux alentours.

title: Soggiorno a NY tra stranezze e lunghe attese
text:
Il punto di forza dell’hotel è sicuramente la posizione in quanto a pochi passi da Times Square. 
Per il resto occorre armarsi di pazienza: il personale fa il necessario, a volte quasi controvoglia. Di certo non coccolano il cliente. 
L’albergo ha 32 piani e gli ascensori sono solo 2: durante il nostro soggiorno uno non funzionava e l’attesa era infinita. Le camere non vengono pulite perché la politica dell’albergo prevede che senza pulizia in camera “si è più tranquilli durante il soggiorno” quindi occorre richiederla giorno per giorno alla reception. 
La colazione è la vera nota dolente. Pochissima scelta di cose da mangiare: un misero contenitore con qualche brioches. Il salato non c’è: si può solo ordinare un sandwich a pagamento però. Per chi avesse allergie o intolleranze, abbandonate ogni speranza: prodotti specifici non sanno neanche cosa siano. Una sola persona che serve tutti gli ospiti quindi se avete fretta di andare in giro a New York, vi conviene fare colazione fuori. E anche se avete la colazione inclusa, come noi, sappiate che ogni giorno dovranno controllare e segnare ogni singola cosa che ordinate per farvi un conto di $0 la cui utilità ancora non mi è chiara. 
Le camere non sono male, a parte la moquette che non è il massimo. Però il materasso molto comodo: almeno la notte dormivo bene! Ma per il resto bocciato

title: Super vriendelijke mensen
text:
We verbleven 4 nachten in dit hotel.het is geweldig gelegen op wandelafstand van time square. Elke morgen koffie..bagels..fruitsap..cake..
Wat het hotel zo speciaal maakt zijn de mensen die er werken .1000 maal dank aan Rafaela  en George  van de receptie en Clinton van het ontbijt.
Rafaela..jij hebt een gouden hart voor de klanten !!! Ook George  en Clinton waren superlief!!!!
Ik hoop dat de directie weet dat ze fantastisch  personeel hebben !!
Fantastisch  !!!! Dank u
Micheline

title: We loved it, nice hotel, amazing staff, we definitely will be back!!!
text:
We had „king bed“ room on 9th floor, and it was perfect, very clean, all furniture is of a good quality and new, modern, no smells, no humidity, very fresh. Towels were fresh and white (like really white - in NYC even 5* hotels hardly maintain white). Up-to-date AC system and it worked just perfectly. They also give you back about $20+ per day(for HHONERS members the amount is even more), which we nicely spent for good hot snacks and drinks at the lobby bistro, which we enjoyed. Bottled water was available at the reception, we also had coffee/tea maker in the room with coffee, tea, milk, sugar etc. We had avocado toast for breakfast, it was good. Service in the bar/bistro also was very good. The staff is the best, all are happy, helpful, kind. All halls and elevators were also clean. We had some concerns before arrival due to some negative reviews, but honestly, I didn’t get why some previous guests were unhappy with the hotel 🤷‍♀️ (maybe the hotel just tremendously improved by the time we stayed). We really had nothing to complain about. Quite opposite, for NYC for such fairly inexpensive rate we received superb quality and service! We stayed earlier at Candlewoods nearby (on 39th str.) for about similar  rate, and it was so much worse than District (old furniture, dirty halls, bed smell, horrible AC, unfriendly staff, old towels etc.). 

Thank you, Distrikt staff, you are doing great job!!!

title: Great hospitality in NYC
text: Distrikt Hotel had brilliant location, spacious rooms, lovely beds and brilliant, very helpful staff: Dennis, Ashley, Cindy & co. Great hosts! Offered an upgrade without any charge(and without me asking).  Free water bottles 24/7 during the heat wave. ATM-service by the front desk. Next to Port Authority.

title: Vacanza a New York
text:
Vicino Times Square, zona Hell’ Kitchen. La camera è pulita e la ragazza alla reception, quella con i capelli rosa, è carina e disponibile e questi sono gli unici lati positivi. Due sole ascensori per un albergo di 32 piani , destinati anche al personale di servizio, obbligano a tempo di attesa biblici. L’aspettò peggiore è la colazione. Una minuscola stanza con un unico commesso è allucinante. Noi avevamo la colazione inclusa ma puntualmente il ragazzo del bar doveva fare improbabili verifiche facendoci aspettare un’infinità di tempo e creando lunghe code. Le paste disponibili erano talmente poche che se arrivavi più tardi rischiavi di non mangiare. Il tutto condito dalla maleducazione del personale di servizio. 
P.s. La camera viene rifatta solo se lo chiedete alla reception

title: Bravo, super Dennis, fai meritare 5 alla struttura
text: L’hotel appartiene alla ‘famiglia’ Hilton, ed è di ottima qualità. Meriterebbe 4 su 5 ma la valutazione va a 5 per la gentilezza e l’affabilità di Dennis, che si è fatto in quattro per rispondere a ogni nostra esigenza! Camera di buone dimensioni (deluxe) a un prezzo giusto per la zona (poche centinaia di mt da Times Square), tutti i giorni pulita e rifatta, con ovvio cambio di asciugamani. A cercare un dettaglio, il siatema di aria condizionata un po’ rumoroso (forse un po’ datato…). Nel prezzo della camera era incluso un voucher giornaliero di 20 dollari da spendere al bar, che significa circa il 10 per cento del costo della camera. Ascensore sempre disponibile e libero (più di una volta, in centro a nyc, mi è capitato di imbattermi in strutture sottodimensionate sotto il profilo dei lift, con lunghe attese), bar essenziale ma efficiente. Sicuramente un’ottima opzione se il budget è questo, sia per la posizione, sia per il rapporto con la qualità offerta.

title: Very shabby and poor service.
text: Everything about this hotel was shabby,  The key cards didn’t work.  The lights in the room didn’t work.  My blow dryer sparked and started smoking.  Staff did nothing when anything was brought to their attention.

title: Ottima posizione ma…
text:
Hotel in un punto strategico vicino la stazione dei bus tanti locali nei dontorni e facilità nel muoversi la stanza pulita primo giorno servizio pulizia ottimo poi per le altre 4 notti assente ci hanno lasciato senza asciugamani e trovato il letto disfatto in pratica non è mai passato nessuno. 
Ci siamo lamentati ricevendo solo scuse e un voucher da utilizzare nella zona food dove c è ben poco di food  e nemmeno hanno rimediato al servizio nemmeno facendoci trovare degli asciugamani puliti poco organizzato

title: This hotel does not reflect Hilton in any way.
text: I would avoid this hotel.   The room was not clean.  Staff attitude was variable.  In house food service / coffee house / bar was not anything to brag about.  In fact the service there was horrible.  Many guests waited in line then ultimately walked away as the service was not what was needed.  Demand was too great or really too much for one person

title: Understaffed And Rude.
text:
As a Diamond Elite Hhonors member, I’ve stayed in my fair share of Hilton properties over the years, but never have I had an experience like this. 

After a gruelling day working all I wanted was some in-room dining and to relax in our room. On calling reception I was greeted (if you can call it that) by a person who was brusk at the most generous. 

You see, the problem with this hotel is that you have to order in-room dining in the bar, and pay for it in the bar. And as there is only one member of staff who can’t leave the desk, nobody can bring a menu to your room or even tell you what is on the menu. 

Add to the the aircon that didn’t have as much puff as Wheezy from Toy Story, you can see why we will never stay here again. 

This was a King Deluxe room. 

I have stayed over 40 nights in Hilton properties in NYC this year, and this was the worst experience ever.

title: Great Stay - Convenient to eat in Hell’s Kitchen, go to Broadway, or Experience Times Square.
text: Minimalist hotel - Rooms were clean and staff was great! The street it is onnis a bit sketchy, but we just kept walking and minded our own business. No one appeoached and hotel is key access at night. Overall, a great stay and the vouchers were a great perk. We were able to get drinks, water, etc, every day.

title: Better than expected
text: Like many reviews have stated, this hotel is relatively small but it’s a decent place to stay in a great location.  Although rooms are small, my room was very clean, bed comfortable but on the soft side, friendly/professional staff.  Price point was great compared to the other big chain hotels in the same vicinity.  Like all other hotels in the area, a mandatory $20 per day fee is charged but you receive $20 per day credit for beverages and snacks.  Really liked that it was a short walk to Times Square, Amtrak, and Hudson Yards.

title: Esperienza non buona
text:
Nel complesso non mi è piaciuto.
Ottima posizione ma per 3 persone ci hanno dato una camera veramente piccola dove non c'era posto nemmeno x le valige, l'armadio era a un' anta ( vedi foto).
Il personale dell' albergo era gentile ma quello del bar era distaccato e sembra scocciato.
Siamo stati 3 notti ma ci hanno pulito la camera 1 volta sola, la prima volta hanno detto che x covid non entravano in camera senza aver richiesto il servizio, la seconda (l'avevamo richiesto) non è stata pulita.
Inoltre una mattina a causa di un loro disguido, non ci hanno dato la colazione senza avere rimborso o altra suzione (magari mandandoci in altro posto).
Insomma... x me questo albergo non vale minimamente 4 stelle

title: There is a DoubleTree next door - Much Better Option
text: The air conditioning broke on the second day. Took two days before the engineers decided it was actually broken and moved us to a new room. Housekeep will disregard the DND sign on your door and enter whenever they please, be careful with that. The F&B credit is substantial but there is no real "dinner" and the bar is only open from 5-10:45. The pictures make this hotel appear much nicer than it really is. The rooms are average at best. We've stayed at both this hotel and the DoubleTree next door, I would definitely go back to the DoubleTree before coming here again. Staff is not very friendly either. Your best bet is to go with the digital key and avoid the front desk as much as possible or you'll be in for a long wait.

title: Poor on-site restaurant experience
text: Chicken wings were served cold and even refused to be microwaved. Who eats cold chicken wings? Very unprofessional behaviour by the host name Elizabeth. Same problem with the coffee one time but on other days coffee was good.

title: Not Up to Par for a Hilton Property
text: While this hotel is within walking distance of the Theater District and Times Square, it was not a pleasant experience staying there. We arrived early and hoped for an early check-in, a situation that is usually accommodated. Unfortunately not here. Later, when we checked in the attendant explained we would have to pay a tourist type fee for each day stayed but it would be offset by "free breakfast" and a stipend of $56.00 for "drinks." She repeated this several times, so it was not misheard. There is no free breakfast and the money can be applied toward any food and drink. The confusion caused several conflicting discussions with the staff in the bar. While there is a sign on the elevator that we saw on the final day of our stay about requesting cleaning, this is new to Covid and I was not aware of it. We were able to get clean towels which helped but the trash needed taking away and we did not want to continue to bother due to our being confused about policies. I had to unplug the phone as it kept beeping. The staff were often distracted and at one point, my husband had to go to the front desk to get a bar employee to help him. When we left the hotel, the front area was littered with trash (see photo) seeming to echo the sentiment of this hotel. All of these things might have been more tolerated had the cost of our room not represented a luxury hotel.

title: A Hairy Situation
text:
According to the staff, I had a one off bad experience, which went like this:

After hours of traveling and working… hours… I head to the bathroom in my room, where I was greeted by hair in the sink and shower. Gross.

Around midnight, I pull my sheets back and I’m greeted by even more hair. My sheets were clearly not changed and obviously I’m now concerned about the overall cleanliness of my room. I call the front desk who gets new sheets delivered. Now it’s one in the morning and I’m changing out my own* sheets and I can’t sleep because I’m grossed out and I have another long day of work ahead of me.

The next day, I was moved to another room, (an upgrade they said, which in an NYC hotel is still smaller than a standard size room). I was assured that the head of housekeeping would be approving the room’s cleanliness before my arrival. Following another busy day of work and desperate for quality rest, I get settled in for the night, earlier, and there’s hairs in the sink and their cousins were waiting for me in the new bed! Two nights in a row, I am removing soiled sheets and replacing them with new ones and because I’m even more grossed out, I’m questioning the cleanliness of everything in that room and I lost sleep. But before I lost sleep, I “lost” my charger. Just kidding, it was stolen by a staff member. In between changing rooms, I left my charger plugged in at the desk. Because the hotel never collected my old room keys, I went back to the room to retrieve my charger and guess what was missing, my charger, stolen by a member of the property.
