The bed was remade, who knows if they replaced the bedding and the charger was gone. I brought this up to several staff members whose responses consisted of blank stares. I was promised a follow up call into this matter which never occurred. It’s also important to note that I was told that the housekeeping staff was lazy and that there was no surprise that my sheets weren’t refreshed. I was told by another staff member who picked hairs off of the bed that it was likely “just the housekeeper’s hair.”

title: Spring nyc visit
text:
Great location, loved that walking to the main places i needed to go were all within walking distance or the subway station, super close as well. 
Very convenient. The rooms are typical NY rooms. My room was clean and comfortable, im good with that. 
Slept great. Even though the busy noice of the street was almost non stop all night, but then again this city does not sleep.

title: still a good price for a NY city hotel
text: Room was very small and clean, bed comfortable, but the room can use more light. I did not like the mandatory resort fee, although a $20 voucher was able to get us 2 non-alcohol drinks and 2 small cans of orange juice. I can't say free use of the computer in the restaurant/bar area can justify a resort fee. It's not really right off Broadway and Times Square like a reviewer said but location is walkable to the theater area.

title: Clean hotel but beware of the Hilton Diamond Treatment
text: This mandatory $20 service charge, and adding my diamond discount of $15 dollars use it or loose, so 35 to spend the day of even if you get in late for Oreos and subpar snacks is BS.. plus be consistent. coffee makers in every room perhaps rather than having to leave the hotel property in the am and walk down the street to get coffee in the am... seriously?

title: Great value for location
text: We stayed at the Distrikt for a girls' weekend to New York City. The price could not be beat for the location right off Broadway and Times Square. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very friendly. It was very convenient to be able to store our bags behind the desk after we checked out to enjoy the rest of the day in the city without having to haul all of our luggage with us. We were not impressed with the quality or service at the Collage restaurant/bar on the first floor and while we used our $20 voucher (included in the room fees) we didn't feel it was worth spending any more money there.

title: Not the best hotel, what’s Tapestry unique?
text:
This was my first time at a Tapestry hotel as a loyal Hilton customer. We were not sadly upgraded. The checkin experience was disorganised. The room was okay but very small. There was no gym. My breakfast, avocado on toast, was inedible. 

The location is good and you can walk to many of the main sites of New York. However I’d stay somewhere different next time. 

I don’t now understand the Hilton Tapestry brand and what it offers.

title: Spring break vacation
text: The cleanliness of the room was horrible. There was hair all over the bathroom shower, floor, and toilet. I asked the front desk to have it cleaned, they stated they could not. I asked to move rooms, they said well we can get the housekeeping supervisor to clean it. When I returned the shower and toilet were cleaned but the floor still had hair. The safe in the room was giving an error code so I did not have my belongings safely locked away.

title: TRAVELLED WITH A BABY - AMAZING HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, STAFF SUPER ACCOMMODATING!
text:
We visited the Distrikt Hotel in New York as a family of 3, two adults and a 6 month old baby and booked via booking.com. 

We communicated with the hotel through booking.com messages (and I called the hotel a few days before travel) to let them know we were travelling with a small child and that we would need a crib/cot upon arrival. None of these messages got through to the actual hotel reception and apparently were just going through to switchboards for the wider "Hilton" hotel brand however this wasn't a problem. The reception staff were so helpful and literally catered for our every need, they bought a crib up to our room straight away with clean bedding to go inside. Also, there was a coffee machine in the room but no kettle – meaning sterilizing a 6 month old baby's bottles etc would be pretty hard. Again, I called the reception and 5 mins later a kettle was at my door, they literally couldn’t have done more for us and we knew we had chosen the right hotel. 

The hotel itself is basic but has everything you need for a stay in the Big City. It has one of the most central locations I have ever stayed in (a stone's throw from Central Times Square) and Hells Kitchen just on the other side meaning you had the best pick for restaurants of an evening. During our trip, everywhere central was walk-able from this hotel (even with a stroller). We walked to fifth avenue, times square, hells kitchen, central park, empire state, rockerfeller, Brooklyn bridge, Manhattan bridge etc. 

The rooms were clean and pleasant. The bathrooms were a little small and most only come with a shower but it wasn't too much of a problem. The rooms are cleaned upon request so if you're staying for a few days you can request it to be cleaned at the main reception area before 10am (for the same day). 

There is a safe deposit box in the room and a reasonable sized TV with all of the relevant TV channels for the US – plenty to keep you entertained. 

Overall we had a fantastic stay here and would definitely stay again on our next visit to New York – the hotel staff were so friendly we would love to go back!

Instagram: @journeywithuss

title: A Beautiful Experience.
text: I arrived early to the property on March 9th as I had a Wednesday matinee, hoping to check my luggage before heading off to the theater. Cinquitti( front desk staff ) told me yes but then told me my room was actually available. I was able to get dry( inclement weather that day ) and chill for a few minutes before making my way to the theater. I had 2 separate reservations so Cinquitti gave me instructions to come down the next day so I got to keep the same room. She helped me on day 2 to re-check in. Her kindness and friendliness did not go unnoticed. The room was quite comfortable. It was very clean and the refrigerator was a nice touch. I will definitely stay in your property again.God bless your wonderful staff for making me feel special.

title: Cerca a todo pero la ubicación no es la mejor
text: El hotel bueno, las instalaciones buenas, está cerca a todo pero la zona no es la mejor. En la noche uno se puede sentir inseguro en las dos ultimas cuadras para llegar al hotel. A pesar de ello, no vimos robos ni nada similar durante nuestra estadía.

title: A Diamond members go to when in NYC!
text:
This was my 3rd time staying at Distrikt but not my last. The location of the hotel is fantastic - subway,  food/local restaurants in HK, Times Square, Broadway shows - everything you need is a short walk away! The hotel is clean, the elevators are quick, the rooms are VERY well sized for NYC with fantastic views and breakfast at restaurant downstairs (where the menu is limited) is all you need to start your day. 
The stars of the hotel are without a doubt the front desk staff! Eva and Cindy - WOW, 5 stars across the board for these two...they welcomed me "home" by my name with huge smiles and open arms, these two alone are part of the reason for my frequent stays and coming from a HHonors Diamond Member, where I could stay anywhere in NYC that I choose, that's saying A LOT. Do yourself a favor, book a room here and I promise it will be your home away from home too!

title: Keurig!
text:
Heel goed hotel. Zeer vriendelijk personeel. De kamer wordt zeer netjes schoongemaakt.
Centraal gelegen dus zeer aan te raden! Dichtbij Times Square en een metrostation. Heel Manhattan is met de metro binnen een half uur te bereiken.

title: Had a good stay in this Hotel near Times Square
text: Stayed here for 1 night during the last winter storm with my brother who is a Diamond member. Upgraded (complimentary) to 2 double bed with accessible shower, with a good view of the skyscrapers. The size of the room is good the fact that it is located in Manhattan/Times Square. Coffee/tea amenities were not available in our room. The onsite restaurant is ok with a small selection of food for breakfast and used our food and beverages credit for it. Just be aware that New York hotels charged different taxes which will be added to the final bill. Overall, a good hotel in the centre of Manhattan, a few minutes away from Times Square. The staff in the reception was a very nice and accommodating.  As a Filipino, the good part of it is the proximity to Jollibee (a Filipino fast food), which is just 3 mins away on foot. Subway station is just the corner.

title: Not the best for a Hilton property
text:
I stayed here in Dec 2021 for work and I really like Hilton properties overall, but this one was disappointing.  I read the reviews on here before I booked my stay and I don't think I'd stay here again.

It's in a great location - walking distance to many neighborhoods and the subway is convenient.  The restaurant on property was close due to covid which was fine.  The rooms are actually normal size for a NY hotel and not small like other hotels I've stayed at.  I had a clogging issue with my bathroom sink and had to call the front desk many times since they kept telling me someone is on their way to fix it and this was late in the evening and I wanted to take shower but couldn't occupy the bathroom if someone was on their way.  He finally arrived and spent about 15 mins trying to unclog the sink but he didn't do a very good job since the issue was still there and I was over it and  let it be.

That's what I remember from my stay and next time I will find a better hotel to stay at.

title: Average hotel in NYC, but good location and nice view from room
text:
I had one night at the Distrikt Hotel New York City in a standard king bed room. As Hilton Gold I was not upgraded. I had access to a discounted corporate rate, but at $360 for the night, it was still somewhat steep. Manhattan hotels are usually pricey though, especially during the holidays. 

My room was on a high floor and did in fact have a pretty nice view - I could even catch a glimpse of the Empire State Building from one side. Very cool.

The room itself was pretty small (again, standard for NYC) and was pretty no frills. There was a fridge but no mini bar. The TV was large and pretty good overall. Decent bathroom. 

The hotel is located in a pretty central location - a short walk from Times Square and many tourist attractions.

The street that the hotel is located on is not super appealing, and the first impression upon entering is not good. The  reception area is super un-inviting and not very welcoming. Fortunately I was able to check in via the Hilton app and I used a digital key, so I did not interact with the local staff on site at all. 

I don't think the hotel had a restaurant on site. If so, I didn't notice it honestly. There are obviously many dining options nearby.

Overall, a decent stay.

title: Great location for getting around!
text:
Weighing up the pros and cons to this hotel, I have given it 4 stars out of 5 for the location the incredibly helpful members of staff. This was our first ever visit to New York, well our first trip to America in general and our travel rep provided us with some photos and location info on this hotel. 

Let's start with the pros... 

- It's around a 10 minute walk from Times Square and has a bus station as well as subway station directly opposite - perfect for getting around conveniently! 
- The Reception staff were super friendly and helpful. Dennis in particular was fantastic at advising us on how to get around each day, what was within walking distance and gave us a great recommendation for a breakfast diner.
- The rooms are clean, comfortable and have a mini fridge inside

Cons...

- Due to the location, it can be somewhat noisy outside when trying to get to sleep
- The rooms looked much different in real life than what I had seen in photos from our rep and what I had seen on Instagram. They are very basic and very small. 
- The bar in the hotel was closed (we were not informed this would be the case and would've been able to claim a free drink each day) which meant no on-site drinks, not even tea/coffee
- There are only two elevators, which are quite compact.  If you're on a high floor (we were on the 31st) you might be waiting a while

All in all, we had a pleasant stay at the Distrikt Hotel. It's in a great location if you want to be close to everything and as mentioned, the staff really were fantastic. We felt welcomed from the moment we arrived to the minute we waved goodbye. It would be nice if the next time we considered staying to see the hotel bar open, as it would be nice to see what kind of vibe that adds to the hotel also. 

Thanks for a great, comfortable stay! :-)

title: Très bien situé.
text: Accueil très correct. Chambre petite par rapport aux photos. Lit confortable. La chambre dans laquelle nous étions, ne comportait qu'un armoire penderie, sans étagères, ce qui a impliqué de laisser nos affaires dans les valises. La chambre n'a été nettoyée qu'au bout du 3ème jour (il faut laisser la pancarte ne pas déranger sur l'extérieur de la porte afin que la personne qui fait le ménage sache que celle-ci est occupée...bizarre, non...) Mention Très bien du fait de sa situation et de la proximité de beaucoup de petits restos pas très chers.

title: Good location overall
text: I was in NYC for a business trip and stayed one night due to proximity of my meeting location. Overall everything was satisfactory, did not use the breakfast service, but the front desk helped me get a car to the airport so that was nice.

title: Amazing staff, Deluxe rooms the Best
text:
Amazing team!! You must visit this hotel, you will not regret. Stay with my family for a week. Restaurant isn’t ready yet but they will find the way to make it right. You will fee welcome , like at home!

Thank you all!

title: Never again , so disappointed
text:
Yes it’s clean and the rooms are ok but it’s way to much money for what you get and not worth it  
It’s a great location but I was not told upon booking that the hotel can’t provide breakfast. I was I formed upon check in. Fine accepted but unlike other hotels I stayed during my trip they don’t even provide a kettle or similar to make a morning coffee or tea. 
After I checked out 2 days later I forgot sth in the room and calling the hotel hoping to retrieve it nothing was returned and I’m certain I left it in my room. Nothing you can do about stupidity but honesty would have been great. Anyway I would never book again.

title: Centrally located, fine hotel
text:
I stayed for one night in this hotel for business. It was a quick walk from the train station and I also walked to my event by Central Park. 

Check in was easy. I didn’t have any problems with the elevators as some others talk about. The bar and restaurant are closed for now. 

The room was clean. Like most rooms in New York, it was tight. It had some minor wear and tear but otherwise fine. It would have been nice to have a coffeemaker

I found the location just fine and didn’t have any concerns.

title: No fridge or microwave
text: Convenient location in the heart of New York City near port authority. The one complaint I have is that only king rooms come with fridges. We had booked a Queen room but it said it had a fridge but it didn’t. The hotel holds your bags

title: Great location  nice size rooms
text: Friendly  staff great location clean room nice size room walking distance to Times Square  and several restaurants. Large tv in room very comfortable bed safe and mini fridge in room waters provided atm in lobby

title: Horrible location and old rooms
text:
Very unhappy with the hotels condition and size of rooms. Horrible and unsafe surrounding area. Diamond Members are treated like first time guests. 
I travel to NYC every single week from
VA and have stayed at dozens of hotels, this one is horrible!

title: New York distrikt hotel
text: This hotel had no bar, restaurant, coffee area. Apparently our $275 room came with no refrigerator or coffee pot. The on-site restaurant was closed so we were directed down the street to Hell’s Kitchen deli for coffee and food. Room was ok but not what you would expect for the money or the area. Never again.

title: Great Weekend Stay
text: Stayed for the weekend, it’s at a great location; a short walk from Penn Station! Overall was an amazing stay, the staff were very friendly. Check in was a breeze, will definitely be staying here for future trips!

title: Disappointing
text: Hotel not in best area.  Parole board was a neighbor = plenty of people waiting to see their parole officer.  Aside from that, check in was fine.  Very friendly.  Was NOT informed that we would not have maid service.  Surprised on second day when room was not made up.  Also, no coffee maker.  My colleague had a machine in her room.  Also no breakfast.  Nothing.  No water or coffee in lobby.  Overall I would choose one of the many other Hilton brand properties in the area.

title: Very Clean,Terrible service
text: The front desk employees didn’t acknowledge us at all during our 3 days there. The Lobby, Elevator and Room were very clean. Also the cleaning staff were very nice and respectful. Overall 3/5 stars, most likely would not return or recommend.

title: Weekend Trip
text: Perfect location for walking anywhere you wish to go. Metros are near by as well. Very Friendly staff, Kareem was fabulous. Exceptionally clean rooms. Wished the roof top had been open, but other than that a great stay!

title: Great hotel
text: The hotel was well maintained and had a great vibe. Location was perfect and the staff was exceptional. Close to Broadway and time square and the metro. Rooms were small but comfy. Not much amenities but who needs those if your this close to time square.

title: First Day Blues
text: Should have been informed prior to booking that we would be checking into a hotel that was clearly not ready for servicing guests. No restaurant, no coffee… had to travel to port authority every am at 5:30. Staff was pleasant as could be expected while left holding the bag by Corporate. Shame on HILTON. Far from an Honors experience!

title: Hilton cancelled my reservation just 4 days before travel with no help to rebook elsewhere
text:
Having reserved this hotel on the Hilton website several months in advance, I received an email from the Hilton "Care Team" just 4 days before my October 1st arrival in Manhattan cancelling my reservation. Here is part of what they wrote QUOTE .. Due to the current travel environment, Distrikt Hotel New York City, Tapestry Collection by Hilton has temporarily suspended operations and unfortunately will not be able to honor your reservation... .We appreciate your continued loyalty and look forward to continuing to serve your lodging needs now and in the near future. Thank you, Hilton Customer Care Team.

WOW!! Not a lot of Care from the Hilton Care Team. I was left to rebook elsewhere at just four days notice, leaving me  out of pocket a couple of hundred dollars - as rates had risen. No help whatsoever offered by the Hilton Brand Care Team. And they thank me for my "continued loyalty". 
My advice - be rather wary of booking this hotel, or perhaps you will receive the same treatment as me. And as you have just read, Hilton won't do anything to help you if that should happen. Very disappointing service from a major hospitality company like Hilton. I'm very unimpressed.

title: Great location but no HH breafast benefit
text:
Only complaints are they have no breakfast for diamonds currently (they did give me 10,000 points though) and no fitness center.   They partner with another gym down the street normally which is covered under the resort fee and they did waive that as well.   This was their first night open post covid so hopefully that will change soon.   They only have two elevators for 32 floors which are also used by the staff so elevator wait times can be a pain, I can see it being a serious issue if one of the elevators is down.   They also normally charge a resort fee of $25 a night which I hate but at least it includes two free drinks a day and they are currently waiving it since the bar is closed.

Great location.   It is across the street from the port authority bus terminal but no issues.   Near the E line stop if you are using JFK and a lot of other subway stops.   I was on the top floor and decent view and I think it's the quietest room I've ever had in a Times Square area hotel.

VERY friendly staff and they did a great job of handling the snafus that come up on your first day open.   

I had a great rate and would deifnitly stay here again.   I stayed at the Doubletree next door in April and this is a much nicer hotel

title: Hotel Cancelled Reservation Less than 1 Month Before Stay
text: I booked a very reasonable rate at this hotel for a stay in September 2021, but Hilton cancelled my reservation less than a month before it was to take place. Now all options are more expensive and Hilton has not offered to honor this rate at any other properties.

title: Great hotel at the center of it all
text: I booked this hotel because I had a discount for this hotel through my credit card. That being said, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this property again. It's a short walk from Penn Station as well as across the street from the Port Authority, so it's very easy to access via public transportation. One of my favorite perks of staying at a Hilton hotel is the ability to pick your own room through the app. This being my first trip to New York City I wanted a view. I had picked a deluxe king room, which I feel like was worth the money. I got a room at the front of the hotel on the 32nd and top floor. While the view wasn't the absolute best, I was not disappointed and could see a lot of the city life along with a few lights from Times Square. Being that far up the room was also quiet, though you could open the window to hear the sounds of the city. The room was very clean and luxurious. My only complaint was the that leather headboard was a little worse for wear, but I've seen a lot worse and it didn't really bother me. The service wasn't overly friendly, but that also isn't something I really care about. All the employees did everything I asked from them. There is a $25 daily resort fee which is typical for the area, but I do feel that at the Distrikt you get more for your money than most places. The $25 includes two drinks at their bar as well as two bottles of water. I did not take advantage of the gym access that the fee also includes, but I would think the trade off of an offsite gym is more than made up for by the increased variety an actual gym offers versus a hotel gym.  The elevators were fast, even to the 32nd floor. I experienced much less delay on the elevators at the Distrikt versus hotel that had far fewer floors. This is probably attributed to Distrkit only having a few rooms per floor. The water pressure was quite good, even on the 32nd floor, and the provided toiletries were more than acceptable. To summarize my review, while the Distrikt may not be the cheapest hotel in the area, I feel that it's an incredible value that is worth staying at.

title: Nice hotel, good location, great value
text: Was able to book this hotel at a great rate and it surpassed my expectations. The beds were very comfortable and the room was a decent size for NYC. It seems every hotel in NYC is now charging a daily resort fee and it was nice to actually receive something in return besides free internet as we received 2 daily drink tickets to use at the bar, plus being a HHonors member also received free breakfast. It's walking distance to Times Square and a lot of broadway shows.

title: Regret this stay
text: The street the hotel is located on is very disgusting and the hotel looks nothing like the pictures posted. City inspections and scaffolding caused the front to be very undesirable to walk in and out of. Graffiti and homeless cover the street. Felt very unsafe and uncomfortable staying here. The front desk manager didn’t care and did nothing to fix our mistake of booking here except for laugh in my face. I wish we paid a little extra and stayed somewhere decent.

title: Sister's dream
text: We arrived on the 1st March. We were on the 24th floor. Room was clean and we had a lovely view of New York at night. Most hotel you have to put down the credit card in case of accident. It's a common thing. Fresh bottles of water every day. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Not much choice on the menu but there are a lots place to eat within walking distant. Shower was good too. My sister had a fabulous time and that all that mattered to me

title: Decent, but conveniently located near times square
text: HH member and business traveler to NYC.  I stayed at Distrikt as there were limited Hilton properties at the time of my stay.  Room was decent.  Enjoyed complimentary cocktails, but breakfast options left much to be desired.  Try to keep up with my fitness routine when I travel.  They provided access to a nearby gym, which was convenient.  Overall, would recommend as an option for business travelers.  Would not be a top choice for personal travel, save for the convenient location near times square, which could be a cost saver for taxi rides.

title: Friends holiday
text:
Great location just a few blocks from time square plenty of bars and restaurant in easy walking distance 
The staff were friendly and helpful 
The reception area and bar very small and in need of an update 
The rooms were small bout clean and comfortable

title: decent hotel
text: In a great location - lots of places to eat close by. Room not large but ok. Bed was comfy, free wi fi throughout, good shower, room tax includes 2 x drinks at the bar each day which was good. Limited food options in hotel but that wasn't an issue, a great dinner 5 mins away, west way for breakfast. Didn't find the room too noisy by NY standards. Would have been good to include a kettle in the room and the limited view in my room is why I am not giving 5 stars.

title: Great location
text: Really friendly team, great location  with a subway statikn at thd snd if thd street.  Perfect for our week in NYC.  Room had comfortable beds, with a mini fridge for our drinks.  Bottles of water left in the room and 2 complimentary drinks in the bar every evening

title: Great location for Times Square
text:
Stayed at the Distrikt Hotel for 6 nights in February. 

Checking in was easy, had to give a deposit of $300 per room for the 6 nights stay and an urban fee for the 6 nights which worked out about £133 per room which was quite a lot however you get 2 drinks vouchers and bottled water in the room each day which was useful. 

The location was very good! I read a lot of reviews about it being a dodgy area etc, however it was so close to Times Square and other attractions it was definitely worth it. Also you can get a pretty decent view from the room. 

I had two rooms booked, one downfall is that only one room had a coffee machine and fridge and the other didn’t have either which didn’t seem fair. Some elevator noise at night and drinks at the bar are expensive but no other faults. 

Overall, I would definitely stay here again for the price and location it’s brilliant!

title: If you just want a bed to sleep in then this is for you
text:
Ok, if you just want a room in a pretty good location then book here.  Done.

And now I’ll tell you what to expect.

This is by no means your normal Hilton quality.  The rooms are small (and I mean small) and in need of a refurb.  We travelled with our two teenage daughters so the room had two double beds with a bedside table in between them and that was about as much as you could fit in it.  We had 4 suitcases and ended up with them down the side of each bed.  There was only one wall light which was dim so no good for doing your makeup while sat on your bed (according to the wife). You had no choice but to sit on the bed to do makeup and hair as there was no table (or do it in the bathroom and hog it).  The bathroom was tiny with no working extractor fan.  There was complimentary shampoo, conditioner and body cream but no shower gel!?  We showered with a complimentary bar of soap!

The room did have a small wardrobe with a safe and mini fridge in it though but I’m not convinced the fridge was working.  I say this because the room window fitted poorly and a bitterly cold draught was blowing in and drinks were colder left in the room than left in the fridge.  There was air con which did work but was noisy and because the room was so small it heated up in two minutes and then was so hot it was unbearable so you couldn’t get the temp right at all.

We were on the 4th floor directly above reception and 40th street and it was really noisy (not helped by the ill fitting window).  I guess there’s a reason why people say try to get a higher room.

This brings me to my next point, the lifts.  I don’t consider myself impatient but pretty much every day we were there I had to wait at least 10 mins to get one of only two lifts servicing 30 odd floors.  I found the cleaning staff and other staff were using them and holding them on the lower level underneath the lobby.

Then my biggest issue was the lack of tea and coffee facilities in the rooms.  Someone must have thought about this and decided giving two free drinks vouchers per room per day for the bar next to the lobby was a way to overcome this.  Wrong!  As I said earlier, we were on holiday with our two daughters but they still only give out two vouchers per room not by occupants per room.  Even the most intelligent of management must know this doesn’t make sense.  Not only this, while we were packing to leave I went down to the lobby to get our vouchers for a coffee while we packed.  I was told vouchers aren’t available on the day of checkout!

My biggest bug bear is the urban district fee.  You’re asked for your credit card on arrival and a £200 hold fee is charged.  This is apparently for incidental charges like drinks to your room or you stealing a bathrobe.  Yes you heard right, they supplied one bathrobe (between four of us) but no slippers, tea, coffee or shower gel!?  Incidentally, the bathrobe in our room had holes in it so not sure why you would want to steal them?  Anyway, there is a $25 + tax fee per room per night.  This is for absolutely nothing but at least the hotel does the decent thing and just deduct it from the bond on checkout and reimburse the rest to your card (unless you charge stuff to your room).

Finally, the bar at the hotel is rubbish.  Poor selection of drinks and I wouldn’t eat there despite them having a small menu, it must all be microwaved.  We only spent our two vouchers there last thing at night on a beer and a glass of wine.  Oops, forgot one point, two complimentary bottles of water are left in the room each day.  Nice but probably to be expected in this da6 and age and also only two bottles despite there being four of us.

So, to summarise, it’s cheap for its location in NYC but don’t expect to be wowed.  If you just want to sleep (not very well) and shower in it then this is the place for you.

title: Great location but everything else is average.
text: The hotel is a small building with about 5 rooms to each floor, a small reception area with a restaurant/bar to the back. Check in was relatively easy although not overly friendly. We got our room keys and headed up to our room using the elevators (not as slow as expected from reading previous reviews). Our room (1804) was small but we didn’t mind considering we were only sleeping in it. However I was disappointed there was no mini bar or fridge to keep refreshments in. Also the view from our room, was looking straight into an apartment building. Therefore we kept the blinds closed 99% of the time. Silver lining - we could barely hear road noise/traffic so we weren’t disturbed! The shower was great and the bed was one of the comfiest I’ve slept in! Our room safe didn’t work when we got there but not a problem. We asked staff to get it fixed and later that day when we got back it was. 2 free drinks at the bar every night was a nice bonus. The location is great if you want to be close to the hustle and bustle! Subway stations at the end of the street, Times Square 2 blocks away and a million food places to choose from! Overall if your looking for a good nights sleep, in a clean bed, in good location, I’d recommend staying here!

title: Not worth IT!!
text: stay away from this Hilton hotel.  The Hilton brand is great, but this hotel fell well short of the Hilton expectations!  Staff was uninviting, room was poorly lit unless you open the blinds so the building next to you could see your business, and no coffee maker AND no complimentary coffee!!!

title: Stay Away!
text:
Beware, this hotel is not what they claim to be!

Instead of a "welcoming and sophisticated stay" this Tapestry Collection property is old, run-down and not well maintained. My bed was very worn, with noticable indentations from all the previous guests that have slept in the bed. The blinds did not work. The desk chair was broken. The shower did not have much water pressure. ...and to top it all off, they charged a hidden "urban" fee of $25/night for NOTHING!

title: Hotel nota 10
text: Hotel excelente, quartos confortáveis, cama e travesseiros macios, chuveiro quentinho.  A localização é ótima, pertinho da Times Square com ótimos restaurantes e lanchonetes por perto.  O pessoal da recepção é muito prestativo.  Excelente escolha.

title: Wonderful and cozy
text: Lovely people, friendly and professional staff!! Went out of their way to make this a special occasion for my husband's birthday as requested, very special. There  was an issue with our reservation, but they were able to fix and upgraded us for our trouble.  Beautiful view of the city and parking garage was not too far.  Close to Shorty's and a couple of pizza places. Only bad was the shower, it was lovely but could use a caulk upgrade around the base of the shower doors.  Still was a nice experience. Will definitely stay again.

title: Great value and the location turned out well
text: I was a little concerned about staying around the Times Square area and the Port Authority. Overall this was one of the better stays I have had at a NYC hotel.  We were on the 26th floor and the elevators were never an issue but then we were not leaving/arriving at "rush hour" times. The room was an acceptable size and the shower had good pressure and hot water. The bed was a little to the hard side but one person's hard is another person's comfortable. There is a $25/day room charge and you get a drink at the bar, two bottles of water and admission to the local gym.You are right next to 9th with a large selection of restaurants or go up to 10th/11th for less tourists. We would go back to this hotel.

title: Trip to New York in District Hotel
text:
I am going to New York for the summer holiday.
The hotel in which i spent my stay was too beautiful, the hostesses  were very welcoming.I visited the statue of liberty, the empire state building.After i went to their mall , i bought some clothes, some stuff.

After i went to the restaurant which is downstairs from my hotel.I ate american dishes like: the pancake , the steak & EEG  the hog-dog. Dishes also like the pain ed viand , the new England clam chowder.

The next time i go back i will go to another hotel, i will visit others  places.the next time i go back i will go to NY with my friends.

title: Such a wonderful stay
text: My cousin and I stayed here for 16 nights in January 2020. This hotel is just lovely. I am a little confused as to why there are bad reviews about this hotel on trip advisor. We had not one issue here. We had a room with 2 double beds and the rooms were plenty big enough for the both of us. The rooms were very clean and felt comfortable as soon as you walk In. I can't say enough about the staff here. So incredibly friendly and welcoming. From the reception staff,  the cleaners, bar staff and security guards we always felt welcomed. The port authority bus terminal is right across the road so you can just jump on a train to take you anywhere in the city. Lots of little eateries around and a short walk to times square. I saw some reviews saying the area was unsafe but we were 2 girls staying here and I can confirm that not once did we feel unsafe.. there is always people around so there is no issues getting to the hotel from out and about. Most nights we would finish our day with a drink at the bar. Nice and relaxing.All in all I would certainly stay here again and look forward to coming back to Distrikt Hotel. Thankyou again to the wonderful team here.

title: Good value close to the theater district
text:
The Distrikt Hotel is a Hilton property, apparently an effort to introduce a moderately priced, no frills modern urban hotel into their portfolio. This is truly a no frills experience. The lobby is minimal, there is no onsite exercise room or pool, although there is a small cafe adjacent to the lobby. In exchange, the rooms seem reasonably large for a New York City hotel these days. We stayed in one of their large rooms, which had an excellent King size bed, a small desk, closet and a case that had some small drawers, a small refrigerator and a TV on top. The hotel has the standard Hilton WiFi offerings, a free standard WiFi which was adequate for browsing, email etc and a higher level for purchase or higher tier Hilton customers. The bathroom was small, but adequate. I give them extra credit for providing a wall mounted magnifying mirror, a small convenience that is often absent even in higher priced hotels. Overall the room was clean and appeared to be well maintained. Staff were friendly and helpful.
The Distrikt is located on 40th St, between 8th and 9th Avenues, directly across the street from the side of the Port Authority Bus Terminal. This is easy walking distance from the Theater District, and near a confluence of subway lines, so it’s a good base of operations for site seeing or business in Manhattan. There are also numerous restaurants and fast food places on 9th Avenue nearby. On the other hand, this is not the area to be in if you are looking for charm or New York style! The trade off was worth it for us, we had a comfortable, clean place to stay at an extremely good price and easy access to everything we wanted to do.

title: Lovely hotel and very central
text: Hotel is immaculately clean and the staff are friendly and helpful - they couldn't do enough for us. Rooms are a decent size and beds incredibly comfy. Great location. Madame Tussauds is just around the corner and then Times Square a little further. Before our stay we read lots of comments online about excess charges etc but we had no problem with this. WiFi is free and you get 2 complimentary drinks per day up to the value of 10 dollars per drink. The street outside is fine but there are a few establishments towards the top that attract a few loiterers - but we soon got used to this and it's out of the hotels control. We would gladly stay there again.

title: Quiet, Quaint Hotel Right in Manhattan
text: This hotel was quite a different experience. Its right in Manhattan within walking distance to virtually everything. The hotel is quiet, and comfortable which is unusual for the downtown area. I would for sure recommend staying here if you aren't interested in hearing the hustle and bustle of New York City when you are trying to sleep. Amazing hotel with great staff! Only issue is that we attempted to leave during the thanksgiving day parade, which was quite difficult. Nothing to do with the hotel tho!

title: Great location in theater district.
text: The room was no frills, but clean.   Staff were friendly and helpful.  There is a small bar in the lobby which  was convenient.  There is subway access a half a block away and plenty of places to eat.  It was really adequate if you are looking for somewhere to sleep when you explore the city.

title: Family Getaway to NYC
text: We had a family getaway before my daughter left to go abroad for 5 months and it was perfect. Great value, clean, perfect location, comfortable beds. Space was a bit tight but we were in NY. Highly recommend and would visit again.

title: THIEVES. Don’t you ever book in this hotel.
text:
Do not book any trip in this hotel, no matter it is from a travel agency or directly on the website. These people are thieves. They took money from me without any of my consent and did not refund. 

Explanation: I booked a solo trip for New Years Eve in NYC at Distrikt Hotel. I was glad to find a great location hotel and not insanely expensive. 
When I checked in, they took my credit card print. They were supposed to charge $350: $200 for tax not refundable and $150 refundable (a guarantee). 
In fact, they took over $600 without any permission pretending the travel agency did not pay and I had to honour this debt as a client !!! (WTF?) 
On the same day, I was refunded half of the stolen money because the travel agent honored his payment. But as for the rest ? 

When I was finally able to reach them after tons of emails and some expensive phone calls because I was not in the US anymore they never recognise they actually stole from me. They never organise anything to give me the refund they were supposed to and also never made any apology regarding emptying my bank account without my consent. 

Please !!  Do not do the same mistake as I did, do not book anything with this hotel or with this company. They are not professional and worst, there are thieves. 
Walkaway from them, it is only a waste of time and a large amount of money.

title: Just average
text:
We stayed at the Distrikt Hotel for a week long girls trip to NYC in December. There are only 5 rooms per floor so don't expect huge rooms but for us, we didn't spend much time there except to sleep & shower. I think it would be awfully tight if you had children.  It's common to wait for another elevator because it's full of carts etc. as staff also uses the only 2 that go to the lobby (that's a consideration if you have physical limitations and can't use the stairs). The lobby & bar are also small so we didn't spend any time there but we did see a few folks having evening  drinks. There were some limited breakfast options for sale but we chose to walk a few blocks to the Westway Diner each morning. There is a desk with a computer for public use. Internet in the room was super slow. No gym onsite but we were told we could use one nearby but didn't. My friend just walked the 32 flights of stairs instead! The staff was always cordial during any contact we had with  them.

 Location across the street to the subway & bus station was super convenient but also came with bus noise if your room is on that side of the building. Views from the upper floors were scenic but the down side of the upper rooms is the plumbing (shower will fade away to nothing & then return full force either super hot or cold if water runs in a nearby room). 

We never felt uncomfortable walking to the hotel after dark as there were lots of folks around. While it's approximately a block from Times Square, it's  a hike to lots of the tourist venues so wear your most comfortable shoes. 

Housekeeping made the beds and put fresh towels out each day but water rings on the nightstand were there when we checked in & still there when we left. It was pretty obvious that the floor wasn't vacuumed during the stay either. The day we were to check out, housekeeping knocked on the door at 8am! We always leave our room early so it can be turned over quickly but not that early!

Be aware of all the extra daily charges: 
Urban destination $25, NY misc $2.22, NY misc $1.47, NY State $30.06, NYC tax $19.91, occupancy tax $2, JAVITS fee $1.50. That's over $82 in extras. There was also an additional amount held on my card when I checked in for any "misc" room expenses. Seems like it was $300 but I can't find my notes to confirm that amount and since we didn't have any expenses, it was reimbursed to my card on check out. The urban fee provides you with a delivery of 2 "free" bottles of water to the room & 2 drink tickets which can be used for drinks or coffee which you must get from the lobby desk each day. Note that there is no coffee maker in the room and breakfast is not included in the room price.

We used NYC Perfect Transportation for our trip to and from JFK airport ($125 each trip +tip) and HIGHLY recommend them. Our driver Miguel was wonderful so we requested him for both trips. 

I would consider this to be an average place to stay compared with other hotels in the area.

title: Perfect
text: Stayed here for 5 nights and from check in to exit, we received great and friendly service. Victoria and Nestor need a special mention for their kindness. Great location for transport links and tourist sites. Good selection of  restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Rooms were comfortable and clean and had all we needed. Really enjoyed spending time in the bar in the evening chatting to other guests and receiving our complementary drinks. Would highly recommend this hotel and if we visit again we would stay here.

title: Needs room for improvement.
text: Had several problems which needs to be corrected.  Thermostat did not work in the room and had to open the window to make the room comfortable.  Hole in the wall in the shower near the shower head.  Trouble with connecting to the internet.

title: Location Is Great
text:
If you want to stay in Times Square you will be  in the middle of it all. Close to the subway and plenty of restaurants. 9th Ave is loaded with places to eat.

The hotel itself is decent. Stayed in better and certainly have stayed in worse. You can see some signs of aging in parts of the room. 

The elevators can get quite busy during check in and check out times. The staff are very nice and accommodating. 

There is a $25 daily fee. You get two drink tickets a day and access to the local gym if you want. I think this is a standard in the area. The food options are limited but we didn't try any. There's 2 Bros pizza down the street with cheap slices and open late. For coffee go to Corvo down the street.

Places we ate on 9th Ave that were awesome! Westside diner, Travola, K-Rico, Shorty's and Taqueria Diana. No point in eating in Times Square when you have Hells Kitchen at your doorstep.

title: Great hotel
text:
Located just across from the port authority bus terminal, the hotel is centrally
Located. Easily accessible to all parts of manhattan. Great clean and modern rooms at a great price and the service is exceptional.

title: Muy buen hotel en NY
text: Hotel muy bien localizado en NY. Muy cerca de las principales áreas turísticas, teatros, etc. Gente muy amable en recepción, internet rápido . Mi cuarto tenía todo lo necesario para pasar la noche, pues la mayor parte del tiempo estás afuera.

title: Hermoso hotel perfecto ubicación!
text:
Nos hospedamos 8 noches y sin dudas volvería! Buena limpieza y buena atención. La ubicación es la mejor, cerca de los puntos de interés y a media cuadra de una estación de metro para moverse por la ciudad. Cómo todo hospedaje en NY cobran los impuestos de la ciudad pero para compensar daban como cortesía agua y una bebida diaria por persona. 
Teníamos el último piso y la vista a la ciudad es hermosa !!!

title: Convenient Location for Times Square and Broadway
text: We have stayed at the Distrikt many times over the past five years and have enjoyed each visit. We've just returned home from a three day stay which was delightful. It's easy to get to whether you drive or take the train. It's an easy walk to both Grand Central and Penn Station. When we drive, we park across the street at the port authority. There's a side entrance to the Port Authority right across from the hotel which is very handy.  The hotel is small and charming with only four rooms on each floor. I would recommend an upper floor to have the best views. The bar (cocktails and breakfast) is small and cozy with tables and chairs but also sofas and comfy chairs. The rooms are well designed to optimize the space and are more than adequate space-wise. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and well stocked with towels and shower supplies. It is within walking distance of so many places we like: Times Square, the Theater District, Central Park, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, jazz clubs, etc. And you won't find friendlier staff anywhere. They are friendly and lots of fun, too!

title: Worst hotel in Times Square.
text:
I stayed here for 6 nights during NYE. Let me start by saying the location is great and the room looks nice. That’s really all Distrikt has to offer. 

The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything in the hallway... even your upstairs neighbor cough! The bar is not a real bar, they only have a few items and can’t even make a margarita. The food is prepared in a microwave and I highly recommend not eating there under any circumstances.

On my last night at Distrikt, I went to the front desk and requested a late check out. I was told I could check out at 1pm instead of 12pm. However, at 12:05pm, I received a call from the girl at the front desk and she was apparently in a horrible mood. She accused me of “making up my own rules” and said “I need you to leave NOW!” I’m a gold member with Hilton Honors and I know how late checkout works. Anyway, I left and on my way out the girl pointed at me while talking to another co-worker.

All in all, this is the worst hotel I have stayed at. If you read the manager’s response to all the reviews on here, you’ll see every response is exactly the same. That should serve as a preview as to how this hotel operates. Hospitality doesn’t exist and you are simply another tourist in their eyes.

Never again, Distrikt.

title: Great Value in NYC
text: I booked this room last minute and received a great rate. The Rooms are on the smaller side, so probably best for a solo traveler. The midtown location is great -- just a short walk from Times Square and close to various subway stations.

title: Great quality and cost
text: Staff was very friendly and upgraded me (unprompted) for free to accommodate my early arrival/check in. The check in/out process was seamless and although a $25 "urban activity" fee was added to the cost of my room, there was complimentary wifi and a drink (alcoholic or nonalcoholic) included.

title: Distrikt Hotel
text:
Great location and price! Nice and clean room. They can storage your luggage after checking out without extra fee. They gave us two complementary drinks at the bar. Hotel is located next to the Port Authority Bus Station and one block away from A C E subway lines. 
I will definitely stay here again.

title: Nice NYE Week 2019/2020
text:
Let me start by saying it’s a nice hotel. Since it only has about 150 rooms, it’s not a zoo. There are five (5) rooms per floor. Two facing front towards the Port Authority Bus Terminal, three in the back. If I understand correctly room ending in “04” (like 3004) would face the building behind (no view) while 03 and 05 will give decent partial views, as you get higher of course. Rooms are smaller, because it is NYC, but not tiny. Baths are shower only, and very nice. 
Even though building only has two elevators, we never had to wait too long. I expected much longer waits.  
Staff was very pleasant and helpful. 
There is no on site gym or pool. Not unusual in NYC. They do have a gym off property you can have access to.

Negatives - There is no restaurant on property. They have a snack bar. You can get a drink and some finger foods. Breakfast is grab and go....basically, coffee and a muffin. There are many places to eat nearby, so not a huge deal. But a really breakfast or a continental breakfast bar would be nice. 

Complaint - not the staff’s fault, but makes no sense (and yes, I knew this going in), there is a $25 a day “urban fee,” call it a resort fee or whatever....I’m actually ok with paying a resort fee, but not for things I’m supposed to get free as it is. I am a Hilton Gold member, I am supposed to get free water in room, free WiFi and free local phone (who uses a land line anyway)....all of this is part of the resort fee. You do also get two free drink tickets (per person) to use at the bar (maximum value of $10), so in theory you do get $20 in drinks (if two people) but we don’t drink! So I used it for a latte or OJ, maybe $6? Just seems to me, this resort fee should be waived for Hilton Gold/+...IMO.

Would we stay here again? Maybe. Not because of the hotel, it’s nice, we liked it. As a whole, we liked the location as well....Times Square/Broadway is literally, two blocks East or two-three blocks up, respectively. Subway entrance is near end of block, on right. Looks like you’re going down to a XXX place, but it’s not, its just a store window down there. 
That said, due to the location, it is dirtier and more homeless than you’ll run into down in SoHo or the Village. Never really felt unsafe, but it is still cluttered and dirty on the streets. 

You want a quieter hotel, close to Times Square, the shows and whatever, this is a nice place. I’d recommend it.

title: Tout a fait correct
text:
Très  bien situé  au cœur de N.Y. près Times Square cet hôtel est d un excellent rapport qualité/ prix. 
Nous étions au32 ème étage .vue magnifique.
Tout est satisfaisant sauf la petit petit-déjeuner qu il vaut mieux prendre ailleurs .

title: For the Price, Look Elsewhere
text: The location is reasonably good, close to midtown and subways.  The views were unremarkable and the rooms tiny.  Choose a double rather than a king.  Few amenities for the price.  The pillows were as hard as rocks.

title: Can’t Beat It!!
text: Everything was great from the staff to the room. Staff were polite and helpful and the room was always clean and comfortable. If you’re visiting NY this hotel is in the perfect location for you to get to all the attractions without any hassle. You’re a short walk away from Times Square yet at night you’re able to sleep soundly without any disturbance from the buzz down in the streets. I will definitely be coming back here on my next trip to NY and will be sure to recommend to all my friends and family.

title: Solid, if uninspiring, winter accomodations in New York
text:
The Distrikt Hotel is a tiny tower tucked in across from the Port Authority bus terminal. I was appreciative that the rate was reasonable during the generally unreasonable December/holiday season in Manhattan when room prices move multiples compared to quieter seasons.

My room on the 40th Street side of the hotel was acceptable with a king bed, decent lighting, and a desk with a comfortable chair. The bathroom was larger than most with good lighting and a step-in shower that didn't leak (a rarity for most of my NYC stays). The room had a small refrigerator and a coffee maker (although I think that was because of my Hilton status). The window opened slightly for access to some fresh air, but the HVAC system worked well enough to keep the room warm during the cold nights.

As others have mentioned, each floor only has a small number of rooms and the sound travels. I was on the end and could easily hear my those in the one neighboring room as they entered and left.

Wi-Fi was very poor at night, but more usable during the morning/daytime. At night, it was impossible to use Facetime over Wi-Fi but basic web browsing was possible if annoyingly slow.

There is a bar off the lobby with friendly staff and some food options.

The only notable feature of the hotel is its location. The Port Authority terminal is hardly a destination, but it is a useful transportation hub. There are plenty of options for food (including at late hours) and there's easy access to the subway for more exploring.

I would certainly stay at the Distrikt on a future trip although it's not at the top of my list.

title: Nice little hideaway near Times Square
text: Enjoyed a short stay at this tiny gem this past weekend. We were pleasantly surprised with just about every aspect of the experience. It's actually hard to find (tiny sign right next door to the overcrowded DoubleTree, which was an annoyance at first, but became more appreciated as time went on). The room was overpriced, but such is NYC... made worse by a ridiculous "urban destination" junk $25 add-on. That said, most importantly to me: the staff were very attentive, professional, and polite. This goes for everyone with whom we interacted... from the front desk staff, to the bartenders, to the bellhop (do we still use this word?). We will definitely stay again.

title: Paper thin walls, below average quality
text: I can’t believe the Distrikt hotel has such good reviews. It has paper thin walls and we were very rudely woken up by drunk people in the room next to ours at 5 am. The bed wasn’t very soft and the pillows were lumpy; the TV wouldn’t turn on. We also are Hilton Gold members, but weren’t given an upgrade because apparently there were no upgrades left which is very frustrating and our requested floor was confirmed then we were moved to a lower floor. The only good side (for me) was the location.

title: Everything is mostly fine - the front desk are the stars
text:
Pros
+ my room was right next to the elevator (the floor only had about 6 rooms) and I was surprised that it didn't wake me up or keep me up as other came and went.
+ the free drink tickets were nice
+ the cleaning staff seemed terribly overworked, but were very thorough and friendly
+ the front desk (depending on who was there) gave some good advice about where to get food that wasn't too touristy.
+ the location is so convenient and some great food can be found on 9th
+ the front desk always seemed friendly and helpful and answered all questions quickly and kindly 

Cons:
+ I got stuck in the elevator my first night there and once I finally got off it stopped working, so I had 27 floors to walk... when I called the front desk they were super nice and apologetic when I told the what happened
+ one night the woman at the bar took 20 minutes to make gin & tonic, she was sooo sweet, but the slowest worker ever and probably shouldn't have been at the bar as she didn't know how to make anything with more than 1 or 2 ingredients
+ no room service was a bummer and no food available in the eve after long work days meant you had to venture out in the rain and crowds 
+ the bar closed early, so after a show it was closed, seemed a little weird
+ it seemed that anyone could come and go in the elevators, the keys weren't needed to access floors and our group felt a bit worried about security risk
+ the room was find, but in need of some upgraded love - sheets were clean but had old stains that couldn't be bleached out, towels were scratchy, the material was pealing off of the headboard and the other furniture was worn here and there

title: Chic but friendly
text:
Liked the modern look of the exterior and lobby right away. Christina the at the desk was very friendly and helpful. Our room is nice sized for NY. Bathrobes supplied for us. So far an excellent stay.
  Very close to everything we need.

title: Gran hotel, pésimo servicio.
text:
La ubicación genial, las habitaciones genial pero el personal deja mucho q desear, al principio según decían no habían  recibido el pago ( por lo que nos hicieron esperar ) pero ellos lo primero que te piden es una tarjeta de crédito y te retienen 350$ de los cuales luego se quedan 200 de tasas 29$ por día.
Una vez la chica que limpia las habitaciones entró sin llamar ni nada, uno de los días no limpio la habitación y tuve que quejarme para tener toallas limpiar , otro día tuve que esperar fuera de la habitación para que la limpiaran , la limpiadora gritaba con el pasillo creo q para despertarnos, no saben idiomas solo el inglés si tú no sabes te apañas, es decir el personal es lo malo

title: Don’t understand the bad reviews
text:
We were here for 3 nights before Christmas. The hotel was significantly less expensive than many other Hilton hotels at the time, so I took a chance after reading the good reviews. I’m glad I did!

We had a very pleasant stay. I found the bed to be extremely comfortable. The room was clean and a decent size. 

The shower is quite small. The only other negative is the elevators. There are only 2, so at busy times you’ll be waiting. 

The front desk staff was friendly. The room came with 2 free drink tickets a day. The hotel is convenient to most things, and easily accessible by subway. 

Overall, I’d definitely stay here again.

title: Buona posizione
text:
Se si considera la posizione, l’hotel è davvero al top: a due passi da Times Square, circondato da decine di ristoranti di ogni genere, e per questo comodissimo per la cena senza dover prendere i mezzi.
Per quanto riguarda il resto, l’albergo è nella media per una città come New York: stanza non grandissima, bagno pulito. Purtroppo ci è stata data una stanza al primo piano, al livello dei motori dei climatizzatori, quindi non era proprio silenziosa ma non abbiamo avuto problemi ad addormentarci.
Un pó cara la tassa di soggiorno che viene addebbitata alla fine, ma per una città come New York, ci può anche stare. Nel complesso un buon hotel ma se dovessi scegliere, cercherei altro.

title: Hotel molto buono
text: Abbiamo  soggiornato in questo hotel per 14 giorni nel luglio 2018;  sesta volta a NY. Hotel vermanete molto buono, accoglienza, qualità delle stanze, pulizia, posizione (vicino alle metro e a due passi dal centro) struttura nel complesso di buon livello. Non do le 5 stelle perchè, come ultimamente spesso capita con prenotazioni in largo anticipo, una volta in loco cercano di addebitare (successo anche in altre strutture) tasse di soggiorno (con relativi servizi aggiuntivi vedi palestra, acqua, ecc..) che al momento della prenotazione però erano già incluse nel prezzo; per fortuna tutto risolto e non sono stati trattenuti costi aggiuntivi.. Per il resto ottimo hotel, forse, ma non ci ha arrecato alcun problema ne di giorno ne di sera, la presenza di qualche soggetto non del tutto sobrio sulla strada del'lhotel dovuti alla vicinanza del negozio di liquori all'angolo con la 8av e alla stazione dei bus, ma ripeto nessun problema.. consigliatissimo

title: This is not a 4 star hotel
text:
Good: Two nights here over a December weekend, so expected to pay a premium price for a comfortable room. Front Desk, Bar, and Housekeeping Staff were very polite and accommodating. For NYC, the room was decent...fairly clean, updated, and enough room for my teenage son and me. Good coffee in cafe/bar and HHonors drink coupons were appreciated. 

Bad: Overpriced for very basic small hotel. Boutique should mean charm; not much of that here. Hotel location is convenient but noisy, right across from Port Authority Bus Terminal. This block of 40th St is dirty and crowded. The bar/cafe is small and sufficient for this size hotel, but worn and not very clean. “Business Center” is a desk opposite the bar. 

Ugly: Wanted to take a bath to soak sore legs. The result was disgusting. Drained and refilled the tub and got the same result. The Staff sent the engineer to look at the problem, but not much can be done about rusty pipes.

title: ヒルトン系ホテル
text: ニューヨーク観光に行くにはどこにでもアクセスのしやすい好立地なヒルトン系列のホテルです。少し狭い印象はありますが、２５０ドル程で宿泊出来ました。

title: Booked couple of nights from ROW NYC then here
text: far better experience. I felt the luxury of what I paid as compared to the other one. Not too perfect but since 4.5 is 5 if rounded off, then I am giving this a 5. Really nice experience. I just hope for it to a little bit cheaper.

title: No problems with this Hotel
text: After reading a few reviews, I was sceptical after booking. However, all the problems seemed to be more personal issues i.e the resort fee (all hotels charge this), and the bar being too small (You're in New York, plenty of bars). All in all, lovely hotel and lovely staff. No problems at all with my stay. Great location and our room was very comfortable. I also didn't find it anywhere near as what people are saying.

title: Beware. This is an overpriced hotel with minimal, if not poor, service!
text: The Distrikt Hotel is an expensive hotel with poor service.  While it is in a convenient location, there is nothing convenient about the service that it provides. The business office (desk) houses a computer that does not work. Your reservation requests are seemingly ignored and the some of the staff are not helpful. In addition, there is no real restaurant just a convenience store room in the bar which is very minimal. Beware, it is not worth the $300-400 that they charge for a small King room.

title: Not recommended
text: Poor grounds, water leak inside the room, super dirty carpet, dirty pillows, dirty blankets and small rooms/lobby/restaurant. the staff is fine. There's also no room service, if you have a problem you have to call or talk to the front desk and your chance of getting your issue resolved is 50/50. Called the front desk asking for a clean blanket instead of the dirty one I found when checked-in they promised to send a clean one over but they never did. You can find many better and cheaper hotels in the area, not worth the money at all, don't be fooled with this Hilton logo/name.

title: Hospitality defined here
text: The hotel is very nice that is excellent service  pleasure.From the I answered and it read it back to Deana with the warm hospitality gravy on an awful wet snowy night are you with Ty knowledgeable and helpful the hotel is very nice located conveniently in New York City. I would definitely recommend the hotel.Thank you Christina

title: Nice Hotel, but has it's Problems
text: We decided to take a chance on the hotel despite a few not so great reviews, many of which i felt were more personal preferences (e.g. the bar couldn't make their favorite drink).  Arrival and check in were smooth. The staff was friendly, welcoming and professional.  We found the rooms small but typical of NYC hotel rooms.  The rooms were nicely appointed and the furnishings were modern and updated.  This is where it goes down hill.  The heater did not work the entire weekend.  We notified the front desk of the issue upon discovery late Friday evening, however it was late and no one from maintenance was on staff requiring us to wait until  8am the next morning.  We requested someone come up early on Saturday morning.  We also informed them the tv was not working.  At first when we attempted to change the channel, the TV would abruptly turn off.  We eventually got the tv to change channels but we only had 3 grainy channels. We called again in the morning to remind the front desk of our issues with the heater and tv.  Someone finally showed up around 1030 a.m. He worked on the heating unit and got it working, we informed him of the issue with the tv as well.  He left and returned with a USB Memory stick and a second maintenance worker to look at the heater.  The first maintenance worker fixed the tv, while the other worker worked on the heater.  We had to leave in order to eat before our broadway show.  We were gone all day and didn't return to the room until approximately 1 a.m and the room was freezing cold.  The heater was not working.  We notified the front desk but again since it was in the middle of the night no one from maintenance as on staff.  We requested a new room, but was told that they didn't have any clean rooms for us to move to.  We understand problems can happen, however as a loyal Hilton Honors Member and disabled veteran, for this level of inconvenience I would expect the hotel management and/or Hilton to give me a full refund for my stay.  It was 37 degrees Friday night and 33 degrees Saturday night.  The room was EXTREMELY cold which we had to endure for two nights.  The desk associate offered us free breakfast, then the manager called us later Sunday afternoon and offered to refund the $25 "Urban destination fee which covered the bottled water and internet, things usually free at most Hilton properties for Honors members.  She then offered a 15% discount which amounted to about $26 per day

title: Great Hotel
text: Lovely clean hotel. Comfortable beds. Great facilities. Helpful and friendly staff. Room cleaned, fresh towels, bottled water and bed made every day. Drinks vouchers daily. Nothing too much trouble always willing to help.

title: Midtown Location Good, rooms are small
text: Hotel midtown location was great, however the rooms are small two bedroom had 1 chair, small closet w fridge, iron, safe - no table space for laptop I used the bar. 2 parents, 2 boys (18yrs , 22yrs) prior to thanksgiving - 12th fly still hearing city sounds

title: Convenient Location, Comfortable Room
text: I stayed here for 2 nights on a recent trip to New York City, it's conveniently located near the theater district, Port Authority bus station, subway station, and restaurants.  You can also walk to Penn Station from here.  It's a smaller hotel, with only 5 rooms per floor.  The quiet rooms are on the upper floors and in the back, facing an apartment building.  The only disruptive noise was the doors slam very loudly when letting them close on their own,  but this settled down by 11:30 pm.  The room was clean, everything worked, and the bed was comfortable.  The upholstered headboard had a hole in it exposing foam, they should patch that rather then trying to hide it by propping up pillows. The Wi-Fi worked well in my room (22nd floor).  The bar was cute and was a nice place to relax at the end of the day.  You can use your  free drinks for house alcoholic drinks, or soda or juice.  I could have done without the 3 knocks on the door from staff while I was trying to get ready to go out to the theater in the afternoon.  Once I put the "still sleeping" sign up, that stopped.  The staff was very nice.

title: Cute Hotel! Friendly Staff!... No Wi-Fi
text: My mom and I come to NYC every year and we usually stay at The Westin Times Square. This year the Westin's rates were so outrageous we decided to try another hotel. I stumbled upon Distrikt Hotel after calling another Hilton property that was full, but whoever answered the Hilton line mentioned there was a Hilton boutique hotel close to Times Square called the Distrikt Hotel. The hotel was definitely great and walking the extra three blocks (this is on 40th and the Westin is on 43rd) was worth it to us for the hundreds of dollars we saved! The hotel doesn't have a restaurant just a snack bar, but there are other hotels nearby with restaurants. Hotel staff were great and helped us with all our requests. A gal who works at night named Christina was SUPER friendly and helpful! Cleaning staff came daily and on time and the entire hotel is very modern and tidy! The building is very tiny and tall... there's 35 floors and each floor only has 5 rooms. We asked for a quiet room, and we were put in room 302 right next to the elevator- and also where you could hear street noise. All the lower floors in NYC hotels you can hear street noise- it's New York after all... it just would have been nicer to have had that request honored for a quieter room. Another thing that was disappointing about our stay was that the Wi-Fi did not work at all. We were hit with a $25 a day "destination fee" that included our "free" Wi-Fi (which we did not have our entire stay). Again... most big cities are doing these slimy destination fees to increase room rates by keeping the "official" price on booking sites lower. Until the FCC stops this deceptive practice I've come to accept most hotels in NYC are usually at minimum going to be $25 more a night than the listed price. Although it's annoying, I booked my room knowing this fee was going to be tacked on. I don't understand why I paid a destination fee... when we had zero Wi-Fi. Overall I did feel safe in this location, and it was near enough to Times Square and the Theatre District, and the room price was competitive. Would stay here again, minus the Wi-Fi issue.

title: Disappointing
text: Extremely basic and very small room. Bar prices for food and drink very expensive. Two standard glasses of mediocre wine, two beers and two packets of crisps totalled in excess of £50! The hotel at Los Angeles airport was far superior! Won't be going back.

title: Great stay
text: Stayed a full week we cannot fault the hotel  nor the  staff they were really friendly and helpful. Location was perfect for all directions, subways only minutes away. Will be looking to stay here again in the future

title: Satisfactory but left a lot to be desired when NYC has so much choice
text: Perfectly adequate hotel all in all - rooms clean and comfortable, sleep good, great location, bar facility available (albeit slow at times despite empty). However, our check in experience left us with a bad taste in our mouths. Despite clear booking (handed printed confirmation over to staff) of 7 rooms 12 guests, the staff couldnt find the booking and were obviously frazzled for a good 20 mins. The last thing you want to tell a group of 12 after a long flight is that we may not have a room. It took a while (after 3pm) for all rooms to be ready and with slow service in the bar on food to boot - all in all the check in experience was a let down to our arrival in NYC.

title: Great stay
text: Great check in, walk from penn station was easy.  Weather got bad ou ne day and very easy to grab a cab. The windows open so we had wonderful fresh air  good value v nice staff and comfortable bed and nice size shower ....and a nice view of empire state building

title: Great hotel and location for the price!
text: Really enjoyed the amenities as a Diamond member. Room and location were awesome, very close to ACE subway stop at 8th Ave/40th St. Only slightly neg thing I can say about hotel was its sign was so small...was a little tricky to find initially even with GPS if you are walking from subway. For ref, it is just to the left of the Doubletree Hotel.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
My mum, sister and I stayed here last week (18th- 22nd November). The location was great, was off the main strip but also a few min walk to time square. 
Our room was nice, 2 double beds, which were really comfortable. Shower was nice, plenty of hot water - wasn't the most powerful shower but did the job. Hair dryer was also provided which was actually powerful. 
Storage space wasn't that great, one wardrobe which only had a few hangers, the safe was inside the wardrobe along with a fridge at the bottom . it was very dark (everything was black, so had to use torch/flashlight on my phone to see in that corner). 
We were on the 13th floor. there are about 4-5 rooms per floor so nice and quiet. There are 2 lifts which took a very long time. We could be waiting 3-4 min for a lift. 
Housekeeping was great. Left our room nice and tidy, and provided 2 bottles of water daily. 
Our stay included free breakfast but we never used this. You are entitled to a free drink on a daily basis from the bar. We were only given 2 vouchers at first but when we said there was 3 of us we were given a third. 
The receptionists/front of house were lovely. They were always smiling and greeted us every time we came in and out of the hotel asking us how we were etc. 
On check out there was a man helping us with our luggage ( I think I heard him say it wasn't his normal job, but someone had called in sick so was helping ) but he was so kind and helpful. 
Overall the hotel was lovely, this was our third trip to NY from England and we usually stay in bigger hotels but I really loved this, and its because of the staff, they defiantly went the extra mile. 
Thank you. Hopefully we will be back next year!! ( I hope housekeeping and front of house enjoyed their cadburys selection boxes we brought over with us - just to a little thank you from us).

title: Perfect hotel
text: A boutique hotel that will surely give you a very unique and memorable stay. Quite place that balances your mood from a busy working city. You can easily check out  various local restaurants nearby. My partner and I enjoyed a sip of free drinks at the bar. We had an amazing stay. Will be back with friends next time.

title: Buena ubicación
text:
Hotel muy bien ubicado para poder llegar a las visitas principales de Nueva York. Está situado al lado de la estación de tren y del edificio del periódico New York Times.
Las habitaciones no son muy espaciosas, armario más bien pequeño y no dispone de salón de comidas. Sí tiene un bar donde tomar alguna copa, café o infusión. Los recepcionistas muy amables, incluso una de ellas hablaba español. 
En general un buen hotel para lo necesario, dormir y ducharse, que al fin y al cabo la gran manzana requiere que se pasee por sus calles durante todo el día.

title: Hidden fees for services that are supposed to be free to honor members
text:
Stayed here Nov 11-14, choosing it based on price and location. The location was decent, but once you check in you get hit the surprise $25 per day, negating the price per night for a better location. I did see a much lower price available for this hotel after checking in, which if price was the deciding factor and you work in the $25 tax and just need a bed, it is a hotel. The travel booking site we are required to use for work travel does not show the fee. I will alert our travel team to flag this hotel.
The list of what the $25 fee covers is just silly to me as a diamond member, many are listed as benefits to being diamond level.
Two bottles of water, replenished daily, this never happened, just had the first day.
Free Wifi, was so slow, I ended up using cellular.
Daily gym access that was offsite, all the way on the other-side of the port authority, requiring to to pack a gym bag to change after the walk.
Unlimited local and long distance phone calls? Who uses the hotel phone for calls anymore.
Two drinks at the hotel bar were included, but when you could get service, they were rude about it. Watching the staff telling another customer to make sure they clean up their stuff and pointed them to a garbage can. Did not even bother to go back.
There was a breakfast option, but nothing self serve. The first two mornings I waited more than 10-15 minutes and no one offered to provide food. There are other food options nearby for breakfast, but they seem to be charging for it.

I'm in a lot of Hilton branded hotels and this one was quite a disappointment. Looks like it was recently changed over to Hilton property without any upgrades to decor or adoption of Hilton Honors program benefits. 

The shower control fell off the wall and I reinstalled it, that was not expected.

title: Really Bad Cutomer Service
text: Really bad customer service. There was a beeping sound in my room all night and the Guest Services lady told me that she can't do anything about it. She said only thing she could do is to either give me ear plugs or I have an option to sleep on the streets. Couldn't sleep all night. Risk this hotel at your own peril

title: Awful Staff
