text: I have had issues with the hotel, starting a few days before my check in date. I will never stay at this hotel again. Every single time I would report a problem, no one said sorry or anything. They would just tell me how they can't do anything. Once I arrived, I was already mad since the front desk staff told my guests that the reservation would be canceled in an hour which I don't understand why since I had spoke to the front office manager the night before. So did I not actually speak to the manager? Every single time I called, no one would tell me the name or the name of the hotel. I had to ask to make sure im calling the right hotel and ask for the person's name I was speaking to. None of my rooms were ready. Making my guests think we don't have rooms was annoying. Every single time I called the hotel for anything, every single person would give me wrong information. Even one person would tell me he was the director of Front office, yet you don't give out your name when answering the phone. Only person who was nice at all was the female night audit. Housekeeping would go into my room after I had a "Do Not disturb" on my door. What the hell is the point of having a DND on my door and housekeeping still comes into my room?!?!?!

title: Quiet and comfortable
text: I was looking for a convenient place to stay during a business trip to NYC and this turned out to be an excellent choice. Walking distance to the Javits Center, it was quiet, comfortable and warm (during the record cold spell). It was just what I needed after a busy day in Manhattan. Would stay here again for sure!

title: great location - great people
text: The Distrikt hotel was in a great location and the staff was terrific.  Bed and pillows below par for me!  I would; however, stay here again as it is close to my business at the Javitz center.  Local restaurants were amazing.

title: Great stay definitely will be going back !
text: Just back from a 5 day stay. We are a family of 4 with 2 teenage children! Hotel in a great location, lovely room with a fab view and staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival we had a complimentary bottle of fizz and some treats to help celebrate a special birthday and anniversary ! would definitely recommend and stay again on our next trip to New York

title: Fairly priced hotel in Hell's Kitchen.
text: Subway station is just at the end of the street.  Bus port terminal is beside the hotel.  Restaurant variety around the hotel is also a lot.  Hotel staff was very accommodating.  Could not ask for more :)

title: Nice clean located hotel
text: Lovely hotel, very welcoming helpful staff, extremely clean and tidy, ideal location for time square if you don’t want to walk out to the madness of time square (as it’s quite mad) just around the corner, overall pretty good but,  the hotel is tired,the headboard torn, walls has pencil marks on them where I guess pictures might have been, the main light in the bathroom didn’t work, the safe was not attached to the unit, yes you could walk away with it, the bedroom unit had collapsed at one point and had been screwed together badly as the doors were out if line, but it was just a bed as we left at 8 in the morning and got back after 11, unfortunately because of this when we go back we will look for another hotel, shame really as the staff were brilliant.

title: Amazing stay!
text:
Wow, the Distrikt Hotel was absolutely perfect for our stay this year in New York City. We come every year and pick a new hotel, but this one has definitely been the best yet. It was my mum’s 60th Birthday and the staff couldn’t have made the experience more special with a free upgrade and bottle of bubble in the room waiting for us upon arrival! 
- 2 free drinks per room per night 
- very clean
- excellent location right between Macy’s and Times Square.
- very calming environment in comparison to the buzzing city
- comfortable beds 
- quick elevator. We were staying on the top floor and never had to wait on the elevator. 

The best thing about this hotel is the staff. All were extremely friendly and helpful. Special mention to Eva who organised the bottle and card for my mum, and special mention to Dennis who helped us out a lot on our final day with luggage, trains/taxis, general advice, and good chat. 

Amazing stay. Thank you Distrikt Hotel 🌟

title: Worst hotel I have stayed at in years
text: Terrible hotel, mean front desk, beat up rooms, and poor WiFi, phones, TV and didn’t feel clean.  I never had WiFi the entire trip.  I actually tried to get out of my reservation and they held me hostage and threatened to keep my funds and not give me a room through hotels.com after I complained. Recommend avoid.  One of my first hotel experiences ever.

title: Family birthday celebratory holiday
text:
The rooms do not look anything like the online photos . The review ones are more accurate . They could do with updating as look very old and tired . The bathroom even had enamel missing from the bath . We requested high floor room via travel agent ,but ended on 5 th floor. Two very small double beds for four adults to share , barely any room to move around . Still only got two free bottles of water a day and two drink tokens a day even though four of us sharing . The air con is noisy and we had to turn it off when In the room  as the bed was just 4 inches away .  The noise outside goes on all night and did keep me awake the first few nights . There was banging in the pipes when you took a shower . 
However, the beds were done every day and were very comfortable . The staff were friendly and the hotel is very central . I probably wouldn’t stay here again though

title: Great service
text: Had a great time with some friends in NYC. Stayed at the Distrikt Hotel and it was spacious and clean. The location for perfect for exploring the city and the service at the front desk and bar were spot on. Had some free drinks at the bar which had a great selection and a generous happy hour. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again next time we visit NYC.

title: I Love NY
text:
Abbiamo pernottato prenotando tramite Booking.com in questo hotel della catena Hilton per una settimana e ci siamo trovati bene.
POSIZIONE: la posizione sulla 40st come si capisce è centrale, è ben servita, purtroppo trovandosi nella zona posteriore di Port Autority è ritrovo di sbandati, comunque essendo una strada movimentata e con diversi hotel ciò non deve preoccupare
STRUTTURA: l’ingresso non molto grande, la reception pure, il palazzo di 32 piani serviti da doppio ascensore, è stato rinnovato bello stile Hilton
CAMERA: la camera al 19esimo una family superior con letto King, ben pulita, di media grandezza, moquette, mobilio essenziale, frigo, cassaforte, grande TV, bagno con grande doccia, il letto  King con materasso memory morbido anatomico, molto confortevole per me che sono abituato a materasso rigido è stata una sorpresa.
La vista dalla camera era sui grattacieli di Manhattan, ma anche sul parcheggio di Port Authority
SERVIZI: la colazione non l’abbiamo fatta anche perché il bar è piccolino e comunque trovandosi in Hell Khitcen basta fare due passi e c’è ampia scelta, consiglio West Way Diner 
Ogni giorno in camera viene lasciata acqua minerale e una consumazione  gratuita al bar
PERSONALE: giovane, gentile

title: Nice, clean hotel, excellent location, watch the price
text: I liked the hotel, location was perfect, staff was really friendly. I just don't like additional costs when you arrive and you think everything is paid. the communication about the final price should be more clear.

title: Excellent stay!
text: I do not understand were are the negative reviews coming from! I stayed in this hotel for 5 days on a business trip, and had a good time. The staff was great, rooms were clean and tidy. As Hilton Honor member a simple breakfast was included every morning. The building has its age, but looks perfectly fine. Stayed in floor 23, no street noises whatsoever. Elevators were fast. Great location, close to subway. I really liked it and will stay there again. There are some funky characters on 40th street, but it is like any major city. Nothing to worry about at all, parents walking around with their kids, etc. Doorman was a nice guy, and the receptionist helped me book a car to the airport at a regular price.

title: Mediocre hotel with a surprise URBAN fee tscked on as you check in
text: This is an OK city hotel. Nothing great...just a basic room with crappy TV service and a shower that goes from full hot to full cold with a microadjustment.  If you are looking for a place to park your carcass for an evening it would be fine

title: מלון ליד הטיימס סקוור
text:
מיקום מצויין לא רחוק מהטיימס סקוור, צמוד לתחנת האוטובוסים ולסאב ווי,
מלון נקי, חדרים פצפונים, אלא אם משדרגים לחדר גדול יותר, אין ארוחת בוקר, אבל האפשרויות מסביב לארוחות בלתי מוגבלות, אין לובי, יש בר קטן שאפשר להזמין משקאות ואוכל קל, שירות מצויין, בסה"כ מומלץ, יחסית למחירים של ניו יורק היה בין הפחות יקרים שמצאתי.

title: Weekend Get Away!
text: The hotel was great, the service in the morning, was not so good, very slow and not in a hurry to help!  We ended up walking to DD for breakfast and eating it in the lobby area.   The rooms were great and the front desk staff was extremely helpful!

title: Lovely hotel in great location
text: We stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel is very clean and comfortable. Beds are super comfy. Nice modern room on 32nd floor with a fab view. Great location just off Times Square. Husband and daughter had told them I was celebrating a big birthday and they brought a lovely bottle of bubbly and gift bag on first night. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Stored bags for us on last day and booked taxi to airport. Would highly recommend.

title: Few Days in NYC
text:
Stayed here for 5 days. Check in was very easy ( even at 1am). The room was small but I have never been a big room in NYC. It accommodated me and my BFF and all the shopping we did. Room was clean. Bathroom clean. I like that we got tea and coffee from the restaurant (I guess that’s what the urban fee is for). Great area. Bed comfortable. Can’t hear traffic. 

I would’ve gave 5 stars but we had an issue with the TV. We complained 4x and even though the staff said someone would come fix it, they didn’t. By the 5th compliant when we showed up irritated it was finally  fixed. 

Besides that issue, I would definitely recommend this place to others

title: 地點方便
text: 飯店地點距離一些景點都很近，對面就是巴士站，搭車到Jersey Garden超方便，都不用轉車，還有附贈調酒，服務人員也都很親切。

title: Very poor
text: Very poor service, the cashier was very rude and the maid invaded my privacy by disregarding the do not disturb sign. The bed was not made when i entered the hotel room on the first day of my visit and the condition of the air was very thick and humid.

title: A huge disappointment
text:
This is labeled a luxury boutique hotel that is part of Hilton's Tapestry Collection brand, but I don't understand why it's considered a luxury brand.

The room felt extremely small even by NYC standards and was not well maintained. The headboard was ripped and the bed was incredibly uncomfortable.

The hotel is in a good location and the price was reasonable, however, keep in mind that there is a mandatory $25 fee per night that will increase the advertised rate. Also, check-out time is 12 pm which will give you time to grab breakfast without rushing to meet the standard 11 am check-out time in other hotels.

title: Awesome stay!
text: Very clean and service is impeccable! Sahmir and Dennis are very accommodating! The bartenders are awesome too! It's walking distance to Times Square and the subway is only steps away. You get 2 free drinks from the bar everyday you're there😁

title: Recommended
text:
Great location, short walk to Times Square, Broadway. Clean & well equipped. Friendly staff.
Would definitely stay here again.
Recommend the pizza place at the end of the road $1 a slice and Marseille 630 9th Av at 44th St for breakfast.

title: Overpriced Faux Boutique Hotel
text:
Upon checking in when I was handed "free" drink tickets, I realized they had gotten me w one of those vile "resort fees".  I was in a bad mood already having to pay an obscene rate as most hotels were sold out. This was my 2nd and last time here...rooms are small and walls paper thin...elevators are slow & tiny.  Mattress was horrid, lumpy & 
dumpy.

title: Perfect Location with Quiet Room
text:
We picked the Distrikt hotel based on location and size (only 5 rooms per floor). The location is conveniently located directly across the street from a subway access, is a short walk to Times Square, and good places to eat in Hells Kitchen. As others have mentioned, the bus station is across the street and we did see one or two homeless folks in the evenings on our walks back to the hotel-but there are homeless/mentally ill people EVERYWHERE in a big city like New York. In fact, if you actually enter the bus station, it’s pretty nice and a variety of people use it. Plus, it provides an affordable option to and from the airport. I never felt in danger walking around in the evening outside the hotel-we were only asked for money when near Times Square. 

The hotel itself was a pleasant surprise. We arrived early morning, well before checkin but the hotel allowed us to store our bags for free while we explored the city. After checking in later in the evening, we were pleased to discover the small number of rooms on each floor made for quiet evenings. The room was comfortable and actually a decent size for NYC standards. The elevator also required a key to be scanned to get to the floors which was nice added security. 

As others have pointed out, there is an added $25 fee each day-but this covered two drinks from the bar and water in the room each night-not really a big deal for us. In fact, having our two drinks in the hotel bar each evening allowed us to meet others in the hotel who were doing the same thing and provided delightful conversations. 

Overall, the Distrikt Hotel is a wonderful little place in a convenient location. I’d stay again and recommend it to anyone looking to be near Times Square and the Metro. And if homeless scare you, just don’t come to New York City.

title: Boutique Hotel located in Midtown.
text: Hotel is clean and the service was good. Please request a room inside the hotel not on the street side. The noise from the rooftop bar and street kept us up for 2 1/2 hours during the night. The beds were comfortable but I believe one was either foam or an older temperpedic,which was very spongy.

title: Charges and location!
text: We stayed at the Distrikt a year or so ago before it became a Hilton Tapestry and decided to stay there again this yr for another week. However we were unprepared for the immediate holding charge to our cash card of $350 when we arrived not having had this before. Reception told us we had two free drinks vouchers for the bar every day BUT what they didn’t say is that in addition this formed part of our $28 daily urban tax (so not actually free ) and for which we also got 2 bottles of water a day. I only found out about the tax after reading reviews on here and when I spoke to them next day. There was no information on this from our booking agents before this nor the reception staff who checked us in. All In all this is not a transparent way for a business or its staff to act. In addition the headboard in our room was torn (not like that last time)despite fact we had booked a superior room and the street the hotel is on has multiple drug users and homeless people to dodge due to being at the back of the Port Authority. In its favour is kept very clean and very close to subway and Times Square.

title: Deceitful billing
text: The hotel was fine, but avoid staying there because they tack on a $25 per night "urban destination fee" for alcohol and bottled water. They insist it's mandatory. That is deceitful and ridiculous in a hotel that caters to many business travelers.

title: 2 into 3 doesn't go
text:
The staff were great! The room had 2 double beds, one single wardrobe,  1 set of drawers. Inside the wardrobe there was a fridge and a safe which took up half the wardrobe and only 8 coat hangers! 2 dressing gowns, 2 lots of toiletries and towels. We were given 2 free bottles of water and 2 free drinks! We did argue about the later and staff always gave us 3 drinks! There is also an Urban Tax of $25 + tax = just over $28 per day to pay!
Room was cleaned every day!

title: Hotel is wrongly charging me 4 hangers
text:
I was a guest of the hotel on Sept 8th. Few days after I left a noticed a U$40,00 charge on my credit card. For my surprise when I contacted the hotel, they told me it was due to 4 hangers "missing" at the room. I´m very upset and frustating, I stayed only for one night with a very small hand bag. I still trying to solve this with the hotel, but not successfull so far.
Ps. Where I live in Brazil with 40dollars I could have at least 50 hangers!

title: Stay at the Distrikt, you won't be sorry
text: Lovely, smaller property.  Very nice service, very clean hotel.  no problems and very quiet for good sleep!  I highly recommend.  Nicely decorated, good location, easy to find, valet parking, too.  Happy with our stay.

title: Fooled customer
text:
Upon arrival I was immediately dissatisfied with appearance of the hotel even before entering the shabby lobby. 

The staff was friendly but the ambiance was pitiful.The bar was even worse. I had to pay $6 in addition to get the "free" mixed drink I wanted which was Malibu and pineapple juice. Apparantly the Malibu wss  fancy drink.

The online info stated the hotel served breakfast for $30 daily which was incorrect. We were informed this was not the case for quite sometime

title: Family Outing in NYC
text: Great boutique hotel, small but adequate.  Staff was outstanding and goes beyond what is required to help you. We had book two rooms, with one for an elderly. We arrived a bit early but the front desk staff work with housekeeping to get us a room way ahead of regular check in times.  All of the staff we encountered was extremely pleasant and friendly.

title: Muy buena atención y céntrico
text:
Hemos estado con mis hijos en este hotel en la 40 Avenida 
Muy céntrico y los empleados de recepcion muy amables
Tuvimos un problema con las entradas al US Open y gracias a ellos pudimos asistir a las semifinales de Rafa Nadal

title: Bien situe
text:
Bon accueil. Chambre propre et bien insonorisée. Nous étions au 9e étage, ne pas hésiter à demander à être plus haut car au 9e vue sur un bâtiment. Hôtel bien situé proche de Times square et port authority. 
Une surfacturation est prévue de 25$ comprenant un verre au bar, un accès dans une salle de sport située à 300m dommage que ce forfait ne soit pas intégré au prix final. Une bagagerie est présente. 
Nous reviendrons sûrement car l’hôtel est idéalement situé.

title: Would not stay here again
text: This hotel was not what I expected in terms of Hilton quality. Even though we had amazing views of the city and were close to most attractions, our room was pretty run-down and the bathroom setup was just awful. Water from the shower spilled all over the bathroom floor, and the sink was clogged during our stay. There were rips and tears on the headboards and the beds were pretty uncomfortable. Would not recommend.

title: It wants to feel like its a "boutique" hotel....
text:
Thing is, its not a boutique hotel, its a chain... its a "maximize every dollar" chain.  I'm a Hilton Honors member [think I slid from Platinum to Gold, don't really care]... I'm supposed to get two bottles of water upon arrival [which in New York City is patently ridiculous as it has the BEST drinking water in the world coming out of the tap... but we're trained not to drink water from the sink... I digress].

They also offer you two "complimentary" drinks upon arrival -- which is all part of the $25 "urban" fee [or some such nonsense].  Basically, its the corporate mooks at the chain adding $25 to your room stay in the form of a free drink [in our case, two cups of coffee... not even Starbucks has that kind of balls!!!].

The room was beyond small - no desk [really]?  --- AND had one of those annoying showers where you can't help but get hit with cold water when trying to start the thing up [seems to be a chain wide problem].

The elevators are only medium slow, fortunately there aren't a lot of guests otherwise I could envision 4-5 minute waits for a ride.

The place is rather conveniently located to pretty much everything we wanted to do, and in our case - being from the northern suburbs of NYC, we do appreciate its proximity to the Port Authority bus terminal [as its an expensive pain in the arse to bring the car].  

On the whole, its not a bad place... its a bit expensive for what you get [which is essentially a nicer lobby than you'd find at a "Hilton Garden Inn" or "Hampton Inn" which is about $100/night less expensive... but the locations aren't quite as quiet as this one is, and its a very short walk to the bus station.

title: DISTRIKT DELIGHT
text: I found a GEM among the many hotels across from the Port Authority on 40th.  Great staff,  AMAZING room!  Do your due diligence and check them out.  Room was UNUSUALLY LARGE for a New York boutique hotel in this area.

title: KEEP YOUR EXPECTATIONS VERY LOW
text: I booked this place for my one night in Manhattan. I must believe that at the price point, one could do much better. The wallpaper is coming of the walls, there are holes in the furniture and I found pubic hair in my shower as soon as I arrived. I went to the lackluster bar area where there was a bartender. He didn’t bother to acknowledge me or anyone else that walked into the place. He only spoke if spoken to and had no personality. When I asked about one of the 3 drinks written on the giant specials board facing the bar, he said that he had no idea what i was talking about and had never taken notice to the “spiked hot chocolate” on the menu. I ordered some tots and was ready to see the town in my new white dress. When i opened the warm ketchup bottle he had given me, it spewed all over said white dress and boiled up to the top like a volcano. Although he was standing there, After receiving no reaction, I told him what had happed and he simply took the bad bottle and opened a new one. No apologies or offers to give me something to wipe myself off with, nothing. I myself tend bar and am very aware of how I treat and talk to others in the industry. I had done nothing to warrant this treatment or apathy. The next day, I called in and discussed this with the management and have received no response.

title: Could use some work
text:
Well the place looks amazing online however it needs some attention.

Small room like most hotels in NYC. Some items for improvement:

Glass shower door cracked
Plastic water guard broken so water all over the floor when showering.
Holes in walls (old electrical outlet) covered with patches of wallpaper.
Large section of leather headboard torn or burned. Poor attempt to patch
Desk chair torn

Staff were friendly and helpful and this could be a decent hotel with sone TLC.

title: Great value for theatre-goers!
text: Walking distance to most theatres and Times Square, Port Authority, and several restaurants. Rooms are quite comfortable, beds and bedding are great, thermostats are easy to operate. A couple of furnishings were a little shabby and it's very close to a not-so-nice neighborhood but we had no problems in 2 stays at this hotel.

title: Excellent customer service
text: The Distrikt is a hip hotel in the center of midtown, nice rooms. What set this hotel apart for me was the customer service, especially from front desk person Juliana. She gave us hospitality that went above and beyond, looking after every detail and jumping in to help when we were in a pinch. She was incredible and made our stay at the Distrikt memorable.

title: Not what it was.
text:
First visited this hotel in 2012 and it was excellent 5 star review. Noticed it has changed to Hilton Tapestry and it is not a change for the better. On arrival one of the lifts was out necessitating a 15 min wait for ourselves and others who had checked in.Although next to reception no member of staff apologized or offered an explanation until asked.

Very little money seems to be spent on maintenance room clean but tired,crack in outer double glazing panel in room, cuts in headboard of bed,wardrobe door that didn't close

Staff all very young interpersonal skills not great. Inexperienced bar tender all doubtless employed to save paying the wages of older more experienced staff.

On the plus side the hotel is well located for what you want to see in Manhattan. 
Basically there are now better hotels than this for the money. Disappointing.

title: I think their so called "Urban Destination Fee" is fraudulent
text: The place is kind of cramped but ok. The staff is friendly and helpful. However, they are required to charge this so called mandatory "Urban Destination Fee" of $25 per day plus tax. This is just made up stuff to pluck money of of people instead of having this in the price. At hotels.com before you book the hotel, there is no mention of this and it's indicated that the price given is the full fee. You really don't learn about this until you are at the hotel although they pointed out it was in the fine print of the confirmation email. This is no way to treat customers and probably fraudulent in terms of consumer regulations. Because of this, I can not recommend this hotel.

title: It is ok
text: Rooms are small. there is a resort fee which I do not understand why they  charge it. Other hotel in the area does not. It is basically a new hotel so it is somewhat ok to stay here. Location prior to getting there is kinda unsafe. Too many people on 8th and 40th St

title: Decent
text:
This hotel is definitely nothing special. It’s small, in kind of a bad area, a bit run down. The room itself is okay, it’s clean but the bed is super uncomfortable. The service at the desk was pretty bad as well. 

We mainly stayed here because we were using our Hilton honors points, so for that it was okay for somewhere just to sleep and not hang out anymore than that.

In all honesty, I would not recommend this hotel and I definitely would not stay here again.

title: Buena ubicación pero fea la cuadra
text: Nos hospedamos 8 noches, la zona está bien pero la cuadra (enfrente al lateral de la estación de ómnibus) no es linda. No tenía mini heladera ni nos pudieron dar cuna para bebé. El personal (salvo una empleada) fue servicial.

title: It was okay
text: We stayed here because we wanted to be close to the Lyric Theatre. It was only a 5 minute walk. However, for a girls trip- the area gets a little seedy at night. You are walking past a few homeless people on the street to get to the hotel. The elevators are very slow and have no AC, but I found the no AC part to be true about many elevators in NY. The room was small, but nice. There are no ice machines, but the front desk will bring some up for you. Overall a decent stay.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Albergo di qualità discreta .
La posizione è ottima. Di fronte, uscendo dall'hotel e andando verso destra vi è il passaggio x accedere alla metropolitana, direttamente dall'edificio che è di fronte.
Il passaggio aperto fino le 21 di sera poi eventualmente si va poco più avanti e lo si raggiunge ugualmente.
Dieci minuti a piedi da Times Square. Pizzeria e bar per fare colazione al mattino 1 minuto a piedi uscendo dall'albergo e andando a sinistra.
Le camere non sono grandi , ma confortevoli per le necessità di pernottare.
I letti sono a una piazza e mezza.
Personale cortese .
Noi eravamo in 4 e davano due bottigliette di acqua da mezzo litro.
Nell'insieme discreto e pulito .
Anche gli asciugamani in alcuni giorni non c'erano per tutti e 4 
Dispone di phon e ferro da stiro anche con asse. !

title: Horrid Stay!
text:
I am a 10 year  Hilton Diamond Member - smallest room available offered to me ever!   Daily cleaning service 9 to 5 pm?  Laughable!  No coffee machine ?  only offered in the  deluxe rooms?  Laughable!  6 hangers on Closet?  Laughable!   Breakfast? Only Microwaved egg sandwich offer ,  no fruits , no yoghurt,  Coffee at breakfast no carafe , only server pours one by one ,  no Pastries!   LOL   -  any special requests after reminding front desk twice were maybe granted , and we were told to be considered lucky to be granted anything.  I am thinking Management focuses on P&L and does not take care of diamond customers or employees.   Very Noisy Air Conditioning it is all inside....compressor and thermostat similar to old Hampton Inns in rural America.  All wall coverings  not complete , no shears and no black out curtains...... profit profit profit....at our expense!    Lovely headboards.....I’d say ratty alright.    See pic below.

Disappointment is a nice word to say the least.

Gabriel Morales Sada
#668302695  hilton honors

title: Great Location
text: We went to our NYC trip to celebrate our anniversary. The location is really good, really close to subway stations, near to times square and brodway, it’s a calm street and the accomodation is modern and confortable. For sure recomend it.

title: Holiday to NYC 🇺🇸🗽
text: We r currently staying here for 5 nights with our 2 daughters. So close to Times Square just a 5 minute walk. We have had no problems with reception staff whatsoever they have been very welcoming, the room would be my only gripe we think the beds r just a tad small think it’s only double beds! Rooms were cleaned everyday and were very clean when we arrived. We have thoroughly enjoyed our time even though it really is somewhere to put our heads down at the end of a very busy holiday.

title: Average hotel
text: The room was clean but they would wake you up really early because of house keeping and the hotel was really small for what they charge. Also the hotel was pretty far from some locations and it had pretty bad internet. But overall it was a decent hotel

title: Hilton does it again!
text: A last minute trip left me searching for a hotel near my meeting.  The Distrikt Hotel fit the bill for location and price.  The "resort" fee of $25 was aggravating until I was told it came with two drinks at the bar and two bottles of water in addition to free internet.  The lounge was a lovely place to unwind.  The room was VERY comfortable - clean, cool and comfy mattress! The employees were all very helpful and nice. Our only complaint was the breakfast in the lounge.  The waitstaff was non-existent and since we were in a hurry, we had to leave without eating.  Otherwise, I will be back.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Come dal titolo, la posizione è ottima ma per il resto è un po’ così così. La stanza che avevamo mostrava i segni del tempo: testiera del letto strappata, qualche macchia sulle pareti, nel bagno mancava un po’ di silicone. La pulizia andrebbe rivista ed anche un po’ intensificata. Consigliato se non si vuole passare molto altro tempo oltre al dormire.

title: Hot room, sketchy area.
text: The air conditioner didnt work. I had two rooms and both were hot the entire stay. Maintenance worked on then, didnt help much. Sketchy area around hotel.  I saw drug and prostitution activity half a block from front door of hotel.  Scary!

title: Great value for the price
text: Have to admit, I had some questions before arriving at the Distrikt. Sought a hotel in the Hilton family close to Times Square as my daughter and I were hitting broadway. The reality is that it’s a very nice hotel, with decent amenities. There’s a small bar/restaurant in the lower level that serves snacks and drinks. The location is convenient to restaurants, theatre and shopping and the staff is super friendly. Would definitely stay here again. PS be sure to check the AAA rate for even more value for $.

title: If you don't mind tiny...
text: Loved the staff, liked the location, disappointed in the room, but the bed as comfortable and air conditioning worked, which is important in New York in July!  Not likely to go back there next trip to the City.

title: Holiday
text: just back from the best holiday ever! Lovely clean modern hotel central to the main sights in New York City. Free WiFi, 2 bottles of water and 2 free drinks at bar every day which is included in resort fees. We asked for high up room and we got 25 floors up which was excellent and good view. Only problem was the city had a power cut and we had to walk all the way up the stairs one night.

title: Very disappointed
text:
I am an honors gold member and have stayed at many many Hilton properties.  This was not a great one

While the location is great and price was competitive , the hotel itself is a big disappointment 

It’s tiny, especially the rooms.  I stayed in a two bed room and it’s was one of the smallest hotel rooms I have ever been in. Bed also was not up to Hilton quality   The bathroom is Tiny 

The lobby is tiny 

Most disappointment was the breakfast.  I am used to having a complimentary breakfast.  The Hilton garden suite breakfast I had a few weeks ago makes this ones look like a meal at Spagos

There is no organization to the breakfast. I finally got up to see why no one had come to take our order.  Only to find out you have to order at the counter. The choice is limited to a few things, not of it freshly cooked.  What a disappointment   Dont Waste your time there   The staff is useless and have no intention of serving you Breakfast   I’d rather go to Starbucks 

I don’t understand how people call this a hot chic property?  There are zero amenities 

Don’t plan on more than. Two people a room unless you love close quarters 

I won’t be back

title: Location. Location. Location.
text: Next door to Port Authority Bus Terminal and few blocks away from Times Square, this hotel is a must for first time visitors to NYC as it allows you to quickly adjust with the feverish pace of arguably the busiest place on Earth.

title: Show
text:
Equipe muito amigável e prestativa ! O Dennis é demais ! 
Quarto limpo e silencioso, em se tratando de NYC, localização perfeita ao lado Port Authority o que facilita muito e prove segurança, indico acesso sempre por dentro de Port Authority à noite!

title: Way Better Than It Even Needed To Be!
text: I chose this hotel due to it's location and it was affordable and the Hilton brand is reliable but I didn't expect it to be as nice as it was. Very clean and well maintained with an outstanding staff and generous amenities.

title: Don't be misled by the final cost
text:
Here's the bottom line: this hotel charges a mandatory $25 "urban destination fee" per room per night.  It includes the Internet, among other things like 2 drinks.  

Here's why I'm infuriated by it: all the descriptions related to this hotel says the Internet is free.  Indeed as I write this, on Trip Advisor under "Property Amenities" it says "Free High Speed Internet (WiFi)".  Under Booking.com, which I used, the very first phrase in the very first line says "Offering Free WiFi..." (yes, "Free" is capitalized).  

Maybe in the US it's legal or normal to label something "free" and then charge a mandatory fee that covers it but I still find it extremely mis-leading. It's not the cost I object to, it's the deception.  Just my opinion.

title: Great location for Times Square
text: We chose this hotel because it was part of the Hilton collection, it was close to Times Square, within walking distance of the MET, and was a decent price. The rooms were nice and clean. The bed was comfy. It was over 90 degrees outside during our stay and the AC in the room was a nice escape. The front desk staff was helpful answering our questions about getting around the city. The coffee shop has great coffee and drinks! We liked the bloody Mary, mimosa, and iced Americano. They give you a coupon for one free drink each day which you can use for coffee or booze.

title: Great boutique hotel in a great location
text: The room was just the right size for the amount of time we spent in it and the hotel was located in a convenient area-easy walking distance to all the attractions midtown has to offer.  Clean; neat little bar/cafe; helpful, friendly staff.  Would definitely go back

title: Very sorry to say, never again.
text: A few years ago I stayed here a few times and loved it. We had great rooms and the staff was extra friendly and nice and the place was spotless. So finally I make it there again, very much looking forward to it but what a change there has been. We were put in room 1004 and right away I asked to be moved but the hotel was full ( I understand that, it was Pride weekend) but I was miserable there. The room was very dark, very bad lighting and even if you opened the blinds, there is just another house there so very little light coming in. The carpet was filthy, the soles of my feet showed that. And it was a very musty smell in the room. There were no decorations nor anything else in the room really. Just a very uncomfortable bed. No mini bar to keep anything cold and just plastic cups to drink out of. One small bottle of shampoo, conditioner and body lotion, very cheap products. The shower was moldy, the backrest of the bed was worn and torn with big patches ripped. Door frames scruffy and dirty, one robe for two people. They only have two lifts for a 32 story building and one of them was out of work most of the time. Terrible noise that woke us up every night and every day, needs more insulation so dont ever stay that low.  They promise you two drink vouchers a day but it works so you have to ask for them every day. So first day we seem to have arrived too late and the bar was closed. Next day, the bar was closed anyway. Third day I got them. Forth day we were checking out so we did not get them. In my mind, I should have gotten 8 on arrival for the 4 nights we stayed to be used when I wanted to. They also should not charge extra for cocktails. Before, they had great front desk staff, this time, they all seemed very bored and certainly not interested in me. Yes, the area has a lot of drunks/druggies but I knew that but it makes me sad to see how downhill this hotel has gone, certainly not worth the money they charge and it surprised me greatly to have to pay $114 for taxes, that is the fault of my booking site tho,  this really was more of a motel than a hotel. Will certainly not stay there again, plenty of other good hotels in the city for the same price or lower. Dear Distrikt, you could be a cool hotel again, please try and work on it.

title: Distrikt Hotel is Gem in the Rough
text: I chose the Distrikt Hotel because it is a part of the Hilton collection. It has a small exterior next to other "named" hotels and the lobby is small. The rooms are what you would expect from a Hilton. It is very clean and quiet. You are in the middle of the theater district and can walk around to see so many things. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel is in the middle of chaotic Midtown, especially because the Port Authority is literally across the street. However, my room was extremely quiet, clean, safe and well-kept. Thanks to the staff, from the front desk (Kayla) to housekeeping, we had a great four-night stay during one of NYC's busiest times for tourists (July 4th).

title: WORST HOTEL EVER STAY AWAY
text: From check in to check out I had nothing but problems at this hotel. I checked in late on Friday night and they gave me a really horrible room on the second floor that smelled really bad. I called immediately and asked to be switched to a different room, and they did not switch me and said they are sold out. I have to call the next day before 9am. So I called at 8:30am, and they wanted me to checkout of the room and bring my stuff down for them to watch and give me a new room at 2pm when check in starts. I refused since I was already at the hotel and I shouldn't have to do that. They called me 20 mins later and said your new room is ready. So I went to get my new key and I went to check in the new room one of their employees was taking a break there watching TV and had his legs up on the bed sitting on a chair. I asked who he was, he got nervous and said I am just fixing your tv. I called the front desk and I complained they said that he was there to clean your room. I knew it was all bs so I was frustrated and angry and the front desk guy started yelling at me and said he can't speak to me and if I need to talk to them I have to go downstairs to speak to them and then hung up the phone. Housekeeping also found out what was going on so they came to my door and apologized and said he was there to bring a robe to the room and to please forgive bc he can lose his job. So within 3 mins I got 3 different stories. I asked for an upgrade and the manager Ryan was so rude he said it's my fault bc I have attitude and I yelled at them and they will not switch rooms for me bc of my behavior. I've never been treated this way, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. ITS JUST BAD. Slow elevators and bad rooms with horrible pillows and mattresses. They also charged me $250 on top of the $200 incidentals that I am disputing with my credit card. This hotel is terrible. I can't tell you enough DO NOT STAY HERE! I wish I could give zero stars. Ryan and his staff need to be trained on how to deal with customers. Zero customer service.

title: OK
text: i like the property what I did not like it my room not being available at check-in and their "heartburn" that I asked for a late checkout. Also I wasn't too appreciative at housekeeping knocking at 8a

title: Nice but 4 stars ✨?
text: The location is good, but the neighbourhood is a rough. If you choose this option ask for a room above the 20th floor. Just to let you know, there are only 2 eleventors. We were waiting sometimes more than 8 minutes. Front desk customer service was good.

title: Location was great
text: the hotel was clean, neat and tidy. The staff were awesome. It was great checking out, and the bell service arranged to store our luggage and connected us with a car service, the price was equal to other transportation options, and far more luxurious. It was pretty nice ride to the airport on a hot stormy day.

title: Great Stay
text: The front desk staff was friendly and polite. The room was clean, but small comparing the size of a typical room in Chicago, but average size for NYC.  I wish there was more counter space around the bathroom sink. I would definitely stay there again!

title: Quintessentially Boutique
text: My new fave hotel in Midtown/Hell’s Kitchen. This unassuming boutique hotel delivers on many counts: knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful front desk staff, impeccable housekeeping service, free bottled water and 2 (2!) daily bar cards for espresso drinks, wine, or cocktails, and most importantly location...The only unfortunate glitch was an unpleasant experience with a bar attendant who couldn’t relinquish his sacred right of jerkhood that day. Fortunately his badass manager, bless her heart, was present and apologized on behalf of the establishment. I will stay here again in the future.

title: BAD FAMILY EXPERIENCE
text: Unsafe neighborhood. Homeless people roaming in street and many were under influence and bothering people while walking toward the hotel . Hotel staff did not reserve the taxi for my airport ride. i had to wake up the receptionist to get me checked out on 06/25/19

title: Loved it !
text:
I have stayed here on so many occasions in the past and loved every stay. We were booked into a 4 star hotel on the east side for 7 nights for our 49th wedding anniversary, but after arriving late at night to a poky small room with no space we checked out the next morning ! The staff were awful, couldn’t care less attitude.
I booked online to stay at The Distrikt for the remaining 6 nights not knowing it was now a Hilton. All of the staff we encountered were excellent including Eva, Samir and the lovely Dennis ! Our room was lovely on the 10th floor, very clean, and there was a coffee machine too. In the first hotel the resort fee was $35 each night but the Distrikt is $25 and that entitles us to 2 drinks from the bar daily as well as water each day.  When I stayed there years ago there was only 1 hotel in the street, I believe there is now 5 hotels. There is some homeless people lying around but they are on a lot of streets not just this one.  In all the years I have stayed here, I have never seen anything untoward, and there is lots of tourists coming and going from all the 5 hotels. This would not put me off staying. I love 9th Avenue
With all the great restaurants. Really near the Highline, a must to have a walk.  4 blocks to Macy’s, ESB 5 blocks. Walking distance to TOTR, Grand Central, 5th Avenue and Bryant Park to mention a fee ! Thank you to all the staff !

title: 100% positivo
text:
El precio es correcto, como el del resto de hoteles en esa zona.
La atención del personal correcta. Nos ayudaron con las dudas y peticiones que tuvimos.
Teníamos incluidas dos bebidas que pudimos cambiar por café para llevar por la mañana o por botellas de agua.
Habitación limpia, amplia, con algún desperfecto pero nada grave.
Habitación amplia, con dos camas que eran realmente cómodas.

title: Not even stayed there yet and having issues!
text: I booked this hotel as part of a package via BA for travel next April (2020), under the assumption that their fitness center is onsite. Errmm after speaking with BA and researching many of the reviews on here, I found out there isn't a fitness center on site! BA has been really good and contacted the hotel to request a change, the manager agreed that the wording is misleading and confirmed I could change, so BA  requested confirmation in writing. However, they have gone back on their word and said they will not allow me to change to another hotel without a charge! This is disgusting and very unprofessional behaviour. Fitness center or not, I certainly do not wish to spend any of my hard earn money at this place. Ridiculous.

title: Ça aurait été mieux sans un incident
text:
Le service d'étage a perdu le "doudou" ou "teddy" de ma fille en faisant le ménage de la chambre et en emportant les draps.
Les recherches ont dû durer moins d'une heure et aucune excuses n'a été formulé. 
C'est inacceptable et Irremplaçable.
La chambre est propre, le ménage est correcte. La salle de bain est bien équipée. 
Le service de TV par câble n'est pas très fiable sur certaines chaînes. 
Les chambres sont mal isolées du bruit new yorkais. Les vitres ont du double vitrage mais la climatisation laisse passer le bruit de la rue (6eme étage) et gare routière en face. Le double vitrage est donc inutile. 
Prévoir pour les européens des earplugs à l'accueil. Ils vous diront merci.
Personnel de l'accueil sympathique mais trop expéditif.
Bon emplacement proche du métro. Même si ça n'était pas un problème pour nous pas mal de sdf et de junkies dans la rue et ça n'est pas comme ça dans tout new york. Toutefois nous ne nous sommes pas sentis en danger pour autant. 
Cet hôtel équivaut à un  trois étoiles à Paris plutôt bon marché. Je le recommande si vous n'êtes pas trop regardant et en attente d'un vrai 4 étoiles. Recommandation surtout pour son emplacement que la qualité de ses services quand tout se passe bien.

title: Don't bother waste of money
text: Air conditioner, was not working, after advising management Engineer said that thermostat needed replacing and that he would replace it.  HA HA I was there for over 5 nights not once did anyone bother to ask about it or to fix it. So much for paying for an air conditioned room. The lights went out one night and then the TV was not working another day.  NEVER EVER AGAIN for what you pay it really isnt worth it better to not be so close to Times Square than to have this experience. Apparently I needed to tell then that I wanted to be transferred really did I have to ask again or beg for this to happen?  Staff being friendly does not compensate for false advertising and nothing working as it was suppose to be, the matter has been referred to  a Solicitor.

title: Don’t waste your time
text: Positive was that the staff was courteous but not a 3 or 4 star hotel. Stayed in room 2902 and the bed boards were ripped and bubbled. The room was not offered to be clean until we came back after 4 pm. The food was worst than a rest stop  on the highway with rubbered microwaved chicken nuggets which were supposed to be chicken wings and microwaved sweet potato fries. There was no counter space and no free coffee. There were 2 drink tickets a day offered for the $29 resort fee. There are definitely better options for the money. Hilton is getting worst.

title: Trip of a lifetime
text:
I stayed here last November for 8 nights for the NYC Marathon/birthday trip and travelled from the UK.

We paid extra for room with a view and the views were incredible. We booked the hotel a year in advance, so I don't think it cost that much extra. My twin brother surprised us half way through our stay and stayed at the Distrikt. He had a standard room which was much smaller and had no view. Although he still loved the hotel. 

The staff were so helpful. Especially Dennis, he was brilliant. Works his socks off. 

The hotel is situated in a great location. Walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Hells Kitchen etc. Subway on same street. 

Plenty of restaurants, bars etc close by.

I would reccomend this hotel 100% and would stay here everytime I visit NYC. 

Hope to see you again very soon!

title: Great Location Wonderful Service
text: Wonderful staff from check in to check out.  Even right after we checked in, young gentleman on the elevator that gave us some pointers was just pleasant.  Close walking distance to Time Square, several subway stops and other attractions.  Checking out was nice as they checked our bags until it was time to return to get car for drive to airport.  They ordered the car for us for a flat fee to the airport and it was waiting when we arrived back. Loved the smallness of the hotel, only 5 rooms per floor, we didn't hear alot of outside noise and it was nice not to have people hollering and carrying on up and down the long hallways of bigger hotels.

title: Not sure why so well ranked...
text:
I was to stay four nights and cut it down to three. The hotel is right across from the port authority which means its central but in a gritty busy noisy dirty area of manhattan.  Its kind of depressing as is the interior of this hotel, a simple lobby and some sort of cafe that was empty and not even open in the morning at least one day in my stay.  The hotel is not full service at all, yet they charge 25$ for something daily, some water and drinks at the dead cafe they have if you can find a server.  The gym pass is nice but you have to walk a few blocks to get there and thats a drag in the rain.  No newspapers either, so again whats with the ridiculous daily fee? 
As for the room, it was decent size the bed too soft and ac didnt work well, I heard a fair amount of noise from the traffic and bus station, even though over 20 floors high.  I cant understand why the hotel is getting such rankings....Its not a good value in my view and more generic than boutique.

title: Hotel buono rapporto qualità prezzo
text:
Il punto forte di questa struttura è la posizione.
Veramente centrale nel quartiere di Manhattan e soprattutto attaccato alla stazione dei pullman di Port Authority. Le camere sono piccole ma accoglienti. Il servizio bar (per quanto riguarda la colazione) è veramente limitato di media qualità.
Consiglio se ci andate (ma questo vale per quasi tutti gli hotel di New York) prendete una camera dal decimo piano in su se volete dormire.

title: Not worth the money you pay for
text:
I work in the travel industry and stay at a lot of hotels. Overall, I had a poor experience at this hotel. 

We had 2x reservations booked back to to back. Fortunately, we were able to shorten our booking after the second night and move to a different hotel. 

For the 1st  night I booked a  queen bed room. For the 2nd and subsequent nights I booked a deluxe double room

Pros: 2x water bottles a day and 2 drink vouchers.
We were able to shorten our booking and be refunded the rest of our booking after the 2nd night.

Cons: 
1st  night: 1x queen bed room: 
Average room with rips in the bed head. 
We had requested no interconnecting room, however we were given one. The room was therefore noisy, being close to the elevators and being able to hear the neighbours next door.
I specifically requested and paid extra for a room with a fridge. The room did not have a fridge and when I enquired about this, I was told it was a mistake on the website. (It was booked through the Hilton honours website- screenshots attached). We were not compensated for this mistake made by the hotel, despite paying extra for a fridge.

Day 2:
As we were moving rooms, I was advised by hotel staff that I had to Checkout and then recheck in for the next night.
At 1145 I went to reception to checkout then Check in again to the new room. As I was in line there was another couple in front of me that had arrived. They wanted to check in early and apparently were told they could between 1200 and 1300 however there was a very rude staff member who abruptly told them they couldn’t check in until 1500. I was also spoken to very rudely by this staff member, who advised me that I had to check out of one room by 12noon and then was not able to check in again until 3pm. After repeated attempts of trying to tell her I had a back to back booking she kept saying come back at 1500. It was only when another staff member approached that they handled it better advising we didn't need to checkout until our room was ready.

2nd night: 1x deluxe double room.
This room was presented a lot better than the previous room.
However we awoke to housekeeping knocking on our door at 0830 in the morning. 

Overall a pretty disappointing experience for what you pay for. 

We cancelled the rest of the reservation and went elsewhere.

title: Pessimo soggiorno a nyc
text: Hotel pessimo, costoso per quello che offre. Non e' di sicuro un 4 stelle come indicato su booking.com. Soggiorno deludente grazie ad un errore di booking.com ho alloggiato in questo hotel. Personale pessimo, camere tristi, scure e con schienale letto in pelle rotto

title: Modern hotel & great location
text:
I stayed at the Distrikt Hotel in November 2015 and November 2017 and cannot fault it.

The hotel is modern and very clean.
It is in a great location, just a couple blocks from Times Square.

The hotel is small to look at compared to some of the bigger hotels in NYC but it does the job.

The rooms are pretty specious and the beds are really comfy which is what you need after a long day walking exploring the city. 

Overall, great hotel for a first time visit to New York. Would definitely recommend (and visit again!).

title: Comfortable, Clean, Quiet, & Convenient
text: We were very pleased with the hotel and our room. The mattress was very comfortable and the room was quiet. They have blackout curtains that allowed us to sleep in. The hotel is a one minute walk to the nearest subway station and only 5-7 minutes to Time Square. With only 5 rooms per floor, it never felt over crowded and the elevators were fast. The staff was excellent too. We would definitely stay again!

title: Godt og centralt
text:
Hotel med gode værelser og god beliggenhed, tæt ved busterminalen og Times Square.
Værelset (403) var stort, i forhold til en storby og prisen.
Værelset var rent, god seng (Kingsize) og stor brusekabine.

title: Awful location and accomodations
text:
Not safe at all, specially for families.
So many more options in the area, cleaner and more welcoming. Do not take your family there. Drug users and dealer right outside hotel. Definitely a place that cannot call itself a Tapestry collection.

title: Extremely disappointing
text: Poor hotel, poor dining offering, poor service, disappointing rooms, poor value.  The breakfast offering is sub-par.  I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member.  I travel frequently.  I have very rarely had such a poor experience.

title: Great location, friendly and accommodating staff
text: The hotel was in the heat of Midtown and easily accessible to public transport etc. it is near a major transit station so I would not recommend walking in this area alone late at night. The accommodations though were in a great price point and the room (select one on the upper levels) was not noisy at all (there are five rooms per floor which was nice as well). The bed was very comfortable and the room was cleaned everyday. Within your guest room rate, the hotel provides you with two complimentary beverage cards each day of stay, which was nice to get a drink or coffee going to/from your day. All staff was pleasant, polite and I felt very safe, as there were several key card only accessible doors/elevators. The only negative I have about this hotel is the wi-fi is not secure and spotty at best. I selected this hotel based on available wi-if for work and was not able to use it. There are plenty of coffee places around though. Overall, I would stay here again since it was so central and stay was pleasant.

title: Reasonably priced hotel but beware the resort fee sting in the tail
text:
First things first, this hotel is really easy to get to.  If you are coming in from JFK, once you join the subway from the airtrain, you can take the same line all the way to the PABT station, it's just a 1 minute walk away.
The hotel staff are good and helpful and the rooms clean and quiet.  It isn't a great location in that it isn't a pretty part of town - right by the bus station - however it is a doddle to get everywhere from either the PABT bus terminal station or Times Square station.  
The bed is very comfortable and the rooms are quiet, even when they face out onto the road.  
The reason the hotel has not scored higher is that the service charge of $25 per day is just too high for what you get.  I feel that the staff are resigned to talking about this, but it isn't easy to see any return on this.  There isn't a pool, the gym isn't even at the hotel, the bar isn't always open, etc...  When all you see for your $25 per day is a single bottle of water, that's not great value in anyone's book.

title: I love the Distrikt Hotel
text: Great location, great value for price, lovely property, great customer service oriented staff, very comfortable bed, nice sized room, drink coupons, friendly reservation person, let me store my luggae after checkout.

title: Good location, but limited functionality.
text: Great location for going to a show or other attractions near Times Square.  There are a couple of good restaurants and bars practically next door.  But the hotel is small, a little cramped, and not particularly inviting.

title: Too expensive for what you get
text: At half the cost, we would have been fine. The problem is that it charges high-end boutique-hotel rates but its service and accommodations are no better than what you'd get at some budget chain. You pay a $25-a-night resort fee that basically gets you 2 bottles of water and a drink in the bar (whether you want it or not -- and the bartender gets pissy if you just get coffee or a soda). Front desk service was all shrugs and blank stares. They couldn't manage to get us keys that worked until about the 3rd or 4th time. Electrical outlets and charging stations in the room didn't work, and the phone wasn't plugged in (there wasn't even a cord).

title: Hotel fine but bizarre breakfast and overcharged
text: The hotel is fine and good value for money with a nice location in proximity to Times Sqaure. The room is a standard size by NYC standards and well furnished. I also received a complimentary pass to the Mid City Gym two blocks away which was a nice touch. However, the free breakfast situation (as a Diamond member) was bizarre. It is served in the Collage restaurant/bar over the counter where only one gentleman was working. There were four options to select from and some pastries as well as coffee or tea. We waited approximately 25 minutes to be served as the line was quite long. This was quite early, so it could have been worse later in the morning. In addition, I was double charged for the urban destination fee and I am currently pursueing my refund through Hilton as the hotel has not replied to my emails. I would stay here again for the price, but I will be mindful of the limitations compared to other options.

title: great location, comfy beds
text: Hotel is very well located to walk for all main tourist attractions, the bed was so comfortable we wanted to take it home and the air con was lovely. Staff were very friendly and helpful, we got 2 bottles of water in our room every day which were very handy to take out with us and vouchers to get a drink each, every night in the bar, this we felt payed us back the daily city tax they have to charge. There is a roof top bar in the hotels either side of the Distrikt, this gave a real feel for the night life of the locals with a live DJ, and amazing views. The area we felt completely safe in. We would definitely use the hotel again. Would like to say if the Distrikt read this can they reply to us what the mattress is called, meant to ask before we left.

title: Very convenient for the theatre
text: This hotel can be hard to find as it is tucked between a Doubletree and several other hotels.  It's a very narrow building, and the door is set back from the sidewalk - so it would be easy enough to go right by it.  The rooms are small (by American standards - much more in line with what we've had in Europe).  But the room was clean, and we were next to the elevator and never heard it all night.  The staff was helpful (don't believe the website - they do have valet parking at $65/night).  The bar/restaurant was quite serviceable for a quick drink before the theatre, or a quick breakfast in the morning.  This hotel is near Port Authority bus terminal, so it's not a swanky neighborhood.  You will step around homeless folks.  But the location is great, and the hotel is safe.

title: Convenient location
text: Convenient base for our first trip to New York, room was smallish but clean and tidy with good air con (we were lucky with the weather). Staff very helpful and cheerful. The bar was probably the least impressive part of our experience, slow service and really very little atmosphere. If you need a central point for visiting NY this hotel will suit you.

title: Terrible
text: Not quiet or clean, reception staff not very friendly. Cup of water with lipstick on in bathroom, used soap and sanitary items in bin greeted us on our arrival to our room. Booked with friends and requested rooms together- they were on the 24 and we were on the 5th. Do not stop in 502 - side of lift shaft and fire escape and looks onto very busy bus station - hence very little sleep. TV in room never worked just said weak signal all the time. Only 2 small lifts and just a small bar selling drinks and snacks- $10 a pint or small glass of wine. Be prepared for the extra $25 a night local surcharge at the hotel - you do get a 2 drinks voucher and 2 bottles of water in the room. Location is good for Times Square, however be prepared for the large number of vagrants sleeping near the hotel can be very intimidating

title: Right up our Street
text: We enjoyed our 3 night stay in this hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful. They arranged for me to be a member of "Hilton Honors" as we checked out as this was very useful in the Hilton hotel we went on to at Niagara Falls. Our king room had everything we needed and the bed was so comfy. It was useful having a desk and two comfy chairs. The room was cleaned to a very high standard. It was lovely and quiet being at the back on the 27th floor with a view of the Hudson river in the distance. We enjoyed a free drink in the bar each day after we had come back from seeing the sights. Having a coffee to take up to our room each morning was a great start to our day.

title: Awesome!!
text:
Really fantastic place! Perfectly located with fantastic rooms and service. Highly recommend. 

We booked a large twin which was worth paying the extra for. It’s not overly fancy but nice enough to base yourself if wanting to be in the thick of things.

title: Small by ok
text:
Very small hotel (5 rooms on each floor), about 35 floors that does the job of a place to stay.  the rooms were clean (typical new York small) and the bathroom had replaced the bath with a shower which I prefer.

Bar area was cosy and prices okay.  I only ended up here as my regular hotel was full and it was a last minute booking.  I would prefer to stay down on 37th where I normally stay as the area on 40th is right next to the bus terminal and has quite a few undesirable types hanging around so I felt a bit uncomfortable on an evening in the street.

title: Popular hangout for down-and-outs
text:
As visitors from England, we were shocked at the hotel's location. Although within walking distance of many sights and the subway, we had to run the gauntlet of many drug-addled men to get to and from the hotel, which was unnerving. On one occasion, a homeless guy walked on off the street and took my jacket from a chair in reception while I was on the phone. The reception staff did nothing to stop this or help me retrieve it so I had to challenge him and get it back from his bag myself.

Our original room had torn headboards, badly scuffed furniture and stained carpet, despite being quite expensive. Poor value for money.

Uncomfortable, unwelcoming bar area although bar staff were helpful and friendly.

This hotel falls well below the standard we'd expect from a Hilton.

title: I would not recommend to anybody to stay at this hotel
text: I read many reviews before booking this hotel. However since we arrived it was a big dissapontment. The receptionists are useless and not helpful at all. The do cannot be bothered to recommend or help. The room is big enough, bed is comfy. The bar/breakfast area is depressive. Same as the lobby of this hotel. They charge you destination fee of $25 per day. This includes very poor speed wifi and 2 drinks in their depressive bar. The location is close to Times Square. It is dirty and can be dodgy in the night. It was a big mistake staying in this hotel. The worst customer service ever.

title: Pleasant Hotel
text: Not located in the best area of NY { TIMES SQUARE }. Area not the smartest, but this hotel is clean & comfortable, with helpful staff & has easy access to the subway. Make sure you ask for a room at the rear which is quiet & sheltered from the mayhem of sirens which seems non- stop. Guests are given a free drink every day & a bottle of water each day is provided. Plenty of diners & restaurants close by. NY is expensive, so start saving !! We had a room on the 25th floor & had some pretty good views of skyscrapers & a glimpse of the Hudson River.

title: Distrikt Hotel NYC
text: Great room and clean hotel for the price.  Staff was exceptionally helpful. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable.  The bathroom was nice and lots of space for amenities and travel items.  The free water each day was a super nice touch.

title: Uma ótima surpresa
text:
Estivemos em NY na época mais fria do ano. O hotel oferece uma boa estrutura para isso, com calefação eficiente e roupas de cama novas e limpas. Chegamos por volta de 9h da manhã e, graças ao excelente atendimento da recepção, já podemos fazer check in e nos instalar no quarto, pois havia aposentos disponíveis. As 4 estrelas ficam por conta dos elevadores, que são apenas 2 para muitos quartos, o que os torna demorados. Também por conta de não haver iluminação central no quarto. Ademais, é de uma ótima localização d atendimento.
No dia do check out, a recepcionista deixou as malas guardadas sem nenhum custo adicional para podermos aproveitar mais a cidade. Além disso, como nevava bastante e ficamos receosos em chamar Uber ou táxi por conta do mal tempo, solicitamos um transfer através do hotel por 70 dólares, que gentilmente nos levou até o aeroporto e ainda carregou as malas. Uma boa surpresa.

title: Great location
text:
Great funky little hotel in awesome location.
Price was great for NYC! Short walk into Times Square! Super Comfy bed! Bus station across the road! 
Couldn’t fault it... although the staff could be a little nicer...!!!!

title: Disappointing!
text: I’ve stated in Hilton’s all over the US and around the world. For a Hilton gotta say this hotel was disappointing.  Homeless sleeping right outside front entry.  Most of the time only one elevator was in operation, 32 floors!  2 bottles of water and 2 drinks downstairs in bar/lounge which if you wanted a coffee or anything before 7 am or after 10 pm well forget that! At the cost of $25 per day fee in addition to room rate.  Room was very small, tv didn’t work most of the time, satellite issues. No guide for tv either on tv or paper guide around room. Called hotel prior to arrival with 2 special requests, was assured it would happen.  NOT! The best part of my entire stay, the exquisite mattress! Like sleeping in a cloud with the exception of a lot of outside noise!

title: Solid choice, dodgy location
text:
The hotel is really nice. It is clean, it is pleasant. and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is quiet and had decently large rooms, the bath products were nice, the room was well appointed. No matter how much you read about how cleaned up time Sq is, the block, particularly around 8th avenue is kind of dodgy. I wouldn't want older relatives to walk it. Definitely filled with homeless and substance users. On Saturday night there were also a few lines of people waiting to get into nightclubs, one which extended in front of the hotel door.

The location of the hotel is across from Port Authority bus terminal and my 28th floor window had a nice view of the lights of Times Sq. And the Bus terminal below. 

All that said, it was a nice quiet hotel. If you're going to focus your time in Chelsea, as I did, it is quite a convenient location. Using 9th avenue as your main thoroughfare was convenient and felt quite safe.

I did not have the chance to use the bar/snack bar.

Would I stay there again? Definitely, if my goals were Chelsea/Westside of Downtown focused. Would I recommend it? Not for someone traveling with kids or older travelers.

title: Localização
text: Hotel com localização excelente. Quarto amplo e confortável, porém com bastante ruído do trânsito externo. Chuveiro deixa um pouco a desejar. Os drinks cortesia no final do dia são uma delicia após um longo dia de passeios.

title: Not worth the points
text:
We pulled up to the Valet area and there wasn't anyone in sight. After ten minutes I went inside and spoke with the staff at the check-in desk who called for a valet. Unfortunately, there was a miscommunication and it took a further 15 minutes. Finally, we checked into the hotel but our room wasn't ready yet. Before leaving the hotel we held our bags and opted for a drink in the bar area.

The bar area was another disappointment. The tables were all dirty, the bar area was scuffed up, and after giving us our drinks the bartender sat on the floor (behind the bar) and took a phone call. Keep in mind we were sitting at the bar and could see and hear him.

Around 4 pm we came back to the hotel to go to our room and it still wasn't ready. The staff finally gave us another room that was supposed to be clean. I wish we had waited! Our room had tears and scuffs in the leather headboard, the carpet wasn't properly vacuumed, the walls were cracked, and the bathroom light switch was hanging off the wall. 

At check out, there wasn't a manager available and so I explained all of our grievances to a staff member. To add insult to injury we booked this stay with a certificate and shouldn't have had taxes and fees added to our bill and yet they were on there.  I was assured I would hear from the manager as soon as she got in but that never happened. I ended up having to call the Hilton Diamond desk on two separate occasions but they did rectify the situation for us.

In the future, we'll be heading back to the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza.

title: la posizione vale tutto!
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in 12 (tre famiglie) nelle vacanze di Pasqua e devo dire che siamo rimasti ampiamente soddisfatti. al 1° posto sicuramente la posizione, comoda per girare a piedi e con stazione della metro e dei bus sotto casa! (collegamento per aeroporti con Bus comodissimo), la camera per 4 un po piccola ma ci tornavamo solo la sera per dormire quindi non è stato un grosso problema (armadio per 4 troppo piccolo!), pulizia buona, qualche problema con gli asciugamani che non erano mai adeguati al numero di ospiti... Il bar di buona qualità anche il caffè espresso non male! due consumazioni omaggio tutti i giorni! due bottigliette d'acqua in camera tutti i gg che a NY è ottima cosa visto  il prezzo dell'acqua in bottiglia!!! 
La zona non è pulitissima e i barboni per strada sono sempre presenti ma anche questo fa parte del fascino della City!

title: Traumatic experience
text: Room smelled like mildew the vent was wrst we were up all.night coughing something was triggering my allergies nobody ever came up to chec no ice bucket or ice machine around was told to go to front desk and they will give me only a cup of ice had to get up 4am just to go outside and get air ..all they did was compensate me by waiving the 29 dollar resort fee in which I paid almost 200.00 for tht one day and tht didnt include resort fee and they said they had no extra rooms to accommodate me and the purpose of me goin there was for my fiance to get a good night sleep since he did a double and had to go bac the early in the am but tht didnt happen he was coughing all night as well so neither one of us slept ..the hotel could of at least offered is a stay at a sister hotel or something..my face broke up the next morning I must say the ladies at reception were very pleasant

title: Great central location
text:
Good location but a little expensive and staff not overly friendly.
We booked a large room with a view but when we checked in we were put on the 4th floor, before going up I asked if this was still a view room and the said 'sort of' but they didn't have anything else as they were full. When we got to the room it was a decent size but our view was a brick wall. We spoke to reception again and they said to see about a move the following morning. We did this and after stating we would want a discount if not moved we were given a room on 20th floor which was much better. Beds comfy and shower a good size. Urban tax of $25 not mentioned at check in but we were expecting it from reading reviews on here, but you do get a card a day to get a drink in the bar - don't forget to ask for this daily as they only give one at a time.

title: sobrevalorado
text: La habitacion está bien, limpieza muy bien, la recepcion está muy desordenada, y el servicio es de lo peor que hay, muy mal servicio, pocos atentos, no se aclaran entre ellos, nos llamaron a las 3 de la mañana!! para saber si habiamos hecho el check in!! (como ibamos a tener la llave de la habitaciñon sin hacer el check in)... el resort fee que te venden ellos es una estafa, al parecer hay un plazo y numero de voucher para solicitar, si llegas tarde y pides tu free drink, pues dicen que ya no hay,,

title: A comfortable bed to rest weary feet
text: This hotel was good for what we were looking for- a comfortable place to rest after long days of sightseeing! The beds were fantastic and the location was perfect to get around. If that’s all you need then I’d have no hesitation recommending this hotel. If you want something a little more luxurious then it’s not for you; no coffee in rooms (which is an issue for me as I need coffee before I get up!), no room service, limited food and drink options etc. However, there is a coffee house downstairs and plenty of places nearby to eat, so no issues!

title: Loved it!
text: Visited July 2018, excellent check in, room was super and perfect for visit.  The room was clean with easy access to Reception.  Concierge was very helpful as our flight was later on in the evening looking after our bags and sorting out transportation to the airport. Bar was great and bar staff were excellent.  The hotel made our first visit to NYC super!!

title: Non male da riutilizzare
text:
Ho preso questo hotel per passare le vacanze a NY 
Posizione ideale, al centro di manathan e a pochi passi dalla metro per L aereo porto di NY, vicino a molte attrazioni e vicino a whole food market molto utile!!!!
Personale gentile disponibile, posto curato pulito, camere tipiche di NY un po’ piccole per 4 persone .....ma in fondo dei conti ci siamo andati solo per dormire
Ogni giorno 2 free drink card e acqua in camera
Insomma buon compromesso qualità, costo zona,servizi

title: All That You Need
text: Upon arrival there was a very nice person to check me in. In the room there was everything that you need, bed was very comfortable, bathroom very clean. Water provided each day. My only criticism of the room I had though that there weren't enough lights. The area by the wardrobe was in darkness which made it hard to figure out what you were going to wear for the day. I would stay again however

title: Great return to Distrikt
text:
After years from our first NYC visit we went back to the Distrikt and our experience has been again excellent.
Hotel still in great condition and the attention to the client is great, we have been upgraded to the same high floor room we had 6 years before!
Also appreciated the 2 bonus beers included in the nyc widespread hotel fee...
Only downside, breakfast menu very limited. We went outside.
Will be back!

title: Good hotel but no tea/coffee facilities
text: This is situated in a great location, walking distance from Times Square but far enough away to be calm at night, staff friendly but no tea or coffee facilities which as British people we want. They have a coffee shop onsite which is why I think they don’t give you any in room. Nice and clean with plenty of space in the room which is rare for NY

title: Fabulous stay!!
text: What an amazing hotel!! Service was first class!! Huge shout out to the beautiful Eva at front desk and the fabulous Dennis at the door! These guys could not have done enough for us, in fact they made our holiday, with our girls asking Dennis if he could be there ‘manny’!! Rooms were spacious and extremely clean, the beds and pillows were devine and the location was excellent!! If.. in fact not if, but when... we go back we’ll definitely be heading back to The Distrikt, and we’ll definitely be requesting to see Eva and Dennis!

title: Das 2 Hotel bei dem ich froh war endlich zu gehen!
text:
Die Lage ist gut, die Zimmer okay, hier hört es dann aber auch schon auf!

Die Mitarbeiter überfordert, planlos unfreundlich und unverschämt! Serviceorientierung = 0

Dieses Hotel hat folgende Corporate Identity = wir lassen sie immer wissen das nach Ihnen sowieso der nächste New York Tourist kommt! 

Tag der Ankunft. Keinen Blickkontakt, Mitarbeitern ( asiatischer Abstammung junges Mädchen) schaute nur in ihr Handy und zwischen jeder Kreditkarten Buchung vergingen knapp 40 Sekunden. Als Antwort kam dann nur „ declined“ dann war das Handy wieder wichtig!
