1 Tag später erhielten wir von der Bank die Informationen das sowohl meine Kreditkarte als auch die meiner Freundin belastet wurde. 

Als wir dann bei der deutschen Mitarbeiterin nachfragten ( Eva ) wir kümmern uns darum, sie erhalten eine Nachricht auf ihr Zimmer! 

Abends wieder im Hotel zurück gab es natürlich keine Antwort! 

Wieder zur Rezeption! Junger Mann mit locken.. den habe ich nur angeschaut und bevor ich was fragen könnte hat er schon nein nein nein gesagt! Auf mein energisches nachfragen schaute er dann zumindest in den Rechner. Naja alles wäre so richtig! 5 min Gespräch, der Herr hat mich nicht 1x angeschaut! 

Dann.... und das hat mich am meisten in Rage gebracht! Ich versuchte mit der Agentur zu telefonieren das wir vom Hotel abgeholt werden. Das klappte leider nicht da die Dame mich nicht verstand, dann bin ich in die Lobby und bittete den Jungen man darum für mich bei der Agentur anzurufen. ( das ist für mich ein absoluter Service und Gehör zum 1+1 des guten Tones) ! Antwort des locken jungen: „ nein ich rufe nicht für sie an, hier haben sie ein Telefon und können selbst anrufen!“ 

Dann erklärte ich ihm was das Problem sei, das ich gerade schon 20 min telefoniert hatte und die Dame nicht in der Lage ist meine Mail Adresse für die Bestellung aufzunehmen. Er wieder „ ich rufe nicht an“ 

Zu guter letzt war ich wirklich froh dieses Hotel verlassen zu haben! 

Aber der Clou die Sicherheitszahlung auf meiner Kreditkarte ist bis heute nicht aufgehoben worden! Bei unserer Weiterreise habe ich bei der Autovermietung 3 Stunden gebraucht bis wir eine Lösung hatten wie ich das Auto bekomme um das nächste Hotel zu erreichen! Dort angekommen habe ich einem anderen Gast dann per Paypal Geld überweisen müssen damit er das Hotel für mich bezahlt! Ansonsten hatten wir auf der Straße geschlafen! 

Heute am 21.4 habe ich die sicherheitszahlung vom Check Out am 10.4 immer noch nicht aufgehoben bekommen. Dies wurde durch die Bank bestätigt!

title: Small and old, but great stay
text: The building itself and the room was pretty outdated, but it did not cause any problem. The staff was very nice, (Eva was very helpful), and the voucher for the first floor café/bar was very useful. Location is great, and the noise level was not too bad compared to other NY city hotels. Overall, I was pretty satisfied and would like to come back.

title: Wifi is horrible and this place charges a destination fee
text:
The wifi was intermittent at best. I couldn’t use it to work in the hotel. The engineer would come, and it would get resolved for a while. But I bet others were complaining too so the problem was just shifted from customer to customer.

And I have a general issue with destination fees. They are a money grab and I feel unethical in the marketing of it all. Just beware of the extra $25 per day charge here.

title: Lage des Hotels super, der Rest naja
text:
Wir waren vom 5.4 bis 10.4.2019 im Distrikt Hotel. Bei Ankunft haben wir am Morgen mit der Hausbank telefoniert und die haben uns mitgeteilt das dieses Hotel einfach Buchungen von der Kreditkarte vornimmt. Ein absolutes No go. Die Freundlichkeit der Mitarbeiter ließ sehr zu wünschen übrig. Um Anliegen wurde sich nicht gekümmert und es wurde einem noch nicht mal im Gespräch ins Gesicht geschaut. Sie wirkten eher genervt wenn man eine Frage hatte. 
Die Lage des Hotels war allerdings super. In 10 Gehminuten war man am Time Square und die U-Bahn Anbindung war ebenfalls zu Fuß in ein paar wenigen Minuten erreichbar. 
Dennoch würde ich dieses Hotel unter gar keinen Umständen weiterempfehlen.

title: 5 night stay
text:
+ Nice, clean hotel. Well located. 5 min walk from Timas Square and 2 min walk from nearest Subway station.
Rooms were clean and staff was OK. 

- We had to pay an additional 25USD/night for services (1 free drink in bar + water bottle in the room). Uppon on arrival we thought everything was paid, so this unexpected extra charge of 25USD/night wasn't very pleasant.
While checking out staff behind reception desk wasn't very friendly to get our luggage they had put away during the day. 

Overall good, clean hotel in the centre of Manhatan.

title: The lobby and coffee shop are cute
text: I stayed here recently for the night to be close to work. I checked into a small room which was fine but the layout isnt practical at all. Makes you feel more “boxed” in. I called for amenities such as a shower cap, shaving and dental kit and I had to call 2xs then took myself down to the lobby where I was told go back to my room they will deliver - i had waited an hour already and just wanted to shower for bed!!! The bathroom I had to use ALL the towels to sop up the water that gushed out. I took a pic of the floor cause I couldnt believe it I couldve swam to my bed !! Btw it took another 30mins to get my towels replenished. I prob wont stay again, Im in the business so I know one things for sure SERVICE IS EVERYTHING!!

title: Good location
text: The hotel had been in overbooking when we got there at 8PM.the guy at reception arranged us for the first night to the cloae 3star hotel(distrikt is 4 stars) where anyway breakfast was included on contrary of Distrikt.Large clean room at 15 floor with large bathroom.Small bar room close to lobby.perfect location close to Broadway theatres.staff really not very friendly and cooperative.to be improved the friendly behaviour with the clients.good ratio quality/price.

title: Distrikt Hotel Manhattan March 25th through 29th 2019
text: Great value for your money - staff were all very helpful including the front desk staff, the doorman and the Bell Men who were quick and courteous to help for whatever I needed.Hotel was clean and modern and in a good location with easy access to neighborhood restaurants on 9th or 1.5 blocks from Time Square and 3 or 4 blocks to the Theatre District

title: Pienamente soddisfatto!
text:
In vacanza con un paio di amici abbiamo soggiornato per una settimana in questo bellissimo hotel, posto in una posizione davvero ottima e comoda.
Molto compete anche il servizio reception a darci informazioni in generale. 
Sono rimasto pienamente soddisfatto e penso proprio che se ritornerò a New York alloggero nuovamente qui.

title: Awful experience.
text: Distrikt Hotel, and the service it provided, are far below the standards advertised.  Online, I was told it had: a fitness center, a restaurant, and room service.  There is no room service or restaurant.  There wasn't even a coffee maker in my room, which I discovered at 5am.  When I went to the front desk to ask for one, I was told that my room was supposed to have one, but "the guy" who knows where the spare machines are had just left.  There was no coffee in the lobby or anywhere in the hotel for guests.  There is also no fitness center.  They will give you passes to what they call a "local gym," but the front desk attendant did not know exactly where it was and only reluctantly looked up an address for me.  Even then, he did not know what corner or block it was near.  As a New Yorker, I know it's unsafe for a young woman to wander around that part of the city - by Port Authority Bus Terminal - at night.  Later that morning, the fixture for water in my shower came off in my hand.  When I tried to report it to the front desk, there was no answer.  There are much better hotel options in New York.

title: Convenient base
text: District Hotel is a good place to stay for exploring Manhattan. It's got good sized, comfortable rooms and is a short walk from Times Square. Loads of places to eat in close by, as well as a great choice of bars.

title: 5mins from Times Square
text: Comfortable beds, great location for Times Square, not overly noisy at night time, bar and snacks downstairs, willingness from the staff to upgrade if possible, good size room. We received a great offer via booking.com inclusive of all charges so make sure you secure a good offer otherwise they add on many additional charges such as 'urban charge' that gives you 2 free bottles of water and 2 drinks at the bar per day. Not everyone wants this!

title: Not a four star hotel
text: This seems to be a typical overpriced New York hotel. The size of the room was barely adequate. The furniture in the room was chipped and scratched. The TV was old and small size. I could hear the neighboring guests as their door closed loudly.

title: QUASI ECCELLENTE
text:
L hotel si trova in pieno centro a pochi passi da time square attaccato alla metro ed a port autuority , la via è’ frequentata da qualche clochard ma a noi personalmente è’ sembrato tutto molto tranquillo anche quando rientravamo dopo cena. Abbiamo preso una king al piano 30 vista bellissima camera pulita e adeguata al rapporto qualità prezzo . Veniamo al lato che mi è’ piaciuto meno il personale davvero freddo e poco simpatico . Abbiamo avuto un problema con le carte non funzionavano allora abbiamo pagato in contanti ma il personale non cercava di aiutarci anzi ci hanno trattato con aria di stizza.
Avrei dato punteggio pieno ma questo atteggiamento mi ha davvero infastidito

title: Discreto!
text: Il punteggio più alto va alla posizione:10 perché è veramente centrale a pochi passi da Times Square. Per il resto noi avevamo la quadrupla, letti piccoli e dotazioni bagno scarsine. Servizi :pochini e ricevimento un po' freddino. Prezzo nella media del centro di New York

title: Worst hotel!
text: There is a reason why this hotel rarely posts pictures of what their rooms actually look like... The sheets were stained and never cleaned. To actually get them cleaned or even made we would have to call. There were issues with the plumbing in our room causing a loud sound to allowing us to fall asleep. When we asked to be moved to another room after 3 nights it was more of an inconvenience for them than anything and never did we receive an apology. This was the only disappointment for my husband and I on our whole honeymoon. We won't be staying here again!!

title: Da consigliare!
text: Io e mio marito abbiamo alloggiato in questo albergo per 4 notti. La camera, al secondo piano, era spaziosa, il letto king-size comodo e il bagno dotato di tutto il necessario. Acqua calda e pulizia buona. Ogni giorno hanno cambiato la biancheria. Unica pecca l’impianto di areazione un po’ rumoroso. Un aperitivo al 36esimo piano è da non perdere! Personale gentile e disponibile. Ci hanno tenuto le valigie gratuitamente per tutto il pomeriggio. Lo consiglio per l’ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo.

title: Boa localização
text: Hotel com boa localização, próximo à Times Square e à estação 42th do Metrô. Apesar de anunciar frigobar nos quartos, fomos informados de que não havia essa facilidade em nenhum dos aposentos. Também sentimos falta de uma mesa no quarto. Havia apenas uma poltrona, um armário, duas mesas de cabeceira e apenas uma luminária. Talvez por esse motivo, o quarto era muito escuro, pois não há iluminação no teto. A taxa de resort fee (25 dólares diários por quarto) incluía um copo de café pela manhã, um drink à noite e o WiFi no quarto. Os funcionários da recepção foram bem atenciosos. Nunca havia ficado nesta área mas gostei. Fica na mesma rua do terminal rodoviário Port Authority.

title: Perfect Location.
text: Stayed here for 2 weeks. Such a great location to the Subway and Port Authority Bus Terminal and within walking distance of lots of nice restaurants, shopping, Broadway and Time Square. Service couldn’t be faulted, all staff very friendly. The room whilst small by Australian standards was fine, nothing flash but all that you need. Note that in a single room there is no provision for Fridge nor Coffee Maker. The daily drink vouchers come in handy for use at the Bar and bottled water provided daily as well. Wifi good throughout the hotel. Noise not a big issue, room close to lift so hear other guests but nothing to be concerned about. Downside the lift. I guess little can be done to rectify, recommend use the stairs if on a lower floor. Overall highly recommended.

title: Mittel
text: Das Zimmer Geruch war nicht gut es richte schimellig , Bar und Frühstück ist in einem Zimmer . Das Frühstück war bei uns inklusiv dennoch sahen kein gutes Buffet. Die Sauberkeit im ganzen ist in USA nicht perfekt so ist auch dieses Hotel mittel. Die Lage des Hotels würde ich als gut bezeichnen.

title: Good location, but hotel was disappointing
text:
I booked this hotel after looking at the reviews which are generally positive. I was left disappointed it just did not reach expectations and I wish I had stayed elsewhere.

Positive points: Good location, comfortable bed, nice shower.

Negative points: Noisy floor no soundproofing so you can hear people come and go, noisy room both the air conditioning and fridge are ridiculously noisy ended up not using and switching off both. The lift takes too long can easily wait in reception for 5-10 mins just waiting for the lift. 

For me the biggest issue was the reception staff, while some were nice, when there was an issue with their system which meant they overcharged me, despite the fact it was clearly an error on their side it has been so difficult to get a refund and their communication has been rude and unhelpful. 

While it isn’t a terrible hotel there are so many other hotels nearby that are similar prices and better facilities I therefore would not recommend and I would never return

title: Good price, decent location, drafty room
text:
Stayed 2 nights for business trip. Price was right. Easy access to Times Sq on 42nd St stations. Not too concerned walking to hotel aline at night, it sits among 4 or 5 others. 

Water pressure, good; bed, bathroom and room in general looked clean. Bed was comfy, a bit "squishy" yet firm.

Would like to have more outlets in the room. Only one plug available between the two located behind each end table, without unplugging something else. Otherwise only one outlet in the room. 
Not a fan of the square shower head. As a female the fancier the shower head the less impressed - I need a more central stream to focus with any substance on my hair. 
COLD, there was quite a draft coming in under the rooms heating/AC unit. I put my water bottle there at night and it was nice and cold in the morning. I did notify the front desk of what seemed to be an excessive draft.
Wish there was self serve coffee and tea. Drink coupon was nice, but had a but of a line at the bistro and only 1 person working. Also thought they offered breakfast. Must have read description for another hotel during decision process and incorrectly thought it was at this hotel.

title: Petite déception
text:
Pour un 4 étoiles, je suis un peu déçu, bien que le prix soit attractif, si on ne tient pas compte des taxes.
Literie décevante (un peu incurvée au centre, couette trop courte), WC dans la salle d’eau. Ca vaut un bon Ibis en France, sans plus.
Quartier proche de Time Square, certes, mais environnement immédiat très moyen, Wifi paresseuse, un lampe de chevet HS.
Bons points : vue du 26ème étage, Bluetooth pour écouter sa musique, chargeur IPhone, chauffage précis, lit King Size.

title: Good place close to transportation and theater district.
text: Hotel is close to port authority and subway and a short walk to the theater district.  It's small and not super fancy but it was clean and the price was reasonable compared to most NYC hotels.   We only stayed overnight and basically used the room to sleep as we were out all day.  It suited our needs perfectly.

title: Boa localização
text: Hotel bem localizado. Instalações novas. Internet razoável nos quartos. Poderia oferecer melhores opções de café da manhã. Localização excelente ao lado da rodoviária e 3 quadras da times square. Bons restaurantes no entorno. Cama grande e confortável mas o quarto era pouco iluminado.

title: Un gran hotel. Recomendado
text:
Nos hemos hospedado en este hotel durante una semana para conocer New York.
Esta muy bien situado, cerca de Time square. 
Estuvimos en una habitación de 4 personas con 2 camas un poco más pequeñas de 1,35cms. Camas Cómodas aunq debo decir q con las pateadas a andar caiamos en la cama que ni nos enterabamos. La habitación no es muy grande, suficiente para lo q se suele parar en ella q es para dormir.
Esta bastante nuevo.
Nos daban 2 bebidas gratis al día para gastar en el bar y 2 botellas de agua.
El personal muy agradable: nos imprimieron las entradas de la NBA, cuando pedíamos o preguntábamos alguna cosa siempre hacían por entendernos o facilitarnoslo. No hablan español. 
El último día nos guardaron la maleta sin ningún coste.
Lo recomiendo 100%. Si volviera a New York repetiría.

title: Recommended "budget" hotel
text: We chose the Distrikt because of its proximity to a theater on 42nd st.,that we were going to,  not because it was cheap ($154 including two drinks and breakfast on Thursday, Feb 28)), and it was basic but very clean, comfortable bedding, entirely satisfactory in every way.  We didn't take advantage of the drinks or the breakfast (breakfast ends 10 AM), but they offered.  The drinks and breakfast are served in their not-too-inviting bar/restaurant.  We are in our '70s and financially able, so we like a bit of luxury, and there is nothing luxurious about the Distrikt, but if you are younger or working on a budget, this is the place for you.

title: Necessita di rinnovamento
text:
L’hotel si trova in una zona centrale comoda ma molto brutta e degradata in quanto costeggia la Port Authority dove arrivano i bus e quindi non molto ben frequentata 
Le stanze dono medie anche per gli standard locali ma necessitano di un rinnovo negli arredi abbastanza vecchi e trascurati
La pulizia è buona ed i servizi non giudicabili in quanto non ci sono
Non una delle migliori soluzioni sempre a parità di standard

title: Distrikt Hotel--a sophisticated alternative to Times Square
text: Distrikt is a worthwhile venue that provides its guests with a quiet, tucked away yet sophisticated and cosmopolitan experience. The hotel is situated right off Times Square and right around the corner from 9th Avenue of Hell's Kitchen. A walk to Times Square took 3 minutes while a walk to an array of high quality restaurants in Hell's Kitchen was right around the corner along 9th Avenue.

title: 2 Elevators for 30+ story hotel
text:
The hotel itself is very small, but my primary issue was that it took sometimes in upwards of 5-10 minutes for the elevator to arrive, then you'd find yourself stuck like anchoves with a bunch of other people who feel the same. One night we got back to the hotel and the elevator's weren't working and a pile of people were filling the lobby, so we had to walk up 15 flights of stairs to get to our room.

There is 0 room service and they make you pay $25 called an "Urban Fee" or something stupid, apparently this fee covers the free drink ticket you get, and a gym 2 blocks away that nobody ever goes to.

The location is great, but it's right next to like 4 other hotels of which I would look at first before deciding to go here.

title: Bel hôtel bien situé
text:
Très bel hôtel avec une chambre au 21e étage qui offre une très belle vue sur la ville.
Proche des bus et métro et à quelques pas de Times Square ce qui est super!
Lorsque nous sommes arrivés nous avions du attendre 30 minutes pour notre chambre, nous avons donc reçu des tickets boissons en compensation.
Seul petit bémol, à l'arrivée nous avions du laisser un acompte de 350 dollars jusqu'à la fin du séjour ce qui est assez élevé.

title: 身に覚えのない電話料金を取られていた挙句、メール返信も一切なし。最低のホテルです。
text:
チェックインの際にクレジットカードを提示したのみで、
領収書を受け取れなかったことから早朝出発時に受け取りました。
フライトの都合で急いでいるにもかかわらず時間もかかり、詳細はその場で確認しませんでしたが、
請求額がやけに高かったことから確認したところ、身に覚えのない電話料金を3000円近くも取られていました。
メールにて連絡するも「宿泊日程を教えて」という返信に回答して以降、度々連絡するもレスポンスなし、
やっと連絡が来たかと思ったら、Accounting Deptから連絡をする…とのことだったが、その後待てど暮らせど連絡なし。人が介在していることなのでミスが起こることはあると思うが、その後の対応があまりに不誠実で、こんなホテルが今どきあるのかと驚きました。本当に最低なホテルです。

title: St Patricks Day in NY
text: This hotel is excellent , located right next to the Port Authority Bus terminal, close to everything and within walking distance of all you ever need. Hotel is well decorated inside and clean, a great base for a break away, would stay here again.

title: 1st impressions were terrible
text: Myself and my 2 friends stayed here for my friends hens party. We were so excited and had travelled from Ireland to celebrate. Upon arrival we were greeted by the not so friendly daria. She gave us a very cold reception and told us we needed a credit card to check in which we didn't have and her exact words were "WELL YOU CANT CHECK IN" and shrugged her shoulders. we offered to pay in cash for our stay and also pay cash for the secuirty deposit too. But that wasn't an option. Which I understand if this is the policy of the hotel but it wasn't clearly stated in the booking but that wasn't the problem, it was her attitude towards us that was the issue. She seemed so uninterested. This was our 1st impressions of the hotel and she turned us off immediately. Her whole demeanour was awful.she is in the wrong job because hospitality is not her forte. Apart from her the other hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. The rooms were a great size for a new York hotel. And it was a few minutes walk to time square. I would definitely stay here again but hopefully daria has a personality transplant by then.

title: Eigentlich ein gutes Hotel, aber.....
text:
Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral 40th Street in der Nähe der 9. Avenue. Das Zimmer war sauber und das Bad für New Yorker Verhältnisse groß. Auch die Geräuschkulisse war erträglich. Aber was uns nicht gefiel obwohl wir unser Hotel über Expedia / Opodo im Voraus incl. Taxes bezahlt hatten, wurde vor Ort eine sogenannte New York Taxes von 25 Dollar pro Nacht erhoben. Aus unserer Sicht war das nicht nachzuvollziehen, da vorab nicht in der Hotelrate ausgewiesen. Aus meiner Sicht ein nicht sehr netter Versuch um im Preisrating besser da zu stehen. Schade, hätte sonst auf Grund der Lage und des Komfort,sowie des kostenfreien W-LAN 4-5 Punkte vergeben.
Sehr gut gefiel uns auch der Gepäckaufbewahrungsservice nach dem Auschecken und das am Empfang eine Mitarbeiterin sogar fließend deutsch sprach. 
Also mehr Transparenz und Fairness und wir würden uns beim nächsten New York Trip  wieder für dieses Hotel entscheiden.

title: Bartender was amazing! Great location
text: The location was extremely convenient being right across the street from the Port Authority Bus terminal. The bartender (young woman with short hair) was truly the best! The room (31st floor) had a great view of the skyline.

title: Distrikt Stay
text: The Distrikt Hotel is part of the Hilton group.  It is a great basic choice and good value.  Keep in mind there are no extras like full restaurant, gym, tv channel guide(can request).  Great for a basic place to stay if you don't  plan on spending a lot of time in your room or in the hotel common areas.

title: Soddisfacente, tutto sommato.
text: Lobby veramente fredda e poco accogliente, così come il bar, receptionist un po' sulle loro...efficaci ma poco sorridenti ed "accoglienti"...nonostante ciò la posizione è ottimale, la camera king ha un letto extralarge ed è pienamente vivibile, affaccia su Port Authority, che è la stazione delle corriere, ma la via è abbastanza tranquilla. In 2 minuti di cammino c'è la metro , e siete praticamente in Times Square. Ottima,la pulizia. Se sceglierete con attenzione, troverete tariffe senza le fee con Wi-Fi compreso...

title: great hotel!
text: Check in was later than expected due to the hotel being full occupancy the previous night, we were offered complimentary drinks in the bar due to this which was a nice gesture. Excellent location and value. Room was extremely clean and comfortable, small but that was expected given the location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location
text:
Arrived at hotel too be greeted by a lovely receptionist Eva who made us feel so welcome. 
You have to pay £150 deposit on arrival which I wasn’t aware of until arrival. Hotel offers you a high or low floor which Is great.
Room was a average size but no bath in the bathroom and around the shower area tiles are a bit worn!
Hotel is in a excellent location minutes from Times Square and Carlos bakery.
Rooms are suppose to sleep four people but would be very tight if there was four people but your not in New York to spend time in your room!!!!! 
Only real downside arrived with a baby with no kettle making facilities and had to make a request twice for a kettle before it was brought too the room.

title: First time in nyc
text:
Stayed at the distrikt for a few days recently and heres my honest opinion of the hotel/room. First, i'll start with the negatives. The obvious one is the stupid urban destination fee, which basically gives you wifi (which considering you get wifi in starbucks i dont think it shoukd be something you pay seperatly for) access to a gym..because i had time for that lol, some bottled water and 2 drinks a day at the bar. Very dissapointed that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, and finally after leaving early in the morning one day and having our room serviced, we returned late in the evening only to find our door open! Not impressed. Luckily nothing had been taken, but obviously complained at front desk, they were very appoligetic and gave us a couple of free drinks.

Now onto the positives. The hotel is in an amazing location, right next to the main bus terminal. 2 mins from time sqare. The room was spacious, clean, nice bathroom, and the bed was soooo comfy. Staff were always friendly polite and knowledgeable. The positives about this place outweigh the few negatives we have and we would def stay here again.

title: Four Days in Cold NYC
text: For a trip I didn't want to take Districtk Hotel made it enjoyable.  The hotel itself, the staff, and the location made my trip a pleasure.  Easy walk to Time Square, subway, and good restaurants.  I just wish the weather was a bit warmer and the staff probably would have fixed that too if they could.

title: Great location
text:
The hotel is in a perfect location.
Never been to New York before so the experience was amazing.
However I wasn’t aware of the $25 per day resource fee but I did book through a third party.  You do however get 2 complimentary drinks per day and access to their WiFi. Also access to a gym that is free to the public anyway.
The hotel is very basic but clean and served its purpose.
On arrival you have to pay $350 in case of any damage caused in your room, you get part back when you leave they just keep the resort fee - again wasn’t made aware of this at time of booking.
The staff that we encountered were really helpful and friendly.
I did email on 4 occasions to try and upgrade room (also sent messages in Facebook page) I didn’t get a response to any and when we got there didn’t have any free.

title: Lovely hotel but a small sting in the tail!
text:
You couldn’t ask for a better hotel than this. Clean, friendly and very comfortable. It’s right inbetween 8th and 9th street and a 5 min walk from Times Square. 

However..... they charge a €25 plus tax per night per room ‘Urban Destination Charge’. For this you get fast WiFi, 2 drinks vouchers per day and 2 bottles of water per day. At the end of the trip we had to pay an additional €144 for the 5 nights. This is advertised on the website but we had missed it. 

I would stay here again making sure I fully read all the small print!

title: Trying to be hip and trendy but failing on so many levels
text: When you walk into this hotel, there is way too loud music playing - perhaps trying to prove it is a trendy, hip hotel. As you check in they remind you about the ‘urban destination fee’ of $25, which covers everything that you never used to pay for at hotels such as such as WiFi, a bottled water etc. By the the way, the WiFi is useless - I tried to FaceTime my family from the room and it kept signalling ‘poor connection’. There are 2 elevators servicing about 30+ floors, so you can imagine how inefficient that is. A normal breakfast service doesn’t exist. Now, the room was large and the bathroom of an excellent size, but I did book their largest King room. However, the bed was like a slab of cement and the pillows collapsed to a point of offering no support at all. So, I awoke after 2 hours with aching hips, neck and back. I booked this hotel because I am a Hilton Honors member, but I can assure you that when I checked out, I will never return to it. Never ever!

title: Great Last Minute Booking
text: We flew in to JFK from Barbados and were supposed to catch a Greyhound home however due to a snowstorm (that they predicted but never actually came) the Powers that Be canceled all the buses out of Port Authority. It was 1am and we needed  a place to stay. We called around and this hotel had a room so we booked it. Oddly when we got to the hotel there was no trace of the booking we made over the phone. Minus a little back and forth the gentleman at the desk not only honored the price but upgraded the room to a King since we were obviously having a rough night. Which was nice. The room came with two free drink vouchers for the following day. Room was on the small side but top notch Hilton property that fit our last minute needs. Close proximity to port authority, my fav restaurant BBQ’s and a bunch of other neat sights and activities in NYC. Glad our desperation didn’t equate to lack of great accommodations. Definitely wouldn’t hesitate to stay for a planned trip in NYC.

title: Wonderful surprise in NYC.
text: We were pleasantly surprised with the Distrikt Hotel, but felt we were probably OK since it is owned by Hilton.  We weren't wrong.  The hotel had the feel and quality of a top notch Hilton property.  We will be back!

title: Needs some upgrades
text: Missing the new technologies that most hotels have these days. Missing good digital key and check in/out experienceRooms clean, good staff, sleep quality good. 3 star hotelNot the same Hilton experience as other hotels I stayed.

title: Distrikt Hotel in NY
text: Elevator problem which meant a long wait and many stops to get to my floor and small rooms.Front desk did not try to find an answer when did not know the answer. Only 1 person serving brakfast so had to wait to be served.

title: Unfortunate experience
text: I had previously stayed at the hotel so I recommended it to my son when he went to NYC at the end of December 2018.  While in NYC he become engaged to his girlfriend.  I sent out a gift basket to the hotel as a congratulatory gesture.  The gift basket arrived at the hotel but my son did not receive it.  Once I learned that they had left the hotel without having received it, I called the hotel to speak to someone regarding the situation.  I was placed on hold for 15 minutes until someone explained to me that they do not deliver to the customer's room and that the customer needs to come and get it.  I explained it was a surprise and he did not know to come and get the gift basket.  I asked why a message was not left with his room and the person explained that they receive 30-40 items a day and it is the guest's responsibility to come to the front desk.  I thought that a simple call to the room would be a service provided by the hotel.  My son would have gone to get it had he been advised by the hotel.  The gift basket remained at the hotel....don't know what happened to it.  I have discussed this with many people and they all thought the hotel would have at least notify my son of the gift basket.   Lessons learned!

title: Trip report
text: Stayed at this hotel from Monday 14th Jan for 3 nights with my daughter. Check in was fast. Allocated room 305. Room was a good size but view was overlooking a building opposite. A bit disappointed with view however it was quiet so got a good night's sleep. Area surrounding hotel is within easy walking distance to Times square and other areas of interest. Room cleaned every day with fresh towels. Staff very helpful. Would stay here again.

title: Really Not A Great Hotel
text: Overall a really disappointing experience from a Hilton hotel. Room was poorly maintained. 1 of the 2 elevators was broken, so ended up taking the stairs mostly. Stairwell was full of glass bottles and ladders, not very safe in event of emergency. Was charged for breakfast even though I am diamond member. Breakfast was very bad.

title: Awful experience
text:
One of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had. My flight was delayed so I didn't get to the hotel until 1:30am. When I arrived there was another guest laying on the couch in the lobby. Apparently the hotel had oversold their rooms and did not have a room for either him or me. I waited 15 minutes for the hotel to sort out his room and another 30 minutes to figure out what to do with me. They eventually gave me a room for the night (I was booked for 2 nights) but told me I had to be out in the morning and they would find me a new room for the 2nd night. The new room they gave me was probably supposed to be closed for maintenance as the A/C didn't work and the shower handle came off when I tried to turn on the water in the morning. I was left a letter by the person on duty the first night which was supposed to be a credit for 1 of the 2 nights. When I presented it at checkout they said they didn't know what to do with it but would give it to the manager when he got in. I was told he would call or email me. I have not heard from them. 

As a side note, the elevators were also terrible. One consistently got stuck and the other literally bounced up and down as you rode in it.

title: Hilton Tapestry Collection - Breath of Fresh Air
text:
I always start stating that I have been Hilton Diamond for many years... with that, this was my first opportunity to stay at one the Tapestry Collection hotels.

I was very impressed.  For starters I got a great rate via Hilton's website.  Reserved a King bed room.  so here's my impression: modern furnishings; the hotel was very clean and well maintained; the bar area was pleasant and cozy- most important is that the service was absolutely the best!

The staff there was helpful and attentive not just to me - but, all customers coming in and out were all well attended to.

So, if you are looking for a hotel - business or pleasure - I would highly recommend.  It is close to Penn Station; the bus terminal and about a ~ 10 minute stroll to Time Square.

Also, 15 minute walk to Javitz where I spend three days at the NRF convention.

I will stay here again for sure.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Nice hotel in the heart of manhattan! 2 minutes walk from subway and a lot places to eat and to have a drink around! The room was excellent , the elevator is very fast, we have stayed at the 30th floor! Very well located!!

title: Fantastic hotel & Great location
text:
The hotel was very reasonably priced for the comfort, cleanliness and location.  We arrived around 14:00 and was able to check in straight away, we were upgraded from a Queen to a King room, which we were very grateful for. Our room was on the 20th floor facing 39th street. We found it very quiet even though our room was nearest to the elevators.  The room was very clean and provided everything that was need for a very please stay. We received a daily drinks voucher for the bar downstairs and a bottle of water in the room.  The location was excellent! 2 min walk and you was on 8th Avenue. 7-10 min to Times Square. Area felt very safe. Subway only 5 min walk on 42nd. Cannot rate this hotel enough, as a couple we had a very enjoyable stay!!
 If I was to pick at anything I’d say the Elevators were a little slow at times and the quilt could have been a thicker tog

title: Close to convention center, very safe and clean
text: Such an odd, but quaint hotel. It's very tall and skinny. Only about 5 rooms per floor. Our room, 402, had a lot of street noise and bright lights. However, the bed is super comfortable and the towels are thick and fluffy.  Rooms are small, but cozy. Drink tickets were nice. Good bar service. Not enough outlets for my preference, but I also haven't been to NYC much, so maybe this is normal. Great shower pressure.

title: Boutique is best!
text: Absolutely loved this boutique hotel located in the heart of the city.  Their was a mix-up with our booking & the staff went above & beyond to help.  We arrived during the World Cup so spent a lot of time in the bar watching various matches with Dennis the ever so friendly porter😀  Perfectly situated within walking distance to many of New York's famous attractions yet it never felt busy or noisy.  Would definitely recommend this place for couples & would stay here again.

title: A nice hotel in a good location
text:
A Lovely hotel for a great price, in a great location in between Times Square and Madison Square Garden. With a subway at the end of the street.

The wallpaper in room was slightly worn, but spent very little time in the hotel room.

title: Disappointing
text: The bathroom had a leak. The exhaust in the bathroom did not work. The shower had mold or black soap scum on the floor tiles. The power outlet in the bathroom did not work. I paid for a deluxe room and got a 3rd floor room with these issues. The bed was not comfortable. Then on top of it they are charging a urban fee. Last time I stayed at this hotel was 2 years ago and I booked 3 times before that and always liked the Distrikt. This time it was disappointing.

title: Hotel Molto Buono!
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 5 giorni e ci siamo trovati bene. Camere pulite e ben arredate. Letti comodi e bagno moderno ( Box doccia!!!)
Lo consiglio perchè è in un'ottima posizione vicino a Times Square.

title: The hotel lost one of my most sentimental belongings!!
text:
I stayed at Distrikt hotel from 13th to 17th December. Whilst the hotel itself, staff and location were all great, the hotel lost one of my belongings and have made no effort to help. I took a Teddy bear with me to the hotel, it is extremely sentimental to me as I've had it since I was born. On our last night the sheets were changed, being absolutely shattered and rushing to pack the next day it was only when I got to the airport I realised the bear was missing and had been since the previous day. I called the hotel from the airport then when I got back to the UK, which cost me loads, but being something so precious I didn't care. I explained that I thought maybe the maid must have scooped the bear up when changing the sheets and how sentimental it was to me, I even spoke to housekeeping who promised to call back, but never did. I have emailed numerous amounts of times and got one response, the hotel have made no effort to help and have been ignoring my polite emails, I'm absolutely devastated that something so important to me has been lost by the hotel and no effort whatsoever has been made to retrieve it. 

Like I said, the hotel during our stay was great, I could not fault it, but the lack of care by anyone after the hotel losing one of my personal belongings (probably throwing it away), I would not recommend.

title: Great value and service
text: Nice hotel with a wonderful staff and a good location a few blocks from Times Square and many theaters. We got a great rate so the value was excellent. Bed and linens were very comfortable; desk chair was noticeably worn.

title: Would be perfect if not for the stupid "mandatory urban destination charge"
text:
Clean, very convenient location, comfortable. Everything you would want in a hotel. It is a perfect base for exploring NYC, being a couple of blocks from Times Square and close to  almost all the subway lines.

But I take issue with the daily "mandatory urban destination charge" of $25 (taxable) which supposedly covers free wifi (unlimited data plan on my mobile so don't need it), unlimited local and long distance calls (unlimited calls on my mobile so don't need it), daily free drink (which really only applies to house wine and a very limited selection of other drinks, plus we were only given vouchers for the first day), two daily bottles of water (NYC has excellent tap water and we try to avoid plastic bottles whenever we can), and gym access (we're here to visit, not work out, we have a gym back home for that).

When I asked the front desk about the charge, they also mentioned that it covers the cost of giving regular Hilton Honors points on the stay. Well, if I need to pay for the points, it kind of defeats the whole purpose...

All this to say that the hotel is nice but this stupid destination charge should either be optional or should be included in the rate if it is truly mandatory. Then it wouldn't leave such a sour aftertaste for misleading customers when advertising rates.

title: Great place tucked in next to Port Authority
text: very nice Hilton property tucked in next to 2 other Hilton brands.  across the street from NJ Port Authority, subway and parking garage.  Just blocks from everything, so a great location for easy access to Times Square, Fashion District, Hell's Kitchen, even Central Park is just a 20 min walk

title: Nice boutique hotel in a nice location
text: I was happy with the location, which is close to Hell's Kitchen, with lots of great restaurants nearby.  It is also 800 meters from Times Square, a short walk to a train station, close to the bus terminal and near convenience stores and a laundromat.  My room was very clean and I had a nice view of the city and Hudson River.  The staff were pleasant and helpful.  Take note that there is a city resort fee of 25USD plus taxes per day.

title: Honeymoon Trip
text:
We stayed at the Distrikt for 4 nights for our honeymoon. In preparation for our visit, the hotel staff via email seemed very friendly and we were told we’d had an upgrade to a ‘special suite’ and would have art and sweets in our room. When we arrived, we were put into room 301 which, although a lovely room, we weren’t convinced this was an type of upgrade and we had no sweets the entire stay. We were convinced we had paid for breakfast but were told we hadn’t and we disappointed this couldn’t be added for us as part of our ‘honeymoon upgrade’ we were promised. 
Moan aside- the hotel was very clean and in a great location.

title: Good position average hotel
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights around Christmas. Good position close to all the action in Times Square.
Would not stay here again . Staff unfriendly & argumentative 
Be aware there is an added “resort tax” payable when you leave

title: Great
text:
We stayed for a week just before Christmas and the hotel was perfect for us. Great central location for walking and literally over the road to the bus station/subway for anything further. Room was cleaned daily and fresh bottles of water left for us each day. Bed was extremely comfy, bathroom
Clean and good size. Always hot water and WiFi coverage, good size tv and plenty of storage. Room a good size for NY. Only thing missing was drink making facilities but there is a coffee shop two doors down where everything is $2. Staff more than helpful with all requests, including our request for a high floor. Great view of the Empire State from our room on 27th floor which was a bonus too. Also stored our bags securely for free on our final day as flight was not until 10pm. Would definitely return

title: Very good stay
text: Had a very good stay at the Distrikt Hotel. Location was great for us as times square and attractions was close by. Staff were excellent and showed us where everything is! Only downside was a screaming baby next door to us! The walls are thin and it kept us awake almost all night but got used to it after a couple days. Housekeepers tend to just walk in and not knock, but very friendly! Overall very good stay and would stay again!

title: Good location
text:
The hotel was adequate with good facilities and good location.
Beds are only double so a little squeezy.
Lifts are slow to get to the 28th floor.
2 daily complimentary drinks we well received.
Bathroom needs some attention as it is showing its age but nothing that would stop a good stay.

title: Leaves much to be desired.
text: Just don’t stay here, especially if you’re familiar with the Hilton brand and typically stay at Hilton, Doubletree, or Hilton Garden Inn. This was such a disappointment.  The bed had hair on it. The shower door wouldn’t close properly, and would cause GALLONS on water to get onto the floor. But you learn quickly and mop it up and just don’t shower fir long (maybe it’s their way to get you to take speedy showers?)...Breakfast and bar service was horrendous and offerings left much to be desired. This entire hotel experience left much to be desired. I’ll never stay here again.

title: Keys to our room given to other guests!
text:
The hotel location is phenomenal, about 2 blocks from Times Square.  And the drink tickets were nice, though not worth the $25 "resort fee"  they charge you.  

But my main issue was just a few minutes after my partner I i finished making love,  while still partially naked,  a lovely foreign walks right into our room.  They were confused, we were confused.  I called the front desk.  No one came.  No one assisted.  A front desk person should have immediately been up the elevator.  Instead,  I was asked, "well what are you doing in that room.  We have you booked in a a different room?"  No apology,  no manager coming up to fix it.  just me and my partner frantically trying to cover ourselves up.  A poor foreign couple getting the New York experience of a lifetime and ZERO response from the hotel.   The gentleman at the front desk said he would have the manager come find as as quickly as he could.  He confirmed that the room was indeed ours and they would rebook the other guests.  We showered, got dressed, and after an hour of no one coming up, left to go explore the city.  

When we came back, we could not get into our room.  We went downstairs and were told that that room was no longer ours and was issued to another guest!!!  The male front desk attendant was a complete moron and still hadn't made the updates in the system.  Another attendant re-issued our key cards (STILL NOTHING FROM A MANAGER) and we went back to our room.  

Several minutes later a manager did stop by with an apology and a bottle of wine.  I explained that a bottle of wine was not enough to make up for having us barged in on.  She explained that was all she could offer and would speak to the general manager the next day to see if more could be done.  We booked directly through Hilton, so she said they couldn't offer anything more, but that the GM would reach out before we checked out or call me.

Upon checkout we asked for our bags (which we had checked earlier in the day to go exploring)  The same moron male front desk attendant said he would text someone to get our bags.  We waited nearly 40 minute and nothing.  After several other guests had come to get their bags and got them we asked what the delay was,  The moron completely forgot about us.  He said, Please give me your ticket."  I explained that we already gave it to him.  The competent female attendant took the ticket,  asked why he waited so long if there was no response to the text he sent and went to retrieve our bags.  She came bag and stated that she couldn't find them.  She then asked moron if they were behind the counter with him.  Sure enough.  Our bags had been sitting right there behind this idiot the entire time.  FIRE or retrain mop top, idiot male front desk attendant. 
 
We've been home now for 3 days and still no contact from the manager about compensation for being walked in on.

title: Bit of a shame
text:
Stayed for 5 nights from the 18 th of DEC. This was my third stay in 5 years and probably my last. When we arrived we were given an alternative room as ours wasn't ready and it wasnt a superior room which I had paid for. We didn't have a coffee machine or kettle so we asked for this every day and kept getting excuses and they gave us drink vouchers albeit minimal brands. On our last night a coffee maker arrived in our room. When we checked out next morning we were again give a voucher for a bar drink but it turned out the bar was closed and we were getting a car back to JFK well before it opened.
On the whole we had a great time in NYC and had got engaged as well but the hotel left a bitter taste in our mouths and sadly won't return, but on the plus side the hotel next door was very good for a drink.

title: Good
text: This hotel was good for it’s price. It is in a decent location, walking distance from Times Square. The service was nice, they had good staff and nice employees. Elevators are slow! Although they move fast, there are only 2 of them for so many floors. So with many people going up and down it is bothersome. The rooms are smaller than normal and overall it is a small hotel, only 5 rooms per floor, but what can you expect in Manhattan. In the end, our experience was just good, not bad, not excellent

title: Great hotel, fab location
text: Great hotel, fab location, helpful staff, clean rooms, nice "extras" on site bar and snacks, subway on next block, 5 mins walk from Times Square, convenient for everything we wanted to see and do. Remember to use your Metro cards on buses too .... much better for seeing things en route! Extremely comfy room, independent temperature control, lovely bathroom with huge shower, giant comfy bed.

title: Comfort, value, location
text: Great hidden gem in NYC. Value, comfort, location. This is an amazing find. My room was comfortable, spacious for NYC, clean. Staff was excellent, and you can't beat the price of accommodations. No room service, but a cafe/bar downstairs. Close to tourist areas - great for business travelers

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel’s location is unbeatable. The rooms were very clean, a bit small but very nice. Didn’t try the restaurant there, but there were a breakfast place as well as pizza place right next door.
Would definitely stay there again

title: Unpleasant Hotel
text:
After reading the reviews prior to arrival I thought the negatives to be exaggerrated but have come to realise the are very accurate. 
Unpleasant hotel 

My party of three recently stayed for a week at this hotel. The trip was mainly for my parent's 50th birthday so I emailed to enquire about paying for an upgrade and getting some bubbly in the room. I got one reply and nothing else despite several emails and phone calls, needless to say no upgrade was successfully arranged which was disappointing. When spoken about on arrival, desk staff shrugged shoulders and didn't seem apologetic at all.  

Cons 
- Staff seem bored and uninterested in  the clients staying in their hotel. Very rude and at times hostile when talking with us. - 
- At one point staff stayed in elevator without inviting us in when opened at our floor. Instead closed doors immediately without acknowledging us standing waiting. 
Pro's
- Small snacks in bar advertised but waited over 30 minutes for three bagels and three hot drinks. No apologies for wait and instead very rude member of staff serving, all but throwing food and drinks at us. 
- Close proximity to Times Square, subway stations and plenty of restaurants/cafes nearby. 
- Really good service at getting car organised back to airport with a decent price. 
- Rooms tidied daily, clean towels everyday and two free bottles of water each day placed in room. 

Overall don't think the price paid reflected the hotel we saw. I don't know why staff continue to stay if they don't want to be there and actually help their guests with concerns/enquiries. 
I believe the hotel is now part of the Hilton group but certainly doesn't live up to the reputation of that company or other Hilton hotels I have visited. Very disappointed and definitely wouldn't recommend or visit again.

title: Limpo e bem localizado
text: Hotel bem próximo à estação de metrô (1 quarteirão), com um bom quarto , limpeza/arrumação e troca de toalhas diárias. Não experimentei o café da manhã por achar caro, mas tem varias opções ao redor.Fácil acesso à Broadway , Times Square e 5 Avenida, cujo trajeto à pé é bem interessante. Recomendo

title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Location
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in December on our first City Break to New York from the UK. The Distrikt hotel is located perfectly for access to all of NYC major attractions, most within walking distance. Times Square (5min walk) Madison SG (2min walk) Empire State (5min walk) Rockerfeller (10min walk).
The rooms are clean, well laid out and provide more than enough space and amenities that you will require, and the staff are very welcoming and helpful.
All in all, would we stay here again, yes, will we stay here again......absolutely

title: Top Preis-Leistung, sehr gute Lage
text:
Die Reception und Angestellten sind sehr freundliche, die Räume etwas klein, was aber in NYC ganz normal ist. Die Zimmer sind sehr sauber und es gibt jeden Tag gratis Wasser im Zimmer (nicht Chlorhaltig). Zudem ist es extrem Ruhig, ich kann mir immer noch nicht erklären warum. Die Zimmernachbarn haben wir nie gehört.
Auch die Lage ist ausgezeichnet, die Subway ist wenige Meter entfernt und auch viele tolle Restaurants sind in der Umgebung.

title: Hilton did not improve this hotel in their takeover
text: I have stayed at this hotel on 3 other occasions. The first was fantastic then a gradual slide. Evidently Hilton took over the hotel in November as I was trying to make sure reservation. The email and internet access to the hotel staff was sports at best and when finally able to contact after 3 days there were no upgraded rooms I was promised from a previous stay so we did not get to take advantage of that. Also by their own admission the staff seemed unsure of new policies and procedures and the hotel seem to be woefully understaffed. There is a small bar in the back to get coffee and danish in the mornings and alcohol and snacks at night. There were a few days when there wasn't staff at the bar even at 9 a.m. for a cup of coffee or 6 p.m. for a cocktail. Eventually tey got there but you would think at over $500 a night for a standard room you could get a cup of coffee in the hotel. We probably will not be staying here on our next trip to New York.

title: Great location
text: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of November this Hotel is a ideal location for time square. There was four of us in our group we had two rooms on the 26th floor the only problem we encountered was the battery in one of the rooms safe was flat so the safe would not lock and this took 2 days of pestering the reception staff to get this fixed. The free drink vouchers for the bat are good you get one each day of your stay, we found all the staff to be very friendly and polite and yes we would definitely stay here again when in New York

title: Excelente performance
text: Excelente opção para quem quer passar alguns dias em NY, menos de uma quadra do metrô linha azul. Quarto e banheiro confortáveis, funcionários muito gentis e processos de check in e check out muito rápidos. A televisão do quarto tinha uma conexão muito ruim, pois a maioria dos canais travava as imagens, só podia ver menos da metade dos canais.

title: Nothing to write home about
text:
The hotel isnt bad. When we arrived we had to pay $350 as a deposit ($50 each night) that we werent warned about. It took a large chunk of my spending money. They returned it 2 days before we left but they had to take $290 for tax. 

The cleaning staff walked into my room several times without knocking and with the 'do not disturb' sign on the door. One gentleman walked in without knocking. I was in the shower with the door wide open and my partner was in bed undressed. We kept our 'do not clean our room' sign on the door every other day as we didnt want people touching our stuff often. Each time the sign was ignored apart from 2 days. Ended up complaining about it as it became too much but the staff were super friendly and helpful. 

Room was spacious enough and did the job. No teas or coffees or hot water to make drinks in the morning but you are given 2 free drink tokens each morning to get those which is nice. Great area very close to everything but not incredibly noisy at night. 

Overall I'd suggest this hotel to people if they are visiting NY for the first time and want to save money but i myself will not be returning.

title: Double Charged!
text:
Initially stayed during my Birthday weekend in early September, while there was only one bottle of Water in the Room. Plus corners of the Shower had Mold/Mildew and the Faux Leather Headboard was peeling off. Still thought this Hotel had booming potential especially given the location. However, upon Check out and since I had already pre-paid I opted to pay the Hotel fees in Cash and surprisingly a few days later I saw that same charge on my Credit Card as pending. Should have suspected something since the Guest Services Agent (Adrianna) said her system was experiencing problems and she could only email the Receipt, and not print a copy. 

After speaking to the then Finance Manager, a Mr. Rich Valles who suggested that I give it between 10-15 days in order for the charge to reverse. Well, it's now been months, MONTHS!!! I've been emailing them back and forth...calling several times and have yet to receive a response or acknowledgement. The last time I called, I spoke to an Eva, who confirmed that Rich no longer works there and to forward the email again to her attention and she will ensure that it's forwarded on to the new Finance. Again, no luck, no satisfaction, no response....just a huge disappointment. Given the delays and constant back and forth, I have no choice but to alert my Bank of this double charge in order to receive my money back. Dear Distrikt...NEVER again!!! There's too many options and this Hotel is not worth the headache!!!

title: Cordialità
text: Hotel situato a 5 minuti da Times Square, struttura semplice e camera a noi prenotata piuttosto piccola, ma siamo stati bene, il personale cordiale e sempre disponibile per ogni evenienza. Nel complesso una sufficienza si può dare .

title: Non male
text: Albergo comodo perché si trova vicino Times Square, camere non troppo grandi. L’unica cosa che la pulizia l’ho trovata un po’ scarsa nel senso che in camera c’era la moquette e si vedeva che c’era polvere ed io in quanto allergica me ne sono subito accorta. Diciamo un po’ minimal ... cosa positiva che la sera quando tornavi in camera ti facevano trovare due bottigliette di acqua

title: 40th birthday stay
text: Hotel is in great location 100 meters to main strip. Hotel itself, I asked if it was possible for a nice room as it was my 40th bday which they emailed to to say they have upgraded us which I thought was great. Upon check in no upgrade so just happened to ask if the hotel was busy to be told they were full, so no point in mentioning the email they sent me. Rooms are way too small had very bad night sleeps and lighting is terrible. Breakfast if a muffin and coffee so pointless. Staff not very helpful tbh. We were there on thanks giving and it was freezing out, it would be great if the small bar they have was open all day as it would of been nice to grab a coffee or soda, but not possible. Dennis did organize are transport to the airport tho. All in all, would I go back there , no but the area is fab!

title: Great value.
text: This is an excellent property for the price and location. Rooms are good-sized for this part of NYC. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient. No breakfast to speak of, but the bar is nice.

title: Great Inexpensive Find In New York City
text: I really shouldn't write a review because i want this hotel to be available EVERY TIME I come to New York City from now on. A small, trendy part of the Hilton brand, we decided to try it. Didn't expect much for the low, low price - close to $200 a night - unheard of in NYC during the tree lighting and holiday season. Very pleasantly surprised. Small lobby, friendly and helpful staff, great common area with tables, comfortable seating areas, computer and printer, food, snacks, breakfast, things for lunch and dinner as well (priced reasonably - we are Hilton Diamond so breakfast and coffee/tea was comped in the am), and a fully stocked bar with a great bartender. The bar last calls at 10:45 but still nice to grab a drink before a show or if you are calling it an early night. No workout area but it's New York City - take a long walk! Internet was fast, never had a problem with slow elevators at any time like some hotels in the area, and rooms were large for New York with ample area for two of us to spread out and a desk to get work done. Keurig coffee and tea in each room. We will definitely make this a first choice when back in new York City.

title: 普通・・・かな
text:
NYのホテルはここを含め2軒しか泊まっていないので比較が難しいですが
同じ価格帯のもう1件のアパートホテルの方が立地、設備、サービスどれも優れていたので、ディストリクトが悪いわけではなかったけどここをリピートすることはないと思います。
設備は狭いけどとても綺麗。細長い建物なのにエレベーターが2つしかなく、なかなかきません。
チェックインのときにWブッキングなのか清掃が終わってなかったのか23時ごろに30分ほど待たされました。お詫びに1Fのバーの無料ドリンク券をくれたけど、バーなのに閉店が22時なのでNY旅行中にそんな早く帰ってくるはずもなく使えませんでした。何か別の方法でわびてほしかった･･･

冷蔵庫がなかったのはNYでは普通なのかもしれないけど想定外。
立地はポートオーソリティに近い以外はそんなに良いと感じることはありませんでした。

近くのPapaya Kingのパパイヤジュースはとっても美味しいので是非！

title: Great holiday shame about hotel
text: So me and my daughter and friends arrived here on 21st Nov just after 3pm. Our room wasn’t ready so we had to sit about for 30 mins. After 2 flights this is the last thing that we wanted. We were also told on arrival that we had to pay 28 dollars per night tax which I had already payed at the time of booking. Eventually room was ready and we went to it. The leatherette on the headboards on both beds were ripped and the carpet round the skirting boards were very dusty. This was fine as we were only sleeping and washing in the room. I found the staff very very rude. When entering or leaving the hotel they wouldn’t even acknowledge you. Not even a hi or bye. We were also told when we arrived that we would get complimentary drinks from the bar, I assumed this was because we had no kettle in our room. When asking for the drinks voucher we were presented with 2, but there was 4 of us in the room. When questioned the staff about this she said 2 per room. Why charge for 4 persons when only accommodating for 2. On Friday night we decided to go into the bar for a few drinks as we got back early. I ordered 3 wines, one of the glasses were chipped and I cut my lip. So I went to the bar man showing him the glass and my cut lip, he changed the glass and gave me 3 mini plasters. This hotel could be a fab hotel if staff were replaced especially the African girl as she had a terrible attitude. The boy behind the bar was lovely but really needed a hand and the younger girl behind the bar with the piercings was just as rude. Told us the bar was closed at 1.40 pm and was not opening back up till 4. My friend approached her and she eventually gave us 2 cokes.

title: Very good hotel
text:
Very good hotel! Have a great location,near  the big station  “port authority “. 7 minutes away from time square. Quite area.
Rooms were big and comfortable 
Very clean!
Comfortable bed and bedsheets.
Most kindnesses and  helpful team.
Hot water,shower doesn’t have hoses.

title: Conforto e Localização
text: O hotel está muito bem localizado no centro de Manhattan, é possível ir à pé até Broadway, Times Square, 5a Avenida. O quarto é bem pequeno, mas funcional, com uma cama muuuuuito confortável e o wi-fi funciona muito bem. Ponto negativo: fui tomar café no hotel e a experiência foi muito ruim. A atendente, uma loira, foi bem antipática e só nos atendeu quando fomos até ela no balcão, ela não ia até as mesas. A idéia era tomar um café rápido, mas demorou uns 45min entre a espera e a chegada do pedido. Tirando esse item, o hotel funciona bem.

title: In the Right District
text:
What a lovely hotel. Very nice reception staff who are most willing to help if you need direction or any advice. Nice clean rooms, well appointed with good bathroom. The Cafe bar was a bonus as very handy for a snack in the morning. Unfortunately there was only one man serving so you needed to wait if there was a queue. An extra server would have been great as you do not want to hang around whilst other get served.
Great position in 40th Street for all the sights of NY. Also if going to JFK Airport to or from the hotel the Blue line station is near the hotel in 40th Street and that line goes to JFK where you pick up the Airtrain to the terminal. Much cheaper at $2.75 plus $5 for the airtrain than getting a taxi whichthe hotel can arrange for $70. This is of course if you can carry your bags up and down a few stairs at the station.

title: Ottimo Hotel - occhi alle tax
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel dal 28 al 3 novembre.
Bellissimo e comodissimo
Vicino a timesquare
Unica cosa ricordatevi le tasse e la fee da 25$ al giorno a camera per 2 buoni e la Wi-Fi
Pulito
Carino

title: Hotel perfetto
text: Hotel in zona centrale vicino a tutto ma tranquilla. Ottenere stanze dal 14 piano in su è ottimo perché da quel piano si gode del meraviglioso panorama; si chiamano roomy with a view. Le stanze sono grandi confortevoli e i letti comodissimi. C’è armadio cassaforte e como’ con cassetti. Servizio ottimo alla reception dove l’assistenza è cortese e impeccabile. Oggi giorno si ritira un voucher per una consumazione al bar e nella stanza vengono lasciate due bottigliette di acqua. Nessun costo richiesto per tenere le valigie il giorno della partenza. Hotel pulito, moderno, ben arredato. Consigliatissimo anche se costa un po’ di più dei pari categoria. Vale la pena.

title: Great location!
text:
We stayed a week for a (mostly) shopping and theatre-going trip to the city.

The location is incredible- very convenient access to just about everything! The staff were friendly- big thanks to Dennis at the door for helping with our bags and transportation!

The room was clean and functional, but seemed much smaller than advertised. Also, missing some amenities like shower caps (essential!) and kettle. The beds were comfortable and we did have a rather nice view.

We never used our bar vouchers (too busy) and the bar space wasn’t particularly appealing. I made use of the gym access once, it is actually two blocks away, which is unhelpful in rainy snowy weather! The gym also charges $6 towel rental and there is no water fountain- these are things the hotel staff should warn and prepare gym goers for! 

We had one hiccup where the staff upon check out charged our stay to the wrong credit card (despite my deliberately confirming with them at check in that the card used to “hold” the room and incidentals would NOT be used for our final bill). Desk staff were apologetic but shrugged shoulders and claimed inability to reverse the charge. As a result, we wound up paying $100 in currency conversion fees that we would have avoided had they used the card we requested. 

There is a parole office a few doors down, so lots of undesirables hanging out nearby. I guess there would be security, but it was not wonderful to walk past them every morning.

So, all up, a great stay, but I wouldn’t feel a particular desire to stay again unless I got a great deal on rates.

title: Great Central Place for Sightseeing
text: Spent 3 nights in this Hotel and was very happy with it.  Not posh but reception very friendly.  Pleased with the room and the bed was very comfortable. A small bar where you can also get snacks was very welcoming. Found it a central spot to get to all the attractions and plenty of eating places close by. Would certainly use this Hotel again if we go back to New York.

title: Beautiful Experience
text: The room was very beautiful and clean, with a good city view.Excellent position, very close to Times Square.Staff was all very nice, from reception people to the porter and the guy at the bar, always very kind to us.

title: Best hotel for a city trip: location, quality/price, cleanliness, services, ...
text: Great hotel for a 4-6 days-stay in New York: located centrally in the heart of Hell's Kitchen, perfect to visit Manhattan and other boroughs; good quality for the price, reception, bar and guest rooms perfectly clean, services aligned with customers' need!

title: Good location comfy bed
text: Stayed for two nights which is long enough for this type of hotel. The rims are quite small with no mini bar or tea/coffee facilities. The bed is very comfortable with clean linen and the bathroom of a reasonable size and in good repair . There is a small bar / coffee shop but no restaurant . Only pre packed food is available . They have a good luggage service if your room is not ready. The lobby is very small and can get very busy.

title: Splendida posizione
text:
Hotel carino, con hall e bar non particolarmente curate e un po' anguste.

Le camere sono invece pulite, confortevoli con un bagno di dimensioni adeguate ed anch'esso pulito. Nella camera c'è wifi, cassaforte, TV, phon e accappatoio.

La posizione è veramente eccezionale, a due passi da Times square.

Il personale della reception è gentile e di supporto in caso di problemi e fornisce le informazioni turistiche necessarie.

Forniscono anche il servizio di custodia bagagli il giorno della partenza.

Buon rapporto qualità/prezzo

title: Good hotel and location
text: We stayed for 3 nights in Oct/Nov and enjoyed the hotel as a good base for exploring NY. Rooms were a decent size, staff were very friendly and helpful and location of the hotel is good. Decent value for money overall.

title: clean rooms, friendly staff, lenient check-in/check-out times
text:
Check-in/Check-out: When I checked-in I believe the staff member told me check-out was at 10:00am (or something like that), I wound up checking-out at 1:00pm b/c I wasn't feeling well & they were totally chill about it. No late check-out fees either! 

Location: I was there for a conference at the Metropolitan West so the location was good for that & apparently a lot of other conventions & conferences occur in that area; also if you're looking to spend time in Times Square then it's close by, but otherwise you're a bit of a hike up from most of the trendy areas in NYC.

Amenities: just beyond the elevators is a restaurant/lounge area with a sign that says something about wanting coffee & muffins, us too -- the hours 7am - 4pm are written on the sign, but when I went in to buy some snacks around 3:15pm no one was working & when I asked the employees at the reception desk, they said it didn't open until 4:30pm... very confusing signage.

title: New York for six days
text: Five nights and six days to discover New York in family. The hotel is near of Times Square and near of subway stations. The rooms are clean but there is a lot of noise outside (trucks and cars and buses).

title: Great Hotel wirh Friendly Staff
text: Had a great stay. Staff was very helpful. Rooms are nice and up to date. Liked the online check-in and check-out. Elevators can have a wait but that seems to be the case in most NYC hotels these days.

title: First time in New York
text: Hotel was ok however wouldn't say it was a superior king room. Limited space for cloths storage. Nice comfy bed. No facilities to make a drink which is not helpful when the hotel bar/ cafe doesnt open untill 8am.i asked why there was no facilities as I had booked a superior room it was expected I was informed all coffee machines had been taken out of the bedrooms. Denise the hotel porter was fantastic and recommended places to eat and visit and helped with directions and maps for the subway he went above and beyond his duties.. thank you Denise.

title: Memorable Anniversary Celebration
text: The first time we went to the Distrikt Hotel was in 2011 to celebrate our 20th Anniversary. The hotel was brand new, modern and cosy. The staff was very nice, wellcoming and even left tow cup cakes as a special gift.

title: Good base
text: Booked this holiday in November 2017 for a surprise 50 th birthday celebration.  Guy on reception looked a little bored on check in and had limited eye contact but did get in that we would be charged a daily hotel fee and needed my credit card for any incedentals..I was aware this is common so was not concerned. I was surprised however at the added hotel fee as i had not been aware of this on booking so the next morning I asked another receptionist to check this for me. She apologized and said the fee did not apply to me as I had booked in November the year before and this was prior to the fees being introduced so said these would now not be deducted from my credit card. Not sure why I was going to be charged if this was the case as the guy at check in had all this information, but receptionist I queried this with was helpful and much more friendly. Queen sized room was clean and daily service from maid was excellent, but room decor was a little tired with rips in headboard, screw holes and pencil markings on wallpaper, worn carpet and peeling laminate furniture in bathroom. Duvet had marks on it and was only covered in sheets rather than a duvet cover. Room was warm and comfortable and WiFi worked well throughout the hotel. Website states these rooms have a coffee machine and mini fridge but we didn't have these in our room. We did purchase some hot drinks from bar to have there (given in paper cups) but don't know why some of stated facilities in room were missing.  Location for us was great: just a short walk to times Square and easy walking distance to lots of tourist sights, cafes, restaurants and subway. Yes it was opposite the bus station but we didn't mind this and we used this to find our way back to the hotel easy. There is a parole center down the street but again this just added to the experience and we didn't feel unsafe. On checking out I discovered payments had been taken from  my credit card for parking my car and a bar bill which I laughed about as definitely didn't have a car and we had paid cash for drinks in the bar at the time. Due to this checking out took some time and receptionist  had to go away to speak with manager before coming back and saying they would refund my credit card which would take 3-5 working days and apologised giving us a voucher to use in bar for 2 drinks. I asked for a copy of the bill which I was given and also one e mailed to me and it wasn't until later that I noticed the address on bill was definitely not mine so it looks as though my details were completely mixed up with someone else's on check in. Overall our stay at District was fine for a short stay at price I paid , but this hotel is definately in need of some TLC and description on website needs some attention so it reflects what you are actually getting, plus issues at check in and check out could have been avoided if staff had checked details correctly and more thoroughly of guests that are checking in and out of the hotel.

title: mai prenotare qui!!
text:
tutto sbagliato tranne la posizione abbastanza comoda ma la via è molto buia.
le foto sono fatte ad arte x far vedere un posto che non c è....camere ritratte con un grandangolo piccole e con bagno orribile,esterno in notturna...di giorno tristissimo,il bar chiude alle 21.....a New York,ed è anche brutto.
il Wi-Fi sembra gratis ma poi ti obbligano a prendere dei buoni x  delle consumazioni che costano 25 us al giorno e che devi pagare anche se non consumi.
il conto è segreto...xché se non lo chiedi con insistenza te lo mandano via mail senza che tu lo abbia controllato prima di pagare.....la vista se non sei in una camera da 15mo piano in su è terribile.....che altro dire...personale gentile ma non troppo.
in conclusione.....mai prenotare qui se siete a New York!!

title: Modern
text: Good located just a few minutes walk to Time square... Nice staff on the reception desk and we got the room on the high floor... Room not too big but very comfortable bed and pillows that is very important for us... Nice bathroom... Good pressured shower that great after exhausted from heat wave.. We were there in summer trip.

title: Good hotel except there's no ice machine
text: There was no ice machine on premise. I ask to lobby about the ice and he answered that they can deliver ice to my room. After more than 30 minutes, nothing happened and I needed to go downstairs and receive ice directly from the staff at lobby.

title: Ótimo custo X benefício!!!
text: Hotel pequeno mas moderno, limpo e cordial. Staff eficiente. Ótima localização para fazer muitas coisa a pé. Café da manhã do hotel muito bom mas se você você quiser tomar café no arredores tem várias opções. E, final da tarde, sempre tem um mimo na recepção.

title: Time at the Distrikt
text: This hotel was ideally situated to be near most of the tourist attractions as it is just off Time Square and the others could be easily reached. The room was on the 30th floor and gave us a wonderful view of part of the city. The staff were all friendly, courteous and were eager to help with any queries. If we return to New York we will most definitely stay here again. Thank you

title: NY TRIP
text: This hotel doesn't look anything like the promo pictures :( The Distrikt is in need of some TLC reception is tatty and dated, the bar dark with uncomfortable seating and our room although clean the décor was old with a rip in the headboard.  The water pressure in the shower was awful.  Not enough staff in the reception or bar...very frustrating waiting 25min to order a coffee!!

title: The pictures look great; in real life, the room was in bad shape.
text: The room was in really poor shape - the furniture was banged up, the mirror on the wall was mounted crookedly, the towels were not clean, the shower tiles were dirty, etc.  I travel a lot for work and spend ~150nts per year in hotels, and I would rank this property in the bottom 5% in terms of the condition of the guest room.

title: Would recommend
text:
We visited here as part of my wife’s birthday treat. Hotel is just off Time Square so is in an ideal location, close to lots of sightseeing hotspots. New York is noisy and busy, no denying it! However there were plenty of places that you could go to to get away from the hustle and bustle. 

The hotel is really lovely, staff are very friendly and helpful. Room was really nice, bed v comfy which made a big difference. Bar prices are pricey, drinks vouchers were given to some (depends on city tax etc)

title: 50th birthday trip
text: Average sized room , clean. Really friendly staff on reception. Breakfast is available in the hotel but not great - better to go out. Convenient to most attractions but not a great area. Right beside the bus station (so handy for transport to shopping malls out of the city) and also right beside a correctional facility so there were quite a lot of homeless people around . Didn’t feel particularly safe in that area but fine when in the hotel

title: Clean and affordable
text: Hotel and our room was clean, spacious and affordable. The bed was comfortable.  Valet took good care of our car.. the valet garage was about 6 blocks away.  Made us a little nervous to have someone else driving our car through Manhattan.  The only issue we really had was there was no vending machine for soda, snacks or ice.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Nice lady at front Desk/OVERALL NICE STAY
text: I stayed for a good five nights I'm from England. This hotel was recommended by my company, MICROSOFT.
