I had some problems when I checked in but was resolved quickly then they had a problem with rooms having no hot water it was so cold I have no choice but to bathe with cold water :( then it was sunday oct 21,2018, first time guest like me didn't know there will be no one at the bar till 4:30pm. I was so disappointed due to the fact that that vouchers can only be redeemed there. I was not advised correctly. I talked to Jason, I assumed he's one of the front desk guy from all the frustrations I have and complaining to him he even told me "I CAN'T DO THAT, ITS UP TO YOU" which makes me even mad. Then an angel in the name of of Cristel, (don't know the spelling she's the only Asian front desk agent there) came up to the desk and handled my situation like a pro. She explained to me and apologize with sincerity. She even went out of the front desk and walk me to their bar (collage bar). She then explained to me all the things I should know hotel wise. She never stop apologizing to me until I get better and she's the one that even made me and my wife coffee. She was amazing. Knowing she'd only started a week ago. I might come back because of her she's remarkable. If you will be asking me if the hotel is worth it? I should say yes, but there's still a lot of things to improve. Small room, but clean. Location was great but not at night.

title: Get together with old friend from New Jersey
text: Had a great time with my NJ travel partner.  I came from California and we spent one night in NYCWe really felt lucky to find the Distrik Hotel. because of its location  Staff was very  nice  I would definitely advise friends to go there

title: LIndo hotel, floja atención, poca disposición del personal.
text: Un lindo hotel, bien ubicado, limpio, ordenado. Personal, poco eficiente, poco amable, solo operan con tarjeta, se les complica recibir dinero en efectivo, no colaboran con las maletas, poco atentos a los detalles.

title: Convenient, clean, and quiet
text: Great location near the theater district and subway. Very clean rooms, great staff, and quiet rooms. We were looking for somewhere near broadway that we could walk to and this was perfect. Also very close to the subway so we could get down to the financial district/ World Trade Center/ Statue of Liberty for some sightseeing. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great location, staff/reception can be better
text: Overall good stay but had some issues with reception. We were given a queen-sized room even though I booked a king-sized room via Booking.com. The receptionist made it seem that I was lying, but in the end it was proven that I did book a king-sized one. She didn't even apologize for the mix-up and was a bit rude.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
We have just returned from a city break in New York. We stayed at The Distrikt Hotel whilst there. I would highly recommend this hotel. 
We stayed in a ‘spacious king size room with a city view’. We were on the 31st floor. The room was large for New York and it had an enormous very comfortable bed. It had a good sized bathroom with a large double shower with plenty of hot water. Even though you could still hear the constant beeping of horns from the city it was not loud enough to keep you awake or bother you though. 
The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the centre of Times Square and you can see the large boards of Times Square from the room which was a great sight. 
The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was very clean and modern. 
We paid the taxes when we booked which made it easier for checking in and out. 
It is close to all the good restaurants which are mostly located on 9th Ave. 
I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Mostly good
text: We were very happy with room and service but left with a bit of a sour note when we paid for a room with a view and got a view of a car park and the explanation was that that should be fine as we were on a higher floor!

title: new york trip
text: bathrooms shower floors were not clean..the amenities were few, limited food, front desk staff were somewhat lacking and not very welcoming to the hotel. The bartender in the bar area was not accommodating when a coffee was not to our our liking and would have to pay for another one to correct the mistake, seriously its just a coffee

title: Superb
text: I loved everything about our stay here. From the staff & accommodation to the $1 pizza place & the Hells Kitchen deli down the road. I will happily return here many times in the future. Oh, and Dennis the porter encapsulates everything that’s good about New York. What a guy!

title: 2 Nights, 1 Person, 2 Beds???
text: Room had two double beds instead of a King. Normally wouldn't have issue, but I stayed two nights and no one was able to let me know if a room ever became available. Sleep was uncomfortable, but location is walking distance from The Square.

title: Awesome stay
text:
My wife & I arrived here Sunday 7th October. Quick check in, no problems, we were on the tenth floor.  Dennis who looked after our luggage was a real gent...We became good friends during our 4 night stay, he was always giving advice on directions to places, recommending places to eat, really top guy!
Lifts can be a little tempremental at times but we experienced this only once or twice, really is no big deal at all.
The rooms are a little small yes but still there's plenty of room. We were never hardly in anyway & size of room certinly didn't put us off, beds are comfortable & we had a lovely clean bathroom with fresh maid service daily. There was also A/C to cool the room down if it became too hot.
Location...A few have said on TripAdvisor it's in a bit of a 'dodgy area', don't let this put you off, never once did we feel threatened, NYPD patrol everywhere & are always there any sign of trouble.  The hotel is in an excellent location, 5-10 walk to Times Square & close to most of the attractions North of Manhattan. If you don't want to take in the hussle & bussle of Times Square, try Dalton's bar or Walk Way Diner, both in between 42nd & 43rd Street on 9th Avenue - both do decent food & drink at good prices. There's also the Distrikt Hotel Bar itself, again always relaxed & good place to chill after a long day out sight seeing or shopping.
This stay was a massive tick off my bucket list, my wife was a little apprehensive before we went but even she was very impressed, the Distrikt was part of this.
Would I book the Distrikt again?  Too right, first hotel on my list anyway if I'm ever lucky enough to visit New York again.
Thanks Distrikt x

title: Tolles Hotel in sehr zentraler Lage
text: Dieses Hotel überzeugt mit Design, Sauberkeit und Service. Außerdem befindet sich das Hotel in einer sehr guten Lage. Die Zimmer sind nicht die größten, aber für zwei Leute ausreichend. Wir waren bereits 2x in diesem Hotel und würden immer wieder kommen.

title: Great position.
text: There’s a lot to like about the Distrikt  Hotel, primarily it’s excellent location ( mid town) being opposite the Port Authority Bus station and a subway with connections to just about anywhere. Times Square and Macy’s are an easy walk and dining options are plentiful. There are wine and liquor shops close by ( not the Athens ) and a laundromat just down the the street on 9th. Be sure to book a room on a higher floor ( more expensive) to get a better view. Our room on the 25th floor had two comfortable double beds and a very nice bathroom ( although we did have some hot water issues.... which were attended to straight away). The airconditioning struggled occasionally and did not seem to operate in the hallway as we waited for the lift. The staff were very friendly and always greeted us with a welcoming smile. I was provided with a kettle and mugs on request and was able to make my own cups of tea and coffee. The small fridge was very efficient, keeping the milk and wine well chilled. The room was meticulously maintained throughout our 8 day stay and the wifi was fine except you had to login every 24 hours. While the immediate surrounds included a few homeless people and a parole board we felt quite safe making our way around. If you have a limited time in NY the Distrikt is a great base for exploring.

title: AMAZING!
text: My Girlfriend and I had the most amazing time at the Distrikt!  Jason was absolutely perfect in helping us and making check-in easy after we had been scammed by an AirBNB in Brooklyn.  From a 20th floor room with a view of Chelsea to advice on where to go for meals after our relocation, Jason at night and Adrianna during the day were amazing hosts!  We had an absolutely amazing time in Midtown!

title: Decent boutique, ugly street, great location, can be a good value.
text: Nice boutique hotel - choose for the convenient location, but NOT for aesthetics - 40th between 8th and 9th is not a pretty street, but it is very convenient for accessing subway lines and mid-town in general. Service was fine, and the rooms were comfortable and reasonably clean. Have stayed here several times in the past, and unfortunately the hotel is starting to show its age. Nothing major, but headboard vinyl was flaking off in one place, and the shower grout wasn't pristine. A simple refresh is all it needs. If you can get a good rate for the night (mid to high 200s) take it.

title: A lot of money for the location
text: Too close to Port Authority bus terminal. Hence, noisy, smelly and lots of questionable characters to get to and from hotel.  Room was nice. Bed VERY comfortable. Service at desk was good except when receptionists were really loud talking with each other when not helping customers.

title: Terrible service overall
text: The hotel itself was clean but the service was atrocious and employees rude. I asked for a quieter room and they put me right next to the elevator. Then I get up to my room and the smoke detector is beeping so I call down to complain. I waited another 1.5 hours for someone to address it before calling again.  Ridiculous. I went to get coffee in the morning and waited 15 minutes for service while standing in line. The guy was rude to everyone and obviously not happy to be there so I left to walk down the street to get coffee. Then I leave for the whole day and get back at 5pm and my room hasn’t been touched but they at least left new water bottles. I took all my trash and carried it to the desk and the women at the desk never acknowledged my existence. Then another employee arrived and tells me they are probably still making there rounds. I asked why they put water in the room then and left it dirty without new towels. Nothing but I’ll tell Management to touch base. I have been to NYC many times and I will not be returning here.

title: Great location
text: Good location and very nice staff. Would be nice if I was open later than 10:30 PM and could also do with coffee making facilities in the room. The counter this by giving you two free drinks a day so I can’t complain really

title: Clean, Centrally Located in Midtown Near Times Square
text: I stayed here after finding it on Hotel Tonight. It is a typical NY hotel (the room was not as small I initially thought it would be). We did get two free drink tickets for the bar downstairs which was nice. I know NY is expensive but the price seemed high for a basic hotel room on a lower floor.

title: Travel for business
text: The room was very clean, bed was comfortable, staff was great!Great location - just few minutes from Times Square, restaurants and more. Great value for price!The only issue I had was the internet - was not working too well.

title: Benino
text: Come dice il titolo ho una visione un pó contrastante di questo hotel!! Lati positivi , in camera non manca nulla anche se la nostra con letto queen era un po piccola ottima la wifi, davvero insonorizzata anche se era al 12º piano non si sentiva nulla dalla strada cosa abbastanza difficile a ny visto k si sentono serene ovunque!! Con i loro 25$ di fee vi viene offerta la wifi 2 bottiglie di acqua ql giorno in camera e 2 drink al bar dell hotel, noi a parte un aperitivo una sera li usavamo per il cappuccino della colazione!! Lati negativi si trova quasi sulla 9ª e non posso dire sia una bella zona tenendo conto k spesso si trova traffico visto la fermata dei bus proprio di fronte!! Nel complesso lo consiglierei se si trova una buona offerta!!

title: Perfect for us (The Dyers)
text: The location of the Distrikt Hotel was perfect for us , it really is just 10 min walk from times square and the empire state building. The staff were very friendly and very helpful, a special mention to Dennis who was very nice and helped us when our transfer didn't turn up, what a top man. The room itself was perfect for us , it was cleaned every day and the bed was very very comfortable. We never had any problems with wifi and we were up on the 30th floor , a couple of times we needed to reconnect but it was fine after that. If I was going to be picky then maybe if any of the other rooms were like ours they could do with a bit of freshening up , a few ripped pieces of wall paper a few chips on the paint a little bit of mould on sealant but seriously that's being picky the room was perfect for us and clean. Would I recommend this hotel for somebody else , absolutely I would but if you are after luxury then maybe not but then you are going to have to pay a lot lot more.

title: Room for improvement
text:
There are a lot of minor issues with this hotel that require a fix to make it truly a 4-star property, in my opinion, and to earn it a 5-star TripAdvisor review, but the major issue was the sound of traffic (with the constant and to be expected honking in the city) while staying in Room 402. My guess is the combo of the lower floor and a window facing 40th St. is probably what did it. Surprisingly, being next to the elevator (which is hard to avoid considering there’s only about 5 rooms on each floor) presented no noise issues. If you’re not as good a sleeper as I am (and even then I still woke), you definitely need to request a higher floor room, assuming that will do away with the sound of traffic early in the morning. 

On to the minor issues (but should be noted for a 4-star hotel): We weren’t fully stocked with towels one day because their linen cleaning service was late. We had to call to learn this and missing towels were brought shortly after we made the request. Slightly annoying was being awakened to an early morning hallway announcement that the fire alarms would be tested just to have the same thing happen the next morning where the same announcement was made, followed by another announcement later in the morning, and eventually the actual testing. It didn’t last long, but if it was possible to do it all in one day and have the announcement made and immediately followed by the test all at once and during non-sleeping hours, that would have been nice. 

Although tastefully decorated with a modern decor, the room definitely could use some love. One of the electrical outlets was so loose, anything I put in would eventually slip out with a slight jiggle. There were holes in the ceiling where old drapes once hung and sloppy drywall patching above the shower head that had yet to be sanded down and painted. The ruler drawn pencil marks down one wall also made the room appear as if the hotel hadn’t fully completed the finishing touches before allowing guests to come in. (This is considering the room did not appear to be newly remodeled due to evident wear and tear, so I’m thinking no one cared to do any touch-ups when the room was redone years back.) Again, all minor issues (especially when it comes to the cosmetic things), but attention to detail is what makes you a cut above the rest. 

On to the pros: The bathroom was what sold me over the cheaper priced hotels, such as Yotel, because it was clean and a good size with a large, modern, glass-door shower. The room itself was also clean and a very comfortable size for two double beds and two people. (One luggage had to go on the armchair because even if a luggage rack had been provided, it would’ve made the room tighter. The other luggage was placed on the large, but good and very cold, air conditioning unit which worked out fine.) The armoire was small and may present a problem for a winter wardrobe for one (if you don’t like living out of your luggage for the most part), let alone two people, but it had a safe, fridge, some shelves, and a few small, soft-close drawers. I loved that the TV had tons and tons of good channels including Showtime. Check out was at noon which was terrific considering most hotels kick you out at 11am nowadays. A resort fee (aka “City Hotel Fee”) is pretty much standard at any hotel these days, so I’m unsure why it is a shock to so many reviewers. Although I agree that it’s an annoying norm, at least Distrikt gives two daily cocktails/beverage vouchers which is more than I can say for most hotels these days that give nothing. As for location, we mainly used Lyft, but the 13 minute walk we took to Times Square one evening was easy. The area didn’t feel any less safe than any other place you’d stay at around Times Square. There’s always a group of people walking on the streets and cars everywhere, so I at least felt safe walking around with my mom in the early evening. The hotel is located a few doors down from 2 Bros Pizza which is cheap, convenient, and delicious. 

If you’ve been to the city at least once and you’re over the need to stay in a glamorous, grand lobby hotel or somewhere smack dab in the middle of Times Square, this is a solid stay. It’s more of a boutique hotel with a tiny lobby and good sized, not at all happening bar area, but the hotel service is very good and friendly. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

title: Way too expensive!
text:
I stayed at the Distrikt Hotel for 2 nights in September during a sitting of the UN General Assembly. To be fair I didn’t know about the UN sitting but that explained the reason for the totally extortionate rate of £595.87 (+£45 taxes). The hotel was not in the best area as it was right next to the Port Authority Bus Terminal complete with all the things and people you’d expect to find. The hotel was good but unlike a lot of NYC hotels, my room was very small. But like a lot of NYC hotels, getting up and down in the lift can take an awful long time!

My biggest gripe however, was the cost. This hotel often charges half the price that I paid. So, I am compelled to give my rating based on what I paid. And, for more than £300 a night for one person, I am only able to rate it 2 out of 5. I understand that NYC is slightly different to the rest of the world, but doubling the price of a room and then asking the guests on checkout to give them a 5-star rating is, to say the least, a bit much.

title: Excellent stay!
text: My room was beautiful and very clean, the position is perfect for exploring Manhattan by foot! I had no problems during my stay and the experience was very pleasant in general. I would recommend this hotel

title: Central location
text:
We did stay in this hotel for four nights. 

The location on the 40th street is ideal for exploring Midtown Manhattan but at the same time the neighborhood has plenty of homeless people and a lot of dirt and trash. 

Our room 2002 on the 20th floor with two Queen Beds had a view but was also not very large - still okay for a short visit. 

All service personnel was very friendly and helpful. 

No restaurant in the hotel but a nice little bar with one free drink per day and person included. 

Is this a helpful review? Then please give me a "Thumbs up Thank FrankGeisler" by clicking the button below.

title: Another Trap in NYC
text: Not a 4 Star quality Hotel. Undisclosed surcharges (+30%) not disclosed at booking.com in Total Price displayed. At $400 per night not worth the money. Tough neighborhood. Poor Amenities. Room Air conditions have bad odor. Showers have black mold in corners.

title: Einfaches gutes Hotel mit Bar - zentral im Zentrum gelegen
text: Einfaches gutes Hotel mit Bar - zentral im Zentrum von New York gelegen - es liegt in der Nähe einer Metro-/Busstation zwischen der 8. und 9. Avenue in der 40. Strasse. Der Empfang war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Ein Träger brachte unser Gepäck aufs Zimmer mit Bigsize Doppelbett und Sicht in den Innenhof. Trinkgeld wurde, wie in ganz Amerika üblich, erwartet. Wir waren hier 4 Nächte und würden wieder hier buchen.

title: Distrikt Hotel
text: Husband and I stayed at this hotel from 1-5th Oct 2018. Had done a lot of research beforehand and choose the hotel on its location and price- we were not disappointed. Albeit the location in the actual street isn’t brilliant (it’s a bit shabby looking), it’s only 2-3 minutes walk to Times Square. The staff on front desk were helpful as was Dennis the concierge, who got us a taxi back to the airport and stored our luggage for us. The room was very nice (room 405) but view was rubbish. Not much time spent in the room so that wasn’t a problem. The bed was comfortable and huge and the shower was lovely and hot. We were given 2 vouchers a day to use at the bar which was handy, also 2 bottles of water were left in our room each day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in a great location, just out of the way of the manic Times Square!!

title: Very good location
text:
My wife and I booked this hotel for our 5 night stay in New York.  I read lots of reviews beforehand and found them to be fair and accurate.

The hotel is well situated for exploring this great city.  Plenty of bars, restaurants and coffee shops close by.  The hotel bar is a great place to unwind after a days exploring, with a good selection of beers, wines, snacks and coffee.

The staff are all very friendly and helpful.  

The room we had was comfortable and cleaned every day, no complaints from us.

Everything you want to see and do in New York is within walking distance of this hotel (or try the hop-on/hop-off water taxi for Brooklyn and the 9/11 memorial & museum). 

We didn't need to use public transport and found the best way to see and experience New York was to explore on foot.

I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

title: Convenient location for Time Square & Upper Manhatten
text:
This hotel was the final stop on our recent US tour.  Located a few block south west of Time Square, it’s convenient for both that & a good chunk of threatre-land.

We arrived quite late & tired after a long day travelling.  Check in was smooth & quick.  We were even offered a choice of floors! No specific views on that but specified a quite room.  Allocated 1805, which filled the brief perfectly.  

Like many Manhattan buildings, this hotel isn’t very wide, with only 5 rooms per floor, but there are 32 of those so I guess at the top, you get a great view of Manhattan.

The room was generally well equipped & comfortable & more than adequate for our needs.  Our only criticism, which is quite minor, is that this was the only hotel on our tour - 8 in all, which didn’t provide complimentary bottled water.  Not a major issue but would have been a nice touch.

Can’t comment about proximity to Metro stations as we didn’t use them, although only a few blocks from Penn St Station.  I’m sure there’ll be only closer but not something we needed since we prefer to walk  to see the city & it’s life.

title: Worst hotel ever stayed
text: This hotel is only good due to location else the service and infrastructure is very poor. Most of the time lift is not working. The room aircon does not cool despite keeping on lowest temperature. Room or Guest service phone are not attended after the several rings or if it is picked up then background music is started

title: Distrikt review
text: Decent hotel in good location, excellent service from staff. Rooms were ok but expected better. The bar was really really expensive.The Wi Fi was also really poor. Close to Times Square, local bars and places to eat.

title: Disappointing
text:
Just stayed here for 5 nights for my special birthday. Booked a double/double ‘deluxe’ room as there was 3 of us thinking that this would be adequate, how wrong was I!
Double beds were very small, single wardrobe for 3 adults, tatty ripped leather headboards, plug sockets dodgy, bathroom ok bit mouldy, duvet had sheets wrapped around them, not an actual duvet cover. Was on the 28th floor as wanted a view, kind of got this but looking down onto a massive car park. 
One of the lifts broke down and was told it was not broken it had malfunctioned!
When asked at reception if our room was in fact a ‘deluxe’ the response was “ some may consider it to be a Hilton but we are not quite there yet”
Staff not as friendly as expecting
Plus side close to Times Square, great pizza place ‘2 Bros’ & little coffee shop on the corner 
Overall felt as though it was over sold, not as advertised, pictures must have been seriously photoshopped and will therefore not be returning

title: Great location lack luster hotel
text: the location is ideal for all the Times Square tourists traps also directly behind port authority and very close to the subway. However, the staff is completely unenthused and unhelpful. From the moment I arrived to check-in it seemed as though I was a bother. The rooms are a decent size and relatively clean but the beds are HORRIBLE; my back is still suffering three days later.

title: Just Ok
text:
stayed for 4 nights during mid September.
front desk staff, as were from time to time, were either non-welcoming (trying to avoid all eye contact or any contact with the guests), confused, rude, or unhelpful.
despite such average - low service level, and not like other hotel rooms in NYC, the room was very comfortable, big, and clean.
location is good for new york first timers, and those who want to be near the times square, but not like other areas in Manhattan, the hotel's surroinding are very dirty and full of homeless people.

title: 1 parte luna di miele
text: Abbiamo pernottato dal 17 al 21/09 2018 in questo magnifico hotel.... pulizia, professionalità, posizione davvero eccellenti....consigliatissimo per chi come noi vorrebbe visitare new york a piedi.....c'è tutto dietro l'angolo.....straconsigliato... l'unica pecca letti troppo grandi ed essendo luna di miele io e mio marito eravamo lontani nel letto...ahhahahahahah.....scherzo davvero tutto al top....da Bruno e Sofia

title: Great location but ...
text:
The location of the hotel is fabulous but the rest is very underwhelming. The room was sufficient and clean and the bed was comfortable but the decor was very tired and looked tatty. One of the power sockets and the usb power charger didn’t work and despite complaining about it a number of times, it didn’t seem to get fixed.

During the day, one of the only 2 elevators appears to be used by housekeeping which means that you can be waiting a very long time for an elevator.

title: Pænt og nyere hotel tæt på Bus stationen
text: Rent og pænt hotel lige ved Port Authority bus terminal. Fint centralt for teater og andre turist seværdigheder. Værelserne er pæne. Vi valgte et værelse med udsigt. Der får man ro og View til de andre højhuse

title: Viaggio di laurea
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con la mia famiglia per circa una settimana e devo dire che pur non essendo abituati ad usare una tripla, non abbiamo avuto alcun problema!
Camera ampia e spaziosa, con vista su Manhattan davvero impagabile, bagno relativamente ampio considerando gli standard Newyorkesi e con parecchio spazio di appoggio.
Unica pecca forse la presenza di due letti alla francese, un po' scomodi se si deve dormire in coppia, ma d'altra parte la maggior parte degli hotel a New York offre questo tipo di materasso.
Nel complesso quindi l'ho trovato davvero ottimo, bella anche la zona, a due passi da Times Square, pulizia impeccabile e personale gentile.
Vacanza stupenda!.

title: Hotel central cercano a metro
text: Distrik tiene una muy buena ubicación a un precio razonable (los demás hoteles cercanos eran muchísimos más caros). Nosotros sólo llegábamos a dormir, ni siquiera desayunamos en él, y en base a eso, el precio es un poco elevado, y la habitación no era muy grande, pero cumplía nuestro requerimiento de buena ubicación y limpieza. Personal muy amable por cierto.

title: Disappointing
text:
Returned to same hotel  again,because of its convenient location however , the service which  was good and friendly  was found of the disgusting side.
We had to remind  the reception on a daily basis to refill soap & shampoo  and to put enough towels for  all of us
Coming back to the room at 1700 finding it in a complete mess,
Reception service was antipathetic, esp the guy in charge
Still  waiting even for the invoice which he promised to  email.....
What a shame.....

title: Great hotel in a good location
text: We enjoyed our stay at Distrikt Hotel which is close to the Times Square area as well and to many other famous NYC sites.  There are lots of choices and we are very glad we picked Distrikt Hotel!  We will be back!

title: Great Hotel!
text: Great hotel, in a perfect location and reasonably priced, very friendly staff. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, clean bathrooms and a spectacular view of Manhattan. The hotel bar highly recommended, the staff that attends is very friendly.

title: A dump
text: Had the misfortune to spend 3 nights in this hovel,,the room on the 6 floor was small,dark with no main light and only one bedside light to see with ,which on reflection was probably a good thing as we wouldn’t want to check the cleanliness too closely.Dont expect a view of the new York skyline,,all you get is a view of the bins & the next door hotels rooms,thankfully the windows were so dirty it blocked anyone spying on you.The areas around the hotel are pretty grim and keep you on your toes,,all becomes rather depressing after stepping round the many homeless a couple of yards from reception.This place is reminiscent of a 70s homeless unit and is shocking that a tour company thought this was ever an acceptable place to rock up to after disembarking the Queen Mary 2..Anyone saying this place & the location is fantastic have got to be fake.

title: Terrific location, good service, but small room
text: The location of the Distrikt was perfect for what we wanted to do in New York. Times Square was just round the corner, there were plenty of attractions within easy walking distance, and public transport was nearby. Our room was small and pretty basic but it was clean and comfortable even so. The service at the front desk was good and friendly. Overall, my wife and I were very happy with our stay there.

title: Okay for one
text: The room is very small, fine for 1 person but with only a single desk chair, it was too small for two.The refrigerator was missing, but one was installed while we were out.  The walk-in shower is nice.

title: Nice hotel/Good location
text: Distrikt Hotel is a clean, friendly, not-too-expensive hotel located within walking distance to the theatre district and the Highline. The neighborhood is a bit dicey, it being across from the bus station, but no one bothered us. It just isn't uptown. Our room was bigger than most NY hotel rooms. One thing to know is that the shower is a walk-out. If wet floors scare you...think twice. Otherwise, a terrific place.

title: Ken and Linda Akinson
text: Excellent all round experience. This was our first trip to New York. Your staff were courteous, thorough and very helpful. We would recommend you to our friends and family. In particular , Dennis was a superb help to us.

title: Gutes Hotel, aber zusätzliche Gebühren
text: Super zentrale Lage 40th Straße, netter Service, saubere Zimmer, für New York ordentlich große Zimmer, leider werden pro Nacht 25$ Service Gebühr extra berechnet, bei Expedia steht das ganz versteckt... Schade sonst war das Hotel super.

title: NYC visit
text:
Not bad but not quite the place you'd expect it to be.
Good points; central position in heart of Hells Kitchen; quiet comfortable room (bed is sensational); clean; 22nd floor view of carpark; great wifi.
Bad points; not 4* under any optimistic guise of the term; cost is not comsensurate with amenities.

title: 3 star basic hotel but ok location
text:
Paid $450 a night and thought it was a nice boutique hotel, it’s a very basic chain feeling place with no extras at all.

Reception felt more like a youth hostel and took a long time to check in.

Room ok in size but tired.

Hotel has no facilities. Unable to get tea / coffee early morning or anything to eat. 

Bit disappointed really.

title: a short stay
text: it was OK, The mandatory hotel tax that we paid and was not mentioned during booking is not ok.    The bad was comfortable and the room quiet. No tee maker. There is a bar in the lobby. Check in took half an our.

title: Très bon hôtel avec un excellent emplacement.
text: Nous avons passé un super séjour. Le service fourni est excellent. Je conseille cet hôtel pour les personnes qui souhaitent se rendre à Times Square plusieurs fois le soir. La chambre propose une bonne literie.

title: Couples trip to NYC
text: Brilliant location, right between Hell's Kitchen and Broadway/ Times Square. Room was clean, bed was comfy, Wi-Fi was excellent and staff were friendly.  We had a room on 30th floor with city view,  view was fabulous and as we were higher up there was no street noise.

title: Weekend in NYC at District Hotel
text: Very friendly and helpful staff. The location was excellent! We were within walking distance to the theater district, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza and the subway stations were very close by too. There were many places to choose from to eat at, all within walking distance also. We enjoyed our stay at the Distrikt Hotel.

title: Perfect!
text: Me and my boyfriend had a wonderfull time in New York. I'll sure recommend Distrikt Hotel to my friends and family if they travel there. The service was excellent, the view was amazing, the price very good, and the location perfect.

title: Man from hotel staff entered my room without knocking at 5am in the morning!!!
text:
The hotel in ok, nothing fancy but good location.
The service is terrible though: a man from the hotel staff entered my room at 5am in the morning and freaked me out! Called reception and they only said it was a mistake. 
Couldn't go back to sleep and left earlier than I thought I would.
Still waiting for a manager to call me back!

Awful experience and not a good process in place to resolve it either. At the very least, people should knock!

title: Nice hotel
text: Comfortable large bed, clean rooms and staff were really friendly. My only complaint is there were no coffee/tea making facilities so the room was pretty basic. A nice size room for a NY hotel. I’d stay here again as the location was pretty good

title: Not 4*
text:
I booked for 1 night (Monday) through hotels.com as tried to be conscious of cost in a very expensive city (as part of a 4 week NY/Long Island stay), Distrikt Hotel offered 1 night for £175 dollars.  Check went pretty smooth and I was informed that $50 would be held as a deposit, 2 keys and complimentary drinks tickets.  (Don't try to take glasses from the bar to your room - you only get paper cups).  The room is very tired looking and not very clean, 2 beds for 2 adults and a 12 yr old which was what I had wanted.  The headboard was worn away, accumulated dust all around the room, nice small fridge and complimentary water.  The alarm clock kept beeping so we just unplugged it.  Nice touch with the multi usb plug very handy.  Wonky toilet seat and tired looking fixtures and fittings in the bathroom.  Good location very close to all that we planned to see.

Unfortunately my husband was taken ill while we were at the hotel which necessitated a second night at the hotel, which cost me double the first night $350 for this room.  As he was ill there was no complimentary water so I went out to the local Duane Reade store and got a large bottle.  Reception staff indifferent to my plight, when I got an inkling that we may have to stay I rang reception on the Monday evening to get a price for the room $261 but because I didn't book it there and got stung with the inflated price the following morning.

I for one will not be recommending the Distrikt Hotel, the rooms are below standard and do not resemble the photos on the different booking sites and indifferent staff.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Close to (walking distance) Manhattan Cruise Ship Terminal, next to Port Authority Bus terminal to airports, Time Square, Broadway, Theatre District. Spacious room and bathroom, just perfect for a few days.

title: 3 star not 4
text:
Our check in went smoothly and staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 4th floor and was very quiet. The rooms aren't as pictured in the photos. They are grubby and worn. The rooms needed freshened up and painted. Our furniture had loads of scrapes and our bathroom furniture was so worn. The bathroom ceiling was disgusting and our shower plug hole was blocked full of hairs. 
Our bedroom was small but comfortable. The beds sheets were clean but the mattress protector had stains on it but no evidence of bed visitors like other guests reviews. Our room was cleaned everyday and free bottles of water.

title: Good hotel and location but guests should be warned about the hotel’s check in policy
text:
This is certainly not the first time I visit NYC and I have NEVER gone through such a terrible time while checking in like I did at this hotel.
After having swiped my different cards at the front desk, the employee said that none of them were working and therefore wasn’t willing to give me a room until I fixed this issue myself.
Despite me making the reservation a lot of time ahead, I was disappointed with how I was treated because of this issue. It wasn’t until I had my card limit fixed at the bank that they let me check in. But had it not been for that, they would have left me with nowhere to stay for two weeks since they said they were sold out. I wonder, what if I had made the reservation with a foreign credit card and had no bank to help me out with this issue? They should be more mindful and considerate because not all tourist guests are necessarily aware of this policy. 
Additionally they never responded to an e-mail I’ve sent them regarding a personal lost item.

The room was spacious/comfortable and was glad to see there was an every day room service. The location is great, close to pretty much all train stations.

Overall I had a good stay but wasn’t expecting to be treated like that for something that exceeded my control.

title: Glaring Missteps
text: The room I had was pleasant, comfortable and large enough for Manhattan. The staff are friendly. However, during check-in one person was taking care of me, she asked me twice how many keys I wanted for the room (one), noted I was prepaid, and then she handed me off to someone else. That person did whatever and gave me two keys. Process took way longer than it should have. An employee swiped the lock on the elevator for me to punch in my floor. The first key I tried didn't work on the room door. I couldn't get onto Wi-Fi with my tablet. I went back to the front desk and was told the system works best with Apple products. The person walked me through getting signed in. Then I discovered my key didn't work to unlock the elevator and I rode the elevator for a while. Finally got the key fixed.

title: Decent hotel
text:
We visited here as the final part of a 3 week holiday in the States.

We arrived late on the Saturday and it was easy to find from the nearest Subway station (42nd Street/PABT). Check in was easy with really pleasant reception staff. All staff looked really smart. We also got a complimentary drink vouchers each for that evening at the hotel bar which we used.

We were in a double room on the 25th floor. We liked the fact that it is a small foot printed hotel with only 5 rooms per floor cutting down on noise from other residents.

The room was small, modern and clean. The bathroom had a good shower and sink unit and was also modern. We also had an amazing view towards the west side. There was a good sized TV on the wall with plenty of channels. The wardrobe was a good size with a couple of draws in it and a small safe. There was also an ironing board with an iron in there too that we used.

The bed was very comfortable with crisp clean linen. The WiFi was fast with good connection. Air con was excellent if a little noisy. The cleaning staff were very good and worked incredibly long hours. The hairdryer wasn’t working on arrival and when reported it was replaced within 10 minutes.

Now for the only quibbles and these are minor. The room wasn’t set out very well. The double bed only had a bedside table on one side. This could be resolved if they had a smaller work desk increasing space at the side of the bed. I had to use my case for this purpose but then had to move it every time we used the wardrobe. The alarm clock in the room bleeped all the time due to the Bluetooth connection on it so we simply unplugged it. There isn’t much room for storage of cases either. This could be resolved if the easy chair wasn’t there. Of course we don’t use the easy chairs or desks whereas other people do so it’s easy for us to say as it is personal choice.

As I say these are minor and wouldn’t stop us booking here again.

The bar is really good with various sports channels on and a good large variety of drinks and snacks. The location is excellent for the Times Square area and access to the Subway and buses. It’s convenient for Grand Central and Penn Station via one stop on the Subway. One tip, if taking a walk downtown then turn left out of the hotel and go down 9th Avenue instead of 8th as it is much quieter.

We enjoyed our stay here very much.

title: Good Location
text:
Good location, free wi fi and good service in terms of cleaning the room are the only
Positives I can find. Rooms are small (as you expect in this area), no food menus to order in food, ambience very average - at best a 3 star hotel

title: Could have been better
text: The room was clean and we got fresh towels and bottles of water daily and the location was fairly central however that's really the only positive things I can say. We went to New York for a special birthday but very disappointed with the response and attitude of the reception staff. The member of staff we dealt with was very abrupt and unhelpful which was not a pleasant start to the holiday. I would not recommend this hotel if you're visiting New York.

title: Good location
text:
This was our first time in New York and,having trawled the internet looking at scarily-expensive hotels in the area,decided to plump for the Distrikt - and it was OK.
Having nothing to compare it with it's difficult to keep it in context,but overall you don't get much for your money in this city!
We had one of their "roomy rooms" and I'm glad we didn't choose anything smaller - it wasn't "roomy" at all (although the shower was disproportionately large) but that seems to be the norm in this town. 
We weren't given any information upon check-in regarding the bar (I've seen other reviews that mention complimentary drinks?),and we at no time received any free bottled water despite being there for six nights;we also initially stood in the elevator wondering why it wasn't moving until another guest entered and told us we needed to swipe our room key to make it work,but none of them were major issues. The room itself contained a small fridge (which was good as we'd brought a travel kettle to make a drink in the room,there's nothing supplied to make a drink) and the smallest ironing board on the planet which,although perfectly functional,needed to be stooped over to iron anything. 
The hotel is more than acceptable but what swung it for us was the location - although we had no view from our window (unless concrete car parks are your thing) it's just a very short walk to Times Square/fashion district where there's a hive of activity.
I've seen other reviewers mention some dodgy-looking characters around the area but we found that to be the case all over the city! No-one bothers you anyway so it's not an issue.
If we ever returned to the area we'd probably look for another hotel just for a change but that's not to say there's anything wrong with the Distrikt - it's just that,for the money,there's nothing we found really special about it.

title: Good hotel ; basic ; location is good
text:
An ideal sort of budget hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful.
The location is near the bus terminal so the environs can appear intimidating, dirty and unsavoury characters hanging about.
The room is suitable with a double bed, no great view, AC is good, shower and bathroom is good. There is a fridge (2 free bottles of water per day) but no tea/coffee facilities. Room is kept clean.
Hotel lobby area is basic, 2 lifts to take you to I think 32 floors? 
There is a bar inside the hotel which again is basic but ok. Good variety of drinks and snacks. You get two free drinks per day plus we also got a free 3 Visitor Attraction voucher via our travel agent which saves a bit of money. 
It’s in an ideal location to walk to the huddle and bustle of Times Square. 
Situated equidistant from JFK and Newark - Taxi cost varies between 60 and 90 dollars depending time of travel.
Overall a straightforward stay..... thank you.
We have stayed at the Staybridge which is next door. It has a lot more to offer.

title: " superbe hotel "
text: C'est un hôtel propre est très bien situer a 5 minute de time square; a la fin du séjour on devait libérer la chambre a 11h ; la réception  nous on garder nos valise jusqu'au  soir pour profiter de la ville sans nos valise ,on a eu chauffeur qui nous a amener a l aéroport gratuitement et il ny a pas de frais de sejour a payer : Resort fees. on peut acheter des billet pour des attraction directement a la réception . si je  retourne a ny je repartirais dans cette hotel

title: Beautiful rooms, Good location, Good price but only a slight issue
text: And that issue not EVERYONE may have to deal with (below). The room was nice, the fridge was small, lovely bathroom, front desk is nice, checkin/out easy - just CHECK YOUR BED(S) BEFORE 5pm. I checked in around 4pm and left the hotel to go to events that I had planned for my partner's birthday. We came back at 10pm and noticed questionable things under the mattress and under the sheets. Called room service, but didn't get our sheets changed until 4am. Yes, 4am. So check your stuff as SOON as you check in, even if you're in a rush.

title: Nice and comfy overnight stay
text: Bf and I decided to stay here after a long day of work. Used Hotel Tonight. There was a 50 security deposit but I got that back when checked out. Beds were comfy, shower was nice. The bar was closed when we got there but they gave us the voucher to use for the next day.For an overnight stay we enjoyed it!

title: Mala experiencia
text:
Mi novio y yo tuvimos una mala experiencia con este hotel por un cargo incorrecto de 50 dólares que nos cobraron el 25 de agosto y que al día de hoy (10 de septiembre) aún no pudimos recuperar. 

Tuvimos que desconocer este cargo ante Visa directamente dado que no recibimos solución por parte del hotel. 

En la última comunicación mantenida con el hotel nos indicaron que estos 50 dólares correspondían al depósito que reservan en la tarjeta de crédito que uno deja durante el check in. Sin embargo, ya les hemos explicado que el monto fue debitado de nuestra tarjeta de débito (no la tarjeta de crédito que habíamos dejado para el check in el 17 de agosto) el día del check out (25 de agosto). 

El día del check out habíamos intentado pagar los cargos diarios de 25 dólares que cobra el hotel (el cual nos pareció sumamente excesivo considerando las prestaciones asociadas) con esa tarjeta de débito, y nos informaron que visa no les autorizaba la transacción. Por este motivo cancelamos en ese mismo momento el cargo del hotel con tarjeta de crédito. 

Una vez de regreso en Buenos Aires, nos llevamos la sorpresa de un débito por 50 dólares en nuestra tarjeta de débito que jamás nos fue informado por el hotel, ni fue autorizado por nosotros.

Las habitaciones están bien, el hotel es normal, la ubicación es cómoda para trasladarse a distintos lugares, pero la cuadra en la que está ubicado no es para nada linda.

No recomendaría este hotel.

title: Great location and value
text: We selected this hotel based on the price and location.  The staff was cordial and caring.  We were very pleased with the Distrikt Hotel and would stay again.  We compared the price to other hotels and find this price to be reasonable.  We liked the location and close proximity to the Port Authority.

title: First time in new york
text:
Location for times square good . Room small and basic . Day staff friendly but not  at night when we arrived he was not very pleasant . Quiet location . Clean room , good shower .
We did not have food so can't comment on that .

title: Ritornati al DISTRIKT
text:
Dopo l’ottima esperienza di dicembre 2016 torniamo in questo hotel, ottima posizione e rapporto qualità prezzo top !

Consiglio di provare questo hotel sia per coppie che famiglie !

L’unica cosa che dovrebbe essere integrata all’interno e’ la palestra

title: What we expected
text: Overall hotel was exactly what we expected. Could do with a bit of redecorating and air con unit worked but was very loud so had to turn off at night which wasnt good during a heatwave. Some members of staff a friendly and welcoming and willing to help, a few let the team down, as during our check in the lady doing so told us no information about the hotel or how the elevators worked in regards needing to use your room key to reach your floor or when the bar would be open if required breakfast. Location of hotel is brilliant majority of things are within walking distance.

title: Bad experience
text: For several days and despite repeated appeals to the front office of the hotel, not enough towels were provided for all guests in the room.Charged credit card twice for the value of the stay.The location is good. The room is average.

title: Labor Day Weekend
text: Check-In into the Hotel was quick and very courteous. Front Desk Agent Adrianna was very professional and  helpful with all my request. Checkout was assisted by Adrianna and the great service was given.

title: Beware! Do not stay here! I really don’t see how this place gets good ratings.
text: Room did not cool properly. Hallways were extremely hot. Mold in the shower. Pleather in headboards peeling off. Bathroom vanity in bad shape. Staff at collage bar not knowledgeable. The only thing going for this hotel is the location.

title: Good location
text: Hotel located near Time Square which is ideal to visit the different attractions in the Midtown. Our room was quite clean and spacious, we did appreciate they still cleaned our room even though we had left it lately (around 2pm) every day during our stay. We also enjoy a free drink at the bar each day. The only negative point may be the noise coming from the hallway because the room is not that much sound-isolated. Aside from that, we will probably come back again for a future stay in NYC.

title: Trip to New York
text: We had a great time at the hotel. It was always clean and we felt welcome every time we enter to the lobby. The personal is very nice and friendly. The location is really good, very close to Times Square and the theatre area.

title: Hotel ist empfehlenswert
text: Zentral gelegenes Hotel, direkt beim Busbahnhof, nur 10 Gehminuten vom Times Square entfernt. Modern eingerichtete und sehr saubere Zimmer. Freundliches Personal. Für einen Städtetrip sehr empfehlenswert.

title: Not exactly what it says on the label!
text: There is nothing overtly wrong with this hotel, but it's very expensive for what it is. What it is, is NOTHING like the website! The rooms are nowhere near as spacious, and it is nothing like as smart. Our room was comfortable, clean, but there were old stains on the carpet and the furniture was chipped and a bit shabby. The public spaces are functional but neither elegant nor particularly smart. That is the danger with accommodation in NYC - it is astonishingly expensive for what it is. The staff were, on the whole, friendly. Odd opening hours for the bar. European travellers need to note that tea/coffee facilities in the room is not the norm in NYC, and there were none here. There was a fridge, which wobbled about in the bottom of the wardrobe. Also - beware of who you book with; my booking site told me that breakfast was included. It isn't; they don't include it. It is in an excellent location, moments from Times Square, although on the 'edgier' side of town. At least there's some local character! I wouldn't stay there again, but I wouldn't dissuade anyone from going - just be aware that it is very expensive, and compared to hotels in central European capital cities - the standard doesn't come anywhere near.

title: 4 days in NY
text: 10 minutes walking from Times Square and just 1 minute from the Metro station of the JFK line. Cleanliness and quality staff makes the difference. I stayed in the cheapest room, second floor with no city view but comfortable and with a big bathroom.

title: Rude staff
text: 1-I waited 1 hour for check in (and there was no row)2-Rude chew gum man3-The room air conditioning wasn’t cooling. I asked for repairs at the lobby 3 times. Nobody cared.4-We 6 had a flight delay and the hotel didn’t have room for us one more day (but the hotel seems empty)5-We moved to DoubbleTree and loved it.  staff more polite and nice6-I’ll never come back or recommend

title: Good location
text: Free computer and printer provided in the Cafe on the first floor of the hotel.  The hotel is newly renovated and modernly decorated. A lot of restaurants and take-out nearby, good for sightseeing, entertainment and shopping.

title: Strongly Not Recommended
text: My reservation was cancelled on the same day with a valid credit card and sufficient amount of money inside, even though my reservation was a no pre-payment advance option. Moreover I was charged for the stay without any notification or authorization afterwards. I strongly recommend you to go for another hotel for your stay if you would not like bad surprises during your trip.

title: Average at best, service indifferent.
text:
A basic hotel at best. Good location close to time square and right next to good transport links. based on reviews we have read from last year when we booked I can only imagine this has went down hill since then. 

Beds are comfortable and the air condition, despite being an old unit, is very good and keep the room cool. 

The housekeeper staff were very friendly and helpful. 

The main desk staff were indifferent at best some were pleasant and some resolved nothing. We twice reported a broken handle on the toilet in our room that was not fixed so gave up. The room was advertised to have a refrigerator, (still advertised on the website) with fresh water each day. This wasn’t the case. 

When I asked about this we were given a mini fridge that held 6 cans and didn’t keep anything cold - felt a bit short changed by this and it was actually colder putting water on the air conditioning unit than in the mini fridge. As with the broken handle I had to report this twice. 

The coffee in the hotel was well priced and very good quality, the lounge area it’s self was also very nice. 

The bar is advertised as being open until 11 however last drinks are 10:15pm. This could have been advertised better. 

While in the elevator, what appeared to be a manager spoke in a very derogatory fashion towards one of the housekeeping staff. 

Overall it was not the experience we have had before in nyc and we paid a lot more for this hotel. 

My person experience is that I would not use the hotel again when I return to nyc.

title: Good for NYC?
text: Stayed here for 5 nights during our stopover on the way to Hawaii from England. Great service on check in. Very accommodating considering how late we got in. Room was awesome. The bed was extremely comfy and had some of the best sleep while staying here. TV had good range of channels to watch while inside and the rooms were very quiet considering how noisy it can be outside. Having access to computers and printers downstairs for free helped out when we needed to print out stuff. The only bad side was as soon as you step outside you get harassed by people selling you tickets for buses and other things. Walking distance to Times Square and other various spots which helped out. The only thing is if you want to spend sometime down the southern end of NYC you will need to spend money on taxis. Overall a great spot to stay!

title: Such a modern and unique hotel.
text:
We now are given a floor on the 30th floor. Lifts are the only access to the rooms unless you really want to walk the stairs. This hotel is really modern, really well thought out and completed to the highest design standard. I absolutely loved staying here. Its in a great location. 10 minute walk from Times Square, if not a little shorter if you're a quick walker. 15 minutes to the Empire State Building and there is a subway/bus station right across the road for all your transportation needs. We also were really close to tour bus stops which was great! 
The rooms were always clean and the maid service came daily. The front desk were more than helpful and explained everything whenever we had a question. It's a quiet hotel. I could never hear our neighbours from the room even when they'd come in at 3am and head to their room next door, as soon as that door was shut you could not hear a thing. There is a bar that serves some small bites and cakes but we never visited it. Down the road is the famous franchise of Carlos' bakery from Cake Boss and a small local shop for water and snacks if needed. There is a safe in the room that could fit a laptop if needed. The only issue was storage space, for a couple of days it was plenty, if we had stayed a week I don't think we would have fit all of our items in the wardrobe and drawers. I couldn't recommend this place more!

title: Small rooms not for 4 persons
text: Small rooms not suitable for 4 persons   you can hear the street noisesmall bedstoilet opens directly into the room   AC wasn't working properly for two days it's a small Hotel in a Small dirty  street no microwave no tea trayno kettle

title: Perfect
text:
We absolutely loved our stay at the distrikt !

Location was perfect for access to a lot of New York attractions 
Time square is a 3-4 minute walk around the corner and the Empire State Building , Rockefeller centre , grand central , the Chrysler building we’re all within easy walking distance !

The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and all the staff members were always there with good advice and were always very helpful when asked for anything !

Rooms are lovely , not the biggest but very well decorated and kept.

We would 100% return here if we visit NYC again.

Thank you Distrikt Hotel

title: Custo x Beneficio sem igual
text:
Realizei a reserva com antecedência de 6 meses, consegui um valor muito bom, fica perto de tudo bem no meio de Manhattan, fácil acesso ao metro e todas as régios, tranquilo para ir e vir do JFK e LGA de metro. Hotel novo com tamanho de quartos bons para o padrão de NY com diárias acessáveis.
Limpeza excelente e sem nenhum cheiro de mofo apesar de os quartos serem com carpet.
Check in e check out on line, super simples e facil.
Vale muito a pena ficar la.

title: Honeymoon venue #1
text:
My new wife and I travelled flew of on our honeymoon on the 30th July and our first stop was New York City. The Distrikt Hotel was a perfect place to begin our journey. Great location and they allowed us to store our bags for a few hours between landing and checking in. When we told them that we were honeymooners, the receptionist (can’t remember her name, apologies) bumped us up to the 29th floor, which gave us a pretty cool view and a glimpse of the Empire State Building! 
The rooms (we had a 2 night stay to begin the week and a one night stay at the end of the week) had very comfortable beds despite being in the centre of NYC never felt cramped. 
I would recommend The Distrikt to anyone who wants to explore Manhattan that appreciates friendly staff, good AC and having a hotel that is close, but not TOO close to the action!

title: Bien situé et pas trop chère
text:
Alors si vous de vais prendre le bus à Port Autorithy c'est le top , la porte et juste en face .
Le prix que nous avons payer 209 euros la nuit , pour NY reste correct .
La boisson offerte et correct également sans sauter au plafond .
Par contre niveau propreté c'est limite , les fauteuils et les encadrement de lit ultra usé .
Niveau réception sa depand à qui vous avez à faire . sa va de sympa à porte de prison .

title: Pas terrible
text: Grosse déception! Chambre petite sans rangement suffisant sans endroit pour poser les valises, sans vue ou plutôt vue sur le terminal des bus , nous n étions qu au 8eme Etage!! bruit infernal , bus , bruit de la rue et de la chambre voisine !! Vous savez quand le voisin se lave ou regarde la télé ! Manque de chance le notre est rentré à une heure du matin !!Drap déchiré un soir , sale un autre !wifi payant imposé et donne droit à Conso gratuite mais le barman ferme à 22h au lieu des 23h30 annoncé pour discuter avec les jeunes filles ! Tête de lit déchirée, frigo qui coule et dégivre sur la moquette, ....Situation sur la 40 w street proche de la 9eme AV pas le plus beau côte de la rue !! CÔTE POSITIF À 10 mn de Bryan Park et de Time square et pas trop cher !

title: Good location
text: We stayed here for 2 nights in April/May lovely clean hotel room was a little on the small size only reason for giving a 4 the staff were amazing so helpful .... perfect for a short stay in New York would Defo use again

title: fab hotel to stay
text: me and my daughter went to new york for the 1st time and we stayed in distrikt hotel,the staff was very friendly and helpful,every morning we got given 2 tickets for free drinks,the hotel is very close to time square,the room we ad was small but very clean,every day we got new towels and clean bedding.i would 100% recommend distrikt hotel,we will def be back

title: STAY IN NEW YORK
text: very comfortable hotel, very good value for money, very clean rooms.Located in a quiet area near the center.anica negative note, the quadruple room too small. for the return Irecommend it.friendly and helpful staff

title: Great if you don't use internet and love heat and humidity!
text: Free Hotel internet service was extremely slow and signals were weak on 16th floor.Overall air conditioning system is antiquated.  Totally absent in hallways and inadequate for room habitation.  Toilet constantly running and front desk did not respond to the service request.

title: No towels until morning
text:
Cleaner took all the towels bar one hand towel and hotel has no towels until the morning, how can a hotel think this is in any way acceptable. Especially when we had asked for the room not to be cleaned.
Also shame the new owners took away the in room coffee machines.
Other than that good location and comfortable beds, although small for two people.
Lifts can also be a problem with long waits.

title: Bom custo benefício
text: Hotel novo e com acomodações pequenas, mas novas (sem cheiros de mofo); bem localizado (dá pra ir a pé na Times Square); com bom custo benefício; perto do metrô; dá pra ir do JFK pra lá de metrô tranquilamente; e com boas equipes de atendimento.

title: Great
text: Very welcoming from Jason the receptionist and the baggage handler Dennis, the rooms are smaller but very clean and gave us vouchers for free drinks at the bar, the beds were comfortable and it was in the perfect place to get to anywhere in NYC, a subway was nearby and Times Square, very convenient, no pressure to give tips and very relaxing stay.

title: New York visit
text: Fab time love New York hotel very clean great location 2 blocks from time square very friendly staff within walking distance of most attractions great pizza place on the corner loads of bars and good food places close by

title: weekend trip
text: Ross and Adriana (sp?) were two people at this hotel that were integral to our stay in NYC! They were very helpful, kind, and approachable. Our stay wouldn't have been the same without their advice to us, being new visitors to the city. Deff would recommend stay at this hotel, the staff and accommodations are lovely. - E&T

title: Wont stay again
text: It was an average stay. The room could get hot at times. The air didnt work well and other minor problems that added up to wont stay again. This review has to be 200 words minimum so dont book this hotel!

title: Wonderful stay
text: Everything you could ever want,an amazing stay at the Distrikt.our rooms were perfect,cleaned every day and the staff were so friendly and helpful.would like to thank,Rich,Dennis and all the staff for making our stay in New York so memorable.

title: Fantastic
text: District Hotel was lovely , the staff was very friendly, Herman , Peter , and Dennis were excellent, they couldn’t have been more helpful. The hotel was in a great location near Times Square and close to many attractions.

title: Perfect for visiting NYC
text: The location is great. Near all activities.The personnel is very helpful and kind. A special thanks to the kind person who helped us with our luggage. We had a very nice room for our family. The only little negative thing was the loud air conditioner.

title: Great location, restful sleep
text:
Pros:
Location (close to Times Square, metro, restaurants, theater), super comfy beds (we both slept very soundly), no audible street noise in room, fast elevators (virtually no waiting), timely housekeeping, friendly staff (a woman at the reception desk recalled my first name the day after I’d checked in & the man at the cafe was always smiling and pleasant)

Cons: 
No restaurant in hotel or mini bar in room, no cab stand nearby (needed to walk to 8th or 9th to hail a cab), constantly running toilet (we reported it on day 2 & it was never fixed; we just closed the bathroom door at night to muffle the sound), the AC was slightly temperamental, the WiFi stopped working the 2nd day yet we still paid the $25/day fee (we called front desk to inquire but no solution was offered), 1 of the headboards was slightly chewed up (not sure what happened there, but it should be repaired). 

In spite of the cons, I’d recommend this hotel.

title: Great location for Times Square/Broadway
text:
Distrikt is a nice hotel with good sized comfortable rooms. The staff were great and the location on 40th St was excellent. Most of the Broadway theatres are 45-47 St and there is subway entrance at the end of the road. They provided 2 bottles of water a day and drinks vouchers for their bar if you asked for them. 
The reason I did not give them 5 stars is just a few little things. I was on the 24th floor and found the in room wifi very frustrating. When it worked it was very slow but it also dropped out often and made you resign back in several times a day. I have not had this problem elsewhere. Similarly the TV had problems with reception on almost all channels.
There are only 2 lifts and 32 floors so there was often a long wait. 1 night 1 lift was out of order with 20+ people waiting.

They charge a daily "resort fee" of $25 plus tax. I personally think this is just a dishonest way of charging more for the rooms. I understand however it is common in NY. Still dishonest.

title: The best beds ever
text: OMG those beds.. after walking around NYC for hours day & night,we were happy to come back to the most comfy beds for a good night sleep ready for another day exploring.Staff who would always say hello & bye as we pass thru the lobby.  Great location, close but not too close to Time Sq. Only a block away from everything/anything food,theatre,minimart,chemist,shopping etc.

title: Great sleep!
text: My room was clean and spacious. The beds and bedding is very comfortable. I had a busy trip on business but slept so well because of the bed and the quietness of the hotel. It is also close to a great Italian called Tavolta. I would stay at this hotel again. It was great value for money.

title: New York short stay holiday
text: Nice hotel , clean rooms , nice bar area with snacks etc. Location ok but preferred location of previous visit nearer Empire State building. Couldn't find decent place for breakfast anywhere near by. Staff friendly enough but service a bit slow in bar area.

title: Nice oasis in Midtown NYC
text: Great non-touristy option in Midtown.  Location next to Port Authority is good and bad (convenient for travel) (not so nice environment).  Capizzi Pizza right near it on 9th is an authentic Neapolitan style pizza house!

title: This is nice hotel !
text: PAB（ポートオーソリティバスターミナル）近くの立地でタイムズスクエアは徒歩圏内。ミュージカル等含め徒歩圏内で移動可能な立地にあり、どこへ行くにも便利な場所。地下鉄もバス乗り場も近い。フロント始め、清掃スタッフの皆さんの対応も丁寧且つ迅速で滞在期間中楽しく過ごせました。２６階に宿泊しましたが景色は勿論のこと、ベッドの寝心地もよく、快適に過ごせました。またNYに滞在する時には是非利用したいと思います。

title: New york in love
text: Siamo stati ospiti di questa struttura una  settimana  durane la nostra luna di miele ed abbiamo avuto un'esperienza assolutamente positiva: l'albergo  è  centrale  e confortevole,le stanze stranamente ampie e pulite. C'è anche  un comodo bar interno per colazioni o aperitivi comodi. È  davvero  a due passi  da times square e ben collegato sia da metro che bus. Da consigliare!

title: Wow
text: Posizione ottima a pochi passi dalla metro, staff molto cordiale e pulizia ottima, una struttura molto ospitale. Consiglio pienamente grazie e speriamo in una prossima volta( nella speranza di ritornare nella grande mela)

title: Good hotel located near Times Square!
text: Only five rooms each floor, very calm during nights. Very good beds!Location nearby everything you can wish for. We had no breakfast but the bar was nice to spend some time before going to sleep.Would recomment this place to everyone!

title: Great deal, great location
text: They call this neighborhood "Hell's Kitchen" and it is a bit seedy, but it's perfectly located for the theater district, Penn Station, and the "Chinatown" buses.  The hotel itself is clean, modern, and well-appointed - "business class" level.  The lobby restaurant/bar is quite nice (and they give you a free drink) although short on gluten-free options.

title: Excellent
text: Very nice hotel, clean & comfortable. The hotel design with few rooms per floor makes it very quite and private. Great location, just a few minutes walking from Times Square. We will definitely go back.

title: When the price is right; a real gem of a hotel
text:
The hotel itself is excellent, and I've stayed there twice (one in 2012 and then June this year). The reception area is small but the desk staff quite efficient, and there's a nicely sized and staffed bar on the ground floor. The lifts appear to be efficient. The rooms themselves are very spacious and have a very good (if unspectacular) bathrooms. Given the location of the hotel is next to the busy post authority - you're guaranteed a very quiet nights sleep based on my experience. 
Because its next to the bus station the street itself isn't fantastic although not dangerous in any way. And we are talking just about a 300 yard walk. Aside from that its extremely close to the subway and extremely close to Times Square.

The price seems to fluctuate considerably for this hotel, but if you're lucky enough to see it available when it sits at about $150 a night or below (which it often is), then you've a excellent deal.

title: beautiful hotel
text: wonderful, attentive staff.   the only reason you didn't get a 5 is because the bed was uncomfortable.   edges felt lower than the center,  so I felt like I was going to slide off.  other than that, excellent price, location, and staff.

title: Loved the Distrikt Hotel!
text: Enjoyed the Distrikt Hotel, reasonable price for Hell's Kitchen. Overall an exceptional hotel--clean, friendly, perfect location. Especially appreciated that everyone there was so friendly and helpful. Will visit again!

title: Not a 4 star hotel.....
text:
We just spend 3 nights here and booked through priceline as a 4 star mystery hotel which is supposed to include a restaurant. 

Hotel is very small, 4-5 rooms per floor. We had the bigger King room which was nice but small. No actually built in closet, standing one for clothes. Had safe. We only got the water bottles one time and you have to ask for the drink passes every day which is included in the resort fee.

Our issues:
1. No restaurant since new ownership. There is a bar and a few shelves with pre-packed items (cookies, bagel, sandwich) but no waitress or cooked food. 
2. No air condition first night, thankfully they fixed it for 2nd and 3rd nights as it was 90 degrees outside. The lobby was ice cold but elevators, hallways were hot all week.
3. This hotel on priceline is a Times Square hotel but really it is a half block from Hell's kitchen. Not a big deal but block was sketchy with homeless people as you make you way from Times Square down 40th street.
4. Maid service- Very very late for 2nd floor. 5pm first day and after being out all day the 3rd day with clean me sign they came at 6:30pm as we were getting ready for dinner. Told them to please come back in hour, they never did. After dinner we came back to hotel at 10:30pm and room was never cleaned.

Most of our issues was with Priceline as they make this hotel a 4 star and really it is like a Holiday Inn 3 star. When priceline called the Distrikt Hotel manager he never came to phone and told his front desk girl to tell them he did have a restaurant. Not true even on Distrikt hotel website it says market pantry. If we have known it was a 3 star type of hotel we would have felt differently but this hotel is up against Millennium, Sheraton, and the Hyatt right at Times Square for same price.

title: Brilliant hotel
text: Stayed at the hotel two weeks ago and traveling back there for one night before catching a flight home tomorrow. I have been to NY 5 times before but none better then this hotel for size of room and location

title: Fine Hotel in NYC
text:
I have been to NYC a number of time and have passed this hotel a few time since it was built.  It always looked a good hotel but was always just a bit above my value for money quotient.  

I was surprised therefore when I got it at a very good price for 3 nights in late July for our families long American road trip.  

The hotel is located right beside the Piet Authority so very handy if like us you were arriving by coach.  I quick 3 minute walk took us to the hotel and the very efficient staff had us booked in and we got a room on the 8th floor.  The hotel by its design is very narrow so there are only a few rooms on each floor and I was very pleasantly surprised with regards to the size of the room given the notoriously small size of New York rooms.  The room was also equipped with a fridge and safe which was very useful.

Bathroom was a good size and was equipped with a hair dryer. 

My only complaints would be a very minor one that some of the furniture and fittings is starting to show a bit of wear and tear taking away from the slightly higher class of the hotel and secondly ( a bit more important) the mattress in one one of our beds had a noticeable sunken spot were the springs had obviously gone. I could have reported this and seen what would have happened but to be honest my normal awkward sleeping position meant it didn’t affect me too much and with only being there 3 days I couldn’t be bothered. 

Overall I would recommend the hotel and it’s location.

title: Great
text: This is a great hotel. We had a bad experience on the other hotel, and this was an immediate booking for the remaining nights. The room is comparatively large with great bathroom. Overall great experience and great location in Manhattan. I would recommend this hotel.

title: 立地は良い。同じ価格帯で外資系ホテルチェーンのホテルにも泊まれる
text:
立地に関しては申し分がないが、部屋に関しては良くも悪くもないレベル。
値段に関しても外資系ホテルチェーンとほぼ変わらないので、会員ならそちらを利用するのが良いだろう。

受付はフレンドリーであり、英語が話せれば問題ない。
あまり高い建物ではないので、景色に期待する人は別のホテルをおすすめする。
セブンイレブン、Dean & DeLuca、無印良品は1ブロック先にある。

title: Far from perfect -- But they have the power to improve the experience!
text: The hotel has a decent location, the staff was friendly and professional, and the hotel décor was modern and didn't appear worn.  However, the lounge/bar/dining area had poor service and few options.  A bit of effort on the part of the hotel could easily make this amenity a much better experience (install a door into the space to reduce noise and air flow from street, which passes right through the lobby; diversity offerings; provide more staff and easier payment options).  The TV had multiple stations with no signal, but a complaint to the front desk resulted in a quick repair.  But the worst part was the air conditioning in our room.  We spent both nights sweating to death, and getting insufficient sleep.  The hotel didn't have any empty rooms to which to move us, and they didn't even have any fans to get air moving in our room.  At the end of the day, this experience really reduced our overall trip experience -- especially since both the weather and taxis were stifling.  Our only escape was theatres and restaurants!

title: Modern oasis
text: The hotel is on a bustling block. The lobby and room was  modern and well appointed. It was clean. The bed was comfortable. As advertised there was a view and it was quite nice. All in all it was a nice place and the price was good only surprise was the unadvertised $25 resort fee.

title: Midtown's Best Kept Secret
text:
I fly out to New York once a year for a trade show at the Marriot Marquis in Times Square. I hate that particular hotel, and always find better deals in the vicinity. For the longest time, I was a huge fan of the RIU Plaza Times Square, but this year, I wanted to try something different. I came across a killer deal for the Distrikt Hotel on Booking.com, and decided to give it a shot. I must say, it was one of the best stays I've ever had in NYC. Not only was the hotel immaculate on the inside, but the service and staff were an absolute joy to work with. Everyone was super nice and accommodating. The check-in was an easy process, and the location to the Port Authority Terminal & a Chase Bank on the corner made my life so much easier. It was also a quick 15 minute walk to my conference. 

Ross, the bartender at the Collage Bar in the lobby, was an immediate favorite. He was a wealth of information on the fine dining scene, and he made a mean Japanese Slipper cocktail! I also had the pleasure of meeting Chef Wanda Richardson and her assistant James. They were teaching a sushi class in the lounge, and I had the pleasure of observing from the bar. Ross was also kind enough to share his samples! 

I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to others. The rates, location, and service are great for business or personal travelers wanting to be in the heart of Times Square without being too overwhelmed by the street crowds. There also some great pizzerias on the block. I highly recommend the one near the NW corner of 40th/8th Ave (near the New York Times bldg).

title: Just back from New York
text:
