Very good location. One block from hells kitchen so plenty of places to eat , two blocks from times square and Broaway( saw Bet Middler fantastic!) Very helpful and friendly staff.Room was perfect , cleaned every day.
Will definately book here again

title: a Treasure
text: Friendly staff at front desk, room staff, coffee shop.  Room was very clean, modern.  Includes the essential safe and refrigerator.  Convenient location for bus and subway travel, theater district, plenty of local eateries.  Decent price for NYC.   Will definitely look forward to another stay.

title: Posizione ottima
text: Bell'hotel vicinissimo a Times Square di fronte alla stazione degli autobus Port Authority. Unica pecca la colazione che non offrono, ma nelle vicinanze c'è un po' di tutto per mangiare! La camera per 3 persone comoda anche se manca un tavolo d'appoggio. Letti comodi e buona pulizia.

title: Great location, with a big rooms.
text:
Hotel had a great location in the middle of the broadway area. Hotel had all the facilities needed although the AC was a bit outdated and the cleanliness of the rooms could have been better.
Despite this minor issue this hotel is a recommended stay!

title: Fab Trip to NY
text: Excellent rooms. Clean, tidy and well maintained. Perfect location v near to Times Square and many of the midtown attractions. Not cheap but reasonably good value given its location. A minor issue, but we struggled to get food from the Collage bar/café. But the bar service for drinks is good. Most of the time we ate at one of the excellent diners or restaurants in the Hells Kitchen area just north west of the hotel.

title: Excelente localização e estrutura
text:
Hotel no centro de Manhattan, 200 metros do metro, 500 metros da Times Square, próximo do Madison Square Garden e do Empire State...
Quarto espaçoso, Wi-Fi funciona, velocidade boa, enfim recomendo muito esse hotel.

title: The Distrikt Hotel a NYC Gem
text: This hotel is the most friendly staff with clean and well appointed space. Very near to Times Sqaure and great access to excellent restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen. I love this hotel and will book as often for business and personal travel

title: I LOVE this hotel!
text: Friendly, knowledgeable, helpful front desk folks, beautiful (boutique hotel beautiful!) rooms, terrific housekeeping services  -- there's a wonderful vibe in every sense at this hotel.  Never have I felt more a

title: Not a 4 star. Maybe 2
text: Very disappointed with room size , location and staff cordiality. It is definitely not a 4 stars. May be 3 or even 2.  I do not know other rooms in higher floors but mine was tiny , uncomfortable without space for hanging cloth or drawers.

title: Good hotel & Service
text: Good Hotel. Wish there was more elevators so i wouldnt have to wait. Bed was soft, room was spacious. Wish there was a microwave to heat food up or have a card telling customers where to go to heat up food.

title: Does the trick
text: This hotel does the trick in general everything is ok nothing special but nice clean rooms, friendly staff as well as convenient digital features for checkin and checkout. Finally the hotel is conveniently situated in the heart of NY. Would definitely go again there.

title: New York holidays
text: my husband I stayed at this hotel for 3 days. What was surprising is that there was nothing in the room for making a cup of coffee, there was no facilities, when we asked the reception they told us that they had been taken over by new management and that all the teachers and coffee making facilities were taken out of the rooms, which I thought was a poor decision. So, when you arrive, after a long flight or wake up in the morning, you can't have a hot drink you have to go out and buy one. You can only get snacks at the bar on the ground floor, which is limited. Apart from no tea/coffee making facilities the room was comfortable and the staff were friendly and polite.

title: Ottimo e centrale!
text:
Sono stata in quest hotel con mio marito per il viaggio di nozze.
Ottimo nella posizione, personale gentile, pulizia Top! Ed il tocco di classe sta tutto nel letto king! 
Dopo le giornate intense in giro per New York tornare in camera e stendersi su quel letto non ha prezzo!
Consigliassimo!

title: A due passi da Times Square
text: Ho alloggiato in questo hotel per quattro notti.La camera ed il bagno sono  spaziosi per gli standard di New York e sono pulitissimi.Il personale è molto gentile e disponibile.Il punto di forza è la posizione,a pochi passi da Times Square e davanti alla metro.Lo consiglio caldamente.

title: Ένα ξενοδοχείο με όμορφα και καθαρά δωμάτια δίπλα σε όλα τα σημεία ενδιαφέροντος!
text: Επισκεφθήκαμε αυτό το ξενοδοχείο τον Ιανουάριο του 2018. Είναι ένα όμορφο ξενοδοχείο πολύ κοντά σε πολλά από τα δημοφιλή σημεία της Νέας Υόρκης, τα δωμάτια καθαρά και όμορφα διακοσμημένα όπως επίσης και το υπόλοιπο ξενοδοχείο! Όσον αφορά το προσωπικό του ξενοδοχείου, αντιμετωπίσαμε την αγενή συμπεριφορά μίας κοπέλας που δούλευε στην απογευματινή βάρδια του μπαρ καθώς μία από τις πρώτες μέρες της διαμονής μας κατεβήκαμε από τα δωμάτιά μας να πιούμε ένα ποτό και η κοπέλα αρνήθηκε να μας σερβίρει λέγοντας πως το μπαρ έχει κλείσει, (το μπαρ έκλεινε 23:00 κανονικά και η ώρα ήταν 22:45),κάτσαμε στο χώρο προκειμένου να συζητήσουμε το πρόγραμμα της επόμενης μέρας με την παρέα μου και προς έκπληξή μας κατά τις 23:15 η ίδια κοπέλα που μας είχε πει πως το μπαρ έκλεισε και αρνήθηκε να μας εξυπηρετήσει, σέρβιρε δεύτερα ποτά σε ένα άλλο ζευγάρι που καθόταν δίπλα μας!!! Εκτός από την αγενή συμπεριφορά της κοπέλας, όλο το υπόλοιπο προσωπικό ήταν πάντα χαμογελαστό και εξυπηρετικό! Ευχαριστούμε ιδιαίτερα τις καμαριέρες που πάντα είχαν το δωμάτιό μας πεντακάθαρο και το προσωπικό στην υποδοχή που μας βοήθησε και απαντούσε στις άπειρες ερωτήσεις μας! Η Νέα Υόρκη ήταν μια εξαιρετική εμπειρία για εμάς!

title: Great Location
text: Great Location, Very close to Times Square and Prt Authority Bus Station, very good Wi-Fi connection, comfortable rooms. Helpful and kind staff. Housekeeping could be much better. Travelling for bussiness and satisfied a lot.

title: You can beleive the positive ratings
text: Stayed here for a week with a group of friends. The location is perfect; within walking distance of Time Square, Empire State and the High Line, and a subway station to deal with anywhere further afield. Rooms were clean and comfortable, with thick walls so no noise from neighbours. Staff were friendly and helpful. In hotel catering is very limited (don't believe the website menu) but there are hundreds of places to eat within a few blocks which will cater for all palates and wallets. I an so please we booked the Distrikt for our 'holiday of a lifetime'.

title: No bufete desayuno
text: Fui de negocios y placer con mi mujer. En recepción tuvieron un lío con mi reserva y tuve que llamar a booking porque me dejaban sin una reserva de 9 días. Ellos lo arreglaron, aunque el gerente fue muy amable. Fallo, no tienen desayuno ni buffet. En recepción falta cortesía

title: Great Hotel to stay in New York
text: Very enjoyable stay at Distrikt Hotel. Lovely modern rooms with modern bathroom with walk in shower. Fridge in room. Located in a quieter street but only 10 minutes walk to Times Square area. Staff helpful and friendly.Bar in hotel also sells snacks and coffee. Arranged our Taxi to airport $70 and securely stored our luggage on last day. Free Wi-fi.Lots of places to eat and drink nearby. Store on corner selling snacks and drinks. Coffee shop nearby and 2 bros pizza on corner selling great Pizza slices $2 including soft drink.  Lovely place to relax after busy day sightseeing.

title: Comfortable property, service slow but friendly
text: I would have enjoyed this stay more if I was on vacation: for a business trip which was on the hectic side, I wanted everything to move a little faster than it did. The front desk took a long time helping tourists with a wide range of questions while 15 or so other parties waited to check in. Once I was checked in though, provided with a free drink from the bar and with my checked bag dropped off to me, it was a pleasant stay: great city view, comfortable bed and not much noise.

title: Spotless and so convenient
text: My teenage granddaughter enjoyed 3 nights in this friendly  little hotel. The Receptionist welcomed us with a little guide back and gave us some l pointers to help us get our bearings. Only a few minutes from the subway and Port Authority Bus Terminal and walking distance from Times Square.  Our room was quite spacious, with all you could need for a short city visit - good air conditioning, TV, desk, plenty of storage space, nice bathroom and all spotlessly clean.  Our room on the 4th floor didn't have any outlook (onto a bac alley), but then we were only there to sleep. The only thing to point out to two people who are not a couple is no twin beds, so be prepared to share a large double.

title: Good
text:
The Room are clean
The service was good. We just have some issue with the valet parking (Wait for mode than 2 hours). 
Good location 5 minutes from Time Square ! 
IT was long on the morning to have our breakfeast.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Hotel moderno, pulito, confortevole, personale sempre gentile ed attento ad ogni esigenza. Dal 19mo piano si godeva anche di una discreta vista. Ottima la posizione, a pochi passi da Times Square, ha contribuito a rendere perfetto il nostro soggiorno e i nostri infiniti tour a NY

title: City break to the Big Apple
text:
Myself and my two sisters and our husbands stayed at the Distrikt hotel last weekend to celebrate a family birthday.... and it proved to be the perfect base for us. In particular I must mention Denis who was so helpful in reception. He gave us travel advice and restaurant recommendations that really added to our stay. Thank you so much Denis. 

My only negative experience at the hotel was the abrupt manner in which one of the bar staff spoke to me regarding a tip. I had inadvertently forgotten to tip him (as it is not something we do regularly in the UK) and he made his displeasure very clear. As soon as I realised my omission I apologised and added a tip. However this incident and the way he spoke to me really put a dampener on the whole evening. He could quite easily have just quietly and politely reminded me of the tipping culture in America.... after all good manners and human decency should be the same no matter where you are in the world!

title: Overpriced and the rudest manager I’ve ever come across
text:
Was really looking forward to our stay at Distrikt given the amazing reviews. However after booking I believe the hotel changed hands. When we booked, our room was meant to have a coffee machine as part of the in room amenities and our room was to include a basic “to go style” breakfast. The problems started before we even arrived. After checking our booking online a few months prior to our trip I noticed the room price had increased a few hundred dollars. After I got the run around from one staff member I was finally told that a hotel tax had been introduced. However it was introduced after we booked! It should not be expected that this new tax would be applied to existing bookings, but it was.  After much emailing back and forward I managed to have the hotel tax removed. The other issue was they stopped including breakfast! And expected that I would be fine not receiving it. HARDLY! Half the reason we chose Distrikt was that breakfast was included and a coffee machine in the room. After more emailing back and forth they said they would manage to sort something out for us. Then once it came to checking in there was no record of breakfast to be included. I tried sorting this issue out with the hotel manager, Rich I believe his name was, who was SOOOO rude I cannot even begin to describe! People like him should really not be working in hospitality. He is an absolute disgrace to the hotel. He didn’t even have the courtesy to look up my booking, just blatantly just said no, he wants proof! Even though I had been through this via email with another staff member.  So 3 days in to a 4 days stay and still no breakfast. On a side note there’s the most amazing cafe a few doors down with $2 everything, lifesaver!!
All of the other staff were lovely, Linda and Sahara especially. 
Another few negatives on the hotel were its location. While it is really central, it’s in a pretty dodgy area and felt quite unsafe especially at night. 
Also, there are two elevators in the hotel and they take forever!!!! Think we waited about 8 minutes one morning. 
The rooms are small, but it’s New York I guess! Would be nice to at least have a kettle with tea and coffee making facilities. 
End of the day I wouldn’t stay here again. Even with 50% off ($270 USD) when I booked it was still too much for the quality and service at Distrikt.

title: Great Trip!!
text:
We’ve just got back from our 4 day city break to The Big Apple 🍎 
The Distrikt Hotel was a good place to stay , it’s not far from anywhere and the staff (especially Dennis ) were very helpful , he recommended “Westways “ for breakfasts which we loved so much we went back each morning , helped us find our way around and sorted out our hop on hop off bus tickets , nothing was too much trouble for him 🙂
The bed was very comfortable , good shower , hairdryer /iron and ironing board in room and the little downstairs bar was a comfy place to sit with a G&T after a busy day of sight seeing and lots of places to eat within walking distance

title: Great Hotel for Our Short Stay
text:
We went to New York to watch a show in Broadway, so we had to find a hotel that was available with short notice. There were less expensive options, but was tempted by the reviews.
The good:
- Helpful and courteous staff. It did not matter who was there from: restaurant recommendations that included local reviews and thanks to the Asian gentleman with the ponytail watching out for my budget; the two ladies who were kind and thorough with our checking in and out; and even when I went down to get water the young gentleman who was new from Texas got out of the counter and moved the container for me and put it back.
- Clean rooms and bathrooms.
- Enough towels, an extra blanket and they had 2 robes for us.
- The location was also great, a walk to everywhere from Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, the dock for tours, Broadway, great food, and is not too busy with cars and droves of people when you walk out.
The suggestions:
- Just bigger/more toiletries for groups of 4.
- The tour persons may need a spot away from the door, they block weary incoming guests from coming in.
Don't worry  about breakfast, there's a relatively good cafe 2 doors down wit $2 each for everything from whatever coffee/tea and bagels.

We plan to go back to NY and stay here again.

title: confortável e boa localização
text: hotel novo, confortável, quarto espaçoso para os padrões de Nova York. localizado ao lado do terminal Port Authority, em Midtown. perto das principais atrações turísticas e metrô bem próximo. Atendimento cordial na recepção e limpeza dos quartos eficiente.

title: Excellent option
text: Great location (close to Port Authority, Subway and Times Square). Staff very friendly and extremely helpful (Rick and Peter are outstanding). Rooms are very clean. Restaurant with good food options. High speed internet.

title: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location. Would definitely recommend it to anyone. Clean,comfortable and friendly staff.
text: Excellent hotel in a fantastic location. Would definitely recommend it to anyone. Clean,comfortable and friendly staff.nice quite bar on ground floor to hang out after a day or night taking in the sights and sounds of time square .

title: Functional hotel, awful location, great staff
text: We stayed here for three nights whilst visiting New York. The hotel is a business hotel and functional but the heating is really old and decor is boring. The area surrounding it is not great. At night it didn’t feel safe to walk the streets surrounding the hotel. The bar associated with the hotel is also not to be recommended. The bartender couldn’t make most cocktails, despite it being happy hour. The staff were lovely but unfortunately we wouldn’t go back. We’d rather pay a little more and be in a nicer area of New York. Having said that it is only a 5 minute walk to Times Square so location is convenient for that.

title: Excellent location
text: Very well location but before we go there , we called the hotel to arrange us a shuttle car to take us from the airport to the hotel and they said ok at 07:30 the car would be at the airport . We arrived at 8:00 and there was no car there , we were calling them and kept saying that the car would come in 15 minutes . 1 hour and 30 minutes passed and no one came to pick us, so they lied to us and that was so bad. This is unacceptable and they delayed us 1 hour and 30 minutes by lying about the car without informing us .

title: Excellent hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights on the 20th floor returning home yesterday. Our stay was faultless, from the staff to the room to the location. Front counter staff were friendly and helpful and were sincere in their manner. Our room was cleaned every day to a high standard. The room itself was large with a very nice bathroom and shower. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable. There was no noise from outside or other guests. We used the bar twice and found it very good, prices comparable considering it was a hotel bar. I would thoroughly recommend it and would definitely return.

title: Couples first visit for 40th Birthday Celebration, July 9-12, 2018
text: This is a very lovely hotel. Great location in the heart of Times Square. The staff was very personable. The rooms were very clean and just enough space for us. The shower pressure was awesome! Was given drink promo coupons on the first day we checked in to the hotel's lounge. At check out, they agreed to keep our bags another 3 hours since our flight was later. We would certainly stay here again!

title: Great Location. Served its purpose
text: Great location served its purpose. Clean room. Decently priced. Walking distance to Time Square. I would stay here again. Workers were friendly accept the hostess working the night shift. Otherwise 5 stars

title: Excellent pricing & location
text: Loved this hotel and very happy I came upon it. Excellent location to walk around Broadway, decent room sizing, bar downstairs with super friendly staff. And EXCELLENT pricing! Will definitely return soon!!

title: Viaggio a New York
text: La vista spettacolare dal ventottesimo piano; la cortesia, disponibilità e simpatia di tutto il personale; la posizione comodissima a due passi da Times Square. Quando torneremo a New York, sicuramente soggiorneremo di nuovo presso questo bellissimo albergo.

title: Would stay here again
text: An excellent rating is very rarely given by me. We selected the Distrikt Hotel based on its central location and reviews.  I did follow one reviewers recommendation to request a room on one of the higher floors. W 40th St can be noisy - it's across from the Port Authority.  I was looking for a hotel that would provide easy access to mass transit and also be close to areas that I could walk to. Distrikt Hotel met the bill. Rich Valles, the Director of Front Office was especially helpful during our stay, along with everyone else.

title: Great little spot
text:
First time staying at this Hotel. Very central location , and very accommodating staff. Rooms very clean, and nice little bar / eating spot within the Hotel. Will stay again when visiting NY.  

About a 15 min walk from the Javits Centre, and close to Time square as well.

Ask for a quite room at the back not facing the street .

title: Okay, not sure how it is in top 100 in city - Super small rooms no amenities in room or hotel
text:
I chose this hotel over others based on it's location #86 out of 306 hotels in NYC. I expected a lot more based on this scoring and the reviews left below.  I would say this is fine, it is clean and near subways. 

However, the rooms are small even by NYC standards. I tend to stay at least once a month and these are tiny.  And there no common amenities in the room or available such as a coffee machine or ice.  You can call for ice - it took 35 minutes the first time and 1 hour the second time.  There are also no amenties in the hotel.  The downstairs bar closes by 10:30 pm and there are no food options besides chips.  No vending in the hotel either. 

The worst part has to be the elevators.  There is no service elevator which means that you are stuck with the workers going exactly one floor and it will stay on floors for minutes at a time. In general you will need to give yourself 8 -10 minutes to go up or down. 

I also booked the city view king room (the highest class room they offer).  Again, it was incredibly small and the city view was the parking garage next door.  Quite disappointing.  

The room is clean, the staff is fine.  It is nothing extraordinary even when you pay for such. I think there are better options, but it is fine.

title: Dope stay and price point
text: We had some slight issues in our room. But the Director of the Front Office names Rich, made sure we felt accommodated to the highest standard. His staff was top notch as well. My review would've been a 5 of not for the small issues in our room.

title: Nice spot to rest after a busy day.
text:
We enjoyed the hotel.  Rooms are adequate size ( remember it's NYC), clean, beds are immaculate and comfy.  Air conditioning worked amazingly well and felt great after 90 degree days.  Bathroom was fine.  Staff was very accommodating and welcoming; the little lounge is a great place to recoup a little of the resort fee you pay.  
One note - the neighborhood is quite busy as you're staying between Port Authority and Penn Station.  Plus is you're near the transportation hubs, negative is that the storefronts and sidewalks aren't as well kept as midtown area, and there's a very bustling atmosphere.  But this hotel itself is a perfectly nice place to stay, and I've stayed in many NYC locations.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: Can highly recommend this hotel.A good night's sleep bang in the heart of NYC.Staff accomdating to your every needs.Bell boys superb...duty manager...excellent.....customer services second to none.Will be back again!

title: Distrikt Hotel NYC
text: We had our honeymoon here and had a great time. The hotel is perfectly placed close to Times Square and has all the things you would need. Staff are friendly and helpful so couldn't ask for more. Great choice of drinks in the bar as well as basic bar snacks. Room was bigger than expected and was clean and tidy with a decent view.

title: Excellent Hotel, just perfect!!
text: Stayed here for 6 nights and we had the most amazing time. Hotel is in an excellent location, 10 minutes walk from Times Square in a quiet and safe area and the subway station is at the end of the street. Lots of lovely bars, Cafes and restaurants nearby. Staff are very helpful and courteous, Rich was so helpful.  I have to mention Dennis who was so helpful and attentive, nothing was to much trouble for him.  Excellent rooms, my room on the 32nd floor had great views of the city and was surprisingly large. The bed is the most comforable bed ever. Bathroom is great and the complimentary dressing gowns were a nice touch. There is an excellent fridge for guest use. Each floor of the hotel has only 5 or 6 guest rooms so it was very quiet with no slamming doors! The hotel provides guests with 2 drinks vouchers each day which can be used in the bar to purchase cocktails, spirits and soft drinks which was a geat gesture. I would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly return again. Thanks for making our first visit to NYC so memorable and give our best wishes to Dennis!!

title: Amazing from start to finish!
text: Having experienced hotels around the world—I can honestly say that we had the best experience ever from start to finish. Rick, Peter and Dennis in particular took care of our every need. We truly will come back when we visit the city again. And we will recommend it to all our friends. The location is convenient and safe...lots of good food and drink all around. Best choice around. The DeMarco’s will be back

title: Centrally located, close to Subway and Times sq
text:
The hotel is a very well planned hotel, as compared to other hotel rooms, this hotel is roomier, has more floor space which is great if you have lots of luggage. The luggage bellboy assists with a smile on his face. The people are really cool and very cooperative, intending to always help the customer in any way possible. Especially Ms. Cinquitti and Ms. Daria are very helpful, they are untiringly and extraordinarily hospitable and welcoming.
I'd definitely be back soon.

title: Distrikt Hotel
text: The hotel was very nice and in a great location! The staff was very helpful and it was a very easy and quick checkout, check-in experience. Overall a great hotel and would strongly recommend if staying in NYC

title: Manhattan Posh
text: The Distrikt is, as the hotel bills itself, affordable luxury in Manhattan.  It is within a stone's throw of the frenetic activity of Times Square, but that means the city as a whole is made accessible by the hotel's location.  Treat yourself to a comfortable and swanky joint here.

title: Great place to stay
text: Good hotel. Super friendly and helpful staff. Very central to get around. Rooms not overly big but certainly fine for me as I was travelling alone.  I missed not having tea/coffee making facilities but it doesn't appear to be common in bigger cities. Places close by where can get tea/coffee all hours of day.  Clean and neat rooms. Feels safe area.

title: Excelent night
text:
Me and my family only stayed one night and the service was excellent, very central position, near the city and they answered all our questions.

muy agradecidos.

They stored our luggage while we visited the city, for which we are very grateful.

Than'ks for all attentions.

title: 50th birthday celebration
text: Very good hotel nice room it was very clean and view from window was of Times Square and other side was the Empire State Building, only 5 min walk to Times Square. Would stay here again as staff were friendly

title: Nyc stay
text: Good location to visit all tourist attractions and close for the subway and bus links. No complaints with the service of the hotel. Very very clean. Bar opens at variable times and could do with a more consistent opening hours.

title: Basic and clean - but good
text:
A small hotel just a couple of blocks from Times Square. 
Room and bathroom very small, but all we needed it for was sleeping and showering.
Reception staff, especially Linda was extremely friendly and helpful. 
Good place to use as a base.

title: Budget Option close to everything
text: Great price, renovated modern room - although a weird shower where water can get through the door onto the tile. Still, a very nice bathroom. Plenty of space overall. Located right next to the Port Authority which brings down the niceness just a tad. Would definitely stay here again, particularly if close to Penn Station for the next trip.

title: Stranger walked in on me in the morning
text: I booked this hotel due to it's close proximity to Port Authority as I was meeting my husband in the city and he was getting in on the bus after dinner which made it very convenient. Room was very comfortable and clean. Robes in the room are nice. We checked in after 8pm and woman at front desk was very friendly. This was our first time staying in this hotel, and I would have given the hotel a very good rating, except for the fact that our room was given to someone else before we checked out and a strange man walked in on me as I was getting dressed in the morning. Not a nice way to start the day. There are no safety locks on the doors so he was able to walk right in.

title: Lovely hotel, most staff lovely but one gentlemen tried on reception
text:
Overall stay was great.  Location fab, room lovely and very modern and clean.  

On arrival after a 7 hour flight we were tired and arrived at precisely 2.05pm.  
We’re told room wasn’t ready and would have to wait in lobby as it would be ready in 55 minutes. 
Although not explained we realised it must be because church in is 3pm.
We were not shown where bathroom was to freshen up just told to sit and they would tell us when room ready.   
Many other guests arrived during this time and were all given rooms.
We spoke to an Irish couple who arrived st exactly same time as us and they were given their room immediately.  
We sat until 3.10pm and staff walked by us not informing us room ready.   We therefore went to stand in line st reception where the gentleman kept taking other guests that arrived after us instead of us like we were invisible.  
Eventually we weee taken and I asked if room was ready as we had been waiting over an hour and that nobody had spoken to us since we were told to sit in lobby st 2.05pm.
I was very rudely informed “Just for your information madam, check in is at 3pm and there is no early check in here”
There was no need to be spoken to in this manner, I was not questioning the check in time, merely saying we had waited over an hour and that nobody had come to tell us room was ready.  
Not good impression from this hotel.  The other gentleman and two females were lovely but this guy needs to learn some manners.  
Also if no early check in, how come about 8 other guests were checked in that arrived same time or within the hour and fifteen minutes that we waited.  
Morning staff were brilliant and extremely helpful.  
This guy needs to go on a customer services training course.

title: Nice Hotel
text: elevators too slow and very annoying. The carpet in the room is not hygenic. the kit in the toilet and in the room  were  poor. Absence of a real hall. Gym is  too far from the hotel. laundry prics very expensive.

title: The best beds in NYC
text: Close to Time Square but not too close, close to Metro's but the best was the beds. The most comfortable ever and you NEED comfort after walking day & night all over the city. We slept all thru the night

title: Best front desk staff in NYC!
text: From the moment we got to this hotel, we enjoyed a top notch service delivered by a great staff. Linda from the front desk was the highlight of our day - everyday. Her positivity is contagious and she was entertaining! Couldn’t thank her more for making our stay at hotel very enjoyable!

title: Handy location, good value for money
text: Walking distance from Port Authority which is the main bus/train station close to Times Square. It is close to big name hotels nearby. It is good value for money. Front desk staff could be more responsive

title: Receptionist made our stay
text: Amazing stay at this hotel, very chic.  Have to shout out to the receptionist Linda for greeting us the way she did.  After arriving at the hotel after a long flight, she made us laugh so hard with her humour.  Outstanding woman with a great attitude.  Love you Linda :)  Would most definitely stay here again if back in NYC.  Great location to, few blocks away from Time Square.

title: Great Service , Location and Rates
text: Great location and so close to Theater and midtown shopping. Outstanding front desk person, Linda Shell, She was our Concierge with great dining tips and greeted us so warmly on our arrival and throughout our stay. Richard, the manager, was also very helpful and made us feel so much at home. Dennis, the bellman , was also so helpful and courteous-always smiling and nothing was too much to ask of him. The rooms were very nice size for NYC and the bathrooms were all updated. We will definitely be back -such a pleasant experience.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
Friendly an efficient check in by Rich & Jason as the room wasn't ready Dennis kindly stored our bags. On our return the room was ready nice and spacious for New York, very clean  and as it was a room at the back, quie
We only stayed for 3 nights but it was very enjoyable.Used the bar as you get a drinks voucher each night which can be used for alcohol,soft drinks or tea and coffee. Bar is ok but needs better lighting as it is difficult to tell if it is open or not.
Location is great on the edge of Hells Kitchen with some great restaurants and bars around and prices better than Times Square

title: good value for the location
text: Rooms were clean.  Service was good.  We arrived early and since our room was not ready they stored our bags.  Valet parking was difficult since when we pulled up there was place for our car.  The location to midtown is great and the price was good value.

title: Distrikt Hotel Review
text: recently stayed for a long weekend at the hotel to celebrate 60th birthday, had a fantastic time. Service was excellent the staff was accommodating, room would benefit to a updated , and dusting, but overall the bed was comfortable for a good night sleep.

title: Vacation stay
text: Nice location in proximity of Times Square.  Disappointed at check-in as we expected the 2 rooms we booked would have been adjacent or at least on the same floor as it was reserved/paid far in advance.

title: Nice hotel but iffy location
text: The hotel was quite nice and staff attentive. The location, behind port authority,  was dirty and noisy with tons of crowds.  But inside was an oasis. Quiet rooms, well appointed. I didn't use the bar but it seemed hopping morning and evening.  If it was located elsewhere I may have given it 5 stars.

title: I'll be back!
text: Good hotel, perfect location! I've stayed here before for business and now booked it again for a holiday. Hell's Kitchen is a nice area to stay in and this hotel is the perfect place to stay for business or pleasure

title: Great location and price
text: Nice staff, very welcoming, clean rooms and restrooms, free drink a day per guest , gym entrance free , located near bus and Times Square, 15/20 minute walk to Chelsea. I would recommend staying at this property !

title: Staff helpful. Room not great
text: This hotel is not what we wanted. The tour operator booked us the cheapest room and that was not what we wanted for a special holiday. It’s not the hotels fault. They say cozy and it was certainly snug. The room was dark and seen better days, units damaged and holes in wall where items removed. But it was clean, beds changed, and everything worked. The location might be great for Times Square, but you need to seriously think whether you want to be at the side of the bus station. Plus side is the staff were really helpful and would helpful with anything.

title: Great hotel
text: For my first trip to NYC, it was a great place to spend my birthday. Very centrally located, clean, with friendly, helpful staff. The proximity to the Port Authority Terminal was handy. I would stay there again on a future trip.

title: WORST SERVICE EVER
text:
It was my first time in NYC and we were excited about the trip. 
When we arrived at the hotel, the check-in took around 20 minutes. 
After that, we were send up to the room. The room was okay.
On the next day, we went for breakfast (we had breakfast included), and the front office agent did not trust us and asked us to go back to the room to take the proof. After we did that, they were no apologies and the employee was rude with us. 
On the same evening, we talked about the situation and Linda told us that she was going to offer 10% discount on the total stay as a compensation for the trouble caused. During the check-out, we found at that the discount was not applied and we were treated like liars when we talked about it.
Moreover, Linda told me and I quote: "I never confirmed you that and you won't get your 10% discount so please leave the hotel". As a Hotelier who works in a hotel in London and Paris, I was shocked about the situation. I never met someone in my whole life like LINDA who was as rude as that. 

As a hotelier and customer, I would recommand you to AVOID this property and specially to AVOID LINDA.

title: Great Hotel & Location
text: Great location just a couple of blocks from Times Square.  We booked as a family of 5 staying 4 nights.  We had 2 rooms (1402 & 1602), both were very clean and well decorated.  Our rooms were on middle-floors overlooking the Port Authority Car Park, this wasn't an issue because we were out all day/evening.  Staff were friendly and polite

title: SUCH A BAD EXPERIENCE NEVER AGAIN
text: Dirty room with stuff from previous client when we arrived . We booked room with breakfast included, we were refused our breakfast, we had to go and fetch proof in our room of the booking . So called manager at reception didn't even excuse for the bother . So we complained , and Linda ( who also said she was manager ) offered us 10 % discount, what we accepted . Finally when we checked out she denied this and was very rude with my son . At arrival, like most of hôtels in NY, we were offered a voucher which allows free fills of 2 bottles of water per day . Next day, Linda said we finally coudn't get this .  So this hôtels offers you things, and finally takes it back . Please avoid Linda who is dishonest and rude .

title: Dirty bathrobe
text: The price for the hotel was great, the location was a little scary. The staff was amazingly friendly, the offer for a free drink was great but I never used it due to being turned off from the dirty robe that I had put on and realized that someone cleaned their nose on it.

title: Such a bad experience never again !!
text: At arrival room was dirty with stuff from previous client , windows and mirrors very dirty . We booked and payed breakfast included . They first refused to give breakfast , we had to go and fetch the proof in the room . No excuses at all from the so called manager . After those bad experiences we were promised 10 % discount from another so called manager named LINDA . She confirmed several times all was set - up for the discount. When leaving she completely denied and was very rude . Very very expensive for very very bad service hotel . Don't believe whatever Linda says, she will deny afterwards .

title: Convenient to the theater district, but lacking in some basic comforts.
text:
We stayed for one night at The Distrikt Hotel so we could see a Broadway show. The hotel is very convenient to the Broadway theater district and reasonably priced for NYC. The lobby was small but adequate and we were greeted quickly on our arrival. Since our Broadway show was before check-in time, they stored our suitcase for us and completed all of our check-in except for giving us our room key. They automatically added another mandatory $25 to the published room rate for add-ons such as 2 drinks in the bar, bottled water in the room, WiFi, and some other amenities that I consider to be standard. We ran into this in another large city recently, so I guess it's becoming just another way to get more money out of us.

After we got out of the show and went back to the hotel to retrieve our suitcase and get our room key, the clerk at the counter was confused and seemed to want to go through the whole check-in process again. Finally, another clerk who overheard what was going on told him how to handle it, and we got our room key. Our room appeared to be neat and clean and the air-conditioner was working very well; however, there were numerous flea-sized bugs flying and crawling around the drain in the middle of the bathroom floor. The countertop around the bathroom sink was very small and did not provide enough room for personal toiletries or clothes. The toilet didn't have a lid, so we couldn't even close the lid to place clothing on top of it. I certainly didn't want to place even my dirty clothes on the floor with the small bugs. The shower was a walk-in shower with only a very small lip (maybe 1/4 inch) between the shower enclosure and the bathroom floor. The lip was not sufficient to keep the shower water from flowing into the main bathroom area, resulting in a very soggy bathmat.  In the bedroom area, electrical outlets were very limited. For instance, the desk had a single electrical outlet with 2 plugs. Both plugs were being utilized by the TV and desk lamp, leaving nowhere to plug in a laptop computer or charge a phone. The same was true on the nightstand, although the alarm clock did have USB plugs on the back.

We did not complain to management, nor did they inquire how we enjoyed our stay when we checked out the next morning. If we had been staying more nights, I would have requested a different room. I will certainly try another hotel the next time we visit NYC.

title: Superb hotel
text:
Can’t really question any element of this hotel. It was a lovely stay with the staff very welcoming from the moment we set foot in the hotel. 

Location - superb. It’s next to port authority bus station if you wish to explore further. One word of caution is to avoid the huge line of open top bus tour sellers as you leave the hotel; just don’t make eye contact. 

The hotel itself, very clean. The room was cleaned each morning we were there. The shower (and I am a shower snob) was immense. I can only measure the room on paying extra for the superior room, which was very much worth it. It’s a boutique hotel, which works. 

The only slight negative was the new barman when we arrived - although helpful was struggling, but he was a nice guy and I’m sure will be fully up to pace now. 

Hopefully get the chance to come back one day in the not too distant future.

title: Home base for 2 college tours...
text: We will be back!!!  Had a great, quick trip into the city with my daughters to check out two universities at opposite ends of the city. Distrikt was just about in the center and was also just a 2 block walk to all of the Times Square action.

title: Great location, good price, nice hotel.
text:
We were looking for a hotel in New York that was near Times Square, not too expensive and for that, this hotel was great. We only really used it as a place to sleep - we were all too busy exploring New York to spend much time in the room or the hotel so I don't have a review for the bar. It seemed nice though. 

The hotel room was reasonable, maybe a bit on the small side but that didn't bother us. There wasn't much of a view from our room but the air-conditioning was great and it was really quiet.

The only slight issue we had was that, on our second to last day, we requested an item we were told would be sent up - but it wasn't. 

Other than that, the stay was great. Definitely would recommend the hotel

title: Amazing time at Hotel and New York
text:
Came home today, 23 June 2018, having had an amazing time staying at the Districk hotel, NYC, central for everything.  The hotel has everything you need, only thing is that english kettle, tea and coffee in your room, when you wake up..but minor..the staff are so welcoming..Ross the barman who can give you any information you require.. Dennis will take your bags, organise a taxi for airport, thank you Mark..and lovely manager, Every one can't do enough..thank you to all the staff..Will book for next year.

Room 604 
Mr & Mrs Davies
*****

title: Tolles Hotel
text: Sehr gutes Hotel, tolle Lage. Direkt bei der New York times. 10 Minuten zum Times Square.l Nebenan Kaffee, Bäcker und Pizza.. würde es wieder buchen. Das Zimmer ist groß und sauber. Personal sehr freundlich.

title: High recommended
text: Stayed at the Distrikt for 5 nights last week. Highly recommend the hotel. Friendly, pleasant staff, especially Linda and Dennis! Very clean and comfortable, shirt distance from Times Square. Overall a fantastic stay!

title: Great place to stay
text: This hotel was an excellent choose for our stay. The location was great within walking distance to many places. The rooms and hotel was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful especially Linda. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel.

title: Fab boutique hotel
text: Fantastic hotel to stay in, with really friendly staff who couldn't do enough for you. Lovely room with a great view from 30th floor. Fab location, 5 mins walk to Times Square and right beside Carlos Bake Shop and Port Authority Bus Terminal to catch bus to shopping outlets in New Jersey. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great service!
text: Convenient location, close to the Javits Center and Times Square. Very helpful desk staff. Clean and quiet. The only drawback was that the room was very small, but since I was traveling alone for business, it didn't make a difference. I would definitely stay at the Distrikt Hotel again.

title: Det duger, men......
text: Trevlig personal samt rent och fräscht på rummet. Dock har dom ett väldigt fult trick att dra av dig mer pengar. I priset ”ingår” en voucher dagligen som du får en fri drink,vatten på rummet mm. Oavsett om du nyttjar detta eller inte så bli du debiterade 100 usd (onsda=sönd). USELT!!!

title: A little gem of a hotel
text: We chose the Distrikt because of price and location and were very pleased with both. Loved the little bistro in the back where we could get breakfast, coffee, and wine. Rooms were surprisingly spacious and very clean. Service was welcoming. No complaints whatsoever

title: First time in New York, perfect location!
text:
-Front staff was very friendly! 
-Room was clean and was cleaned thoroughly everyday
-There is a resort fee you need to pay which is not included in the hotel cost which is $25US/day but includes a free drink/coffee/tea, water bottles, wifi, gym access
-Roughly around a 10min walk to times square, 2 min to the nearest subway (perfect location)
-Rooms were adequate for new york 
-Not loud and busy as a hotel in times square 
-After a red eye flight we asked to check in early around 12pm and they mentioned they could have the room set up for us but ended up telling us it would be another hour and to come back in. We came back an hour later and they mentioned it was not ready and to call us in half an hour so we called back and they then mentioned the room would not be ready until check in time which was 3pm. It was a little frustrating at first but they apologized and mentioned they were low on staff and gave us a free drink to make up for it.

title: I woke up to be confronted by......
text: ....blood on my comforter, on the side closest to my face.  I was horrified and immediately discussed this with management and the housekeeping supervisor who came to inspect.  She stated that the blood was "old" and the comforter had been washed between uses, though I am not sure how she could "confirm" this. Even so, a blood stain on the comforter is unacceptable.  I was totally grossed out, and still am.  The hotel offered me a 50% refund, which I have yet to see 12 days later (though it should have been a 100% refund in my opinion).  I will never, ever, ever stay here again.  If you do decide to visit this hotel, note that there is no security chain/bolt on the bedroom door.  Also, the hotel will add a mandatory $25 per night "service fee" to your bill (beyond the quoted price). This fee, which is sneaked in under the radar, is becoming ubiquitous in NYC and is an unjustified way to raise hotel prices.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: only disappointment was taking our own overnight bags to room ourselves.  At first I was a little suspect of location but then I found it to be very in walking distance to many desirable locations. I found the price to be reasonable.

title: Excellent location and comfortable stay
text: Everything about the Distrikt Hotel was great. Clean and comfortable room and has a terrific location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I loved getting a free drink and it was a decent size too! Great way to end the evening. Hope to stay there again in the future.

title: Sehr gutes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis
text:
Die Nähe zu Central Parc und 5th Av ist sehr gut.
Die nähere Umgebung ist etwas schmuddelig. Das Hotel selbst ist einfach aber sauber. Frühstücksmöglichkeiten in näherer Umgebung an vielen Stellen. Wlan nicht sehr stabil. Gute Fenster, kaum Strassenlärm zu hören. Personal freundlich. Preise für NYC sehr gut. Kann man ohne weiteres empfehlen.

title: Happy staying in New York
text:
Very happy and satisfied  with service and locations. Closer to all icons and easily accessible to transport. Will recommend to visitor who likes walking around. City of New York  is one of you must 
see😮😀

title: Functional and well positioned
text: Good location close to restaurants and shopping. Close to transport and only 2 blocks from 7th avenue. Our room was small but more than adequate for a short stay. It was clean and the bathroom very modern and functional. The room was quiet at night and the staff were friendly and obliging.

title: Excellent!!
text: We cannot say enough about how great our stay at Distrikt Hotel was! The service was excellent from front desk staff to door men to bartenders. The rooms were modern and very clean. Great location close to Times Square. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Another quality stay at the Distrikt
text:
Its was our second visit to the Distrikt Hotel and was not disappointed with the hotel one bit.
Reception staff were super helpful , printing us information off to help us with our next days travels.
The two guys helping with luggage were helpful and always very polite.
Rooms are lovely and clean with all you need.
Great location for all midtown locations and subway stations.
The only one minor negative was 2 out of the 3 bar staff we came across were really slow.
On our last 2 nights there was a different guy who was really helpful ,carrying drinks to your table with you and didn't have people sat waiting at the bar.
We will be booking the Distrikt on our next visit to New York.

title: Distrikt hotel
text:
Very clean, Great position.  Close to Times square,  subway, buses, lots of eateries etc. Awesome staff, everyone polite and happy to help with anything. Made us feel very comfortable. One lady even took me to the subway station to help me operate machine to buy my subway tickets! Definitely going to stay here next time we're in New York city.  
Mansfield's

title: Excellent stay and hotle
text: We visited distrikt hotel on 3rd June for 4days , lovely hotel beds really comfortable and location perfect for visiting attractions . All the staff are really friendly and will help you any way they can from the manger Richard whom was great and the lads Peter and Dennis whom looked after our luggage , Shereen  Webb on reception who lent us the use of her mobile so we could ring our taxi back as we couldn't get through on the phones she went above and beyond her job , to Mary our maid whom kept our room lovely and clean . You all made our stay that much better you are a credit to the hotel . Thank you for the most amazing stay and experience . Would highly recommend this hotel

title: 5 day in new york
text: A well place hotel easy walking Distance to Times square and lots of attactions. Room on the small side but ok as we only realy slepted here. Bar prices on the high side even for New York. Reception staff were good and most staff were very helpful. One barman was realy poor very quiet for a barman and on a few ocasions left the Bar unattended even though he had plenty of customers. We would use this hotel again as it right next to hell's kitchen area with loads of great priced restaurants and bars.

title: Negatives exceed positives
text:
Room not ready until 4pm. No fridge, safe didn’t work, 1 bedside lamp and uncomfortable bed. Our beer on tap in bar not available for 3 days. 
 
Positives...location was terrific....easy walk to Times Square & entertainment district & front desk staff

title: Excellent location, price, and service!
text: This hotel was so close to Time Square and Hell's Kitchen. We were able to go to many places, since we were within walking distance to many things. I stayed at a hotel before that was right down the street that wasn't as nice as this one. Perfect stay!

title: Great hotel
text: I enjoyed my stay at the Distrikt Hotel very much.  The room (and bed) were comfortable, the staff was friendly.  Enjoyed the free drinks in the bar and free water in the room.  This is a great value in an expensive area.

title: 2nd Visit just as nice as the 1st one.
text:
This was our 2nd time to visit the Distrikt Hotel.  The staff was still as accommodating and helpful as the 1st time.  They pointed us in the right direction, gave us advise on food and helped us get to Yankee Stadium.  The rooms are nice and the location is great for Times Square and Broadway.  There's subway access right up the street.

We will definitely stay at the Distrikt again on our next trip to NYC.

title: CONFORTEVOLE
text:
Buon hotel in centro,600mt da Time Square e 200 dal grattacelo del "The New York Time".La metro a 100mt,quindi che dire perfetto come posizione.
Il servizio buono a parte la portiera di colore che non ci voleva fare la fattura dicendo di chiederla a Booking,ma, penso il direttore ,un signore col pizzetto brizzolato è intervenuto e ha capito subito che non era un problema e ce l'ha fatta.Eravamo al  18°piano ,bellissima vista sui grattaceli, camera molto pulita, bagno con doccia e specchio grandi.Consigliato

title: Desagradable experiencia / unpleasant experience
text:
Viaje recientemente a New York y me hospede en este hotel desde el 22 de Mayo hasta el 30 de Mayo. Viaje con el Hotel totalmente pago desde Argentina a través de una agencia de viajes; pero cuando llegué para hacer el Check In la Srita. Sahara Robles y el Manager Rich Valles me dicen que obligatoriamente debo pagar US$25 + tax en concepto de City Hotel Fee; argumentando que por ese importe tengo derecho a usar el gimnasio, me dan dos bebidas en el bar del hotel y dos botellas de agua en la habitación.
Yo le dije que no había solicitado ese servicio y que no deseaba utilizarlo; y ellos me respondieron que era obligatorio y lo debía pagar.
Luego de varios días estando en el lugar, devolví las botellas de agua, no utilizamos el gimnasio y tampoco consumimos las bebidas en el bar; el Sr. Rich Valles igualmente me cobro la totalidad del importe por los días que estuvimos hospedados.
Conclusión / Atención: La tarifa que este Hotel Publica en todos los medios, es engañosa y no es real; porque cuando uno llega al hotel le cobran desleal y obligatoriamente US$ 25 + tax por noche aunque le digas que no vas a utilizar ese servicio que ofrecen.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great accommodation right in the middle of Times Square. Friendly and very accommodating staff. The room was surprisingly large for the price.  We will definitely return to this hotel on my next visit.

title: Bad start great finish
text: Great price and location, when we arrived the room was not available... overbooked. Once we worked that out everything else was great. Great breakfast and rooms. Larger room than anticipated. I would return to this hotel and I do recommend it.

title: Great place to stay in NY
text: 5 minutes from Times Square and subway. The room was very clean, quiet, very comfortable bed. The service was great, stuff is very kind. Check in and check out is easy, I did it online took less than a minute.

title: Great location
text: I stayed here with my 2 grown up children from 30/05/18 to 04/06/18. The hotel is in a great location about 5 minutes from Times Square. All the staff are really friendly & helpful from the reception staff to the staff in the bar & the cleaning staff. We had a room for 3 to 4 adults & whilst it was very comfortable room it was somewhat on the small side. Also we had 1 very small wardrobe to hang clothes in. We felt the room would be moot suited to 2 adults & a child. Apart from this we had a good time & Rich on reception was very helpful when I had to e mail a medical report to my insurers. I would recommend this hotel but next time I would have 2 rooms.

title: Superb 😀
text: Located right in the heart of Manhattan, the hotel only a 5 minute walk from Times Square but was situated in a quiet area. Rooms were very comfortable and spotlessly clean. All staff were very courteous, friendly and knowledgeable. Would book this hotel again no question! Loved every minute of our trip 👍

title: Amazing!
text: I stayed here for 5 days and it was great! My room was clean every time I go in and everyone there is so nice. Such a great location and price! Tons of restaurants and bars super close by. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

title: Nice and comfortable room, close to Times Square and subway
text: There is a subway station on the same block, but across the street.  It's just a few minutes walk to Times Square.  Location was great.  Room was updated and clean.  Staff was very nice and even held our bags 5 hours before check-in.

title: Excellent stay at Distrikt
text: Enjoyed our stay very much.  Excellent value.  Pros:  room was very large for NYC;  very clean and modern; location the best--proximity to mid town and theater district.  Cons:  get a high floor, noise can be disturbing; elevator slow but manageable.

title: Very Solid Times Square Hotel Option
text: The location is prime and so is the staff's professionalism and willingness to help.  The rooms were standard and the bar area left much to be desired as far as options are concerned but overall, I'm pleased with our stay!

title: Great location in midtown
text:
Really great location for the hotel, right beside the Port Authority bus terminal, so access to buses or trains is so easy. Other hotels also along the street which did make it busy in the mornings, but quieted down at night. No street noise heard from our room which is a first for experiences in NYC in the past. 

Room was good -  lots of space for our luggage. Only complaint was that a few times our bathroom was not refreshed between days - towels left on floor as instructed were taken away but none given to replace them. 

Front desk staff was always welcoming and cheery, no issues there, easy luggage storage on our last day and smooth check in process. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to see both uptown and downtown New York - its right in the middle. One block from Penn station, 2 blocks from Times Square/Broadway. There is no view because of surrounding buildings, but we were out all day so we didnt mind at all.

title: BEAUTIFUL HOTEL
text:
Clean, quiet and very comfortable room.
The view from the 30rd floor was amazing.
Located in a very good connected area.
10 min away from Times Square.
Staff in the reception really helpfull.
There is also an area with computers + printer that is useable from the customers without costs.

title: Great hotel in the city
text:
We have stayed in New York 3 time before this is my favourite place to stay 
The hotel is amazing and the staff were really helpful. It is really fresh and happy place with music playing as you walk it 
We had a room with a view on the 29 floor. 
Worth paying that little more if you can 
We look d over the city which was nice. 
The room was large and had every thing we needed for 5 nights stay 
The shower was amazing as well

title: First time in New York
text: we had a great time in New York.  The Distrikt Hotel was very local to all the attractions and shopping/eating places and the staff and hotel we couldn't fault.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to stay at when you are staying in New York.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: Very clean and staff were friendly . They gave us drink tickets for their bar and we had a good experience . The bed was comfortable, not too hard or soft. I would definitely stay there again when  I come back to NYC

title: Quick trip to NY
text: Very nice experience. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was small as expected but very clean. Hotel bar was a nice amenity. Only slight negative was our complimentary water bottles newer arrived despite requesting several times.

title: Great location near Times Square in fully updated hotel.
text: Convenient location to theaters and High Line but the street itself has little to offer--across the street from Port Authority. Rooms and bathrooms fully updated and well appointed.  Online check-in and checkout make for easy and fast arrivals and departures. It possible try to get a room on a higher floor not looking at the Park Authority parking lot.

title: trip to new york
text: Hotel was excellent staff were so friendly and helpful nothing negative to say about this hotel a short  walk from times square and  great coffee shops nearby also nice wee pizza shop on the corner offering 2 slice and a soda for $2.99 but thats only if you opt for the marguerite

title: Distrikt hotel
text: Perfect location, excellent view, quiet hotel. Friendly staff, willingly to help and to inform. Every day a complimentary drink, every day fresh bottles of water. Very clean and spaccious room. lovely decorated room.

title: Excellent location
text:
Superb location with comfortable beds and helpful staff on reception 
Excellent value for money
A smashing deli called Hells Kitchen around the corner open 24 hours
We will definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends

title: Great experience
text: Excelent location and cleanliness. Very good price - service. We had a very pleasant stay and had not complains. The place is just a few blocks away from Times Square so the location is perfect to take diferent walks.

title: First time in New York
text:
We stayed for a week on our first trip to the city and had a great stay. Really well located in midtown within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State building and most other attractions.  All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful and greeted us from reception whenever we were coming and going from the hotel.
Our room was on the 26th floor and surprisingly quiet for the middle of Manhattan! It was quite small but clean and neat and had everything we needed. In the room there was a safe, iron and ironing board, a generous sized TV and toiletries in the bathroom.
The shower was really powerful, the air conditioning was effective and the bed was really comfortable.
Each day our room was refreshed, bed made and clean towels replaced the old ones.
There are only a couple of things that could have improved overall, some of the mains power sockets in the wall seemed loose and were unusable, when we tried to plug something in the plug wouldn't stay and fell out. The other thing I found strange was that the duvet was not in a duvet cover, it was wrapped between two regular sheets that came off it as soon as you moved it and you ended up with an uncovered duvet with no sheets.
Our departure on our final day was handled really well, our cases were stored for us until it was time for us to go to the airport and a private car was arranged for us for the time we requested. This service was fantastic, it saved us having to haul our luggage and hail our own cab and cost the same flat fee to JFK as it would in a yellow cab.
If we came back to New York, we would definitely stay again.

title: Hotel parfait
text: Cet hôtel est très bien situé , à quelques minutes de Times Square. La chambre était très belle , le lit confortable, muni d'une douche et toilette individuelle. Le personnel est vraiment très aimable et sympathique. Très à l'écoute . Nous sommes ravis de notre séjour et nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel. Lors d'un prochain séjour à New York nous reviendrons.

title: New York visit 26May
text: Enjoyed our stay and the staff were very kind & helpful. We have already mentioned the lack of in room tea/coffee facilities but also we felt that the room could do with an upgrade and it would be helpful if you could move the shower head away from you when you first get in, to avoid a blast of cold water

title: Fabulous hotel
text: Lovely stay , me and my husband had a much needed break, it’s was a fantastic location, friendly staff, very clean,rooms are cleaned every day too ,with fresh towels;) all round perfect hotel,I would definitely use again

title: A nice trip to NYC
text: Good location, with super friendly staff.  Minor issues with allocated room were dealt with quickly and efficiently.  Staff always available to help (umbrella when raining for example) and provide recommendations (Capizzi for pizza was awesome).

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
Lovely hotel. The staff were amazing, so friendly and helpful, happy to give advice on the best places to go and went the extra mile by printing out maps to where we requested directions to.
2 minutes walk from Times Square and 10 minutes for Broadway so the location is fantastic.
Room was very clean, immaculate. The only downside is no fridge in the room or anywhere to keep drinks and snacks cool which all in all, really wasn't an issue as everything is on the hotel doorstep! The hotel staff made the experience a great one. They are so lovely. Thank you from London for a very enjoyable visit to what I think is the best city in the world xoxox

title: Great hotel with somewhat worn accomodations
text:
I recommend this hotel. The staff is wonderful and always willing to help. The collage bar is a nice place to grab a drink or two after a day of work or seeing the city. The locations is just incredible, right between penn station and times square, with easy access to all of the mid-town hot spots.

My only complaints were specific to my room. The springs in my bed were broken and my climate control never got the temperature down to where I wanted it. Overall though, I would still recommend this hotel for its location, service, and value.

title: Greate location, greate staff and clean rooms.
text:
We were very happy with our 9 days long stay. The staff was friendly and the location is greate.
The only thing that was not all that good is that the airconditioner was a bit noisy and that they did not change our bed sheets.
But all considered - we enjoyed our stay.

title: Un' ottima scoperta
text: L'hotel è in ottima posizione per visitare New York dato che si trova vicinissimo alla metro blu (una delle più collegate con le altre) e a 5 min a piedi da Time Square.Il personale molto cordiale e le stanze sono pulite e servizievoli. Consigliatissimo

title: Excellent location and good boutique hotel - beware of hotel fee.
text:
Excellent location in Hell's Kitchen and close to Time's Square and metro. I was able to get a very good value with an advanced reservation after waiting for a sale. Clean and functional. Floor access secured by key card. Nice comfortable bed and had no trouble sleeping on an upper floor.

Major issues included spotty internet on a few  nights and now they also charge a hotel fee, so be aware of that added cost.

title: So disapointed!
text: Just returned from a trip to New York. Stayed 4 nights at District Hotel. Easy to check in, but felt cheated when we checked out. Upon check-in we received so-called free tickets for each drink. These tickets we would get new every day, then it was also mentioned that there would be 2 bottles of water in the room. Not a word that these FREE drinks cost a little. The hotel was already paid and clear from Sweden, but when we checked out we received a $ 104 bill! we did not even make our free drinks !!! So this was our first and last visit to this hotel. I think it was tasteless to give us these FRIDRINKS without saying in the same sense - you have to pay for them! And as I said, we did not use one of these, but still cost us $ 104. IS SO DISCUSSED / Anette

title: Fantastic Stay at Distrikt Hotel
text:
We booked this hotel on the strength of the reviews on TripAdvisor, as it was our first visit to New York.  We wanted somewhere central to stay to make our stay in the city easier, and after spending 4 great nights at this hotel in May, we are delighted with our choice.

Firstly, the welcome we received on arrival was possibly one of the best experiences we have had from a hotel front desk anywhere in the world.  Shariis on the front desk was exceptional, an absolute superstar.  She couldn't have made us feel more welcome if we were family!

In addition to Shariis, it is fair to say that all of the staff that we met during our stay were fantastic, whether they were maintenance, working the bar, or on the front desk, they all made the hotel feel friendly, and a real home from home, which I didn't necessarily expect in a New York hotel.

We were on the 31st floor (3101), and had a very nice view over one end of Times Square from our full length windows, also looking out through the buildings we could see the river.  The room itself was very nice.  Spacious, comfortable (great mattress), good bathroom, and a refrigerator.  The only thing missing was coffee making facilities, but a minor point.  I would also add that we weren't bothered by street noise considering how close to Times Square we were.

We didn't use the hotel restaurant for breakfast, so can't comment on that, but we did use the bar, which was very nice with a good atmosphere.  Jovi, the bartender, did a great job of making us feel welcome, and we really enjoyed our conversations.

In terms of location, the hotel was perfect for us, close to Hells Kitchen, Times Square, Port Authority Bus/Subway, and everything was easy because of this.  There were plenty of dining options & bars in the vicinity.

All in all, we made a great choice of hotel, and would recommend the Distrikt Hotel NYC to anyone looking for a modern and friendly hotel for their stay in the City.  If the management of the hotel do read this review, they really should be proud of the job that their staff do, particularly Shariis, who is a fantastic ambassador for the hotel, and the reason I am sure that many guests would return, I know that we will.

title: A Gem in Hell’s Kitchen
text: This place is a true find. I used to work in a hotel in NYC & was stunned at the downright palatial room size. It was modern & beautiful. The staff was so nice & welcoming. I’ve found my new NYC hotel!

title: Great location and service!
text: Stayed for three nights at Distrikt. Location very central. Rooms were clean and spacious. A few minor things (chirping fire alarm) but were rectified promptly. Staff are friendly and helpful. Would definately stay again!

title: Average
text:
Hotel was in a great location, short walking distance to Times Square. Hotel rooms were small but clean. We were suppose to get a suite for our honeymoon but if that was a suite I’m not sure what the other rooms were like. We got a room facing the bins at the back of the hotel. 
We went for happy hour and was very disappointed. The poster (below) advertising happy hour was a picture of cocktails (but we were told cocktails aren’t in the happy hour). There is also another board advertising happy hour with drinks listed i.e beers, wines, bubbly, cocktails (with an actual name of a cocktail on it which we ordered) but again advised prosecco or the cocktail on the board are not in the happy hour just selected wines and beers (I don’t like wine and my partner has a wheat allergy so can’t drink beer). We found it very misleading.

title: Great location
text:
Stayed for 6 nights whilst visiting NY
Clean hotel with comfortable and quiet rooms, great location to Times Square and surrounding areas all walking distance 
Only negative is the breakfast options 
Plastic bowls, plates, knives and forks, powdered scrambled eggs, potato’s and bacon- don’t bother just head out elsewhere this was terrible

title: Great Stay
text: Just returned from a weeks stay and right from the start it was obvious that they had a really friendly and helpful staff and they remained so thorough out our stay, nothing to much trouble. The rooms were kept immaculate and was really comfortable. It is situated right across from the rear door into the Port Authority Bus Station and entrance to the Subway so getting around was easy. The hotel is good but staff great.

title: Credit card charged wrongly
text: We provided a credit card on check in as standard practice in hotels, however our card has been charged £52.18 for nothing. We hope this is a slip up by the hotel and will be refunded immediately. If you are the manager and reading this review I eagerly await your response. I have emailed the hotel customer services separately and hope this is rectified ASAP.

title: I would certainly stay here again
text: This was our first visit to New York with friends who had been before. The hotel is in a great location, staff are very friendly, approachable and professional, the room was spotless, bathroom spotless, cleaned on a daily basis, the bed is the comfiest we’ve ever stayed in on any holiday, you have a hairdryer, iron, ironing board and safe, the hotel itself is well maintained and also spotless, the only reason I’ve not given it 5 out of 5 is the lack of tea/coffee/water facilities in the room but it would not stop me staying here again, if we visit New York in the future this would definitely be on the list of options. Thank you for a pleasant stay :)

title: Very small rooms
text:
This place is in an OK area of midtown west
But there are a lot of homeless around the area.
It is clean and the staff were professional and friendly but the rooms are very very small.
A good 10-15 min walk to Times Square,the price is OK in NYC standards but I’m sure you would find the same price with better locations.
Was slightly disappointed due to ready so many positive reviews.

title: Hôtel parfait
text: l'hôtel se trouve dans un bon quartier près de station de bus, de la palace de Time . C'est un bon hôtel. la chambre était un peu petite mais confortable, propre. Le personnel était accueillant et gentil.  Hautement recommandé

title: Distrikt Hotel a comfortable stay
text:
This hotel was well placed near the bus terminal and near to Times Square area and the Theatre district. check in was pleasant and the people on the front desk were helpful and welcoming.
I selected this hotel as it was one of the few in the right location that offered two beds in one room, as I was staying with my son but didn't want the expense of two rooms.
If you are looking at being near Central Park I would choose another location.

title: Average big city hotel
text: Rooms were small but adequate. Hotel lacked character but was functional. Most positive aspect was position, near central Manhattan. Breakfast/bar room was dark and dingy and did not encourage relation.

title: Schönes Hotel - super Standort
text: Wir wurden freundlich im Hotel empfangen und hatten einen guten Service beim Check in. Das Zimmer war schön, sauber und großzügig, wir hatten ein Comfy Room gebucht. Wir schätzten die Lage sehr, denn das meiste war zu Fuss gut erreichbar (Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue, Rockeffeler Center, Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, Central Park). Times Square und Hells Kitchen sind in wenigen Gehminuten erreichbar. Wir würden das Hotel wieder buchen.

title: Molto buono!
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo albergo per dieci giorni e ci siamo trovate molto bene! Camera spaziosa e pulita così come il bagno! Personale disponibile. Comoda la posizione.. con dieci minuti sei a Times Square. Unica nota negativa forse è che la zona in tarda serata si anima di qualche homeless in più e di qualche tipo strano. Eravamo due ragazze da sole e quindi in tarda serata magari avevamo qualche timore in più.. comunque sia non abbiamo mai avuto problemi! 
Hotel consigliato!

title: Great location, good price, fantastic service.
text:
5 minutes walk  from Times Square. 3 minutes walk to the metro station.
Great room, all his new. Tge staff is very griendly helpful.
Quick check in, quick check out.
Free WiFi. They gave me coupons for 2 drinks in the hotel bar on each day.
I'll return for sure.

title: Good location
text: Good location but even though we're at the back of the building it was still quite noisy when other guests were coming and going. Subway on next block and bus station across the road which meant we were able to get straight to the airport without too much of a fuss

title: Zentral und perfekt für einen NYC-Trip
text:
Direkt neben Doubletree und Four Points Sheraton wirkt das Distrikt Hotel von  außen eher unscheinbar. Es ist eines der schmalsten Häuser in der 40sten Straße und liegt zwischen 8 und 9 Avenue. 

Die Lage ist perfekt für einen CItytrip  - nur einige Gehminuten vom Times Square entfernt. Die Metro Station direkt gegenüber im Bus Terminal wenn man weiter weg will. 

Angekommen wirkt die Lobby freundlich und minimalistisch. Das einchecken ging zügig. Wenn man mag  steht unten in der Lobby jederzeit aromatisiertes Wasser zur Verfügung. 

Zimmer und Bad sind klein (normal in NYC), aber sauber und lassen so weit keine Wünsche übrig. Einziger Kritikpunkt ist das doch etwas sehr weiche Bett, aber sonst war wirklich alles perfekt. Die Aussicht aus dem 28sten Stock ist auch klasse.

Unten gibt es ein kleines Lokal  bzw. eine Bar in der morgens auch Frühstück angeboten wird. Da wir nur Übernachtung gebucht haben haben wir immer im Stehcafe (Corvo Coffee) nebenan für kleines Geld wirklich lecker gefrühstückt. 
Ein kleiner Supermarkt befindet sich auf der nächsten Ecke (9 Avenue) so, dass man sich auch dort für zwischendurch was holen kann. 
Das Theaterviertel  und Hells Kitchen sind auch gleich um die Ecke, so dass man Abend zu Fuß zum Theater gehen kann und beim Essen auch die freie Wahl hat ohne eine Weltreise machen zu müssen. 

Alles in allem ist das Hotel für einen City Trip zu empfehlen und wir würden es wieder wählen. Perfekte Lage, gutes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis und angenehmes Ambiente.

title: Great hotel, fab staff, brill location
text: Stayed here for 3 nights, the staff here couldn’t do enough to help they were awesome, clean tidy smart hotel in an ideal location to grab the hop on hop off busses five mins down the road, lovely and helpful reception staff who helped us with any queries we had, would highly reccomend this place for everything NYC related x

title: สวยงาม
text: โรงแรมแห่งนี้ ตั้งอยู่ในใจกลางแหล่งท่องเที่ยว ดีสนีย์แลนด์เลย เป็นโรงแรมที่ใหญ่มากๆ มีหลายระดับราคา และมีที่จอดรถในโรงแรมไว้ค่อยบริการ พนักงานสุภาพ และให้ความสะดวกปล่อดภัยดีมากๆ ราคาที่พักสูงมาก เพราะอยู่ด้านในเลย

title: Enjoyed our Stay at the Distrikt very much
text: The room was everything we look for to stay in. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very quiet and the shower was invigorating. The people at the front desk were pleasant and professional and check-in and out were very easy. Close to all major subway lines and easy to get a cab if you prefer that. We took a bus to the city and the hotel was right across the street from the Port Authority. This is our third time staying here and we will definitely be coming back.

title: NO TEA COFFEE MAKER IN ROOM
text: There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room.The breakfast is  basic.No free Wi-Fi. Wifi got connected without a password that also was charged on check  out.Local taxes will be added only on check out as a surprise .They gave drink cards without asking and charged when  check out.They gave water bottles and charged for that also on check out.The location very good. Lots of hidden charges be careful check before booking and also at check in.

title: Very good
text:
Close to the subway and times square. Best beds ever.
