The breakfast is not worth it's money. Go to Dean and deluca across the street for nice bagels and coffee.
Very nice staff and very clean rooms. Fresh water with fruit flavors downstairs every day.
Can really recommend this place.

title: Not as good as it used to be.
text: More like a 3 star hotel. Tea and coffee facilities have been removed from the rooms and when 2 guests are staying I would expect 2 robes and not to have to ask for an additional. Rooms are nice though however the aircon is noisy. Woman on check in desk was plain and simply rude with no interpersonal skills. Barely uttered a word during the check in process.

title: Super verblijf!!
text: Wij verbleven hier 3 nachten in april. Niets te klagen gehad. Attent personeel, nette, schone kamer. Ideale ligging op 10 min lopen van times square en metrohalte op de hoek van de straat. We zouden zo weer terug gaan!!

title: Didn’t let us down
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights and must say the staff all made us feel welcome , happy to help with anything , room was adequate , up to date decor, shower good   , no kettle in room but requested one at the reception and was in room when we returned , a tea/coffee tray would be the only thing I would say would complete our stay .
As for the location it was perfect , 5 minute walk to Times Square , very central for Manhattan .
The concerns on previous reviews with regards to the parole office did not affect our stay .
Went to Heartland Brewery for lunch which is located in Port Authority bus station and was very good , we only used this on our last day but would recommend.

title: Great budget hotel
text: Stayed four nights very comfortable hotel nice comfy beds and clean towels and bathroom well situated for everything. Only complaint was lack of kettle in the rooms. 10/10 for the staff very helpful and pleasant.

title: The Staff is Awesome
text: Never have I experiences a great group of people with great attitudes and an awesome work ethic.  They did everything in their power to make our stay perfect. Even though the hotel does not have all services as other hotels in the area, I would come back because of the staff,

title: habitaciones comodas, limpias, bien ubicado
text: muy lindas las habitaciones, cero ruidosas, con espacios comodos, limpias, baño grande, todo perfecto. Los que no son muy simpáticos son los conserjes,de los cuales solo 1 hablaba español, el resto no solo no lo hablaba sino que tampoco hacían el esfuerzo  para ayudar. Y el que hablaba español bastante antipático. Y no contaban con información tipica para el turista, ya que uno va a NY para hacer turismo. en otros hoteles en los cuales me he alojado, siempre habia aunque sea un plano de manhattan. La ubicación buena solo por el hecho que estaba en frente de la terminal de bus, y estaban todas las paradas de subte. No lo volvería a elegir, por mas que el hotel es lindo y nuevo, solo por el hecho de la mala onda de los recepcionistas.

title: Great Hotel - Thank you!
text: My partner and I stayed for a week in April 18 and cannot fault the hotel. The location is perfect, close enough to the mayhem of Midtown, but far enough away to avoid if you wish. Great food places in walking distance (Hells Kitchen), and subway stop on the street (and only a few blocks to Penn Station). The staff were wonderful and couldn't do enough for us. We really enjoyed relaxing in the bar at happy hour after crazy days exploring the city - the bar maid was also lovely. Room was a good size for NYC and all amenities just what we needed! Will stay again on our next visit! Thank you!

title: excellent stay
text:
We had a wonderful time in this hotel. staff was nice, room was clean, it is close to many sites and restaurants we wanted to visit. The beds were really comfortable. we would stay here again without a doubt.
Nous avons passé un superbe séjour dans cet hôtel. Accueil très pro, chambre spacieuse et très propre. proche de times square, musée intrepid etc. vraiment très pratique, nous recommandons cet hôtel pour un séjour réussi sur manhattan

title: Good and convenient place..
text: We stayed this place for a couple of nights during our Canada/USA visit. Working distance to many of the attractive locations. The service and staff were friendly and facilities were easily accessible. Worth for the money.

title: Excellent location but noisy air conditioning and this is how to travel to the hotel
text:
The location is excellent.

The hotel is right next to the Port Area Bus Authority but the double-glazing does its job. The room was spotlessly clean with a large bathroom.  

The room is, however, basic with little or no frills.  This would be a budget hotel standard anywhere else. 

Having said that, if you are in New York, you will probably not be spending too much time in the room. 

The staff were all polite and courteous. 

My main issue is with the air conditioning unit in the room. It is very noisy and woke me up every morning when it kicked in. At one stage, it started rattling. This was fixed by pressing down on the lid.  A simple enough exercise but not one you want to do at 6:30 in the morning. So make sure you pack some earplugs.

The cynic in me would also think that the hotel receives commission from booking transport with a company called ExecuCar. The Tripadvisor reviews for ExecuCar do not make good reading for them.  My Meet And Greet driver did not turn up!  I had to make five calls, and waited 40 mins in a heatwave in June before a driver turned up. This was a very unpleasant experience and added to the expense as I was using my UK-registered phone at £1 a minute.  So I reckon at least £25 in calls.  ExecuCar put me on hold whenever I called and cut me off several times. 

By the time we managed to get a driver to turn up, it was main rush hour and my first visit to New York was spent in a very long rush hour traffic jam.  When I complained to a lady from ExecuCar during one of my calls chasing up the car, she said that I could cancel and complain.  I did send an email and I have not had the courtesy of a reply. And the driver requested the full Meet And Greet fare.  Appalling customer service. So, with the awful Tripadvisor reviews and this level of customer service, why is the hotel using them?  

I did email the hotel before my visit asking for the best way to get to the hotel from Newark.  I was quoted a range of options with a reference to a "shuttle" bus that the hotel told me takes 2 hours. This is not the case, and I am again a little surprised as to why the hotel overstates the time. The answer is newarkairportexpress.com.  This bus takes you to the Port Area Bus Authority station which is a three minute walk from the hotel. It costs $18 and runs every 15 minutes. The Meet And Greet was $123 (I opted for this as it was my wife's special birthday - which makes the appalling service even more galling).

title: Diciamo Buono, ho visto peggio ed anche di meglio
text: Location Ottima per essere a New York Time square  raggiungibile a piedi,   un po di problemi con la ventola del condizionatore rumorosa, il bar un po piccolo e non sempre aperto, personale molto disponibile

title: Localização espetacular e ótimo quarto.
text:
Localização espetacular, próximo das principais atrações da cidade (podendo ir a pé a muitos lugares) e em frente ao Port Authoroty, que é uma rodoviária e contém linhas de metro, ou seja, basta atravessar a rua para ter acesso a qualquer lugar que queira ir. 
Quarto muito bom, espaçoso e confortável, banheiro idem.
Check-in e check-out rápido e simples.
Peca um pouco no serviço de quarto, tivemos que pedir papel higiênico pois não repuseram por 2 dias seguidos. Relatei o problema na recepção e em 5 minutos já recebi, ótima resposta, e acredito que tomariam alguma providência. 
Recomendo fortemente o hotel.

title: A good property in Hell's Kitchen
text:
We recently visited NYC and spent a week at the Distrikt Hotel. This is a fair mid range hotel that is well-located in midtown Manhattan. 

Reservation was made by way of booking.com. Email confirmations came through immediately and full payment was taken accordingly. We arrived an hour before check-in but room wasn't yet ready so we availed of the left luggage facility. Front desk staff were friendly and polite throughout our stay. 

One minor hiccup worth mentioning - the hotel wanted to charge us an extra US$500 upon check-in. We showed them our full payment records and booking.com reservation confirmations. Only then did they check their systems and identify mistake on their end. The extra charges were eliminated and all was well after a few minutes. In the end, not a major problem but equally not something we enjoyed dealing with after a long flight. 

What we liked: 
As for location, Distrikt Hotel is in a good spot, just 2-3 minutes walk from the 42nd Street station. There are numerous restaurants, bars and coffee shops in quick walking distance. 

Lobby area is quite small in this mostly vertical skyscraper. Reminded us of many hotels we have at home in Hong Kong. Many floors with just a handful of rooms each. 

Our room was spacious and very good value for money compared to other properties we have stayed at in NYC over the past 5-6 years. Decor was modern and boutique manner. Bed was very soft and comfortable. Plenty of closet and luggage space and some nice views from the upper floor room we had. Bathroom was spacious and modern as well. Room safe was large and fit for multiple laptops. 

What we didn't like so much: 
A/C didn't work as well as we would have liked. Mind you we had some unexpected hot temperatures during the week of our visit. Shower pressure was not as strong as we like as well. Room didn't come with coffee & tea facility - this would have been a quick and easy improvement to our stay. Wifi was hit and miss throughout our stay. At times perfect and at times very slow and unstable. 

In the end, not a perfect stay at Hotel Distrikt but the pros outweighed the cons and we found the property to be good value for money at the time of booking. We would consider staying here again during future visits to NYC.

title: Perfect
text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to NY . Good location great for walking distance to many of NYC attractions. Room was clean and had all we needed during our stay , smooth and easy booking in after a long day travelling . Receptionists very friendly and very helpful if you needed help with anything . It does have a dining area which we didn’t use as was out and about the majority of the time.

title: Great Birthday Weekend
text: This hotel is in a great location if you are wishing to stay close to Times Square. It doesn't have the most extravagant amenities, but it definitely makes up for it in the staff employed. Everyone was knowledgeable of the area and willing to help. The room looked exactly the photographs on the website. The water pressure was great!  It's the perfect hotel for someone that is visiting the city and wishing to be on the go and come back to a great bed. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone who would wish to go out and explore and just use the hotel as a room to get rest.

title: Tired
text: Whilst in a great location, this hotel is tired,daggy and in need of a desperate revamp. Rooms are small and services are limited (no laundry facilities/service) airfreshner in the lobby is awful, and the restaurant/bar in the back is tired and unwelcoming. Would not recommend staying here until it has improved.

title: Great hotel
text: Really enjoyed our stay here, the hotel is in a fantastic location with times sq just round the corner. The staff are so nice, especially Justin who was so helpful and friendly.  We had two children with us, so struggled a bit for space in our room, but anyone travelling as a couple or single will find the rooms a lot more spacious. The hotel room was very clean and well looked after. The Districkt has a very laid back, casual feel about it, and the friendly helpful staff are key to the atmosphere here. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Disappointing
text:
Do not stay in this hotel if you have an option - and there are many better ones out there. 
We booked 2 Rooms in this hotel. After we checked in we found out that the air conditioning unit in one of the rooms was not working. It was 85 degrees outside...after 20 minuets the doorman came because there was no technical person and after pressing a few times on the controls confirmed with sad eyes that the AC is, indeed, not working. No one to fix the AC. No one but the person at the front desk to talk to, not even a fan to cool the room.
“I appreciate your position but there is nothing I can do” was the only answer I got.
Finally managed to convince them to downgrade me to a smaller room with a working AC.
The hotel is understaffed and every request takes a very long time (we had to take our own luggage down from the room). 
There are only two elevators so expect to wait every time you need to go up or down.

On the positive side the location is good and the rooms were clean.

Since it is New York I am sure you will find better value for your money

title: Visit to New York
text:
Tired hotel need a revamp - easy walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Empire State building and Central Station etc. 
The hotel staff were lovely and were very keen to please, nothing was too much trouble for them.    
Room was adequate but nowhere to put anything as such.  Free wifi when you could get connected, 
Downside no coffee making facilities in the room which would have been nice

title: Some good points, some bad points
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and have a mixed impression. 

While the staff at check in were friendly and welcoming, I found the evening and early morning staff less so. Twice I approached the check in desk and was just met with a blank look, no hello or can I help you. The evening staff member on my last night was just plain rude. 

The guy at the bar was great, very friendly and polite. 

Rooms were good. A bit on the small side but clean and tidy. Not really anywhere for you to store your bag (especially if you have 2 big suitcases)
Bathroom was on the small side but was functional, only downside with ours was the shower door didn’t close all the way and the bathroom door stuck and you had to really pull/push it to get in and out. 

Big downside to the room was there was no kettle. You had a small fridge but no way to make a tea or coffee in the morning or at night. I would also be concerned if I had kids as we were on the 24th floor and our window opened right out so might be a safety concern to people travelling with kids. 

There’s also a liquor store and some kind of government building in the street where a few unsavoury looking people loiter outside of which can be a bit scary, so would suggest coming in through 9th Avenue 

All in all it was a good hotel, fairly close to Penn Station and Times Square.

title: Three timer
text: I was in NYC for a weekend get away and having stayed at the Distrikt in the past knew that it offered good value, clean rooms and friendly service. The location is perfect for seeing Broadway shows and close to all the great restaurant options on 9th Avenue. Thanks for making my 3rd stay as comfortable as my first and second. Highly recommend.

title: Manhattan was so much fun.
text:
My stay in New York was fantastic.  Sharis and Netanya greeted me at check in and made me feel right at home.They took care of my bags as I had to go right to work once I checked in and came back to my room with a spectacular view of Mid town Manhattan.
I could not have asked for more.  This is my new place to stay while in New York.  I'm so glad I found this Hotel.

title: Great stay
text: Great location.  Nice, small hotel.  Great service.  Easy check in and check out.  Room was great.  Clean and the service was terrific throughout stay.  Food and coffee is also great.  We will stay again for sure!

title: Ok
text: Bu not more, this week the prices in NY was crazy and i thin 350 USD fro a night is over priced, typically NY hotel with a small lobby but a bar in the lobby, rooms are ok but not that cozy, you could hear everything through the door...

title: Central e confortável
text: Hotel bem localizado, perto de Times Square, ao lado da estação de BUS e metro perto. Hotel bem decorado, simples, com funcionários simpáticos e prestáveis. Nao é muito grande o que faz q seja mais confortável. O quarto nao é muito grande mas confortável. Os andares mais altos tem vista como é obvio. Bar é simples mas a happy hour e simpatia valiam a pena.

title: Buon hotel, con qualche pecca
text:
L'hotel è situato vicino a Port Authority Bus Terminal, comodo da raggiungere e Times Square raggiungibile in pochi minuti. 
Personale cordiale e disponibile, check-in e check-out veloci; la hall un po' troppo  piccola e caotica in presenza di gruppi. 
Camera e bagno funzionali e di dimensioni adeguate per muoversi comodamente. 
Pulizia buona con una piccola svista subito rimediata di cui la direzione si è scusata. 
Qualità del sonno buono anche se dovevamo tenere chiuso il riscadalmento per via della ventola rumorosa anche al minimo.
Perplessità sul supplemento giornaliero  obbligatorio City Hotel per utilizzare la wifi, la palestra e drink, avremmo preferito pagare solo per quello richiesto o consumato.
Tutto sommato  un buon hotel anche se ci saremmo aspettati qualcosina meglio.

title: Fantastic hotel but bar shuts through the day
text: This would be five star but the bar shuts through the day which is not ideal. After spending all morning sight seeing it would be nice to relax in the bar but it’s shut. Room was perfect. The staff all very friendly. Location is perfect. No view in the room but that wasn’t an issue. Would return.

title: Heel fijn hotel
text: Mooie ruime kamer, rustig, vriendelijk personeel, schoon, hells kitchen is een leuke wijk en er zitten geweldige eet tentjes in de buurt. Je zit lekker centraal, metro zit om de hoek. Kortom een aanrader voor je bezoek aan NY

title: Accommodation
text: Good quality hotel close to Times Square. Value for money. Staff were very helpful. Front desk greeted you each time your returned to the Hotel. Efficient check in & check out process. Would recommend Hotel for couples

title: Couldnt have asked for a better stay
text: Everything was absolutely great, comfy room, amazing bathroom, quiet, great location. Really near subway and time square and lots of food places. Clean and really helpful front desk service. Would recommend to everyone

title: You get what you pay for.
text: Sub par location in garment district too near the port authority bus terminal, no hot water, room over looked exhaust/cooling fans, lobby looked like it was under construction. Fine for budget travelers. Glad it was only one night for me. Room comes with 2 free bottles of water.  I guess that's a deal.

title: New York
text: Recently stopped at the Distrikt Hotel, New York. This was our first trip to New York. The hotel is ideally centrally located in Manhattan. The hotel staff are excellent, friendly and go out their way to try and help you. The rooms are clean and very accommodating with free wifi. If you don't mind walking, most attractions are in walking distance, we walked to The Empire States Building, The Chrysler Building, Grand Central Terminal, Times Square, Broadway, the Financial District plus many other attractions. If I ever go to New York again I will definitely be stopping at this hotel again.

title: Hotel très bien situé
text: Très satisfaits d'avoir choisi cet hôtel pour séjourner 3 nuits à New York proche des sites à visiter. Chambre confortable très propre, le personnel est sympathique. D'ailleurs une amie qui etait avec nous a de nouveau réservé pour une petite semaine en mai. Avons pris le petit déjeuner juste à côté de l'hôtel avec viennoiseries avec prix très corrects. Hôtel à recommander

title: Hotel bien situé
text:
Super hôtel , personnel très sympa et compétant .Chambre très propre et faite tout les jours . Proche de Time square à un pâté de quartier. Quartier très animé .metro sur Broadway . La population locale est très sympathique ,zone touristique.
Chambres petites

title: Good location
text: Couldn’t vault this hotel. Clean and tidy/ perfect location right by Times Square. WiFi very good. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Only fault was having pre booked and paid I was re charged when checking in and wasn’t told this. Having realised the following morning over £900 more than half my credit card limit!!. When asked why I had been charged again, I was told it had been a mistake and cancelled. All I would have asked to have been told at the time, not the following morning on my banking app!! But would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Very Poor Experience
text: Visit started off on a bad note when I inquired about a $25 "City Hotel Fee" - I was told that was for wifi, water and 2 drink passes - I said no thanks, and they said it's not an optional fee.  So much for the "free wifi" that they advertise on this site, an others. So my $287 room charge became $360. And apparently $360 buys me a tiny room on a low floor, facing a wall with faulty electrical sockets so that I have to unplug the lamp to charge my phone. The response to all of this was sorry - we're full but we will give you a drink pass.  Again, not what I'm looking for.  Ok, I certainly won't be back and suggest that you find a better part of town and a more accommodating hotel for your next stay in NYC.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
This hotel was just perfect, we had our room on the 28th floor and had a great view, helpful staff in the reception and 10 minutes walking to times square, and close to many restaurants. NYC hotels are pricy but this hotel you really got value for your money.

Will 100% stay here again when in NYC.

title: Convenient location
text:
The hotel itself is close to most mid town attractions and there are some great restaurants in the area. Our initial room was nice enough, but we did have issues with the TV and hot water supply. We raised this with staff and were eventually moved to another room. 

This is not a flashy hotel but is clean and tidy. Be mindful that the hotel is located next to the Port Authority so has a lot of traffic noise. it was disappointing that coffee making facilities had been removed from the rooms after we made our booking a few moths back. Apparently as a cost cutting measure. As someone who likes to have a coffee in bed this was disappointing.

The highlight of this hotel is the delightful Jovy who works at the bar. She was very engaging  facilitating conversation with all bar patrons and provided great service.

I'm not sure that I'd stay here again but I wouldn't dissuade anyone from staying here.

title: Posizione eccellente
text: Posizione assolutamente centrale. A poche centinaia di metri da time s square. Personale gentile ma la pulizia della camera lascia un po’ a desiderare. La struttura non è il massimo ma, considerando hotel di pari livello, va più che bene.

title: Close to Time Square
text:
We stayed at The Distrikt Hotel approx 4 years ago and decided to stay again during our recent trip to NYC, it didn’t disappoint. Perfect base to explore Manhattan and from some rooms you can see Time Square.
Rooms comfortable and clean and a lovely walk in shower. Very quiet considering how close you are to Time Square. Would definitely recommend

title: Best Place to Stay in NYC
text: I enjoy staying at the Distrkt Hotel so much that I keep returning. Their staff is friendly and all have great customer service. I also appreciate the clean dust liners on the pillows and the duvet. It's that attention to detail between the staff and the room that keeps me coming back.

title: Nice room with a view
text: Our Roomy with a view was very nice - we could see time square from our bed. Very clean and nice and modern decor. Good location to metro and less than a kilometer to the river to go for morning runs.

title: Nice hotel with a great location.
text: Overall a nice stay in the hotel. Although we have experienced some minor hiccups throughout our stay, such as wif-fi not working properly (for some guests apparently) or a noisy A/C in our room, the overall impression is nice. Location, location, location is the key for this hotel. Everything is in walking distance, being restaurants, delis, pubs/pizza places, subway station, Port Authority, MSG or Times Square. You can explore the city and its corners directly out of the main entrance.

title: 5 night stay
text:
Just spent five nights here, we had a “roomy with a view” on the 27th floor room 2701. 

The rooms was a decent size for NYC. The fridge was super efficient and handy to have. There wasn’t much closet space for five days worth of clothes for two people. There is no tub in the room which I wouldn’t normally mention but if you’ve been walking around all day in NYC it’d be nice to have a soak - no big deal.

All the staff we met and talked with were friendly and helpful. It was my birthday while we were there and they sent a card and a gift to the room, which was appreciated - thank you :)

On our first day our room wasn’t serviced until like 5pm, but the cleaning lady called me and I asked to have it done earlier and that happened each day thereafter which was appreciated. 

Hotel is clean, in a quiet(ish) location and is near a metro which is super handy. 

I wouldn’t return, and the only reason is because mid-town is just not for me (too busy!), nothing to do with the hotel at all. I just prefer TriBeCa / SoHo and quieter areas.

title: A week in Manhattan at Distrikt Hotel
text:
Great location. Just far enough away from the hustle & bustle but within 5 minutes walk of the nearest subway station. Also nearby are cafes, coffee shops, off licences & fast food shops should that take your fancy.
We paid a little extra for a room with a view. It was worth it. An incredible sight when the sun goes down.
The bed was classed as king sized but I've never been in a bed so big. You could have got another 2 people in with us.
Friendly reception & cleaning staff. Rooms cleaned daily to an excellent standard.
The chap who worked the bar was incredible. Such a great guy. Lot's of fun.
We were also offered an extended checkout time on our last day. This was chargeable but was fantastic to be able to relax in the room until our airport transport arrived.
Should we ever return to NYC I would love to stay here again.

title: Would Defo recommend this hotel
text: Perfect hotel, brilliant location and I would Defo stay here again. Could of done with a fridge in the room, and or coffee facilities/water etc BUT they do have room service :) welcoming staff, basically in the middle of everything.. couldn’t be happier. The beds are amazing, I slept like a baby !

title: Super rapport qualitéPrix
text:
Hôtel sans chichi très bien situé dans Manhattan le personnel très agréable la chambre propre et confortable rien à redire 
Possibilité de laisser ses bagages le dernier jour 
La vue du 9eme étage n'est pas imprenable loin de là mais ce n'est pas grave

title: Lovely stay in Manhattan
text: Kind staff, rooms are cleaned very well and are bis enough. Breakfast possible. Only the two elevators sometimes need longer for 32 floors. The Hotel is well situated in Manhattan. Nearby to Times Square and theatres.

title: Disappointed, expensive for what you get!
text: I stayed at this hotel for the 2nd time, and found the standards has slipped. The house cleaning wasn’t great. There is no tea or coffee in the room, and we had to ask for water everyday we were in the hotel. The area at night is also not ideal.

title: Rien à redire!
text: Hôtel superbement placé ! 5 min de Broadway, 10 de Time square et Subway au bout de la rue. Chambre propre et literie très confortable. Personnel très souriant et agréable. Possibilité de prendre un verre au bar de l’hôtel....

title: Perfektes City-Trip Hotel
text: Das Hotel ist perfekt gelegen für einen City-Trip. Nur wenige Gehminuten vom TImes-Square und den anderen Sehenswürdigkeiten in Midtown. Die Zimmer sind sehr sauber und das Personal sehr freundlich. Von der grösseren Ansammlung Hotels in dieser Strasse ist es das kleinste mit der kleinsten Grundfläche. Nur gerade 5 Zimmer pro Stockwerk, verteilt auf 36 Stockwerke. Das macht es auch relativ ruhig (ohne viel Türgeklapper am Morgen oder nachts). Wir würden jederzeit wieder dorthin gehen. Der frühere Hinweis auf die schummrigen Gestalten in der Strasse bis zur 8th Ave sind wahr. Jedoch braucht man von diesen auch keine Angst zu haben. Da sind manchmal einige Alkoholiker oder Dögeler. Da gewöhnt man sich aber nach ein paar Tagen in NYC daran.

title: Nice little boutique Hotel in Hell's Kitchen!
text: We stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised.  The Hotel is in a good location, close to Times Square and the Port Authority. Everything is within walking distance and there are plenty subways close by should you choose to travel that way. The Staff were all very pleasant and accommodating, helping us move room initially (as it was a bit too high for my girlfriend), on leaving day there was no water but the staff allowed us to come back and shower even though check out was 11. This however was not our fault and the Hotel were gracious in allowing us a 3pm check out instead. TV reception wasn't the best and internet was ok too. Nice little bar down in reception as well, where we made use of our free drink vouchers. Great little place that we will look up again when we return to NYC!

title: Five star staff
text: Wow this place could not do enough to help you out and nothing was to little for the staff the most friendliest people in new York city I would highly recommend staying at this hotel very clean and cheap *******

title: 추천하지 않습니다.
text: 가격비교 사이트에 워낙 저렴하게 나와서 총 여행기간의 1/4정도를 갔었는데요, 추천하지 않습니다. 벽이 너무너무너무너무나 얇아서 옆방의 정말 모든소리를 다 들을수있습니다. 게다가 그 하우스키핑의 유난히 시끄러운 정돈 소리가 아침잠 많은 저로써는 정말 곤욕이었네요. 거창한 소리에 비해 방상태가 엄청나게 꺠끗하지도 않았습니다 ㅠ

title: Week long stay
text: Stayed here for six days in January the hotel is perfectly situated for all central N.Y. attractions The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful.Will return to this hotel on our next visit to New York.

title: Great Spot and Super Friendly Staff
text: Traveling alone in New York I was a little unsure of what to do and how to get around.Natanya at front desk was very helpful and I became very confident navigating the avenues of NY and using the subway trains.I appreciated Dennis’ help in organizing an airport transfer and for storing my luggage.All of my needs were met by the staff even when I was unable to work out the a.c.The location is very close to main sights and is conveniently located in Times Square.The room was comfortable enough.I would revisit Distrikt Hitel when next in NY as it was reasonably priced for this time of year.

title: Hotel - Excellent, Staff - Sublime
text: The Hotel is excellent very modern just a few minutes from Times Square with plenty of food to be had nearby. Rooms are cleaned everyday with fresh towels etc, you also get two free drink cards daily from the bar which come in extremely handy but the biggest reason why I won't be staying anywhere else in NYC in the future is the staff. Every member from the front desk to the cleaners to the bar workers greet you with a smile on their face and go above and beyond their duty to help and assist you no matter the circumstance, they are just truly nice honest good people especially wee Jovy she's a sweetheart and it was pleasure to stay there

title: Average
text:
PROS:
Within 5 minutes walk of Times Square
Shower and bed were great - waffle robes are a nice touch too.
Staff were friendly and gave us some good pointers for food/other services.
Rooms are of a half-decent size - not as bad as some other hotels.
Good TV selection - although the signal for a lot of channels wasn't great.

CONS:
Within 5 minutes walk of Times Square - whilst a lot of noise is cancelled out, if you are staying on a lower floor - you can definitely still hear the hustle and bustle of NYC.
Our toilet leaked everyday for the 3 days we stayed there.
WiFi - didn't work for 2 of the 3 days we stayed there.
Located right next to a parole office - the area is definitely not the best, but there is a lot of footfall outside, so you feel safe (to an extent) - a lot of hotels based in Hells Kitchen suffer the same problem.
2 Lifts to service 32 floors - they can take an age to come - unsure why they bothered putting the security measures of keycard access in the lifts either - ANYONE can just open the doors and walk up to any floor.
Steep service charges - $25 per day - to be fair, as we booked before these existed we didn't have to pay - but I'd not have been happy to of paid this - covers gym access and free drinks in the bar, nothing we would have taken advantage of.

Would I return - probably not.

title: Amazing stay
text: The room was spotless and cleaned every day.  Decor was lovely and modern. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great location near Times Square and right next to a subway station. Room was quiet and so it was easy to sleep at night - the beds were very comfy. This was our first time in New York , would definitely chose to stay at this hotel again and reccomend it to others

title: Great location, a few minutes from Times Square
text:
We as a family of 4 returned a week ago from this lovely hotel. From the emails before we arrived to the service we received whilst there, we couldn't fault this hotel. The room with 2 double beds was just about big enough for us and on the whole very quiet.
Thank you again for a lovely stay!!

title: Perfect location!
text: I have just returned from a 7 night stay here at the Distrikt hotel. If you’re wanting a hotel with the ‘wow factor’ then this probably isn’t the hotel for you however if you’re wanting a clean, basic hotel in an ideal location then I couldn’t recommend it more. From entering the hotel the reception staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a lovely stay. So friendly, helpful, always smiling and attentive to our needs at all times. They made you feel so comfortable - 10/10 on customer service. Dennis who works in reception really did go above and beyond to help us - so thank you! The rooms again were basic, slightly on the small size. A very comfortable bed which is very much needed after walking around NY city & an amazing shower! Cleaners were in daily & provided us with clean towels. The hotel was spotless throughout. Would I return back to this hotel? Absolutely. Thank you for an enjoyable stay! X

title: Disappointing stay
text:
Firstly on arrival we found that our safe wasn’t working. We were told someone would come and fix it but in the immediate to leave our possessions in our case!!! As time was limited we reluctantly did this but weren’t happy about it. On arrival back at the hotel after a day out sightseeing we found our bedroom door open, I don’t mean unlocked, I mean actually open!!! 
I went to complain at reception and was given a pitiful excuse that it must have been housekeeping (suggesting it had probably been left open since the morning). No sincere apology, frankly not bothered. Offered a free drink voucher but not told they expired that day so when we went to use them the next day they couldn’t be redeemed.
Staff on reception uninterested. People I’m assuming were porters hanging about on their phones-who knows maybe they weren’t staff and were guests? Hard to tell as no one remotely bothered about offering a good or friendly service. On checking out we were hit with a $50 fee for the WiFi, gym (that we hadn’t been told existed) and two complimentary bottles of water that had been in our room both days. We hadn’t been told of this charge on arrival and were disgusted. Fifty bucks for a gym we didn’t know existed, WiFi which in this day and age should be free and four bottles of small water!! Wow! What a joke. Beware. Location good for the sights but unimpressed and wouldn’t stay again.

title: Problems with Extra Charges That I had NO IDEA
text:
What was supposed to be a relax trip with my husband became a nightmare after I got home and had a "surprise" in my credit card invoice.  
Location good, room too small in my opinion (but ok), the lounge was always crowded, lifts too slow, I had problems every time I arrived and asked for the packages delivered (staff seemed to be lazy to look for it, no organization, all packages on the floor, or inside a closet without any separation criteria), clean, wifi not so good, etc.
But let's go back to what happened to me related to payment:
I booked the hotel using Trivago and I was redirected to CANCELON.com where I did the reservation. The first problem happened when I saw the amount charged by the website, that was completely different from what I saw. At that time I was not allowed to cancel my reservation due the policy rules (Then I thought: Ok! Let's forget this and enjoy NYC.)
I was 100% SURE that I paid everything, but when I arrived to do the check in the receptionist asked for my credit card. I told her that in my understanding I had paid everything in advance and she agreed, and reverted to me with a smile and said: We are going to charge (block) you USD50 as a guarantee, and in the end of your stay this amount will be unblocked.
In this case, I agreed.
So, when I came back home I checked my credit card invoice and I was not understanding a charge of USD172 from the hotel. I sent an email to clarify and they replied to me explaining that it was a ""City Hotel fees" - This is a package that includes two daily drinks at our Collage & Bar (teas, coffees, assorted beers or cocktails) and daily gym passes to Mid-City gym (valued at $15.00 per pass). It also includes access to our higher tiered wifi, unlimited local and long distance phone calls, plus two bottles of water replenished daily every day of your stay. The package costs $25.00 per night, with applicable tax. It is one of our best-valued packages. This service fee is applied to any reservations made after February 1st."     
I replied to them that I was not aware of this. In the reservation I did at Cancelon.com this was not written anywhere, the receptionist never mentioned this when I did my check in. If I was told in advance that I was obliged to pay such fee, probably I would have used some of that "advantages". Of course I would be pissed of, but not feeling robbed or cheated like I'm feeling now. I tried to cancell this amount with the credit card, but it's not possible. Distrikt Hotel started ignoring my emails asking for solutions and I think it's fare to share with other travelers that this kind of charges can happen without your knowledge. Now I'm paying around R$600,00 for something I didn't have a clue that existed. By the way... I sent an email asking then to charge me with the service I used such as Internet and water bottles. But they still ignored.    
Be careful.

title: Couldn’t have been happier
text: This was a trip for my 21st birthday and my first time to New York and this was an upgrade from my original hotel and I was so impressed! The staff, the rooms, the location were all fab! We will 100% return to this little gem of a place

title: walking distance to Time Square
text:
Very close to Times Square, only a few mins walk. Recommend, would stay again but in a different room.

Clean hotel and friendly staff. Happy to help. Easy to check in and out. They also offer luggage storage when you check out, this is secure and they give you a ticket and put tags on your bags. 

Toilets where very nice and clean, lots of towels , soap and hair wash. It was fitted with a warm power shower. They also have a robe. 

It would have been a 5 star review if the wifi wasn’t down for a whole day, Is was a major problem as we couldn’t contract any one to let me know we had arrived. There where computers in the bar but this is a big inconvenience having to log into your personal emails on a shared computer. Also, wall paper was riped and there where holes and marks on the walls where their used to be a picture it looked like but they had taken them down. This was a shame also. The queen size bed is just a normal double bed would be classed as in the UK. 

We where on the 16th floor in room 4. I wouldn’t recommend this room. 

Would stay at the hotel again in a different room that didn’t need re-decorating. I didn’t expect this for the price paid :(

title: Great location, clean room....BUT
text: The location of this hotel is perfect..walk to Times Square, subway station over the road..Great coffee shop at the end of the street. The rooms are clean and with a very comfortable bed. However there was a few minor problems such as intermittent WiFi, which was fixed eventually. No bottled water in rooms, The lifts were really slow with one of the pair sometimes not working..so a bit of a wait to get up or down sometimes...and the lounge, although very comfortable, and could be a buzzing place...the bar didn't seem to be open most of the time and seemed confusing working out if you could have breakfast there or not.?On the plus side the staff were really helpful especially Jodie and Dennis. This hotel just needs to tweak a few minor things and I would give it 5 stars

title: Preis / Leistung stimmt
text: Schönes Hotel, das sehr zentral gelegen ist. Nähe Time Square. Schöne Lobbybar mit guter Bier und Wein auswahl. Wir würden wieder dieses Hotel wählen. Negativ Punkt: Suspekte Leute in der Nähe des Busbahnhofes.

title: Amazing trip to New York!!
text:
We visited the Distrikt hotel for a week and it totally blew me away! The rooms are absolutely incredible, so clean and comfortable and a real decent size!!!
We had a beautiful view from the room too!
We heard no noise on the evenings so we slept really well the whole time we were there.

The staff at Reception go totally out of the way for you to make you happy. They are so friendly and nothing you asked then was a problem! They even tried to get us cheap theatre tickets!

The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk away from times square so very handy and everything right on your doorstep!! 

I was so pleased with our stay here and would return here straight away if we went back. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to everyone I know that wants to go!!
Thanks for an amazing week!!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The hotel was very clean, very comfortable. We had a very nice view. My favorite part was the shower, we had the walk in shower. Very nice shower. Everything was near by. Friendly staff! I will definitely come stay here for my next visit to New York

title: Gin and toilet
text:
My amazing boyfriend booked a trip to NYC for my 30th birthday and he managed to book us the perfect hotel to go with the perfect trip. The staff were amazing big shout out to Dennis and Jovi. 
The rooms were cute the shower was the best ever. Location couldn’t have been more perfect. My favourite night was enjoying a few drinks in the bar and thinking we ordered a gin and toilet rather than tonic. We shall be back.

title: Nice rooms
text: We had a great time would definitely stay again. Rooms are very clean, staff is nice, room service was great. Great location close to everything we wanted to see and do. I would recommend to a friend and hope to back again.

title: Wow... Stay here its awesome
text:
I've been lucky enough visit NYC a number of times but this hotel is the best I've stayed in.

 Location for us sasha perfect, really close to the port authority bus terminal which is where our airport shuttle dropped us off. Some people have mentioned dodgy looking people on the road.... Don't worry about that at all... Nothing threatening or unsavory. Its right next door to a sheraton hotel so it's hardly skid row!! It's also super close to the New York Times building, Carlos bakery (from cake boss) and of course all of the action of time square is just a 5 min Walk away... If that. Another plus of the location is that the street the hotel is on meets 8th Ave and this is where most of the tourist 'hop on' buses stop.

The room was amazing. We were on the very top floor which I heavily recommend as we got the most insane views of the river and the empire state building. The quality of the room and the views absolutely made our stay to be honest. Really clean and all of the amenities you could need. Bed was comfy, full length mirror and powerful shower.

Staff were so welcoming and helpful. Made us feel right at home. WiFi works really really well and the bar area is cool, relaxing and reasonably priced.

Can't recommend the place more highly. Stay here!

title: Family road trip
text: Great base for a wonderful holiday . Excellent and incredibly helpful staff . Room kept spotless , nothing was too much trouble , kettle was brought straight up to our room when asked for . Really great place . Everywhere within walking distance .

title: Great place
text: Great hotel with great staff, will be back because of the hotel staff, lejovy and shariis was a pleasure and so happy to help with all our needs from recommending places to see to the best places to eat, love you guys

title: Excellent location
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a whole week while visiting NYC. The room is not large and the bathroom is tiny, but if you are planning on being out all day exploring the city, this is basically what you need. Room is clean. Do not expect any luxury. Staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is located next to a subway exit and an excellent place to explore the city.

title: OUR STAY
text: We've stayed at this hotel four times and find it very much to our liking. The rooms are nicely appointed and very clean. The location of the hotel is perfect for theater and other NYC attractions.I recommend it to people coming to New York who don't want to spend a fortune, but will appreciate the value of this hotel.

title: Brilliant hotel and staff in ideal location
text: Myself and a friend visited in February/March for 7 nights and turns out we picked a great hotel. The room was very spacious (pair of doubles) with very comfortable beds, clean bathroom well equiped, and nice view from the room, along with a friendly welcome note from the staff who were extremely friendly, informative and professional since we first arrived. The location of the hotel is also ideal - a 5 minute walk from Times Square to the east and every restaurant you could think of to the west  (on 9th). You also have a handy subway stop at the end of the street with excellent connections, for getting around New York and from/to JFK (takes about 45 mins via the AirTrain or just over an hour taking the LIRR to Penn Station, albeit a fair walk to the hotel from Penn Station with a case in hand). The hotel is very good value overall and perfect for all travellers, whether you're new to New York or a previous visitor.

title: I’ll be back...........
text:
We were lucky enough to have found this gem of a place. Location is perfect for everything!! The staff have been amazing, nothing has been too much trouble, if there’s something that can’t be sorted immediately then it’s always been done in a timely manor. 
Welcomed by Kit on reception when we arrived, friendly, informative, knowledgeable about all things tourist (we went full on cheesey tourist) and anything else we asked or needed, a fantastic first and lasting impression, Dennis was always pleasant warm had a smile that makes you instantly smile back. Myles and Kit spent hours trying to sort out a transfer issue which by the way, had nothing to do with the hotel, allowing us to go off exploring.
Then there’s the ladies, Shariis is warm bubbly, she understood our humour instantly, had in depth conversations with us when she had time, just outstanding, even advised the best time to come regarding the weather!! (It’s just snowed in April while we’ve been here) but the top of our list has to be Jovi. This woman is like a walking miracle,how to shop right, where to eat the best food, advised us on how to prioritise our trips to get the best for memories and money. Thank you, and we won’t forget the kopenburgs!! This team is the reason we are booking for next year and bringing the kids. 
The room was cleaned daily, well presented, easy to use tv, shower, and heating. Exactly what is needed. And the bed was so comfortable! 
Considering we were only in there to wash and sleep It’s exactly right.
Thank you and see you all next year

title: Brilliant birthday holiday!
text:
Spent 4 nights with parents and brother at Distrikt for Mum’s 60th birthday. 
Absolutely loved the hotel. On arrival the reception staff sent up a huge cupcake and card for Mum!
Nothing was too much trouble to the staff. Booking trips, making recommendations or just a really friendly greeting everyday. 
Rooms very spacious- especially for NYC! 
I requested high floors to ensure a good view of city which we were given. 
Location is perfect, beds are divine and could have stayed in the shower all day. 
If returning to New York again this is where I would choose to stay!

title: ...Que boa surpresa
text:
Excelente localização 
Quartos limpos e modernos
Excelente atendimento 
Wi fi com muito bom funcionamento 
Simpatia e total disponibilidade 
Bom preço / qualidade 
Próxima visita irei voltar sem dúvida 
Recomendo

title: Perfect location near Times Square
text: Nearby subway and a lot of places for breakfast. We had a room at the backside which was quiet so we had no issues with street noise. I highly recommend this boutique hotel for couples because the rooms are not too big. Times Square is at 5 minutes walking distance, but the location of the hotel is in a smaller and more quiet street

title: Great hotel
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights recently and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC. I booked based on trip advisor reviews and I have to say it did not disappoint! The hotel is modern, the rooms are clean, bathroom was much nicer than previous NYC hotels I had stayed in.
We were on the 25th floor and it was so quiet. The beds are really comfortable too! Location is perfect if you want to be right in the middle of it all! I would definitely return to Distrikt Hotel.

title: Happiness
text: Such a delightful staff, everyone we worked with made our trip so delightful we are already planning a trip back! This is the first time I've asked for dinner suggestions and had staff members actually care enough to provide good information. great location easy to find driving in and convenient to theaters and all other sight seeing adventures.

title: Short break in new York.
text:
Just back from a short break in new York and stayed at the District hotel, all staff so friendly and helpful. 
Hotel in a great location bus station just over the road as is the subway time square just a short walk.
When we return to NY this will be the hotel for us. 
John and lesley G

title: Am I alone in not loving this place?
text: I'm selected this hotel, in part, based on the very favorable TripAdvisor reviews. My own experience, however, was decidedly lacking.  The toppling items: the elevators are often times a very long wait, I had no hot water (or very lukewarm water) on two out of four shower occasions, the rooms were perfectly average in every way and simple but not in a hip way. They are small rooms, and this is NYC so that is expected...but the rooms have no soul. The outlets are awkwardly placed and my TV remote stopped working at some point (I opted to unplug the TV). The desk staff was nice enough and the access to a very solid neighborhood gym was fine, but I am not sure why everyone loves the location or the hotel itself? Both are average in every way for NYC. Not a terrible option, just not worth the glowing praise here.  You'd need hot water for that.

title: Really Awesome Staff, Large Room for NYC Metro
text: A colleague of mine and I stayed at Distrikt last week to attend some NYIAS events.  We split a room and the 2 double beds size for Times Square area was really great.  The bathroom was large.  We were able to conveniently valet park & had our cars retrieved with ease!  The bellman, Dennis was n absolute joy, helped us with our bags with a mike each day, helped us call the elevators, gave us great directions and advice, as well as did the front desk staff.  The offsite parking valets were careful, professional gentlemen. The housekeeping staff were also so helpful and kind.  I love staying at Distrikt for business.  It’s wonderful there. Right around the corner you can find a professional nail salon, Drybar, & delicious restaurants including the Green Fig.

title: Just great
text:
Second time visit to this hotel & didn't disappoint. The location is great making Broadway and all central attraction are within walking distance. Tall & narrow with 4 rooms per floor.  We stayed on the 14th floor & were very satisfied. 

Had a couple of problems dealt with very well by the front desk: specific mention going to James as particularly helpful.

title: Comfortable stay for first timers in NYC
text: We stayed at the Distrikt for 7 nights during March in what was our first visit to New York. We had a lovely, comfortable and clean room on 32nd floor with great views. One downside ( for me anyway) was the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in our room. We asked the next day at reception and a kettle was provided but when we enquired about cups the receptionist went a bit vague on us so we ended up buying polystyrene ones whilst out and about. Loads of restaurants in Hells Kitchen area especially if u turn left out of hotel then right at bottom of street. Would recommend the Rustic Kitchen for brunch although does get busy.

title: Localização Privilegiada
text:
Ao chegarmos no Distrikt Hotel fomos recepcionados por James, muito simpático e solicito. Fomos informados que deveríamos deixar uma caução de U$ 50.00 que seria estornado posteriormente.
O Hotel é perto da estação de ônibus e metrô, da Times Square e da Broadway e de diversas atrações que podemos chegar a pé, as mais distantes fomos de metrô que estava logo ali. A área do hotel é pequena, no térreo há um pequeno lobby e um aconchegante bar e os elevadores que nos levam aos seus 31 andares.
O quarto é muito confortável, num tamanho adequado, bem estruturado e a cama é de deixar saudade.
Recomendo muito o Distrikt Hotel!

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We stayed for 4 nights on our first trip to New York. Before we arrived the Hotel were in touch by email which was very welcoming. On arrival Reception quickly checked us in. The rooms are very clean - there were 4 adults in our room and it was big enough for us. 

We spoke to Reception in a number of occasions for local information and nothing was too much trouble.

The location is spot on - less than 5 minutes to the start of Times Square, subway near by and taxi rank. 

We would highly recommend and hope to return in the future!

title: Cozy and great location
text: We ended up moving here from a different hotel due to a lack of AC and thus the noise/lights of Times Square with the windows open. The staff were very friendly and accommodated our 8am arrival. The room was the “Cozy Queen” and was very “cozy” aka small, which was ok since we were out a lot. There was no fridge as advertised, and the TV was a bit close to the bed, but overall the bed was amazing, the room clean, and the room cold (with AC) and quiet. The water bottles was nice and the complimentary vouchers as well. Overall, I would say this room is a bit pricey for what it is, but it’s NYC and Times Square. The location is absolutely worth the pennies though as you are a block from almost all subway lines and port authority as well. It was also worth the sleep recovery I lost the first night.

title: Hotel normal en una zona no muy agradable.
text: La gente de recepción muy amable y servicial. La habitación un tanto pequeña con un lindo baño, todo muy limpio. La zona por la estación es poco agradable, mucha gente en situación de calle, basura, jeringas en el suelo, botellas, etc.

title: Great boutique hotel in excellent location
text: This hotel was a great value.  The room was extremely clean, and we got drink vouchers and water bottles for each day of our stay.  This was a great touch.  We were very close to the 42nd and Times Square subway stop, and though close to the noise and tourism of Times Square, did NOT feel even remotely close to those things.  My only complaint is that there was not a coffee pot in the room.

title: Great Hotel, and excellent location.
text:
Had a great stay at this hotel. Walking distance to Times Square and Empire State etc. Close to some nice bars and places to eat.

The room is decent size, which is great considering the rooms in New York tend to be small. The staff were great, and really helpful, and the bar was a nice addition.

title: Great place to stay
text: Great place to stay close to Broadway, MOMA, etc. with easy access to the rest of the city. Nice sized rooms, very accommodating and helpful staff, enjoyed the free beverages each day. All in all a great value.

title: Great staff, location, and value.
text:
Had a great stay - we received great service from all the staff from check-in through to check-out. In particular Jovi, James and Netanya were of great help to us. Jovi recommended a really good diner 5 minutes away (Westway Diner on 9th - great food and value), James was very helpful and gave us great advice, and Netanya went "above and beyond" helping us extensively with an issue we had with a purchase we had made in New York.
Our room was clean and bigger than one we had previously stayed in (autumn 2015) within a more expensive NYC hotel hat was just 5 minutes away on 8th Avenue. That time we had a small bedroom with a tiny, smelly (damp) bathroom.
In the Distrikt the bedroom and bathroom were very clean, and the shower was excellent. The only small complaint was the quality/firmness of the mattress on the bed - it was a bit jaded.
The location of the hotel is perfect - close enough to everything you want to see.

title: amazing hotel
text: loved every minute of being here! I absolutely loved this holiday so close to time square house keeping were great when my girlfriend was sick only downfall was the wifi was slow when trying to stream on netflix

title: Impressive, clean hotel, great service
text: Overall impressive hotel, excellent service from reception staff, Denis the guy that works assisting luggage was helpful and always friendly, bartender  Joe-by was really nice and informative , clean hotel with a mini fridge, however no kettle to make tea/coffee. Perfect location! Would recommend this hotel

title: Third Visit - So it must be good!
text: We keep coming back because the staff here are very welcoming and helpful. The beds are the best hotel beds I’ve ever slept in and the shower a proper power shower. Location is great, close to Times Square, walking distance uptown to Central Park and downtown to Chelsea Market, good choice of restaurants on 9th Avenue.

title: Pay Rise for James
text: Best asset of this hotel is the staff. Everything from giving directions, holding bags, giving umbrellas,etc. All the staff were very accomodating and did it with a smile. They were all very friendly especially lucky_lefty01 James, Dennis, and Netanya. Loved seeing them everytime before we leave the hotel and when we get back. Loved our chats with Dennis about his pending holiday to Australia. Ps. Approve that man his leave! Netanya who is very friendly, always tries to greet us even when shes on the phone and James well that guy is a legend. Just a cool dude who you can always have a conversation with. Top bloke. In saying that, the hotel also boasts a very good location a couple doors from 2 bros pizza. And  a 10 minute walk to times square. The room itself is very clean and modern. Cannot fault the place. Definitely staying here when we get back to new york.

title: Amazing firm beds
text: The beds were so nice and firm and supportive. Room not the biggest but quite big bathroom with lovely shower. The location was amazing being so close to Times Square and subway stations. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

title: No in-room coffee
text: This was our 3rd stay at the Distrikt. This was and is a great hotel. The staff are always cheerful and helpful. The rooms are clean and reasonably spacious by New York standards. The shower was superb. But where oh where was the in-room coffee making facility? This was always a most welcome facility and a great USP for the hotel, we sorely missed it. However there is a Dunkin’ Donuts in the bus station opposite and their coffee and glazed donuts restored some of our disappointment.  Be assured though his is a great hotel for a NY visit.

title: Well located clean no fuss hotel.
text: Well located hotel, clean rooms with great views, some of the rooms are smaller than others so ask for the larger room. there is a safe in the room and coffee making facilities. The hotel now boasts a new bar which we never used but looked quite nice although not that large. The staff were more than helpful and great at providing support with a birthday surprise and celebration. I don't think the hotel offered breakfast, but the hotel next door did so there might be an arrangement for that. Great location for times square and not far from Penn. railway station if your travelling into New York by train.

title: Great value.
text: Very good location and if you're just looking for a nice place to stay without a bunch of frills, this place is great.  For New York, decent sized room.  Staff is friendly and professional.  Can't beat the proximity to many of NY's best places.

title: Excellent location
text: Excellent location close to time square  a short walk to restaurants and bars , the hotel itself is mediocre small basic rooms , no extras , rooms clean and cleaned daily staff ( what we saw of them ) are polite but we did ask for an upgrade and they would get back to us , still waiting ?, we did ask for a drink from the bar but bar staff not available 3 days this happened  we were there for 5 days and had 2 drinks .If this is your 1st time in new york this hotel is ok i will visit new york again but not this hotel

title: Great stay, couldn’t rate highly enough!
text:
What a great hotel, top location, brilliant value and such helpful staff. Would recommend staying here to any family or friends taking a trip to New York. Also a special place as we got engaged whilst staying here. 

Also recommend Del Frisco’s steak house for a good meal when staying in NYC!

title: Love this hotel!
text: The Distrikt Hotel offers everything you would need and want in a big city accommodation; excellent location, decent rates, extremely clean rooms and attentive staff. This has been our fourth visit to the hotel and we will continue to come back!

title: Not nearly a 3 star
text: Stay for 2 night in this overpriced holiday inn. Not only were the accommodations lackluster and I paid 500 for 2 nights I was also charged an additional 75$ a night for car valet. No room service and poor ventilation.

title: Five star service!
text: Due to bad weather I’m Ireland, our trip had to be pushed back by two days. James amended our booking free our charge, which was a huge weight off our mind and wallet! Room was spacious, clean, quiet and had a super comfy bed! Hotel also arranged for a private car to JFK for our departure. I couldn’t have asked for a better service from this hotel and can’t recommend enough!

title: New York 4 night holiday
text: Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great central location in NYC rooms are a little on the small side but immaculately clean. One little thing was there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms, but on our last day we did mention to reception about this and you can ask for a kettle in your room if you want one 😀 Staff were all very friendly and helpful, we asked about a taxi back to JFK and ended up with a big stretched limo a very nice end to our holiday.

title: Fint sted, fantastisk placering
text:
Relativt lille hotel, men meget fint og hyggeligt.
Placeringen lige ved busstationen gør det meget nemt at komme frem og tilbage til lufthavnen, samtidig er metroen lige rundt om hjørnet, så transporten rundt i byen er meget nemt. Det ligger på en sidegade så der er ikke så meget larm fra gaderne.

Der er ikke morgenmad på hotellet. Vi havde intet sted at hænge jakkerne på værelset hvilket var lidt irriterende.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: The hotel was beautiful. Nice location downtown , as you walk in you’re greeted amazingly by the front desk to be checked in. The room was way more roomy and spectacular than I had thought , amazing comfortable bed and beautiful shower, also accompanied by a nice view. Would stay here again.

title: Mediocre filthy and run down
text: I woukdbt books this hotel.  Granted there is quite a lot of competition in New York can definitely find a better deal somewhere else Furthermore When I had an issue with the hotel the hotel  did not correct it in fact they send a bottle of water which was not helpful at all

title: Three night stay in the Distrikt Hotel
text: My wife and I stayed in the Distrikt Hotel for three as part of a three city break. Our room was fairly small but spotlessly clean. The power shower in the bathroom was excellent and the selection of toiletries was good. We definitely missed a kettle in the room to make a coffe or tea. The collage bar in the hotel is quite a pleasant area to have a drink. We did not eat in the hotel as it was our first time in New York and we were out most of the time. The hotel staff  were extremely helpful and courteous. Mention must go to Kit on reception who did everything possible to try and get us transport to the Airport as we had missed our shuttle not realising that the clocks had gone forward one hour. All in all a very pleasant stay and the location of the hotel for sightseeing is perfect

title: The service is not great but rooms were ok.
text:
Upon arrival, the girls were really friendly.
We were half an hour early for check-in and they asked us to wait until 3pm. So we did, we took a seat and waited, I then asked to use the Wifi which they allowed.
The said they would come to call us when the room was ready.
It took us until 3.20pm of which I chased repeatedly to see if the room was ready. We finally had our room ready after 50 mins of waiting (20 mins of waiting if you go by check-in time).
They also didn't help us with the location or what was around.
The room was decent and the bathroom was very clean.
The Wifi is a bit temperamental.
Our rooms were clean.
Although the girls were really nice at reception. After that day, we never saw them again and there were new guys at reception. They weren't as friendly as the girls to say the least.
Upon check out, we queried about late check out. The guy at reception didn't know the pricing so he said he would call back when he confirmed with the manager which was a bit ridiculous, we never got a call back. When I went downstairs to check and the prices are extortionate and when I spoke to the manger himself, he was not very friendly either. It was also very confusing.
We then decided we wanted to pay for an extra 1 or 2 hours in the room to pack.  
When checking out, this process was very smooth but we weren't thanked or wished well for our flight. They didn't say bye to us. They didn't ask if we were ok getting to the airport.

title: Неплохой
text:
Отель в центре Манхеттена, цена правда  300$/ночь, рядом вокзал и много бомжей. Метро близко. Сам номер чистый, чай и кофе, холла правда почти нет совсем, завтраки на 16$ - можно не брать , есть нечего там .
Вообщем - чистый, удобное расположение, но 300$ за ночь - дорого, в Америке вообще вся аренда дорогая очень.

title: Preis-Leistung top
text: Für New Yorker Verhältnisse ist das Verhältnis Preis zu Leistung wirklich einmalig. Zu empfehlen ist das Hotel vor allem Urlaubern, die New York zum ersten Mal erkunden und gerne das Touristenprogramm machen wollen, da das Hotel zentral in Midtown gelegen ist und die wichtigsten Attraktionen zu Fuß zu erreichen sind (Times Square, Theatre District, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue und zum Central Park sind es auch nur ein paar Blocks). Was ich als Europäer im Winter vermisst habe (aber das ist leider überall in New York so), ist eine ordentliche Isolierung der Fenster. Wir mussten die Fenster mit Decken und Pölstern abdichten, weil es in der Nacht so gezogen hat und das bei -10 Grad Celsius Außentemperaturen.

title: Birthday visit to NYC
text:
Booked Distrikt hotel after looking at lots of reviews.  This is a small fronted hotel on W40th Street located between 8th and 9th Avenue. The port bus authority building is on the corner of this street so this is near a good transport hub making transport downtown to Statue of Liberty and to 9/11, World Trade nice and easy! The walk to Times Square is a couple of minutes so is nice and centrally located!  

We were two couples, both using deluxe rooms. The hotel charge a $50 deposit against each room which then credits back to you on check out!

The room itself was lovely. Nice size, spotlessly clean, maid service daily and the room was always immaculate on arrival back after a busy day!  

No coffee maker in the room which would have made this an excellent venue in my opinion.

The small bar at the back of the lobby was pleasant and we enjoyed a coffee there!

Would we return - yes, this hotel is recommended 👍🏻🗽❤️

title: Perfect
text: After staying for the first time at this hotel in January for one night, I decided to return to stay for one night. I enjoy the spaciousness of the room. It feels modern and brand new. Whenever I ask for a quiet room, the hotel always accommodates my need. I ordered food delivery because there was a snow storm and the bell person brought my food to my room after I called the concierge desk that I was waiting for my food delivery. Highly recommended!

title: Surprisingly pleasant hotel at a perfect location
text:
We didn't have a lot of expectations of the hotel as it was a mid-class priced hotel around times square. But when arriving were pleasantly surprised. We were upgraded to a higher level so we could enjoy the view more, which made our stay even better. The room was very large as also the bed. Everything was nice and clean and the bed was very comfortable to sleep in. We arrived after a long journey from Newark to the hotel and were quite hungry and a bit tired so we asked for dinner suggestions at reception. The receptionist (Myles) was super helpful and suggested us a great place to have dinner a few blocks away (5 Napkin Burger). Also with other questions during our stay the reception was always helpful and friendly. 
From the hotel, Times Square is just a short walk away and we agreed that this must have been one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in during our holidays over the years. 
One strange thing was that we could open our room window completely and due to the height (21st floor) we thought this was slightly odd as one could easily jump/fall out. We expected that there would be some kind of security or lock to make sure the window couldn't open completely. But this is just a small note to the hotel.

title: Excelente localização e conforto em Manhattan
text:
Situado na 342 W 40th Street, tem ótima localização (próximo à Times Square e ao lado do Port Authority Terminal) e quartos bastante confortáveis.
Porém, como a maioria dos hotéis de Manhattan, tem preços um pouco salgados.

title: Convenient location and parking package.
text:
Convenient location and parking package. The rooms are nice and clean. 
The staff is nice. However, as pleasant as they are, I wouldn't trust them. 

The man checking us in didn't know what he was doing - it took 25 minutes to check in and there was no line up... we almost missed our show. He also ended up swiping my visa card too many times causing it to get blocked, so I couldn't use my credit card the entire trip. 

Also, don't trust the staff at the bar/resto. We ordered a croissant and were baffled that it was $6. Later we saw on the menu that that was not the price.... Another night he also claimed to "not have change" which would have been more believable if he even took the time to look inside the cash register right in front of him...

title: Value for money and convenient
text:
Hotel is within walking distance from Times Square and around the corner from the entrance of the Port Authority Terminal, making travel and sightseeing very convenient. Also easy to walk to the Theatre District- you can simply walk home after a show! A pity that there was no in-room coffee-maker provided. However, a small cafe down the street provides great breakfast sandwiches and coffees for a steal! 

Our room was on level 28 and clean and quiet. The reception desk staff were also pleasant and helpful.

title: Horrible! the most noisy hotel in NYC
text: Imposible to sleep, reception dont help you nothing to fix the problem. You can not rest because the soundproff is horrible, is like sleep with the neighbour, please dont go to this hotel. Until 4:00 many people singing, talking, crying... and no body told them nothing... i went to another floors amd javenthe same problem... Is a 2 star as maximun.

title: Excellent
text: After a long flight from the uk we finally arrived at this fabulous hotel! When we got there we were greeted by a really nice women who showed us where the food bar and drinks bar was as our room was not ready for us due to us being earlier then expected. The food was amazing and this hotel was located in a really good place easy to get to places will definitely be returning!

title: What a fabulous hotel!
text: We loved this hotel. The staff was amazing and went above and beyond for us during our stay. I will definitely be back the next time I am in New York City. We loved the location and complementary drinks in the bar.

title: New York Getaway
text:
We have just returned from a 4 night stay at Distrikt Hotel. As a travel agent, finding the perfect hotel to tick all of our boxes was really important to me. Distrikt really did not disappoint. We arrived at the hotel before midday and as expected our room wouldn’t be ready until 3pm, however the hotel kept our luggage for us so we could go out and begin exploring the city. They also gave us two free hot drink cards to use in the hotel bar. Thank you. 
We returned to the hotel at 3pm to find our room was ready to check in. We were over the moon to find we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a Roomy King on the 32nd floor, with what had the most spectacular views. Our room was very clean included some good toiletries in the bathroom. Use of the in room safe was great and the digital clock which also could be used to charge phones. My only flaw with our room would be that it would be even better if you offered tea and coffee making facilities within the room. 
My experience from start to finish with the staff at this hotel was fantastic. I communicated via email prior to my stay with Britney and Kit. They were both very helpful and acknowledged my request of a high floor and that we would be celebrating our anniversary. Staff upon arrival were very helpful giving us information on the area and recommendations of places to eat. They were all so friendly and happy which really gave the best positive vibe to guests at the hotel. 
Overall we had the best time in NYC which was massively influenced by our stay at Distrikt Hotel. Thank you to all of the staff who made our stay memorable. As a travel agent in the UK I will most definitely recommend your hotel to any of my clients wishing to visit NYC. We will be back!

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Loved our stay here, it's in a great location close to Times Square and close to subway links. We found it so easy to get around all areas of New York from here.

The hotel was very secure, rooms were very clean and the beds so comfy, much needed after a day walking around new york.

The staff were great too, very friendly and helpful. Always happy to answer any questions and help plan your day, they even stored our bags and arranged a taxi back to the airport on our last day.

We booked to a room with a view and it was well worth the upgrade. Stunning views of the area, the lights of Times Square and could see the Hudson River. The extra space and the view just made it so much more magical.

This hotel really did make our trip that much more special.

title: Muuuuy ruidoso, Imposible  dormir!!! Hostal de 1 estrella max.
text:
Es un hotel pequeño, con habitaciones muuuy pequeñas y sin aislar, puedes oir todo. Hasta las 3 de la mañana oyendo a los vecinos hablar, reir, ver la TV... IMPOSIBLE DORMIR. Es un hostal de 1 estrella como máximo. Justo a los lados tienes el Doble Tree y el Four Seasons que si son Hoteles, no lo dudes. 
En recepción hay algunos trabajadores muy competentes pero si las habitaciones son ruidosas... que pueden hacer ellos? No te cambian de hab ni te dan otra opción. Puedes poner la TV a tope para que los vecinos se callen pero a tu cuenta y riesgo...
Si quieres dormir, vete a otro sitio. Si lo encuentras a 30$ entonces quizás si merezca la pena, no por más. 
La habitaciónnes son ridiculamente pequeñas, sin nada espeial, ni desayuno, ni vistas, solo una cama pequeña también. La TV esta tan cerca que te duelen los ojos al verla.
No lo recomiendo, no volveríamos.

title: Love everything about the hotel
text: This is my second time visit to Distrikt. I just love the location,  friendly staff and clean rooms. I was a little disappointed that I didn't get the room with the view this time but still can't find any faults.

title: Honeymooon 20th Feb - 2nd March
text: My new wife and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. Our check-in was very smooth and we found out upon check-in that we had been upgraded from a cozy room to a roomy king with a view! Dennis was the chap in the lobby that helped with our bags and showed us to the room. Everytime we saw him in the lobby or in the lift he had a chat with us about where we'd been and what we planned to do next. He also offered advice on how to get there and many other useful tips. When we arrived in the room there was a lovely cupcake and a handwritten & drawn card with a wonderful congratulations message. Our room was on the 32nd floor and had a fantastic view of the city which was amazing to wake up to. The lift is key card access only so only someone staying on your floor or staff could access it. Yes there is a parole office down the street but we never had any issues with anyone lining up to go in or from anyone else. There is a great deli on the corner if you leave the hotel and turn left, it's across the road (Get the meatball sub!). It was a nice short walk to the bustle of times square and an even shorter walk to the subway. We had such a fantastic time in New York City which was only heightened by having this hotel room to come back to. The staff always said good morning when we left and welcome back when we came home. Our stay at the district was flawless. My parents had arranged a limo to pick us up from the airport and a private sedan to take us back. All arranged through the hotel.
