The hotel was superb, the neighbourhood is rather gritty but hey it's hell's kitchen, and if your looking for a place to stay in New York then this is the place. Hell's Kitchen is all part of the city's character! Thank you so much to all the staff for helping to make our honeymoon one we will always cherish and remember. We'll be back one day!

title: Great location and service.
text: Great location,  room was small but in the city expected it.... very clean and friendly, expected a coffee maker in the room based website,  but coffee was available In the cafe,  would stay again,  nice rooms and comfy beds.

title: Honeymoon
text:
Me and my husband stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon from 4-7 September 2017.

Check in was smooth, and the lady was friendly.  The room was great, comfy bed and very spacious.  The rooms were very quiet despite the hotel being in such a good location.

Port Authority bus terminal is opposite the hotel and the subway and Times Square are short walk away.

Booking a cab back to JFK was also easily done at reception.

We’re going back to New York this June for my 30th Birthday but are taking family this time and we are staying here again - can definitely recommend The Distrikt Hotel!

title: OUTSTANDING hotel!
text:
Kind of hate doing this, as next time I'm in NYC I'll have a harder time getting a room there.... but here goes:
Just stayed there two nights. Lobby is small, but welcoming, modern, bright and clean. The staff are and treat you like human beings, not numbers. The room was as others have posted, also quiet, with a great bathroom, phenomenal shower, comfy bed and - did I mention "quiet"? - an opening window to let fresh air in. Wonderful!

title: The Distrikt Experience
text: Everything went very smoothly, reception was very pleasant, the room was very clean & organized, i enjoy the complementary tea & to top it all off the overall location was awesome along with the great atmosphere within!

title: Perfeito! Um hotel com ótima localização, staff super atenciosos e prestativos e acomodações de primeira.
text:
Superou minhas expectativas!! O hotel está super bem localizado, a poucas quadras da Time Square em NY, perto dos teatros e badalações e em frente ao terminal de ônibus. E isso faz toda a diferença pois pode ir caminhando nesses pontos turísticos da cidade!
Os funcionários do hotel são super atenciosos e cordiais, sempre prestando atendimento a nossas necessidades.
Com certeza um hotel que iremos voltar.

title: Best hotel in new york.
text:
Well after 16hrs of traveling from the UK to NY we got the most warm and friendly greeting from Myles he was brilliant a complete credit to the hotel. Nothing was ever a problem was happy to help. All of the other staff aswell were all friendly and helpful. 
We checked in and got up to our room on the 31st the room was lovely and big,light and airy. The bathroom was big and had a lovely shower. The bed was so big me and my hubby hardly touched each other. It was also extremely comfy with lovely bed lining. The housekeeper Mary was also very good and the room was always made up to perfection. 
We then had someone come to the room with 2 cupcakes and a congrats card as we was on our honeymoon this really made it special. We had lovely views from the room one of the empire state building and the other of the Hudson river. The place was only a short walk from Times square which was great and most things was in walking distance. We were sad to check out on Thursday and come back to the UK but just want to say thank you all so much for making our honeymoon and our stay an amazing experience. We will def be back. You all do and amazing job keep up the good work. X

title: Back in NYC
text: Great Hotel , great location 5 Minutes from Times Square, 5 minutes from a great Diner good for breakfasts, 2 minutes to the nearest subway. Staff are amazing , room was more than adequate ( 4 of us 2 adults 2 teenagers)  room was really clean and cleaned each day staff were amazing really helpful and friendly . ignore the negative reviews I think they stayed somewhere else I will definitely be staying there again.

title: Nice hotel great location best barmaid in the world!
text:
Comfortable hotel 5 mins walk from Times Square. Good facilities friendly staff and barmaid (tender!) Jovy who was the most friendly welcoming person I have met in years!
Immediately put us at our ease and gave us great City tips. Most importantly she makes a mean cocktail. 
If you come to NYC make sure you visit Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building and Jovy!

title: Nice Hotel.
text: My advice would be to upgrade from a queen size bed to a king size, you have much more space. Comfortable hotel and the staff are really friendly. Special mentions to James, Ralph and Netemar (probably spelt wrong!)

title: Amazing Staff, Great Location makes the Hotel even better
text: Excellent staff made our stay very pleasant. The location is central to New York and easy to get around by foot or subway. Plenty of food choices around the hotel and the Bar itself is great! Room we had was a double with 2 beds on the 24th floor, plenty of storage and a stand alone shower. View from the room was good.

title: Nice hotel but you mainly pay for the location
text: This hotel is located near Times Square, so it's perfect location wise. The room and service however aren't worth the price. The room is small and basic with some toiletries provided. The cleanliness could also be a bit better.

title: Well located!
text: Great location, between W40th Street and 8th and 9th, very easy to walk to several places such as Broadway and Times Square. The rooms are small but well appointed with great TV, hairdryer, iron and toiletries in the bathroom. The shower and towels were excellent, the duvet between the sheets rather than in a cover was a bit odd and possibly not as hygienic. The room was a little chilly, heating unit was noisy but warm. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, we didn’t use the bar but it looked very welcoming and urban.  Would recommend for a city visit base.

title: My stay
text: Myles and the staff were amazing. The location was major key. It was just walking distance from time square and easy to walk back to. Bar service was excellent and drinks were amazing as well. I will recommend this hotel to others and can’t wait for my stay again.

title: 60/30 Birthday Celebrations in New York
text: The Distrikt Hotel on 40th Street is lovely. Close to Times Square and across the road from the Port Authority Bus Station. The staff are friendly and helpful. Happy hour in the bar is good value considering the price of drink in NYC. Think this the same in most hotels but the plugs are too far from the mirror (woman hair thing). The wardrobe in our quad room was the size of a single so tricky to manage our clothes.But other than that - a great place to stay.

title: Business Trip to New York
text: We had an excellent experience.  The staff at the hotel are incredibly helpful and easy to work with.  The rooms are comfortable.  Only complaint is that the service in the bar / breakfast area was slow.

title: Fun Time
text: Great location! Great accommodations! And most of all, what a fantastic staff! They went out of their way to take care of a couple of weary travelers. Our room was available much sooner than we expected (which was much appreciated) and the staff was always warm and friendly. Will be staying here anytime we travel to NYC!

title: Nice modern hotel with friendly staff!
text: Stayed there over a week-end, on the 18th floor with a nice view over Times Square buildings. Very nice room, modern decoration, I loved the walk in shower and the radio alarm with built in phone chargers was a nice touch too. The staff was really attentive and professional. Lastly it is a great location to walk around Manhattan, I went all the way to Guggenheim as the morning was warm and dry. Would definitely go back!

title: Covers all the bases!
text: Great hotel, excellent location, great rooms, excellent staff, only negative is the hotel bar is very expensive. Room was great but we were at the back of the hotel, other people in our party were at the back and did experience a bit of street noise, but hey ho it's New York!

title: Great valentine's holiday
text: My wife and I went to New York for valentine's this year and stayed at Distrikt Hotel. We found the central location great and enjoyed a lovely shower and good night's rest. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and even surprised us with a birthday cupcake and hand drawn card. Despite being only 2 mins from Times Square the room was quiet and the location was good for getting around. If you phone the hotel ahead of arrival they can arrange airport transport, this would have saved us a lot of time if we knew in advance.

title: Excellent staff and decent location
text: I took my wife for valentines and birthday trip. Picked the hotel originally due to price/location/style, and was not disappointed when we arrived! The staff are great, and both the hotel and rooms where a lot better than expected. I travel a lot with work as a global consultant and therefore been through many hotels, and this hotel stands out as one of the better I have been too.

title: Brilliant
text:
From the moment we walked in to the moment we left the staff looked after us as if we were their best friends! 

Unfortunately my partner had some bad news and needed to make an urgent call home to the Uk. The reception staff and doorman were all fantastic with her even when the tears flowed... thank you! 

Location is superb. Most people seem to head to Times Square but we turned left and into the Hells Kitchen area. Amazing variety of restaurants and bars just around the corner. Pictures show view from floor 21. 

Without a shadow of a doubt we will be staying here again and hopefully it will be  within the next twelve months!

title: NYC
text: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for a four night stay in February it was very central and all staff were very helpful friendly and polite,  room on the 18th floor was lovely, would definitely stay there again, thank you to all staff members xx

title: Good Hotel
text:
My wife and myself stayed here before and after a cruise. The hotel is in a great location 10 minute walk from Times Square lots of bars and restaurants close by. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Reasonably priced by New York standards. 
I would defiantly recommended an staying here.

title: Best New York City Hotel
text:
This hotel is Amazing. The staff are super friendly and accommodating to your every need. The rooms are always tidy when you get back from sightseeing in the city and the hotel is in a very good central location. This hotel is unlike any others in the area because it provides a personal touch such as the reception area is just the right size so you can have a conversation with the lobby staff. You feel like a guest in a very personal place not just a massive hotel like the others surrounding. WiFi works great and everywhere is clean. The water with fruit in the lobby is a great touch as you comeback from walking in NYC. Some staff that need recognition are ; Dennis, Britney, Jovy, E.B , James, Gil, Peter and sharils. Thank you for making this a stay that we will not forget. If we ever return to New York we I’ll be staying here. 

Times Square : 5-7min walk 
Subway station : 5 mins

title: my experience
text: I found the hotel location excellent,  the staff where friendly and accomadating to any queries we had, the rooms where spotlessly clean and maintained and heated or cooled to your desired temperature and would definitely go back

title: New york Trip
text: Great hotel to stay in. Not some great big fancy place but friendly clean and ticked all the boxes for the price you pay, great location too...if you have any sporting ticket questions James on reception is great and helped us buy and print basketball ticket for the nets in brooklyn!...we look forward to coming back.

title: Superb small hotel
text: The service at the hotel was wonderful from the front desk to the cafe.  Netanya was especially helpful with directions and recommendations.  It's location in the West 40s was convenient for me.  I recommend this hotel highly for convenience and service.

title: Great Location, Nice Hotel
text: I stayed here just after new year and found the hotel very very good. Situated in mid town keeps you in close proximity to theatre land, shopping and subway links to travel up or downtown. The rooms are not large, but are big enough and equipped with everything you may require. They are also very clean and in really good decorative order. The staff are welcoming, very helpful and eager to ensure you have a great stay. Would definitely recommend the Distrikt Hotel for anyone travelling to New York.

title: Great Hotel Close To Times Square
text: Stayed here last week with my girlfriend. We were very impressed with the price of the hotel in relation to its location. The staff were very friendly and the room was a good size for Manhattan. I would stay here again.

title: Our third visit, still first class!
text:
We stayed at Distrikt hotel for our third time in December. As I have said in my previous review, we wouldn't choose to stay anywhere else when in NYC.

It was nice to see a familiar face when we returned again (Dennis), he recognised us from 2 years previous - super service with a friendly smile. We also met new people this time on front desk, everyone super nice and faultless first class service. I'd personally like to thank Neesha :-)

Again, when we come back to our favourite city, we'll be back to visit our favourite hotel!

title: ravis
text:
Séjour en juillet 2017 hôtel très propre et très bien situé à proximité de times square 
très belles chambres bien insonorisées excellente literie et bon accueil .
nous avons apprécié sa situation et son confort et  la machine a café dans la chambre . Nous recommandons cet établissement  avec "boulangerie" et pizzeria juste à côté !

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Stayed for 2 nights - great accommodations and staff. Very clean - happy with hotel and restaurant. Loved the infused water in the lobby. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was good and pretty spacious for NYC!

title: Great place to stay!
text: Such a lovely hotel in a great location. Staff were friendly and welcoming throughout the stay and gave great recommendations for places to eat ect. Rooms were slightly dated, could use some TLC however, everything else was perfect!! Would definitely return for our next trip to NYC!

title: Great stay
text: I actually stayed at distrikt hotel in Jan 2017 but it will only let me back date to March. I really enjoyed distrikt hotel as previously visiting new york I had an issue with street noise, Distrikt is located a good walking distance from Hells kitchen and close enough to times square. Though there was construction next door at the time we had no issues with noise and thr room was clean and tidy. Overall a great stay and we enjoyed the iced water down stairs each day even in the snowy weather. Only thing is previously I have walked to times square alone in the evenings to shop however being a bit further I didnt feel as safe to do this as there was alot of street construction which meant walking down boarded up side walks out of site though this isnt a hotel issue.

title: Terrific stay at Distrikt
text:
We had an 8 night stay in Distrikt Hotel and loved it for its location, welcoming atmosphere, great staff (Netanya is a stand out) and willingness to help with every- and anything.

The Asian gentleman (sorry, I forgot your name) at the front desk was extremely helpful with providing a kettle and extra coffee and milk pods when required.

Netanya was super friendly and very helpful with directions and tips and pointers.

We can't wait for our return stay here. Thank you!

title: Great stay in NYC!
text: Lovely hotel 5 minutes walk from Times Square! You would never have known you were in the center of New York as the room was so quiet. The staff were brilliant and the room was great. Good value for money!

title: Great Hotel
text:
Cannot fault this hotel which is in a central location. Next to the Port Authority Bus Station and with a subway at the end of the block.
Room was clean and comfortable and had a coffee maker in the room and a hairdryer in the bathroom.
All staff were friendly and helpful.
Would stay again

title: simply outstanding
text:
One of the best places I've ever stayed at. The staff couldn't be more helpful, nothing seems too much trouble. The room size is great and the bed super comfy. Absolute highlight is the shower!
Will definitely be back!

title: We’ll definitely be back!
text:
I honestly love providing feedback even in the best of stays, because I totally respect a company that wants to improve. That said, I can’t think of a single thing to recommend for the staff or property. 

During our stay, our only issue was actually with other guests on the floor. I think there were multiple guests in 2-3 of the rooms on our floor, and they were often hanging out in the hall loudly, all hours of the night. There isn’t much that can be done in that case.

The staff was incredible from the time we interacted via email before our stay to the time we checked out. They made sure my daughters had a wonderful first visit to NYC, despite my making a mistake on the reservation. Every time we came and went, the front desk staff greeted us with sincerity. 

Between that and the awesome location (super close to transportation, and close to Times Square without being in the thick of it), we’ll absolutely be back!

title: Fabulous and quiet place to stay in the heart of the city!
text: We have always enjoyed our stays at the Distrikt, the beds are comfortable and the rooms are lovely.  We stay twice a year, great access to midtown and Javits Center for the gift shows.  Easy walk to restaurants on 9th Ave and perfect transport hub across the street port authority.  Perfect location and quiet.

title: Short 2 night Break
text: We travelled as a couple in January 2018 as part of a trip covering Iceland,Canada and New York. The hotel is only a short distance from the Railway and Bus stations and a short hop to times Square whilst, the port area to catch the water taxis are  within walking distance. The room were of average size, clean and comfortable and catered well for our needs. There is a small bar at the back of the entrance area which also serves hot and cold snacks. The staff were very helpful in terms of information especially as we had never been to New York before and needed help to get around.

title: Close to Times Square
text:
A little better than basic. I was having repairs done on my apartment, so I had to do some hotel jumping over a fews day. Randomly picked this hotel off the Hotel Tonight app because the pricing was good.

The staff was ok, but not super helpful. Upon check-in (at 10:30p) we asked how long the hotel bar was open and the front desk told us 11p. So we went to our room, got settled and arrived at the bar with 10 mins to spare only to be told they stopped serving at 10:30. The next morning I asked the front desk why there were coffee makers in the photographs but none in our room. She told me she would call housekeeping and get one up there, but then sent me to the hotel restaurant where I could purchase coffee (why should I have to purchase it when it's advertised as free?). When I came back to the room much later that day I noticed there was no machine delivered. I asked the front desk about it again and this woman was much more friendly and helpful saying they phased out machines in the rooms and gave me coupons for free coffee. The location of the hotel is not very safe. Although, it is close to commuter lines and Times Square, the streets around the Port Authority is poorly lit at night and full of sketchy people. 

The room itself was clean, small and basic. Good if you're not spending much time there, but I would look elsewhere.

title: Great walking distance to Time Square ,
text: We traveled her Nov 2016 for a concert, we had never been to New York before so this we a lucky pick for us as far as hotels go. We were within walking distance to Times Square. The hotel itself was very clean and updated looking. The room was what appeared to be an average size compared to other places we looked at , it seems everything in NY is on the smaller size. The check in was fast and so was check out , I had to do a little bit of work while I was there and the WIFI worked great for me in my room. We had a few drinks in the bar on the main floor and they were compt. due to computer troubles, they weren't able to process our bill and rather than try and add it to the room as a room charge the manger said for the trouble it was on him.  Overall we love NY and will be back and would stay here again.

title: Great hotel for the price
text: A great balance. Friendly, decent and clean rooms, nice location, and a simple bar in the lobby that doesn't rip you off. Hard to find places like that in the city, especially so close to Times Square.

title: Great Stay!
text: We stayed for 4 nights in December. The hotel is central right opposite bus terminal. Clean rooms, not too small, friendly staff, all you could ask for in New York - not overpriced in comparison either. Round corner from restaurants and 10minute walk to all main sites. Highly recommend

title: Outstanding hotel!!!
text:
Firstly I would like to thank all of the staff at The Distrikt Hotel for making my 21st such a memorable experience. Myself and my mum stayed at this hotel for 5 nights back in November 2017. Before leaving the UK my mum emailed the hotel to let them know it would be our first time visiting NYC and have heard it can be quite noisy therefore, would there be any possibility of being located further up the hotel rather than at street level. To our amazement we were upgraded the next day from a cozy queen to a roomy king with a view (a complimentary cupcake and birthday card was also thrown in). Upon arrival we were greeted by the loveliest and most helpful staff members going (I’m so sorry, after 12 hours of travelling I couldn’t remember your names). 
Check in was quick and simple, the hotel reception was a reasonable size and guests were welcome to flavoured water everyday which was located at the front desk. Being 33 floors high I would have thought that lifts may have been a problem however, I was wrong. There were 2 lifts which operated daily, the wait for these lifts was roughly 1 minute (being so high up). Alternatively stairs are an option if you don’t like lifts. Easy access for those with disabilities or families with pushchairs.
Staff at front desk again were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble, from getting advice on the subway system to booking cabs to the airport on the last day.
The hotel was exceptionally clean in the bar area and reception however, this made up for the lack of cleanliness in our room. Reading recent reviews you’re lucky if you get ‘Mary’. The towels were changed  daily and were clean however, throughout the whole 5 nights the bed sheets were only changed the night before checkout. There was dust and the floors hadn’t been hoovered since arrival. For the amount of time that was spent in the room, we didn’t see the point of bringing it to their attention. 
The beds were comfortable, lots of room which was great! Bathrobes and extra pillows were also provided.  Tea and coffee was provided on a daily basis, safe and mini fridge was a reasonable size. 
Continental breakfast was provided with a surcharge however, being in NYC there will always be somewhere cheaper to eat.
Hotel is a 5 minute walk from Times Square and 2 subway stations are located at the end of the road. Walgreens (supermarket) is also located 2 blocks away. Penn station is roughly a 10 minute walk away, restaurant and shops are dotted everywhere. 
The port authority bus terminal and station is across the road however, noise was not a problem for us. If you leave the window open you will hear some sirens. For the City that never sleeps, we certainly did!!
I would personally like to thank the assistant manager (Sharisse) and the gentleman who was working the afternoon on 21/11/17, your service was absolutely outstanding and for that I thank you. Sharrise thank you for the on the house Strawberry cocktails that were provided on the last day.
Highly recommend this hotel, friendly staff, reasonable size, friendly and helpful staff. We will definitely be going back!!!

title: Really friendly staff, great central location
text: Stayed at this hotel with my daughter as we were spending 4 days sightseeing. Clean room, really comfortable bed & friendly staff. Good central location so a perfect base to visit Times square & beyond. The reception staff advised on how to travel & got us a taxi to go to Battery Park. They got us a taxi to go back to the Airport. Everything else was walkable. We did a LOT of walking but had a fab trip.

title: Sleep & Go
text: Don’t aspect anything from the hotel, it’s a place where you sleep only and go the next day to do what you have to do. I mean don’t but high hopes on there services. It’s not anything like Dubai hotels or any other international city.

title: Would stay again
text: Lovely clean hotel with very helpful staff. Close to everything you really need in New York. Bar menu is simple but not needed when you have so many places to go. Taxi ride from JFK was approx €55 and they will book a taxi at reception for your return travel

title: weekend break
text: This is a pleasant hotel, but could do with a check of appliances prior to new guests. only had one lamp working, tv remote did not work, and telephone not working, when i reported them they were fixed immediately and appreciate a light bulb can go at any time, however the remote and telephone could be checked prior. plus fridge did not have any drinks available to purchase not even water, completely empty.

title: Perfect NYC exploring hub
text:
Me and my husband stayed for 10 nights in room 2503, which is a king room over looking the Hudson River area.
A perfect place to explore not only times Square but the whole of NYC. Special mention to Jovi at the bar who gave great advice on what to go see apart from the standard visitor attractions. The whole team are friendly, nothing is too much trouble for them. Our toilet broke and was fixed immediately. Very comfortable beds, spotless and perfectly located next to a hub for city transport, subway and times square is across the street. Thanks for a great experience :)

title: Good value for money
text: I stayed with my daughters at this hotel in January 2018. Great room for the New York standards. Very competent reception staff. Excellent location, close to Port Authority, subway entrance, walking distance to theaters and shops.

title: Great price get what you pay for
text: We stayed in room 1304 was pre booked via our travel company it was worth what we payed traveling to the city you are usually just in the room to sleel and we found it very good staff are excellent very welcoming and will go above and beyond for you in cases

title: Perfect location
text: The Distrikt Hotel is in a perfect location. About a 12 minute walk from Grand Central Station, a few blocks from the Javits Center, and close to many great and varied restaurants. This was our second time visiting, and we brought another couple with us.

title: Great location for Javits Center and restaurants
text: Excellent staff, room size a bit larger than some, no bathtub, and walk to all levels and types of restaurants. Our biggest complaint -  the street side rooms are noisy all night with the PABT across the street.

title: Dont let them book SuperShuttle taxi
text:
Hotel was OK, clean and around the corner from Times Square.
However, we relied on the Hotel to book us a return taxi from JFK and they booked SuperShuttle.
$88 for two return, paid to the driver as instructed on the journey in from JFK.
The driver for the trip back wouldnt let us ride unless we paid another $44, which he checked with his office.
DONT LET THE HOTEL BOOK YOU SUPERSHUTTLE they overcharge.

title: Flying visit
text: Slightly off beat location in Hells Kitchen but only 10 minutes walk from Times Square. The staff, especially Netanya were Uber friendly and helpful. Great with restaurant recommendations and in arranging a dinner cruise.

title: Great all round hotel
text: First time in New York for myself and son,daughter had been before.Super hotel right where you want it 5 minutes walk from Times Square.Staff were brilliant and couldn't be more helpful.Restaurants and theatres all within walking distance.This will not be my last trip to New York and this hotel.

title: Wir waren dort für
text: Wir waren dort für 5 Nächte im Januar. Die Lage ist einfach perfekt. Man braucht ganze 3 Minuten zum Port Authority. Unser Zimmer war total schön und sauber und jeden Tag wurde alles aufgefrischt und das Bett gemacht. Preis Leistung ist einfach perfekt. Würde es wieder buchen.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: I booked this hotel through Priceline in October and my husband and I had a wonderful stay.  A great location and large rooms.  I rebooked this hotel through Priceline Jan 27-28 because my daughter had a gymnastics meet at Pier 94.  We arrived at the hotel around 11:15 and our room was not available. This was not a problem as we had plans. We checked our luggage and returned around 2:15.  The room was still not available.  One of the desk clerks (Netayna) asked my daughter "Is that your costume we have in the back?  Are you performing?"  My daughter explained she was here for a gymnastics meet.  The other clerk, Cherise, asked "Is it tonight?"  When we said yes she asked if we would mind a room with two beds (when we booked through Priceline the only option was a king.)  To us this was an upgrade.  In five minutes we were in a room on a high floor.  Both employees wished us well.  The next morning Netayna asked how it went.  These two employees are the reason the Districkt Hotel will be our choice whenever we are in NYC.  Thank you for excellent customer service.

title: Convenient small hotel at the corenr of the theater district.
text: Friendly and efficient checkin and checkout.  A bargain at the price we paid.  Rooms were modern and  spacious enough (by Manhattan standards).  Closed to subway, times Square, theater district, restaurants.

title: Gut gelegene untere Mittelklasse
text: Ich war bereits zum dritten Mal geschäftlich in diesem Hotel untergebracht und brauchte die Nähe zum Javitts Center. Das Hotel ist gepflegt, aber nicht ganz neu. Das Personal serviceorientiert und hilfsbereit. WLAN funktioniert gut (auch VPN). Leider gibt es kein gutes Frühstück mehr, sondern nur etwas Behelfsmäßiges. Daher sollte man vielleicht das Geld für das Frühstück sparen und in ein typisches Diner gehen. Das kostet am Ende genauso viel. Der Times Square liegt dicht, der zentrale Busbahnhof Port Authority gegenüber. Nach Westen hin hat die Stadt noch Potential, aber das ändert sich ja permanent.

title: Great location. Great Hotel
text: This was our first time in New York for my wife's 50th Birthday and this hotel, along with its staff made our stay an amazing never to be forgotten experience. The staff even put a lovely card and cupcake in our room for my wife's birthday. And if that wasn't enough, the people on reception sang "Happy Birthday" Amazing !!!!!

title: Wonderful staff
text: Everyone that works there is helpful and friendly. I appreciate the flavored water in the lobby each day. Convenient location to get around the city. Comfortable bed and nice amenities in the bathroom.

title: Noisy Rooms
text: You can hear the conversations of the guests next door as if they were in the room with you.  Manager on duty explained that all the rooms are like that.  Hard to imagine.  Staff did little to remedy the situation.  Bar staff and front desk staff were very nice.

title: Underwhelming, Inconvenient, Never a 4 Star Hotel
text:
Me and girlfriend stayed here the last week of November for 5 nights, she had stayed a couple of times before and had only great things to say about so we said we would go back. 

First of all, I have to say the front desk staff were lovely and friendly, we couldn’t fault them. But besides that, the hotel was honestly so underwhelming and disappointing. We paid a higher rate for what we were led to believe was a room with a view of the Empire State Building. When I emailed a few weeks before we were due to arrive to confirm this, we were told we actually wouldn’t have a view of the ESB but that we would have a view. Our view was basically the car park on the roof of the port authority building. That is not what we were led to believe or asked for when we booked so be very careful. We booked this in April 2017 by the way.

Next was the bar/restaurant which was honestly so disappointing. I went down the first morning for some food and was charged over 35 dollars for two bagels and two cokes!! I know it’s Manhattan but what a total rip off, obviously I shouldn’t have paid but I was quite tired at the time. The server didn’t even give me my full change because he didn’t have enough coins and just looked at me as if to say tough luck. The previous two times my girlfriend stayed there was a restaurant that was so convenient, I don’t know why they changed it, maybe there was new management but it is a total disaster and a rip off. I asked for room service that morning and was told no you have to come down. How convenient for a four star hotel.

The top of the wardrobe was absolutely coated in dust, we put a bag up there and were nearly choked by the dust falling down. Our first couple of days we didn’t ask for our room to be cleaned, but after that we asked for the cleaners to come in and replenish the room with towels etc. but they never bothered to leave any toilet paper. I had to ask at reception and they sent someone up with ONE single roll! Unbelievable, like we were causing too much hassle for them. 

Overall, you would expect and deserve so much more from a four star hotel, we found it so inconvenient and frankly poor for the price. It felt such poor value for money and we definitely would not recommend.

title: Weekend Trip
text: This hotel was perfect for what we were looking for. We took the bus into Port Authority and it was literally right there. The staff was super super friendly. I had issues with my booking and the staff was on top of it at all times. I plan to stay here again!

title: Good location for walking to Time Square
text: While the hotel itself was comfortable and quiet, it was right down the street from the local parole office.  But it was close to lots of great restaurants and Time Square.  I had no complaints or issues, and we were very comfortable in our rooms.

title: Beds Very Uncomfortable
text: The beds were so uncomfortable and worn that you could feel the springs poking through the fabric.  I would not recommend this hotel if due to the uncomfortable beds.  However, the staff were pleasant and the atmosphere and location were satisfactory.

title: Little Gem!
text: Cannot fault this place at all, we were greeted by the lovely Myles who also told us we had been upgraded to the 32nd floor with fantastic views of the city. The room was spacious and very clean and had everything we needed, we will def be back here and I would 100% recommend to anyone. Thank you xx

title: Another great experience !
text: We stayed here last year and loved it and had and even better experience this time.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Rooms super clean and comfortable.  Awesome location!  Can't wait to come back.

title: Good choice
text: Very good location. Close to the bus station. The railway station isn’t far away. The restaurant is near the hotel and the shopping is also convenient. The airport express lines is nearby. The hotel security is good! The environment is clean and quiet. It’s a great choice to travel. Thanks!

title: Awesome Front Desk/ Overall Experience
text: The front desk for the night of the 20th were extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Thank you to Britney and Kit you guys were/ are awesome!! I highly recommend this Hotel for the price and their customer service!

title: 5 night stay at the Distrikt!
text:
I've recently returned home after a whirlwind 5 night stay in New York. 
Our travel agent booked us to stay at the Distrikt after reading good reviews and what can I say... The Distrikt certainly didn't disappoint!

The staff are all extremely helpful and friendly - especially Myles at the front desk who booked our theatre tickets for us. He gave us great advice and went out of his way to help us. Thanks again Myles! :-)

The room was spacious and clean. We were given fresh towels every day and our bed was made daily, too! Everything we needed was in the room, including a great coffee and tea machine and a really powerful hairdryer too. (girls take note! theres no need to bring your own) a large flat screen tv and the bed was huge and super comfy. The bathroom was stylish and modern with a large waterfall shower. No complaints whatsoever! We even got lucky and managed to bag a room with a view.

The hotels location was spot on for us... a very short walk to times square and Broadway. We could travel easily to other parts of the city from the hotels central location. A big thumbs up. If you want to be near the center of the action, this hotels for you.

All in all, we had a fansastic experience at the Distrikt, from the staff, the loaction and the room itself, we couldnt fault it. 

I would highly recommned this hotel and I would happily stay here again.

Thanks again everyeone at the districkt, we hope to see you again soon!

Megan and Jess. :-)

title: Distrikt is THE place to stay for work in NYC!
text: Distrikt Hotel was not only attractively priced compared to other properties nearby... but you get so much more. Clean crisp design, superb customer service (thank you Netanya!) and conveniently located in midtown... WiFi is fast and rooms are quiet. I look forward to my next business trip here and recommend it based on multiple stays in similar properties in the city, Distrikt is still my go to.

title: Great staff and great location!
text: Every single staff member we encountered was always smiling and very helpful!  The hotel was reasonably priced, clean, quiet and cozy. Walking distance to many of the areas attractions. I wouldn't think twice about staying at the Distrikt Hotel if we were to travel to NYC again.

title: Simple, but good.
text: Right next to the office and had good reviews. So I tried it. Does what it says at the tin.... great location if you want to stay close to Time Square. Very friendly staff!!!! They could do with better breakfast offering.

title: Great Staff
text: I stayed in DHNYC the second time for the NRF and its location suits perfect. The staff is awesome and you feel like beeing home and really taken care off. The room is equiped very well. Only the breakfast is not all that well. Appart from that I had a wonderfull stay.

title: Overall lovely experience!
text:
This hotel was very nice and exceeded expectations! Staff was extremely helpful & friendly! Room was very clean and it appears they recently made updates to the entire hotel. It located a short walk to all the major attractions (ie time square, theaters etc) Booked through booking.com and received an amazing nightly rate. 

The only con I would have, which really isn’t even that big of a deal, the tv remote didn’t work. But, you don’t go to NYC to stay in the room & watch tv so it really had no effect on our stay or the quality of the stay! 

Would 100% stay here again and highly recommend to others!

title: Got a great rate, but location is a miss
text: Was down for a night's stay. As I walked closer and closer, it felt a lot sketchier. There is a parole office just down the block, and it is located right across from Port Authority. That said, the rate justified the stay. The rooms were fine.

title: Hotel distrikt NY city
text: The room and the hotel very clean and elegant with a reasonable price, well located in a place close to everything,the service outstanding,we would stay again without thinking twice,my husband and I love it

title: hidden gem
text: Among the huge hotels nestles the Distrikt Hotel. It is a clean, well served place to stay in a very convenient and relatively quiet location. It is not the fanciest or most decorative , but surely one of the best deals with a  genuinely friendly staff.

title: Amazing.
text:
Simply amazing. Great experience from start to end. 
I honestly felt like a king for a few days. The staff is really friendly and hospitable and they truly care about the customer. Big up Peter and James at the front desk! Really awesome guys.

title: Central NYC hotel
text:
The Distrikt hotel was booked for us as part of a Secret Escapes holiday and it was perfect for getting out and about in NYC. 
It is near Times Square, Bryant Park and the Empire State Building and public transport. 
The hotel itself is small and spotless clean, the rooms are comfortable and secure, as your key card unlocks the lift. 
The staff are really friendly and helpful and there is a restaurant if you want to eat in. 
We would definitely recommend a stay here.

title: Great and affordable hotel with good location
text: Distrikt hotel was our choice as a place to stay in NYC and we were not disappointed! Helpful and easy going staff were 5/5, the rooms were neat and the views from the 29th floor amazing! The location could not be better. You can get a subway within 100 meters from the hotel door. The lines A C and E can get you literally any place you need. Times Square and MadisonSG within walking distances, good restaurants and fast food very near. Also couple of Delis to grab something quick. Complimentary coffee every morning you can brew in your room was huge plus! All in all very good place to stay, not too pricy and with that location it could me much more. If I come back to NYC, I will come back to Distrikt also! Greets from Finland!

title: Great hotel - even better service
text:
I’ve stayed here a couple of times now, partly because of the location, but mainly because of the service. It’s ideally located within a 10 minute walk to Times Square, grand central and the Jarvis exhibition centre. Great pub at the end of the road too!  Room is great with the best pillows I’ve ever used!  Got home to find an email from the hotel telling me what make they were!  The bedside radio has old/new iPhone and micro usb charger built in, as well as 2 USB ports, which meant I didn’t need to use a converter plug. 
The Guy at reception booked me a cab to return to JFK. When it turned up, it was a stretched limo...which cost less than the Uber that got me there!

title: A Neat Hidden Gem
text: If you are looking for a convenient and clean hotel this is the place. Great for location to Times Square, rooms fully equipped, quiet, clean, and fantastic staff. Great for the price, will return. You will not be disappointed. Also close to numerous restaurants and shopping. Hop on and Off nearby.

title: Our trip to NY
text: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days ,we got in love with this place, everything were to clean,the staff were very helpful, very nice place to stay,in the center of Manhattan ,food in every corner,many things to do

title: Very happy with our stay
text: Close enough to walk to everything we wanted to do.  No problems with the room, was very clean.  Met all our needs for the long weekend visit.  Staff was great, especially the night crew, who we just had more interaction with.  Very friendly.

title: Broken heating, BLACK MOLD & Rude Mgmt
text: The heater in the room would sound like a jet engine when running and mind you when I was staying there it was like 2° outside so it was either listen to a jet engine or freeze. When I called the manager, i was met with attitude that later escalated into her screaming at me for asking her to come up to the room and then she screamed at me more when she got to the room. Needless to say I stayed elsewhere after that. Stay here only if you like being treating horribly.

title: A great stay at Distrikt Hotel
text: Distrikt Hotel was centrally located for all of the places we needed to go during a recent visit to NYC (Madison Square Gardens, Eugene O'Neill Theater, Javitts Center.  The room was nice and the staff was great -- just what we needed!

title: Distrikt Hotel New York City
text: Excellent location, great price, outstanding staff. Will stay again in the future. Definitely one of the better hotels in the Time Square area. Very accessible to food, bars, movies, and plenty of other nightlife activities.

title: very good value and great location
text:
good value, great location, very clean and tidy - the bar area is small and doesn't function well for meals, micro-waved etc, - better 'sold' as snacks only rather than meals - but there is so much to do and so many places to eat nearby not an issue
reception staff great - bag lost by Delta for 5 days, and they were very supportive!

title: Great Stay for a great price
text: This hotel was clean, convenient, comfortable and efficient. The rooms are larger than most in NYC. staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Location was walking distance to many restaurants and area attractions.

title: Fantastic stay in New York
text: Spent seven nights in this fantastic hotel. It is ideally situated for exploring the city. During our stay we found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful. On one occasion we accidentally left the do not disturb sign on the bedroom door when we went out so the room wasn't cleaned (our fault) when we returned I went to the front desk to ask for some tea and coffee for the morning which was immediately provided with a smile. Before returning to our room we went into the bar for a drink (happy hour 2 till 7daily). Twenty minutes later we returned to our room to find it had been completely cleaned and tidied. Our room was well equipped with comfortable beds, coffee machine, fridge and safe. It accommodated four adults reasonably well although storage was limited. The bathroom was well equipped and had an excellent shower. The bath robes were a nice touch. When we left the front desk organised our transport to the airport which arrived on time and was of exceptional quality. When we return in the future we will definitely be booking this hotel. Hotel ratings Service excellent. Value excellent Cleanliness excellent.

title: Second stay and still as good
text: Have just returned from 4 night stay at this great hotel. Fantastic location, room spotlessly clean, friendly staff. I asked for an upgrade as the trip was for my daughters 21st. There was a note on my file and we were given a higher room with 2 beds. They also delivered a lovely cake and note to the room. Outstanding service and made the stay even more special. Thanks to all the staff but especially the night desk man.

title: Pre Christmas
text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on the start of our holiday. It was ideally located as it was only 2 blokes from Times Square. The room was a good size for New York and  well decorated.  The staff were really helpful. Good base for anyone staying in New York.

title: Would definitely recommend!
text:
Stayed here 4 nights last week, after a 9 hour flight was lovely to arrive and get in a nice comfy bed, views were brilliant from the 30th floor. Rooms were a good size, cosy with a safe. Close to everything, whatever wasn’t we just jumped in a yellow cab, very cheap to get you to different places. Staff were always polite and very helpful with advice.
They booked us a taxi to the airport to go home and a limo arrived! Fantastic hotel and service I would definitely stop here again!

title: Good hotel, great location
text: We stayed at the Distrikt Hotel for 2 weeks over Christmas / New Year. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is clean and well presented. The bar is cosy and serves a limited range of food, but just enough. The hotel is only 6 or 7 minutes walk from Times Square and most other places you want to go in New York. Only 30 metres from the subway station and lots of places to eat. We would definitely go back.

title: A genuine friendly place to stay
text: Really pleasant and helpful staff, clean room and comfortable beds, a warm welcome after a long day of travel. Good advice from reception even as to where the best New York cheesecake  could be found! Good location for Times Square and most attractions.

title: Amazing staff and best location
text: My stay at the Distrikt hotel was AMAZING! After booking at the very last minute we were more than happy with our experience.  The location was perfect, just a short walk to Times Square.  The rooms were clean and modern and the staff were brilliant, they made us feel like we were part of the family.  I have to mention some of the wonderful staff at the Distrikt that went out of their way to make sure we had the best time, they are Shariis, Dennis, James and Leo, nothing was ever too much trouble for any of them and they always had time for a chat and to give us tips on where to go during our stay.  I look forward to visiting New York in the near future and will definitely be choosing the Distrikt hotel again.  Thanks guys, we had a ball!

title: best for price+comfort
text: After a hard day, the best place to rest and sleep. The beds were so comfortable. The hotel had a very good atmosphere, all service very friendly and ready to help you. In the lobby exists a many computers, excellent quality for ever you need to search, print..

title: Great
text: Great experience, look forward to coming back. The staff was nice and the breakfast was good. Need to add water bottles to the room free of charge of course. Fruits as you enter the room instead of a brownie would also be nice and healthy.

title: Great stay with my family!
text: Great for families! Close to sights....Times Square, Rockerfeller Center, Theatre District etc. We loved the Kuerig and refrigerator in the room! Only downside was the street was a bit sketchy because Port Authority was across the street, but no one bothered us. Great value for the money and very clean!

title: Ist time in the states
text: The distrikt hotel is a clean well run friendly place to stay. In a great part of town and perfect for a short stay. The staff are simply the best, forever trying to please. I wouldn't dream of going elsewhere , great hotel well run by great staff, PERFECT

title: Our little oasis in the Big Apple
text: I found this hotel doing a search for locations that would be convenient as well as affordable. We found this and much more at the Distrikt Hotel. The staff was awesome. Everyone there made us feel like we regular visitors and treated us exceptionally well. When we entered the lobby, we went from the noises and crowds outside and into what felt like our own apartment building.

title: Bien situé, c’est tout!
text:
Hôtel bien situé à 2 blocks de Time square. 
Pour le reste c’est du standard. Chambre petite, peu de lumière, la climatisation fait du bruit (ça reste convenable). Au 28e étage on entend pas les bruits de la rue sauf les sirènes hurlantes!
L’accueil est ok, dans les standards us, le service est ok. Pas de navette aéroport. 
Le prix est élevé, on paye l’emplacement.

title: Blizzard!
text: January visit - I came with my little sister. We both felt safe and comfortable throughout the entirety of our stay.  Location is good.  Price was very reasonable.  Room was clean.  Concierge was friendly and helpful.

title: A few Nights in New York
text:
Always a bit nervous when trying out a new hotel but this one was a little gem. Just down from Time Square made it a perfect place to stay in Mid Town and being close to Hells Kitchen you where in just the right spot for some good food as well. 

The room was very comfortable clean and well equipped and the staff where very helpful and went the extra mile to help you out.

I cannot comment on the food as I did not go for the breakfast option

Overall very happy and would stay there again.

title: A brilliant hotel in central location!
text:
A fantastic hotel a few mins walk to times square with loads of places to eat and drink around it. The staff are excellent helpful fun and very good customer service. 
The rooms are spacious and comfortable with tea/coffee facilities and safe in room. 
The shower is just so good and they provide bathrobes to use. This hotel is fantastic value for money and i would highly reccomend it and I look forward to returning to it when I next visit NYC.

title: Lovely hotel and great location
text:
Would absolutely recommend Distrikt to anyone going to New York. Great location right by Times Sq, rooms really nice and the beds really comfy (the mattress was so soft!) 

The reception staff were absolutely brilliant always greeting you and so helpful when trying to decide on a place to go. 

We stayed on the 13th floor in 1303, which didn’t have an amazing view (but who cares when you are in a city as great as that) we were right by the lift which I was worried would be noisy but didn’t hear a peep even late at night.

title: Not visited yet but
text: Havent actually stayed here yet but felt i must leave a positive review based on the service i received booking from myles simmons. I had many queries and enquiries which were answered extremley promptly , literally within 10 mins of me sending the email. Helped me select the ideal room for me. I would recommend booking direct with the hotel as you will always get the best price compared to comparison sites. I trawled through hundreds of hotels in new york and for location price and quality of hotel you wont find anywhere better. Really looking forward to posting a review of my stay in march now.
